content: ततो रावणनीतायाः सीतायाः शत्रुकर्शनः।इयेष पदमन्वेष्टुं चारणाचरिते पथि।।5.1.1।।
explanation: Hanuman, crusher of enemies resolved to find the whereabouts of Sita, carried away by Ravana. He followed the path of the Charanas, celestial bards.

content: दुष्करं निष्प्रतिद्वन्द्वं चिकीर्षन् कर्म वानरः।समुदग्रशिरोग्रीवो गवांपतिरिवाबभौ।।5.1.2।।
explanation: Hanuman who raised his head and neck, intending to cross the formidable ocean which none else could accomplish, looked like a leading bull.

content: अथ वैडूर्यवर्णेषु शाद्वलेषु महाबलः।धीरः सलिलकल्पेषु विचचार यथासुखम्।।5.1.3।।
explanation: Tawnyhued Hanuman, gifted with extraordinary strength and patience happily strolled on the marshy tracts of grassy land which had the colour of vaidurya.

content: द्विजान् वित्रासयन् धीमानुरसा पादपान् हरन्।मृगांश्च सुबहून्निघ्नन् प्रवृद्ध इव केसरी।।5.1.4।।
explanation: Wise Hanuman went about like a lion scaring away birds, uprooting trees with his chest, and trampling many animals.

content: नीललोहितमांजिष्ठपत्रवर्णैः सितासितैः।स्वभावविहितैश्चित्रैर्धातुभिः समलङ्कृतम्।।5.1.5।।कामरूपिभिराविष्टमभीक्ष्णं सपरिच्छदैः।यक्षकिन्नरगन्धर्वैर्देवकल्पैश्च पन्नगैः।।5.1.6।।
explanation: The mountain was as though decorated with mineral rocks of varied colours like blue, red, yellow and green as well as black and white৷৷It was frequently visited  by yakshas, kinneras, gandharvas and nagas surrounded by their retinue, capable of assuming any form at their free will rivalling gods and nagas in splendour.

content: स तस्य गिरिवर्यस्य तले नागवरायुते।तिष्ठन् कपिवरस्तत्र ह्रदे नाग इवाबभौ।।5.1.7।।
explanation: As the monkey leader stood at the foot of the great mountain filled with lordly elephants he looked like an elephant standing at the centre of a pond.

content: स सूर्याय महेन्द्राय पवनाय स्वयंभुवे।भूतेभ्यश्चाञ्जलिं कृत्वा चकार गमने मतिम्।।5.1.8।।
explanation: Offering salutations with folded palms to the Sungod, to Mahendra, lord of the gods, to the windgod, to the Creator Brahma and to all the attendants of lord Siva, made up his mind to proceed (to Lanka).

content:
अञ्जलिं प्राङ्मुखः कुर्वन् पवनायात्मयोनये।

ततो हि ववृधे गन्तुं दक्षिणो दक्षिणां दिशम्।।5.1.9।।
explanation: Hanuman, endowed with great equanimity, facing the east and joining his palms by way of salutaion to the Windgod, his father, he enlarged his size and turned south in order to depart.

content: प्लवङ्गप्रवरैर्दृष्टः प्लवने कृतनिश्चयः।ववृधे रामवृद्ध्यर्थं समुद्र इव पर्वसु।।5.1.10।।
explanation: Having made up his mind to leap for the cause of Rama, Hanuman began to grow in size just as the sea grows during the fullmoon and newmoon days, while the monkey troops were watching.

content: निष्प्रमाणशरीरः सन् लिलङ्घयिषुरर्णवम्।बाहुभ्यां पीडयामास चरणाभ्यां च पर्वतम्।।5.1.11।।
explanation: Having swollen to an immeasurable figure, he pressed on the mountain with his feet and hands in an attempt to cross the ocean.

content: स चचालाचलश्चापि मुहूर्तं कपिपीडितः।तरूणां पुष्पिताग्राणां सर्वं पुष्पमशातयत्।।5.1.12।।
explanation: Pressed firmly by Hanuman, the mountain was shaken for a moment which caused the flowers to drop down from the tree tops.

content: तेन पादपमुक्तेन पुष्पौघेण सुगन्धिना।सर्वतः संवृतः शैलो बभौ पुष्पमयो यथा।।5.1.13।।
explanation: With heaps of flowers full of fragrance fallen down from the trees all over the mountain, it looked as though it was a mountain of flowers.

content: तेन चोत्तमवीर्येण पीड्यमानः स पर्वतः।सलिलं सम्प्रसुस्राव मदं मत्त इव द्विपः।।5.1.14।।
explanation: The mountain pressed hard under the feet of the valiant (Hanuman), discharged streams of water just as an elephant in rut would exude water of intoxication.

content: पीड्यमानस्तु बलिना महेन्द्रस्तेन पर्वतः।रीतीर्निर्वर्तयामास काञ्चनाञ्जनराजतीः।।5.1.15।।
explanation: Pressed by the powerful Hanuman, mount Mahendra let out streams of the hue of gold and silver (containing the ores of these minerals)৷৷

content: मुमोच च शिलाः शैलो विशालाः समनःशिलाः।मध्यमेनार्चिषा जुष्टा धूमराजीरिवानलः।।5.1.16।।
explanation: The mountain threw down big boulders along with sulphur just like fire emits columns of smoke, surrounded by flames.

content: गिरिणा पीड्यमानेन पीड्यमानानि सर्वतः।गुहाविष्टानि भूतानि विनेदुर्विकृतैः स्वरैः।।5.1.17।।
explanation: Squeezed on all sides of the mountain by Hanuman, all creatures living in the caves shrieked making horrible sounds .

content: स महासत्त्वसन्नादः शैलपीडानिमित्तजः।पृथिवीं पूरयामास दिशश्चोपवनानि च।।5.1.18।।
explanation: Due to the crushing of the mountain, a loud noise of the various creatures shot up filling the earth in all directions and groves around.

content: शिरोभिः पृथुभिः सर्पा व्यक्तस्वस्तिकलक्षणैः।वमन्तः पावकं घोरं ददंशुर्दशनैः शिलाः।।5.1.19।।
explanation: The snakes spread out their broad hoods manifesting swastika marks on them and bit the rocks with their fangs pouring out terrible fire.

content: तास्तदा सविषैर्दष्टाः कुपितैस्तैर्महाशिलाः।जज्ज्वलुः पावकोद्दीप्ता बिभिदुश्च सहस्रधा।।5.1.20।।
explanation: Bitten by the venomous and angry snakes, the mountain was broken into a thousand pieces by the blazing flames.

content: यानि चौषधजालानि तस्मिन् जातानि पर्वते।विषघ्नान्यपि नागानां न शेकुः शमितुं विषम्।।5.1.21।।
explanation: Even the medicinal herbs grown on the mountain could not neutralize the effect of the poison of snakes.

content: भिद्यतेऽयं गिरिर्भूतैरिति मत्त्वा तपस्विनः।त्रस्ता विद्याधरास्तस्मादुत्पेतुः स्त्री गणैः सह।।5.1.22।।पानभूमिगतं हित्वा हैममासवभाजनम्।पात्राणि च महार्हाणि करकांश्च हिरण्मयान्।।5.1.23।लेह्यानुच्चावचान् भक्ष्यान् मांसानि विविधानि च।आर्षभाणि च चर्माणि खडगांश्च कनकत्सरून्।।5.1.24।।
explanation: Even the ascetics left the place approaching that the mountain would be broken into pieces by creatures. The alarmed vidyadharas leaped into the sky along with groups of their women, leaving behind golden jugs of wine as well as precious utensils, big and small sizes, and golden goblets, cups in the drinking place, as well as many tasty eatables like licking food, chewing food and many types of meat. They also left bullhides and swords with golden sheaths.

content: कृतकण्ठगुणाः क्षीबा रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनाः।रक्ताक्षाः पुष्कराक्षाश्च गगनं प्रतिपेदिरे।।5.1.25।।
explanation: The intoxicated vidyadharas with eyes red like lotuses, wearing garlands around the neck and smeared with red sandalpaste flew into the sky.

content: हारनूपुरकेयूरपारिहार्यधराः स्त्रियः।विस्मिताः सस्मितास्तस्थुराकाशे रमणैः सह।।5.1.26।।
explanation: Adorned with necklaces, anklets and armlets, the vidyadharis stayed wonderstruck in the sky, smiling gently in the company of their lovers.

content: दर्शयन्तो महाविद्यां विद्याधरमहर्षयः।सहितास्तस्थुराकाशे वीक्षाञ्चक्रुश्च पर्वतम्।।5.1.27।।
explanation: The seers among the Vidyadharas, proficient in different fields of knowledge were also watching the mountain from the sky along with others.

content: शुश्रुवुश्च तदा शब्दमृषीणां भावितात्मनाम्।चारणानां च सिद्धानां स्थितानां विमलेऽम्बरे।।5.1.28।।
explanation: Then the vidyadharas heard the words of praise(of Hanuman) by the sages, seekers of the ultimate truth, the charanas and the siddhas who stood and watched in the clear sky:

content: एष पर्वतसङ्काशो हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।तितीर्षति महावेगस्समुद्रं मकरालयम्।।5.1.29।।
explanation: "Hanuman the son of the Windgod, who is like a mountain, with extraordinary might  intends to cross the ocean, the abode of crocodiles".

content: रामार्थं वानरार्थं च चिकीर्षन् कर्म दुष्करम्।समुद्रस्य परं पारं दुष्प्रापं प्राप्तुमिच्छति।।5.1.30।।
explanation: "For the sake of Rama and the vanaras he wants to reach the other shore of the ocean, which is difficult, and indeed impossible".

content: इति विद्याधराः श्रुत्वा वचस्तेषां महात्मनाम्।तमप्रमेयं ददृशुः पर्वते वानरर्षभम्।।5.1.31।।
explanation: The vidyadharas heard the sages speaking in that manner on the mountain. They beheld Hanuman, the bull among vanaras, whose strength  was beyond measure.

content: दुधुवे च स रोमाणि चकम्पे चाचलोपमः।ननाद सुमहानादं सुमहानिव तोयदः।।5.1.32।।
explanation: Hanuman, huge as a mountain moved his body and shook the hair on his body, thundering like a cloud.

content: आनुपूर्व्येण वृत्तं च लाङ्गूलं लोमभिश्चितम्।उत्पतिष्यन् विचिक्षेप पक्षिराज इवोरगम्।।5.1.33।।
explanation: Like the king of birds Garuda would shake a serpent, he shook his tail covered with hair in order to take off.

content: तस्य लाङ्गूलमाविद्धमात्तवेगस्य पृष्ठतः।ददृशे गरुडेनेव ह्रियमाणो महोरगः।।5.1.34।।
explanation: Hanuman had the tail curled at his back which appeared like a big serpent being carried off by Garuda.

content: बाहू संस्तम्भयामास महापरिघसन्निभौ।ससाद च कपिः कट्यां चरणौ सञ्चुकोच च।।5.1.35।।
explanation: The monkey fixed his arms, looking like iron clubs, firmly on the mountain and crouched his waist and contracted his feet.

content: संहृत्य च भुजौ श्रीमांस्तथैव च शिरोधराम्।तेजः सत्त्वं तथा वीर्यमाविवेश स वीर्यवान्।।5.1.36।।
explanation: The glorious and courageous Hanuman his head and shoulders contracted, summoned up all his energy and vigour.

content: मार्गमालोकयन्दूरादूर्ध्वं प्रणिहितेक्षणः।रुरोध हृदये प्राणानाकाशमवलोकयन्।।5.1.37।।
explanation: Having cast his eyes upward in order to view the distance and direction in which he had to leap, he restrained his breath in the chest while looking at the sky.

content: पद्भ्यां दृढमवस्थानं कृत्वा स कपिकुञ्जरः।निकुञ्च्य कर्णौ हनुमानुत्पतिष्यन् महाबलः।।वानरान् वानरश्रेष्ठ इदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.1.38।।
explanation: A mighty elephant among vanaras, Hanuman holding his feet firmly and standing in that position, contracted his ears and addressed the monkeys, when he was about to leap:

content: यथा राघवनिर्मुक्तः शरः श्वसनविक्रमः।गच्छेत्तद्वद्गमिष्यामि लङ्कां रावणपालिताम्।।5.1.39।।
explanation: "Just like an arrow released by Raghava would fly, I too will proceed with the speed of the wind to reach Lanka ruled by Ravana.

content: न हि द्रक्ष्यामि यदि तां लङ्कायां जनकात्मजाम्।अनेनैव हि वेगेन गमिष्यामि सुरालयम्।।5.1.40।।
explanation: "If I am not able to find the  daughter of Janaka at Lanka I will go to heaven, abode of the gods, with the same speed.

content: यदि वा त्रिदिवे सीतां न द्रक्ष्याम्यकृतश्रमः।बद्ध्वा राक्षसराजानमानयिष्यामि रावणम्।।5.1.41।।
explanation: "If I do not find Sita in heaven in spite of my efforts, I will bind that king of demons, Ravana and bring him here.

content: सर्वथा कृतकार्योऽहमेष्यामि सह सीतया।आनयिष्यामि वा लङ्कां समुत्पाट्य सरावणाम्।।5.1.42।।
explanation: "I will, by all means return successful with Sita or else I will uproot Lanka along with Ravana and bring him here".

content: एवमुक्त्वा तु हनुमान्वानरान्वानरोत्तमः।।5.1.43।।उत्पपाताथ वेगेन वेगवानविचारयन्।सुपर्णमिव चात्मानं मेने स कपिकुञ्जरः।।5.1.44।।
explanation: Having thus addressed the monkeys the foremost of vanaras,Hanuman endowed with great speed leaped without any exertion. The elephant among monkeys felt like Garuda.

content: समुत्पतति तस्मिंस्तु वेगात्ते नगरोहिणः।संहृत्य विटपान् सर्वान् समुत्पेतुः समन्ततः।।5.1.45।।
explanation: When he took off, numerous trees on the mountain drawing together the branches all over flew along with him.

content: स मत्तकोयष्टिमकान् पादपान् पुष्पशालिनः।उद्वहन्नूरुवेगेन जगाम विमलेऽम्बरे।।5.1.46।।
explanation: He swept away the lapwings in heat on the blossoms of the trees by the speed of his thighs while he coursed through the cloudless sky.

content: ऊरुवेगोद्धता वृक्षा मुहूर्तं कपिमन्वयुः।प्रस्थितं दीर्घमध्वानं स्वबन्धुमिव बान्धवाः।।5.1.47।।
explanation: Swept away by the force of his thighs, the trees bent forward following him for a while just as relatives accompany their kith and kin on long travel.

content: तमूरुवेगोन्मथिताः सालाश्चान्ये नगोत्तमाः।अनुजग्मुर्हनूमन्तं सैन्या इव महीपतिम्।।5.1.48।।
explanation: Uprooted by the force of Hanuman's thighs,great trees like  sala followed him just like the troops follow the king.

content: सुपुष्पिताग्रैर्बहुभिः पादपैरन्वितः कपिः।हनुमान् पर्वताकारो बभूवाद्भुतदर्शनः।।5.1.49।।
explanation: With numerous trees laden with flowers following him, Hanuman who looked like a mountain, presented a queer spectable.

content: सारवन्तोऽथ ये वृक्षा न्यमज्जन् लवणाम्भसि।भयादिव महेन्द्रस्य पर्वता वरुणालये।।5.1.50।।
explanation: Then the huge trees sank into the ocean of salt water even as mountains did, afraid of Indra's (thunderbolt).

content: स नानाकुसुमैः कीर्णः कपिः साङ्कुरकोरकैः।शुशुभे मेघसङ्काशः खद्योतैरिव पर्वतः।।5.1.51।।
explanation: Covered with tender sprouts and buds of different kinds of flowers Hanuman shone brightly like a flying mountain with fireflies.

content: विमुक्तास्तस्य वेगेन मुक्त्वा पुष्पाणि ते द्रुमाः।अवशीर्यन्त सलिले निवृत्ताः सुहृदो यथा।।5.1.52।।
explanation: Shedding their blossoms (under his thrust) the trees dropped into the waters of the sea just like close relatives follow at the time of farewell.

content: लघुत्वेनोपपन्नं तद्विचित्रं सागरेऽपतत्।द्रुमाणां विविधं पुष्पं कपिवायुसमीरितम्।।5.1.53।।ताराचितमिवाकाशं प्रबभौ स महार्णवः।
explanation: Driven by the wind caused by Hanuman's speed a variety of flowers fell into the ocean because of their light weight and the ocean looked colourful and bright like the starspangled sky.

content: पुष्पौघेणानुबद्धेन नानावर्णेन वानरः।बभौ मेघ इवाकाशे विद्युद्गण विभूषितः।।5.1.54।।
explanation: Covered with blossoms of different kinds and colours, Hanuman looked like a cloud brightened by lightnings in the sky.

content: तस्य वेगसमाधूतैः पुष्पैस्तोयमदृश्यत।।5.1.55।।ताराभिरभिरामाभिरुदिताभिरिवाम्बरम्।
explanation: The seawater looked splendid with flowers dropped by dint of his speed. It  resembled the firmament spangled with enchanting stars just risen in the sky.

content: तस्याम्बरगतौ बाहू ददृशाते प्रसारितौ।।5.1.56।।पर्वताग्राद्विनिष्क्रान्तौ पञ्चास्याविव पन्नगौ।
explanation: That great Vanara appeared as if he was gulping the entire ocean with its rising waves. While he was looking upward it appeared as though he was keen to drink in the sea as well.

content: पिबन्निव बभौ चापि सोर्मिमालं महार्णवम्।।5.1.57।।पिपासुरिव चाकाशं ददृशे स महाकपिः।
explanation: While he was looking upward, that great vanara appeared as if, parched with thirst, he was gulping the entire ocean with its rising waves.

content: तस्य विद्युत्प्रभाकारे वायुमार्गानुसारिणः।।5.1.58।।नयने विप्रकाशेते पर्वतस्थाविवानलौ।
explanation: As he was moving in the sky following the direction of the wind, his eyes blazed like two fires burning on the mountain, flashing like lightning.

content: पिङ्गे पिङ्गाक्षमुख्यस्य बृहती परिमण्डले।।5.1.59।।चक्षुषी सम्प्राकाशेते चन्द्रसूर्याविवोदितौ।
explanation: The large, round, reddishbrown eyes of Hanuman shed their bright light like the rising Moon and Sun.

content: मुखं नासिकया तस्य ताम्रया ताम्रमाबभौ।।5.1.60।।सन्ध्यया समभिस्पृष्टं यथा तत्सूर्यमण्डलम्।
explanation: By the reflection of his copperyred nose, his face looked red like the Sun's orb coming close at twilight.

content: लाङ्गूलं च समाविद्धं प्लवमानस्य शोभते।।5.1.61।।अम्बरे वायुपुत्रस्य शक्रध्वज इवोच्छ्रितम्।
explanation: As the son of the Windgod was flying through the sky, his coiled up tail looked splendid like the banner installed at the festival in honour of Indra (on the fifteenth day of the month of Bhadrapada).

content: लाङ्गूलचक्रेण महान् शुक्लदंष्ट्रोऽनिलात्मजः।।5.1.62।।व्यरोचत महाप्राज्ञः परिवेषीव भास्करः।
explanation: With his white teeth and curled up tail, the wise son of the Windgod looked splendid like the halo of the Sungod.

content: स्फिग्देशेनाभिताम्रेण रराज स महाकपिः।।5.1.63।।महता दारितेनेव गिरिर्गैरिकधातुना।
explanation: The great monkey with copperred buttocks (other parts being dark) looked splendid like a cleft mountain with a huge deposit of minerals shining red.

content: तस्य वानरसिंहस्य प्लवमानस्य सागरम्।।5.1.64।।कक्षान्तरगतो वायुर्जीमूत इव गर्जति।
explanation: The wind passing through the arm pits of the lionlike vanara crossing the ocean sounded like a thundering cloud.

content: खे यथा निपतत्युल्का ह्युत्तरान्ताद्विनिःसृता।।5.1.65।।दृश्यते सानुबन्धा च तथा स कपिकुञ्जरः।
explanation: The elephantlike monkey was seen darting across the ocean(going from north to south) like a meteor risen in the north  along with its tailend falling down the sky.

content: पतत्पतङ्गसङ्काशो व्यायतः शुशुभे कपिः।।5.1.66।।प्रवृद्ध इव मातङ्गः कक्ष्यया बध्यमानया।
explanation: The vanara expanded into an enormous size form appeared as though moving like the setting Sun. He looked like a huge elephant bound round the waist.

content: उपरिष्टाच्छरीरेण छायया चावगाढया।।5.1.67।।सागरे मारुताविष्टा नौरिवासीत्तदा कपिः।
explanation: When the vanara was flying in the sky, his shadow reflected in the ocean looked like a ship driven by the wind and sailing on the sea below (as if the lower part of his body was under water and upper part occupied the sky)

content: यं यं देशं समुद्रस्य जगाम स महाकपिः।स स तस्योरुवेगेन सोन्माद इव लक्ष्यते।।5.1.68।।
explanation: Whichever part of the sea over which that monkey flew, it appeared as though it was riotous with eddies, whirlpools and revolving foam etc., stirred up by the speed of his thighs.

content: सागरस्योर्मिजालानामुरसा शैलवर्ष्मणाम्।अभिघ्नंस्तु महावेगः पुप्लुवे स महाकपिः।।5.1.69।।
explanation: As the great vanara was flying swiftly, the oceanic waves in rows dashing against his chest rose as high as the  mountain.

content: कपिवातश्च बलवान् मेघवातश्च निःसृतः।सागरं भीमनिर्घोषं कम्पयामासतुर्भृशम्।।5.1.70।।
explanation: The forceful wind generated by the monkey moving swiftly, and by the clouds agitated the ocean violently, creating dreadful sounds.

content: विकर्षन्नूर्मिजालानि बृहन्ति लवणाम्भसि।पुप्लुवे कपिशार्दूलो विकिरन्निव रोदसी।।5.1.71।।
explanation: As the tiger among the monkeys pushed the big network of waves of the saltwater ocean and leaped forward, it appeared as if  he was drawing the intermediary space dividing the earth and the sky.

content: मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशानुद्धतान् स महार्णवे।अत्यक्रामन्महावेगस्तरङ्गान् गणयन्निव।।5.1.72।।
explanation: Hanuman moving along in high speed looked as if he was counting the mighty waves risen ike Meru and Mandara mountains.

content: तस्य वेगसमुद्धूतं जलं सजलदं तदा।अम्बरस्थं विबभ्राज शारदाभ्रमिवाततम्।।5.1.73।।
explanation: Then the water raised by his onrush along with the cloud widely spread in the sky shone like an outstreched autumnal cloud.

content: तिमिनक्रझषाः कूर्मा दृश्यन्ते विवृतास्तदा।वस्त्रापकर्षणेनेव शरीराणि शरीरिणाम्।।5.1.74।।
explanation: On account of the seawater rising up,  the whales, crocodiles, fish and tortoises laid bare like the limbs of the body disrobed.

content: प्लवमानं समीक्ष्याथ भुजङ्गाः सागरालयाः।व्योम्नि तं कपिशार्दूलं सुपर्ण इति मेनिरे।।5.1.75।।
explanation: Seeing Hanuman, the tiger among vanaras, coursing through the sky the serpents in their seaabode mistook him for Garuda.

content: दशयोजनविस्तीर्णा त्रिंशद्योजनमायता।छाया वानरसिंहस्य जले चारुतराभवत्।।5.1.76।।
explanation: The shadow of Hanuman, the lion among monkeys, thirty yojanas long and ten yojanas in breadth appeared more pleasing৷৷

content: श्वेताभ्रघनराजीव वायुपुत्रानुगामिनी।तस्य सा शुशुभे छाया वितता लवणाम्भसि।।5.1.77।।
explanation: The broad shadow of the son of the Windgod in the sea following him shone like a dark row of clouds sailing in the pristine sky.

content: शुशुभे स महातेजा महाकायो महाकपिः।वायुमार्गे निरालम्बे पक्षवानिव पर्वतः।।5.1.78।।
explanation: Hanuman the great vanara, splendid with a huge body coursing through the air seemed like a winged mountain flying the sky without any support.

content: येनासौ याति बलवान् वेगेन कपिकुञ्जरः।तेन मार्गेण सहसा द्रोणीकृत इवार्णवः।।5.1.79।।
explanation: As the powerful monkey, an elephant among vanaras, was proceeding swiftly along, the ocean got instantly transformed into a trough on account of water swelling by the force of his flight.

content: आपाते पक्षिसङ्घानां पक्षिराज इव व्रजन्।हनुमान् मेघजालानि प्रकर्षन् मारुतो यथा।।5.1.80।।
explanation: Hanuman was found pulling clusters of big clouds along with him like the Windgod and appeared like Garuda,the king of birds, drawing flocks of birds along with him at the time of landing.

content: पाण्डुरारुणवर्णानि नीलमाञ्जिष्ठकानि च।कपिनाकृष्यमाणानि महाभ्राणि चकाशिरे।।5.1.81।।
explanation: While Hanuman was drawing big clouds which were either white or red or blue or yellow, he looked charming.

content: प्रविशन्नभ्रजालानि निष्पतंश्च पुनः पुनः।प्रच्छन्नश्च प्रकाशश्च चन्द्रमा इव लक्ष्यते।।5.1.82।।
explanation: Entering into and emerging from the clouds, he looked like the Moon that appears and disappears (behind a bank of clouds).

content: प्लवमानं तु तं दृष्ट्वा प्लवङ्गं त्वरितं तदा।ववर्षुः पुष्पवर्षाणि देवगन्धर्वदानवाः।।5.1.83।।
explanation: Then seeing Hanuman crossing quickly, the gods, gandharvas and demons rained flowers on him.

content: तताप न हि तं सूर्यः प्लवन्तं वानरोत्तमम्।सिषेवे च तदा वायू रामकार्यार्थसिद्धये।।5.1.84।।
explanation: The Sun spared Hanuman from the heat and even the Windgod served him, blowing cool while he was taking leaps in order to fulfil Rama's mission.

content: ऋषयस्तुष्टुवुश्चैनं प्लवमानं विहायसा।जगुश्च देवगन्धर्वाः प्रशंसन्तो महौजसम्।।5.1.85।।
explanation: The sages praised him while he was coursing through the sky, the gods and gandharvas sang in praise of him extolling his majesty and vigour.

content: नागाश्च तुष्टुवुर्यक्षा रक्षांसि विबुधाः खगाः।प्रेक्ष्य सर्वे कपिवरं सहसा विगतक्लमम्।।5.1.86।।
explanation: Observing the unwearied monkey the nagas, yakshas, the demons (protecting the southwest), the learned sages and birds praised him.

content: तस्मिन् प्लवगशार्दूले प्लवमाने हनूमति।इक्ष्वाकुकुलमानार्थी चिन्तयामास सागरः।।5.1.87।।
explanation: While the monkeychief was leaping (across the sea) the Seagod wished the wellbeing of the Ikshvaku family and honoured him. (The Seagod belonged to the same race) :

content: साहाय्यं वानरेन्द्रस्य यदि नाहं हनूमत:।करिष्यामि भविष्यामि सर्ववाच्यो विवक्षताम्।।5.1.88।।
explanation: 'If I fail to help the monkeychief, the wise will blame me'.

content: अहमिक्ष्वाकुनाथेन सगरेण विवर्धितः।इक्ष्वाकुसचिवश्चायं नावसीदितुमर्हति।।5.1.89।।
explanation: 'I expanded on account of a scion of the Ikshvaku race (Sagara) and I should not do anything to make him (Hanuman) suffer since he is the minister helping the Ikshvaku race'.

content: तथा मया विधातव्यं विश्रमेत यथा कपिः।।5.1.90।।शेषं च मयि विश्रान्तः सुखेनातिपतिष्यति।
explanation: 'I will have to make arrangements for his rest. Later he can resume his journey comfortably'.

content: इति कृत्वा मतिं साध्वींसमुद्र श्छन्नमम्भसि।।5.1.91।।हिरण्यनाभं मैनाकमुवाच गिरिसत्तमम्।
explanation: Having resolved in his mind, the Seagod addressed the noble, golden mount Mainaka, hidden in the sea:

content: त्वमिहासुरसंघानां पातालतलवासिनाम्।।5.1.92।।देवराज्ञा गिरिश्रेष्ठ परिघः सन्निवेशितः।
explanation: 'O foremost mountain you are kept here by Indra, lord of the gods as a barrier against the intrusion of demons residing in the netherworld.

content: त्वमेषां जातवीर्याणां पुनरेवोत्पतिष्यताम्।।5.1.93।।पातालस्याप्रमेयस्य द्वारमावृत्य तिष्ठसि।
explanation: "You are staying at the entrance preventing the violent demons of the immeasurable nether world from jumping onto the surface.

content: तिर्यगूर्ध्वमधश्चैव शक्तिस्ते शैल वर्धितुम्।।5.1.94।।तस्मात्संचोदयामि त्वामुत्तिष्ठ गिरिसत्तम।
explanation: "O noble mountain you have the capacity to grow across, upward and downward by your free will. I therefore prompt you to grow.

content: स एष कपिशार्दूलस्त्वामुपर्येति वीर्यवान्।।5.1.95।।हनूमान्रामकार्यार्थं भीमकर्मा खमाप्लुतः।
explanation: "Valiant Hanuman, a tiger among monkeys and a performer of dreadful deeds, is  flying over you to fulfil Rama's mission

content: अस्य साह्यं मया कार्यमिक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्तिनः।।5.1.96।।मम हीक्ष्वाकवः पूज्याः परं पूज्यतमास्तव।
explanation: "I should help him for he is working for the welfare of the Ikshavaku family. The Ikshvaku kings are worthy of adoration to me and for you as well.

content: कुरु साचिव्यमस्माकं न नः कार्यमतिक्रमेत्।।5.1.97।।कर्तव्यमकृतं कार्यं सतां मन्युमुदीरयेत्।
explanation: "You may act as our minister and let us not miss this chance. Pious men lose their cool if a worthy act is left unfulfilled.

content: सलिलादूर्ध्वमुत्तिष्ठ तिष्ठत्वेष कपिस्त्वयि।।5.1.98।।अस्माकमतिथिश्चैव पूज्यश्च प्लवतां वरः।
explanation: "Rise up from the waters. Let him rest on you since this noble monkey is our guest and worthy of worship.

content: चामीकरमहानाभ देवगन्धर्वसेवित।।5.1.99।।हनुमांस्त्वयि विश्रान्तस्ततः शेषं गमिष्यति।
explanation: "O goldenpeaked mountainyou are the refuge of the gods and gandharvas. Let him also rest on you for a while before he negotiates the remaining part of the journey.

content: काकुत्स्थस्यानृशंस्यं च मैथिल्याश्च विवासनम्।।5.1.100।।श्रमं च प्लवगेन्द्रस्य समीक्ष्योत्थातुमर्हसि।
explanation: "You ought to rise up if you consider the nobility of the scion of the Kakusthas, the deportation of Mythili, and the exertion put forth by Hanuman, the lord of monkeys".

content: हिरण्यनाभो मैनाको निशम्य लवणाम्भसः।।5.1.101।।उत्पपात जलात्तूर्णं महाद्रुमलतायुतः।
explanation: Hearing the command of the god of the ocean, mount Mainaka, rich in gold and covered with trees and creepers rose up at once from the water.

content: स सागरजलं भित्त्वा बभूवाभ्युत्थितस्तदा।।5.1.102।।यथा जलधरं भित्त्वा दीप्तरश्मिर्दिवाकरः।
explanation: Just as the rising Sun comes out with glowing rays tearing the veil of dark clouds, the mountain rose up from the water of the ocean.

content: स महात्मा मुहूर्तेन सर्वतः सलिलावृतः।।5.1.103।।दर्शयामास शृङ्गाणि सागरेण नियोजितः।आदित्योदयसङ्काशैरालिखद्भिरिवाम्बरम्।शातकुम्भमयैः शृङ्गैः सकिन्नरमहोरगैः।।5.1.104।।
explanation: At the instance of Varuna, (the presiding deity of the ocean) the lofty mountain appeared, projecting its peaks, hitherto submerged in the water. The golden peaks inhabited by nagas and kinnaras resemmbled the rising Sun as though scraping the sky in a moment.

content: तप्तजाम्बूनदैः शृङ्गैः पर्वतस्य समुत्थितैः।।5.1.105।।आकाशं शस्त्रसङ्काशमभवत्काञ्चनप्रभम्।
explanation: The sky shone like barnished weapons smeared with the golden colour of the  mountain peaks that rose up above the water.

content: जातरूपमयैः शृङ्गैर्भ्राजमानैः स्वयंप्रभैः।।5.1.106।।आदित्यशतसङ्काशः सोऽभवद्गिरिसत्तमः।
explanation: The noble mountain, Mainaka was glittering  like a thousand Suns with selfeffulgent golden peaks shining.

content: तमुत्थितमसङ्गेन हनुमानग्रतः स्थितम्।।5.1.107।।मध्ये लवणतोयस्य विघ्नोऽयमिति निश्चितः।
explanation: Hanuman considered the mountain rising up in the midst of the ocean and standing in front an impediment.

content: स तमुच्छ्र्रतमत्यर्थं महावेगो महाकपिः।।5.1.108।।उरसा पातयामास जीमूतमिव मारुतः।
explanation: The great vanara,who was swift in action felled down the mountain that had risen high instantly with his chest just as the wind would strike a cloud.

content: स तथा पातितस्तेन कपिना पर्वतोत्तमः।।5.1.109।।बुद्ध्वा तस्य कपेर्वेगं जहर्ष च ननन्द च।
explanation: Felled by the vanara's speed, the tall mountain overwhelmed with joy roared in high pitch.

content: तमाकाशगतं वीरमाकाशे समुपस्थितः।।5.1.110।।प्रीतो हृष्टमाना वाक्यमब्रवीत्पर्वतः कपिम्।मानुषं धारयन् रूपमात्मनः शिखरे स्थितः।।5.1.111।।
explanation: Now the mountain assumed a human form  and standing on its own summit, which stood very high, and glad at heart, addressed the heroic vanara gone to the aerial region.

content: दुष्करं कृतवान्कर्म त्वमिदं वानरोत्तम।निपत्य मम शृङ्गेषु विश्रमस्व यथासुखम्।।5.1.112।।
explanation: "O best of vanaras you have achieved a formidable deed. Alighting on my peak and comfortably resting awhile, you may resume your journey.

content: राघवस्य कुले जातैरुदधिः परिवर्धितः।स त्वां रामहिते युक्तं प्रत्यर्चयति सागरः।।5.1.113।।
explanation: "The son of Rama's family, Sagara, has extended the ocean in the past.It is most appropriate that he (the god of the sea) honours you in return as you have set out in the service of Rama.

content: कृते च प्रतिकर्तव्यमेष धर्मः सनातनः।सोऽयं त्वत्प्रतिकारार्थी त्वत्तः सम्मानमर्हति।।5.1.114।।
त्वन्निमित्तमनेनाहं बहुमानात्प्रचोदितः।तिष्ठ त्वं कपिशार्दूल मयि विश्रम्य गम्यताम्।।5.1.115।।तव सानुषु विश्रान्तः शेषं प्रक्रमतामिति।योजनानां शतं चापि कपिरेष समाप्लुतः।।5.1.116।।
explanation: "I was prompted by the ocean for your sake since he has great regard for you. O great monkey you may rest here for a while and continue your journey. The lord of the ocean feels that this tiger among monkeys can cover the distance of a hundred yojanas. He tells me, 'let him rest on your peak and then cover the rest of the distance'.

content: तदिदं गन्धवत्स्वादु कन्दमूलफलं बहु।तदास्वाद्य हरिश्रेष्ठ विश्रान्तोऽनु गमिष्यसि।।5.1.117।।
explanation: "O foremost of the monkeys after eating plenty of sweet and tasty roots and fruits and resting a while you may go.

content: अस्माकमपि सम्बन्ध: कपिमुख्य त्वयास्ति वै।प्रख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु महागुणपरिग्रहः।।5.1.118।।
explanation: "O chief of monkeys, indeed we too have a relationship with you based on merit  which is wellknown to all the three worlds.

content: वेगवन्तः प्लवन्तो ये प्लवगा मारुतात्मज।तेषां मुख्यतमं मन्ये त्वामहं कपिकुञ्जर।।5.1.119।।
explanation: "O son of the Windgod you are an elephant among monkeys, the foremost among them who move at a high speed.

content: अतिथिः किल पूजार्हः प्राकृतोऽपि विजानता।धर्मं जिज्ञासमानेन किं पुनस्त्वादृशो महान्।।5.1.120।।
explanation: "Even a newcomer, however ordinary, deserves worship by a wise man who wishes to educate himself in the path of righteousness. Needless to say that distinguished guest like you deserves all reverence.

content: त्वं हि देववरिष्ठस्य मारुतस्य महात्मनः।पुत्रस्तस्यैव वेगेन सदृशः कपिकुञ्जर।।5.1.121।।
explanation: "O foremost among the vanaras you are the son of the highsouled Windgod's, preeminent among the gods, you are also equal to him in speed.

content: पूजिते त्वयि धर्मज्ञ पूजां प्राप्नोति मारुतः।तस्मात्त्वं पूजनीयो मे शृणु चाप्यत्र कारणम्।।5.1.122।।
explanation: "O knower of righteousness to worship you is to honour the Windgod. Therefore you are worthy of worship for me. I will tell you the reason. Listen.

content: पूर्वं कृतयुगे तात पर्वताः पक्षिणोऽभवन्।ते हि जग्मुर्दिशः सर्वा गरुडानिलवेगिनः।।5.1.123।।
explanation: "Formerly in Kritayuga, O dear, mountains were endowed with wings. They used to move speedily in all directions like Garuda and the Windgod.

content: ततस्तेषु प्रयातेषु देवसङ्घा: महर्षिभिः।भूतानि च भयं जग्मुस्तेषां पतनशङ्कया।5.1.124।।
explanation: "When they moved about, even hosts of sages, gods and creatures panicked for fear of falling down (and destroying all worlds).

content: ततः क्रुद्धः सहस्राक्षः पर्वतानां शतक्रतुः।पक्षान् चिच्छेद वज्रेण तत्र तत्र सहस्रशः।।5.1.125।।
explanation: "Provoked at this, the thousandeyed Indra who had performed a hundred sacrifices cut off the wings of mountains into a thousands pieces with his thunderbolt.

content:
स मामुपागतः क्रुद्धो वज्रमुद्यम्य देवराट्।

ततोऽहं सहसा क्षिप्तः श्वसनेन महात्मना।।5.1.126।।
explanation: "Angry Indra held the thunderbolt and came towards me chasing. At that time the great Wind-god tossed me into the air and dropped me down at once.

content: अस्मिन्लवणतोये च प्रक्षिप्तः प्लवगोत्तम।गुप्तपक्षसमग्रश्च तव पित्राभिरक्षितः।।5.1.127।।
explanation: "O distinguished vanara your father, the Windgod threw me down into this saltwater sea. Thus my wings were protected.

content: ततोऽहं मानयामि त्वां मान्यो हि मम मारुतः।त्वया मे ह्येष सम्बन्धः कपिमुख्य महागुणः।।5.1.128।।
explanation: "O esteemed vanara the Windgod is revered by me and so I honour you. O chief of monkeys, my bondage with you is therefore of high value to me, indeed.

content: अस्मिन्नेवंगते कार्ये सागरस्य ममैव च।प्रीतिं प्रीतमनाः कर्तुं त्वमर्हसि महाकपे।।5.1.129।।
explanation: "O great monkey when I hold you so high, you ought to oblige me and the (god of the) ocean wholeheartedly (and accept our hospitalty).

content: श्रमं मोक्षय पूजां च गृहाण कपिसत्तम।प्रीतिं च बहुमन्यस्व प्रीतोऽस्मि तव दर्शनात्।।5.1.130।।
explanation: "O noble monkey oblige us by accepting our offering given with love and be relieved of your fatigue. Your presence itself is welcome to me".

content: एवमुक्तः कपिश्रेष्ठस्तं नगोत्तममब्रवीत्।प्रीतोऽस्मि कृतमातिथ्यं मन्युरेषोऽपनीयताम्।।5.1.131।।
explanation: The great Hanuman, pleased with the words of Mainaka, said "I am pleased at your hospitality. Remove your unhappiness.

content: त्वरते कार्यकालो मे अहश्चाप्यतिवर्तते।प्रतिज्ञा च मया दत्ता न स्थातव्यमिहान्तरे।।5.1.132।।
explanation: "My commitment is hastening me. The day set (for the accomplishment of the task) is also drawing to a close. A vow is made and I will not halt in the middle of my work."

content: इत्युक्त्वा पाणिना शैलमालभ्य हरिपुङ्गवः।जगामाकाशमाविश्य वीर्यवान् प्रहसन्निव।।5.1.133।।
explanation: Having said this, the mighty monkey gently touched the mountain with his hands before ascending to the sky with a smile on his face.

content: स पर्वतसमुद्राभ्यां बहुमानादवेक्षितः।पूजितश्चोपपन्नाभिराशीर्भिरनिलात्मजः।।5.1.134।।
explanation: The mountain and the sea honoured and adored the son of the Windgod and gave him appropriate  blessings.

content: अथोर्ध्वं दूरमुत्प्लुत्य हित्वा शैलमहार्णवौ।पितुः पन्थानमास्थाय जगाम विमलेऽम्बरे।।5.1.135।।
explanation: And thereafter leaping a long distance into the clear sky, he (Hanuman) took the path of the Windgod, his father, leaving behind the mountain and the sea.

content: भूयश्चोर्ध्वं गतिं प्राप्य गिरिं तमवलोकयन्।वायुसूनुर्निरालम्बे जगाम विमलेऽम्बरे।।5.1.136।।
explanation: Rising higher and further up and looking at the mountain (which was going down into the ocean), the son of the Windgod coursed through the cloudless sky unsupported.

content: तद् द्वितीयं हनुमतो दृष्ट्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम्।प्रशशंसुः सुराः सर्वे सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।।5.1.137।।
explanation: Gods, siddhas as well as the great sages praised him for the second great achievment of Hanuman, which is impossible for others to accomplish.

content: देवताश्चाभवन् हृष्टास्तत्रस्थास्तस्य कर्मणा।काञ्चनस्य सुनाभस्य सहस्राक्षश्च वासवः।।5.1.138।।
explanation: The gods who happened to be present at that time (on the mountain) and the thousandeyed Indra were delighted by the gesture of golden Sunabha (Mainaka) mountain.

content: उवाच वचनं धीमान् परितोषात्सगद्गदम्।सुनाभं पर्वतश्रेष्ठं स्वयमेव शचीपतिः।।5.1.139।।
explanation: Indra, the lord of Sachi, was personally satisfied and spoke to Mainaka, the best of mountains, in faltering tone, his throat choked out of joy.

content: हिरण्यनाभ शैलेन्द्र परितुष्टोऽस्मि ते भृशम्।अभयं ते प्रयच्छामि तिष्ठ सौम्य यथासुखम्।।5.1.140।।
explanation: "O Hiranyanabha, the foremost among the mountains I am highly pleased with you. I give you security (free from fear of losing wings). O pious one you may stay on happily as you please.

content: साह्यं कृतं ते सुमहद्विक्रान्तस्य हनूमतः।क्रमतो योजनशतं निर्भयस्य भये सति।।5.1.141।।
explanation: "You have rendered very valuable help to Hanuman who was attempting to leap  a distance of a hundred yojanas. He is fearless even when there is reason to fear (of falling down).

content: रामस्यैष हितायैव याति दाशरथेर्हरिः।सत्क्रियां कुर्वता तस्य तोषितोऽस्मि दृढं त्वया।।5.1.142।।
explanation: "The vanara has gone on a mission to help the son of Dasaratha. I am highly pleased with the service rendered to him.

content: ततः प्रहर्षमगमद्विपुलं पर्वतोत्तमः।देवतानां पतिं दृष्ट्वा परितुष्टं शतक्रतुम्।।5.1.143।।
explanation: Thereafter Mainaka, the great mountain was delighted to see Indra,  lord of the gods, performer of a hundred yajnas satisfied.

content: स वै दत्तवरः शैलो बभूवावस्थितस्तदा।हनुमांश्च मुहूर्तेन व्यतिचक्राम सागरम्।।5.1.144।।
explanation: Then mount Mainaka, assured by Indra became secure. And Hanuman also crossed over the ocean in a short while.

content: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।अब्रुवन् सूर्यसङ्काशां सुरसां नागमातरम्।।5.1.145।।
explanation: Then the gods, gandharvas, siddhas and great sages approached Surasa, the mother of nagas, who was glowing like the Sungod and said:.

content: अयं वातात्मजः श्रीमान्प्लवते सागरोपरि।हनुमान्नाम तस्य त्वं मुहूर्तं विघ्नमाचर।।5.1.146।।राक्षसं रूपमास्थाय सुघोरं पर्वतोपमम्।दंष्ट्राकरालं पिङ्गाक्षं वक्त्रं कृत्वा नभः समम्।।5.1.147।।
explanation: "The glorious son of the Windgod, called Hanuman, is crossing the ocean. Obstruct him for sometime by assuming the hideous form of a demon, gigantic as a mountain, fearful with yellowishbrown eyes, with big teeth and a wide mouth like the sky.

content: बलमिच्छामहे ज्ञातुं भूयश्चास्य पराक्रमम्।त्वां विजेष्यत्युपायेन विषादं वा गमिष्यति।।5.1.148।।
explanation: "We want to assess his strength, valour and intelligence once again. We wish to know whether he will win or give way to despondency".

content: एवमुक्ता तु सा देवी दैवतैरभिसत्कृता।समुद्रमध्ये सुरसा बिभ्रती राक्षसं वपुः।।5.1.149।।विकृतं च विरूपं च सर्वस्य च भयावहम्।प्लवमानं हनूमन्तमावृत्येदमुवाच ह।।5.1.150।।
explanation: Thus honoured by the gods, Surasa assumed a terrific ugly form frightening to all and stood in the midst of the ocean. Putting up a distorted appearance and encompassing Hanuman who was crossing the ocean, she spoke to him:

content: मम भक्षः प्रदिष्टस्त्वमीश्वरैर्वानरर्षभ।अहं त्वां भक्षयिष्यामि प्रविशेदं ममाननम्।।5.1.151।।
explanation: "O bull among vanaras the lords of the universe have provided you as food for me. I will eat you. Enter my mouth".

content: एवमुक्तः सुरसया प्राञ्जलिर्वानरर्षभः।प्रहृष्टवदनः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.1.152।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Surasa,  the glorious Hanuman said this with a blooming face and folded hands:

content: रामो दाशरथिर्नाम प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया।।5.1.153।।
explanation: "Dasaratha's son called Rama accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and his wife Vaidehi entered Dandaka forest.

content: अन्यकार्यविषक्तस्य बद्धवैरस्य राक्षसैः।तस्य सीता हृता भार्या रावणेन यशस्विनी।।5.1.154।।
explanation: "While Rama was engaged otherwise, his glorious wife Sita was abducted by Ravana actuated by deeprooted enmity of demons with him.

content: तस्याः सकाशं दूतोऽहं गमिष्ये रामशासनात्।कर्तुमर्हसि रामस्य साह्यं विषयवासिनि।।5.1.155।।
explanation: "I am going as Rama's emissary to search for his wife. It is proper for you to render help since you are a resident of his kingdom.

content: अथवा मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा रामं चाक्लिष्टकारिणम्।आगमिष्यामि ते वक्त्रं सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि ते।।5.1.156।।
एवमुक्ता हनुमता सुरसा कामरूपिणी।अब्रवीन्नातिवर्तेन्मां कश्चिदेष वरो मम।।5.1.157।।
explanation: Having heard Hanuman, Surasa capable of taking any form at her free will told him that no one can cross (her region) as she had been given such a boon(by the Creator)৷৷

content: तं प्रयान्तं समुद्वीक्ष्य सुरसा वाक्यमब्रवीत्।बलं जिज्ञासमाना वै नागमाता हनूमतः।।5.1.158।।
explanation: Surasa, mother of serpents, observing that Hanuman was attempting to escape, said this in order to gauge his strength:

content: प्रविश्य वदनं मेऽद्य गन्तव्यं वानरोत्तम।वर एष पुरा दत्तो मम धात्रेति सत्वरा।।5.1.159।।व्यादाय विपुलं वक्त्रं स्थिता सा मारुतेः पुरः।
explanation: "O best vanara you must pass through my mouth today. Such is the boon granted to me by Brahma in the past". Then she quickly opened her big mouth and stood.

content: एवमुक्तः सुरसया क्रुद्धो वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.1.160।।अब्रवीत्कुरु वै वक्त्रं येन मां विषहिष्यसे।
explanation: Thus addressed by Surasa, Hanuman the supreme vanara said, "Open your mouth wide enough to hold me."

content: इत्युक्त्वा सुरसां क्रुद्धो धशयोजनमायता।।5.1.161।।दशयोजनविस्तारो बभूव हनुमांस्तदा।
explanation: Provoked by the words of Surasa, Hanuman stretched himself to ten yojanas.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा मेघसङ्काशं दशयोजनमायतम्।।5.1.162।।चकार सुरसा चास्यं विंशद्योजनमायतम्।
explanation: Seeing his body stretched to ten yojanas like a cloud, Surasa also widened her mouth to twenty yojanas.

content: हनुमांस्तु ततः क्रुद्धस्त्रिंशद्योजनमायतः।।5.1.163।।चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं चत्वारिंशत्तथोच्छ्रितम्।बभूव हनुमावनीरः पञ्चाशद्योजनोच्छ्रितः।।5.1.164।।
explanation: Provoked, Hanuman further stretched his body to thirty yojanas and Surasa on her own enlarged her mouth to forty yojanas. Then the great hero Hanuman stretched his body to fifty yojanas.

content: चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं षष्टियोजनमायतम्।तथैव हनुमावनीरः सप्ततीयोजनोच्छ्रितः।।5.1.165।।
explanation: Surasa widened her mouth sixty yojanas and then the heroic Hanuman enlarged himself to seventy yojanas.

content: चकार सुरसा वक्त्रमशीतीयोजनायतम्।हनुमानचलप्रख्यो नवतीयोजनोच्छ्रितः।।5.1.166।।
explanation: Surasa widened her mouth to eighy yojanas and the heroic Hanuman grew up to ninety yojanas, looking like a mountain.

content: चकार सुरसा वक्त्रं शतयोजनमायतम्तव सानुषु विश्रान्तः शेषं प्रक्रमतामिति।तद्दृष्ट्वा व्यादितं त्वास्यं वायुपुत्रः सुबुद्धिमान्।दीर्घजिह्वं सुरसया सुघोरं नरकोपमम्।।5.1.167।।सुसंक्षिप्यात्मनः कायं बभूवाङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः।
explanation: Intelligent Hanuman observing Surasa's enlarged mouth open and dreadful like hell with a long tongue, suddenly shrunk his body to the size of a thumb.

content: सोऽभिपत्याशु तद्वक्त्रं निष्पत्य च महाबलः।अन्तरिक्षे स्थितः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.1.168।।
explanation: Glorious and mighty  Hanuman quickly went into her mouth and got out and stood in the sky and said:.

content: प्रविष्टोऽस्मि हि ते वक्त्रं दाक्षायणि नमोऽस्तु ते।गमिष्ये यत्र वैदेही सत्यं चासीद्वरस्तव।।5.1.169।।
explanation: "O Dakshayani I have indeed entered your mouth and your boon has come true (as nobody can go against the boon of the Creator). Allow me to proceed in quest of Vaidhehi. My salutations to you."

content: तं दृष्ट्वा वदनान्मुक्तं चन्द्रं राहुमुखादिव।अब्रवीत्सुरसा देवी स्वेन रूपेण वानरम्।।5.1.170।।
explanation: Seeing Hanuman released out of her mouth like the Moon released from the mouth of Rahu, Surasa assumed her true form and said:

content: अर्थसिद्ध्यै हरिश्रेष्ठ गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम्।समानयस्व वैदेहीं राघवेण महात्मना।।5.1.171।।
explanation: "O noble vanara proceed happily to achieve your purpose. Go and unite Vaidehi with the noble self, Raghava.

content: तत्तृतीयं हनुमतो दृष्ट्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम्।साधु साध्विति भूतानि प्रशशंसुस्तदा हरिम्।।5.1.172।।
explanation: Witnessing Hanuman achieving a very difficult feat for the third time, all the living beings applauded him saying "Well done, welldone".

content: स सागरमनाधृष्यमभ्येत्य वरुणालयम्।जगामाकाशमाविश्य वेगेन गरुडोपमः।।5.1.173।।
explanation: Rising above the invincible ocean, the abode of lord Varuna, Hanuman coursed through the sky speedily like Garuda.

content: सेविते वारिधाराभिः पतगैश्च निषेविते।चरिते कैशिकाचार्यैरैरावतनिषेविते।।5.1.174।।सिंहकुञ्जरशार्दूलपतगोरगवाहनैः।विमानैः सम्पतद्भिश्च विमलैः समलङ्कृते।।5.1.175।।वज्राशनिसमाघातैः पावकैरुपशोभिते।कृतपुण्यैर्महाभागैः स्वर्गजिद्भिरलङ्कृते।।5.1.176।।वहता हव्यमत्यर्धं सेविते चित्रभानुना।ग्रहनक्षत्रचन्द्रार्कतारागण विभूषिते।।5.1.177।।महर्षिगणगन्धर्वनागयक्षसमाकुले।विविक्ते विमले विश्वे विश्वावसुनिषेविते।।5.1.178।।देवराजगजाक्रान्ते चन्द्रसूर्यपथे शिवे।विताने जीवलोकस्य वितते ब्रह्मनिर्मिते।।5.1.179।।बहुशः सेविते वीरैर्विद्याधरगणैर्वरैः।जगाम वायुमार्गे तु गरुत्मानिव मारुतिः।।5.1.180।।
explanation: Hanuman passed through the path of wind like Garuda. The region was refreshed with clouds that released torrents of rain and frequented by birds. The great masters of music (Tumburu, Narada and Gandharvas) trained in Kasika moved there driven by lions, elephants, tigers, birds and serpents and were moving in different aerial vehicles. It was splendid with god at fire who strikes fiercely like thunderbolt. It was inhabited by great sages who had acquired merit. The region was traversed by firegod who carried havis in large quantities earnestly. It was decorated with planets, constellations, Moon, Sun and clusters of stars. It was filled with groups of greal sages, gandharvas, nagas and yakshas. It was isolated part of the universe traversed by the king of gandharvas like Vishvavasu. It was an auspicious path for Moon and Sun, a sporting ground for Airavata, the vehicle of lord Indra. It was an extensive world of living beings created by Brahma. It was frequented by many heroes ascending to heaven and blocked by vidyadharas.

content: प्रदृश्यमानः सर्वत्रः हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।भेजेऽम्बरं निरालम्बं लम्बपक्ष इवाद्रिराट्।।5.1.181।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod was seen everywhere in the sky. He appeared like a longwinged king of mountains unsupported.

content: प्लवमानं तु तं दृष्ट्वा सिंहिका नाम राक्षसी।मनसा चिन्तयामास प्रवृद्धा कामरूपिणी।।5.1.182।।
explanation: Seeing Hanuman speeding in the sky a demoness called Simhika who can assume any form at her will had grown out of proportion and thought on her part:

content: अद्य दीर्घस्य कालस्य भविष्याम्यहमाशिता।इदं हि मे महत्सत्त्वं चिरस्य वशमागतम्।।5.1.183।।
इति सञ्चिन्त्य मनसा छायामस्य समाक्षिपत्।छायायां गृह्यमाणायां चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.1.184।।
explanation: Thinking thus, she dragged him by his shadow before she took hold of him, Hanuman started deliberating within.

content: समाक्षिप्तोऽस्मि सहसा पङ्गूकृतपराक्रमः।प्रतिलोमेन वातेन महानौरिव सागरे।।5.1.185।।
explanation: "I am caught suddenly. I am handicapped.I am like a huge ship in an ocean retarded by the wind blowing from the opposite direction.

content: तिर्यगूर्ध्वमधश्चैव वीक्षमाणस्ततः कपिः।ददर्श स महत्सत्त्वमुत्थितं लवणाम्भसि।।5.1.186।।
explanation: Looking around, right and left, up and down, the monkey saw a huge being rise from the salty sea.

content: तद्धृष्ट्वा चिन्तयामास मारुतिर्विकृताननम्।कपिराजेन कथितं सत्त्वमद्भुतदर्शनम्।।5.1.187।।छायाग्राहि महावीर्यं तदिदं नात्र संशयः।
explanation: Seeing the form with a hideous countenance, Hanuman reflected about the creature of ugly appearance endowed with power which can catch a creature though his shadow, about which king Sugriva had once told him. 'It is the same creature, no doubt', said Hanuman.

content: स तां बुद्ध्वार्थतत्त्वेन सिंहिकां मतिमान्कपिः।।5.1.188।।व्यवर्धत महाकायः प्रावृषीव वलाहकः।
explanation: Recognising the true nature of Simhika the clutcher of shadows, the wise Hanuman grew to a huge size like a cloud in rainy season.

content: तस्य सा कायमुद्वीक्ष्य वर्धमानं महाकपेः।।5.1.189।।वक्त्रं प्रसारयामास पातालान्तरसन्निभम्।
explanation: Observing the body of Hanuman growing in size, Simhika started distending her mouth wide like the depth of the underworld.

content: घनराजीव गर्जन्ती वानरं समभिद्रवत्।।5.1.190।।स ददर्श ततस्तस्या विवृतं सुमहन्मुखम्।कायमात्रं च मेधावी मर्माणि च महाकपिः।।5.1.191।।
explanation: Roaring like a heavy mass of clouds, Simhika chased Hanuman. Intelligent Hanuman observed her enormous mouth and noticed her vital parts.

content: स तस्या विवृते वक्त्रे वज्रसंहननः कपिः।संक्षिप्य मुहुरात्मानं निष्पपात महाबलः।।5.1.192।।
explanation: Hanuman, the vanara whose physique was as hard as thunderbolt suddenly contracted once again and entered her opened mouth.

content: आस्ये तस्या निमज्जन्तं ददृशुः सिद्धचारणाः।ग्रस्यमानं यथा चन्द्रं पूर्णं पर्वणि राहुणा।।5.1.193।।
explanation: The siddhas and charanas who were watching his performance of drowning in her mouth were amazed as though the moon is seized by Rahu on a fullmoon night.

content: ततस्तस्या नखैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मर्माण्युत्कृत्य वानरः।उत्पपाताथ वेगेन मनः सम्पातविक्रमः।।5.1.194।।
explanation: The vanara who had the speed of mind tore her vital parts with his sharp nails and rushed out quickly before she closed her mouth.

content: तां तु दृष्ट्वा च धृत्या च दाक्षिण्येन निपात्य च।स कपिप्रवरो वेगाद्ववृधे पुनरात्मवान्।।5.1.195।।
explanation: Selfcontrolled Hanuman, the great monkey acting with firmness of mind and ingenuity threw her down and once again rapidly grew in size.

content: हृतहृत्सा हनुमतापपात विधुराम्भसि।तां हतां वानरेणाशु पतितां वीक्ष्य सिंहिकाम्।।5.1.196।।भूतान्याकाशचारीणि तमूचुः प्लवगोत्तमम्।
explanation: Heart torn asunder and killed by Hanuman, miserable Simhika instantly fell into the sea water. Observing it, the beings who ranged the sky said to the foremost of vanaras:

content: भीममद्य कृतं कर्म महत्सत्त्वं त्वया हतम्।।5.1.197।।साधयार्थमभिप्रेतमरिष्टं प्लवतां वर।
explanation: "O great jumper a great deed has been done by you today in killing that fierce creature. O great monkey fulfil your mission without any obstruction.

content: यस्य त्वेतानि चत्वारि वानरेन्द्र यथा तव।।5.1.198।।धृतिर्दृष्टिर्मतिर्दाक्ष्यं सः कर्मसु न सीदति।
explanation: "O lord of vanaras he in whom these four qualities, fortitude, vision, intelligence and dexterity exist as in you will achieve his mission and not get lost".

content: स तैः सम्भावितः पूज्यः प्रतिपन्नप्रयोजनः।।5.1.199।।जगामाकाशमाविश्य पन्नगाशनवत्कपिः।
explanation: Honoured by them the venerable monkey went ascending into the sky like Garuda to achieve the objective.

content: प्राप्तभूयिष्ठपारस्तु सर्वतः प्रतिलोकयन्।।5.1.200।।योजनानां शतस्यान्ते वनराजिं ददर्श सः।
explanation: On reaching the other side of the shore crossing  a hundred yojanas, he saw rows of forest trees.

content: ददर्श च पतन्नेव विविधद्रुमभूषितम्।।5.1.201।।द्वीपं शाखामृगश्रेष्ठो मलयोपवनानि च।
explanation: Hanuman, the best among jumpers, even while in air he saw an island adorned with many trees, also gardens adjacent to Malaya mountain.

content: सागरं सागरानूपं सागरानूपजान् द्रुमान्।।5.1.202।।सागरस्य च पत्नीनां मुख्यान्यपि विलोकयन्।स महामेघसङ्काशं समीक्ष्यात्मानमात्मवान्।।5.1.203।।निरुन्धन्तमिवाकाशं चकार मतिमान् मतिम्।
explanation: Looking at the ocean, he observed the sea bordering the land and the trees grown on the marshy land in the region of the mouths of the rivers (the consorts of the sea.). Looking at his own body which was like a huge cloud as though obstructing the sky, the wise monkey of selfcontrol thought as follows.

content: कायवृद्धिं प्रवेगं च मम दृष्ट्वैव राक्षसाः।।5.1.204।।मयि कौतूहलं कुर्यरिति मेने महाकपिः।
explanation: 'The demons will be inquisitive to know about me seeing the extraordinary size of my body as well as my speed', thought the great monkey.

content: ततः शरीरं संक्षिप्य तन्महीधरसन्निभम्।।5.1.205।।पुनः प्रकृतिमापेदे वीतमोह इवात्मवान्।
explanation: Then Hanuman contracted his huge mountainlike body and assumed his normal form, just as a sage who gives up ignorance on awakening .

content: तद्रूपमतिसंक्षिप्य हनुमान् प्रकृतौ स्थितः।।5.1.206।।त्रीन् क्रमानिव विक्रम्य बलिवीर्यहरो हरिः।
explanation: Hanuman returned to his normal  form contracting to his small size, just like Lord Visnu returned to his original form after taking three strides and defeating the valour of king Bali.

content: स चारुनानाविधरूपधारी परं समासाद्य समुद्रतीरम्।परैरशक्यः प्रतिपन्नरूपः समीक्षितात्मा समवेक्षितार्धः।।5.1.207।।
explanation: He reached the opposite shore of the sea. He had achieved the impossible. One who could assume a variety of lovely forum, he, gazing at his own body, deliberated on the future course of action.

content: ततः स लम्बस्य गिरेः समृद्धे विचित्रकूटे निपपात कूटे ।सकेतकोद्दालकनालिकेरे महाद्रिकूटप्रतिमो महात्मा।।5.1.208।।
explanation: Then  the highsouled Hanuman, who resembled a huge mountain, descended on the peak of the huge mountain Trikuta, called Lamba,  which was wonderful  with kethaka flowers, uddalaka and coconut trees.

content: ततस्तु सम्प्राप्य समुद्रतीरं समीक्ष्य लङ्कां गिरिवर्यमूर्ध्नि।कपिस्तु तस्निन्निपपात पर्वते विधूय रूपं व्यथयन्मृगद्विजान्।।5.1.209।।
explanation: Reaching the sea shore, beholding Lanka located on the peak of Trikuta, Hanuman shook his body, scaring the beasts and birds and landed on the mountain.

content: स सागरं दानवपन्नगायुतं बलेन विक्रम्य महोर्मिमालिनम्।निपत्य तीरे च महोदधेस्तदा ददर्श लङ्काममरावतीमिव।।5.1.210।।
explanation: Landing on the shore after crossing by his prowess the great ocean filled with demons, and serpents, adorned with garlands of waves, Hanuman beheld Lanka which was like Amaravati, the capital of Indra.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे प्रथमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the first sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman reaches the main entrance of Lanka  assuming a diminutive form.] स सागरमनादृष्यमतिक्रम्य महाबलः।       त्रिकूटशिखरे लङ्कां स्थितां स्वस्थो ददर्श ह।।5.2.1।।
explanation: The mighty Hanuman crossed the inviolable sea, stood comfortably on the peak of Trikuta mountain and looked at Lanka.

content:
ततः पादपमुक्तेन पुष्पवर्षेण वीर्यवान्।

अभिवृष्टः स्थितस्तत्र बभौ पुष्पमयो यथा।।5.2.2।।
explanation: Covered fully with the continuous shower of flowers dropped on him from the trees, heroic Hanuman appeared as though he was a heap of flowers as he stood there.

content: योजनानां शतं श्रीमांस्तीर्त्वाप्युत्तमविक्रमः।अनिःश्वसन् कपिस्तत्र न ग्लानिमधिगच्छति।।5.2.3।।
explanation: The glorious, powerful vanara (Hanuman) even after crossing a hundred yojanas, felt neither suffocated nor exasperated.

content: शतान्यहं योजनानां क्रमेयं सुबहून्यपि।किं पुनः सागरस्यान्तं संख्यातं शतयोजनम्।।5.2.4।।
explanation: (He said to himself), "I can cross a distance of even hundreds of yojanas. What to say of a hundred yojanas which is a calculated distance."

content: स तु वीर्यवतां श्रेष्ठः प्लवतामपि चोत्तमः।जगाम वेगवान् लङ्कां लङ्घयित्वा महोदधिम्।।5.2.5।।
explanation: Courageous and exalted Hanuman, the best among vanaras, noted for his speed reached Lanka crossing over the great ocean on his own.

content: शाद्वलानि च नीलानि गन्धवन्ति वनानि च।गण्डवन्ति च मध्येन जगाम नगवन्ति च।।5.2.6।।
explanation: Hanuman passed through forests laden with fragrant flowers, bluish grassy land, big rocks and mountains covered with trees.

content: शैलांश्च तरुसंछन्नान् वनाराजीश्च पुष्पिताः।अभिचक्राम तेजस्वी हनुमान् प्लवगर्षभः।।5.2.7।।
explanation: Brilliant Hanuman, a bull among monkeys, crossed the mountains covered with blossoming trees and forest ranges.

content: स तस्मिन्नचले तिष्ठन्वनान्युपवनानि च।स नगाग्रे च तां लङ्कां ददर्श पवनात्मजः।।5.2.8।।
explanation: That son of the Windgod stood on the mountain and saw the forests and groves round Lanka situated on the mountain peak.

content: सरलान् कर्णिकारांश्च खर्जूरांश्च सुपुष्पितान्।प्रियालून्मुचुलिन्दांश्च कुटजान् केतकानपि।।5.2.9।।प्रियंङ्गून् गन्धपूर्णांश्च नीपान् सप्तच्छदांस्तथा।आसनान् कोविदारांश्च करवीरांश्च पुष्पितान्।।5.2.10।।पुष्पभारनिबद्धांश्च तथा मुकुलितानपि।पादपान् विहगाकीर्णान् पवनाधूतमस्तकान्।।5.2.11।।हंसकारण्डवाकीर्णा वापीः पद्मोत्मलायुताः।आक्रीडान् विविधान् रम्यावन् विविधांश्च जलाशयान्।।5.2.12।।सन्ततान् विविधैर्वृक्षैः सर्वर्तुफलपुष्पितैः।उद्यानानि च रम्याणि ददर्श कपिकुञ्जरः।।5.2.13।।
explanation: The mighty vanara saw around Lanka, trees like sarala, karnikara in full bloom, datepalms, priyala, muchulinda, kutaja, kethaka trees filled with fragrance priyangu, kadamba, so also flowering plants like saptachhada, asana, kovidara and karaveera fully loaded with flowers and buds. These trees were thronged by birds, with their branches shaken by the wind. Flocks of swans and waterfowls were found in ponds of different types. There were various pleasure groves with flowers in bloom and fruits of all seasons and varieties of water resorts and delightful gardens.

content: समासाद्य च लक्ष्मीवान् लङ्कां रावणपालिताम्।परिखाभिः सपद्माभिः सोत्पलाभिरलङ्कृताम्।।5.2.14।।सीतापहरणार्थेन रावणेन सुरक्षिताम्।समन्ताद्विचरद्भिश्च राक्षसैरुग्रधन्विभिः।।5.2.15।।काञ्चनेनावृतां रम्यां प्राकारेण महापुरीम्।गृहैश्च ग्रहसंकाशैः शारदाम्बुदसन्निभैः।।5.2.16।।पाण्डुराभिः प्रतोलीभिरुच्चाभिरभिसंवृताम्।अट्टालकशताकीर्णां पताकाध्वजमालिनीम्।।5.2.17।।तोरणैः काञ्चनैर्दिव्यैर्लतापङ्त्किविचित्रितैः।ददर्श हनुमान् लङ्कां दिवि देवपुरीं यथा।।5.2.18।।
explanation: Fortunate Hanuman having reached Lanka ruled by Ravana found it surrounded by moats full of blue lotuses, guarded by demons with frightening bows, in view of Sita abducted and kept there. It was protected by boundary walls inlaid with gold that great and beautiful city with buildings resembling the assembly of planets and whitewashed, elevated  houses looking like autumnal clouds and well laid out streets decorated with garlands of banners and flag posts, rows of colourful creepers and festoons. The city of Lanka appeared like Amaravati, the city of gods.

content: गिरिमूर्ध्निं स्थितां लङ्कां पाण्डुरैर्भवनैः शुभैः।ददर्श स कपिश्रेष्ठः पुरमाकाशगं यथा।।5.2.19।।
explanation: The foremost among the vanaras, perched on top of the mountain saw the city of Lanka on the mountain with auspicious mansions as though touching the sky.

content: पालितां राक्षसेन्द्रेण निर्मितां विश्वकर्मणा।प्लवमानमिवाकाशे ददर्श हनुमान् पुरीम्।।5.2.20।।
explanation: The city of Lanka, ruled by the lord of demons and built by Visvakarma looked as if it was a city floating in the sky.

content: वप्रप्राकारजघनां विपुलाम्बुनवाम्बराम्।शतघ्नीशूलकेशान्तामट्टालकवतंसकाम्।।5.2.21।।मनसेव कृतां लङ्कां निर्मितां विश्वकर्मणा।द्वारमुत्तरमासाद्य चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.2.22।।
explanation: Having reached the northern entrance of the city he started thinking that Visvakarma must have conceived Lanka as a lady with its ramparts as her hips and loins, moats filled with water as her robes, the spiked iron tridents as her locks of hair, and the tall towers as her her ear rings

content: कैलासशिखरप्रख्यामालिखन्तीमिवाम्बरम्।डीयमानामिवाकाशमुच्छ्रितैर्भवनोत्तमैः।।5.2.23।।सम्पूर्णां राक्षसैर्घोरैर्नागैर्भोगवतीमिव।अचिन्त्यां सुकृतां स्पष्टां कुबेराध्युषितां पुरा।।5.2.24।।दंष्ट्रिभिर्बहुभिः शूरैः शूलपट्टसपाणिभिः।रक्षितां राक्षसैर्घोरैर्गुहामाशीविषैरिव।।5.2.25।।तस्याश्च महतीं गुप्तिं सागरं च निरीक्ष्य सः।रावणं च रिपुं घोरं चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.2.26।।
explanation: Observing Lanka that resembled mount Kailas, with sky scrapers appearing as if flying, filled with dreadful demons and nagas protecting the city of Bhogavati (the city of Patala), unimaginably wellbuilt. It was once occupied by Kubera (half brother of Ravana). It was guarded by horrible demons holding tridents and spears in their hands. The city appeared like a cavern protected by venomous serpents with protruding fangs. Hanuman examined the high security of Lanka and looked at the ocean. He thought of the form of Ravana, a formidable  enemy:

content: आगत्यापीह हरयो भविष्यन्ति निरर्थकाः।न हि युद्देन वै लङ्का शक्या जेतुं सुरैरपि।।5.2.27।।
explanation: 'It is not possible for monkeys to come here and even if they do, it is no use.  Lanka is invincible even to the gods in war.

content: इमां तु विषमां दुर्गां लङ्कां रावणपालिताम्।प्राप्यापि स महाबाहुः किं करिष्यति राघवः।।5.2.28।।
explanation: 'What will  Rama the mighty armed hero do even after reaching this formidable city of Lanka ruled by Ravana?

content: अवकाशो नसान्त्वस्य राक्षसेष्वभिगम्यते।न दानस्य न भेदस्य नैव युद्धस्य दृश्यते।।5.2.29।।
explanation: 'There is no scope for reconciliation with the demons. It is not possible to win over them with gifts. They cannot be divided by dissension. There is no scope for war.

content: चतुर्णामेव हि गतिर्वानराणां महात्मनाम्।वालिपुत्रस्य नीलस्य मम राज्ञश्च धीमतः।।5.2.30।।
explanation: 'Only four great monkeys can have access to this place. They are Angada the son of Vali, Nila, Sugriva, the wise king of monkeys and myself.

content: यावज्जानामि वैदेहीं यदि जीवति वा न वा।तत्रैव चिन्तयिष्यामि दृष्ट्वा तां जनकात्मजाम्।।5.2.31।।
explanation: 'Whether Janaka's daughter, Vaidehi is alive or not is not known. After seeing her I shall think over'.

content: ततः स चिन्तयामास मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः।गिरिशृङ्गे स्थितस्तस्मिन् रामस्याभ्युदये रतः।।5.2.32।।
explanation: Standing on the mountain, the elephant among monkeys pondered for a while on the means of finding Sita, in which lay the welfare of Rama.

content: अनेन रूपेण मया न शक्या रक्षसां पुरी।प्रवेष्टुं राक्षसैर्गुप्ता क्रूरैर्बलसमन्वितैः।।5.2.33।।
explanation: 'I shall not be able  in my present form to enter the city guarded by fierce and powerful demons.

content: उग्रौजसो महावीर्या बलवन्तश्च राक्षसाः।वञ्चनीया मया सर्वे जानकीं परिमार्गता।।5.2.34।।
लक्ष्यालक्ष्येण रूपेण रात्रौ लङ्का पुरी मया।प्रवेष्टुं प्राप्तकालं मे कृत्यं साधयितुं महत्।।5.2.35।।
explanation: 'To accomplish this great task I will have to assume an inconspicious form and enter the city of Lanka in the night as that is the appropriate time.

content: तां पुरीं तादृशीं दृष्ट्वा दुराधर्षां सुरासुरैः।हनुमान् चिन्तयामास विनिश्चित्य मुहुर्मुहुः।।5.2.36।।
explanation: 'Looking at the city, unassailable even to gods and demons, Hanuman sighed again and again thinking:

content: केनोपायेन पश्येयं मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम्।अदृष्टो राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.2.37।।
explanation: 'By what means can I find Mythili, daughter of Janaka, without being noticed by the evilminded Ravana, the lord of demons?

content: न विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं रामस्य विदितात्मनः।एकामेकश्च वश्येयं रहिते जनकात्मजाम्।।5.2.38।।
explanation: 'How can the purpose of Rama, a noble soul be not spoilt? I may have a private audience with the daughter of Janaka.

content: भूताश्चार्था विपद्यन्ते देशकालविरोधिताः।विक्लबं दूतमासाद्य तमः सूर्योदये यथा।।5.2.39।।
explanation: 'Just as darkness disappears at Sunrise, wellplanned strategies also fail at the hands of a thoughtless messenger when they are set in opposition to proper time and place.

content: अर्थानर्थान्तरे बुद्धिर्निश्चितापि न शोभते।घातयन्ति हि कार्याणि दूताः पण्डितमानिनः।।5.2.40।।
explanation: 'Even though messengers are not intelligent, they think themselves clever and capable. They act foolishly, swerve from proper course of action and fail in their effort.

content: न  विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं वैक्लब्यं न कथं भवेत्।लङ्घनं च समुद्रस्य कथं नु न वृथा भवेत्।।5.2.41।।
explanation: 'How should the task be performed? How to avoid impetuousness? How can my purpose of crossing the ocean be not wasted?

content: मयि दृष्टे तु रक्षोभी रामस्य विदितात्मनः।भवेद्व्यर्थमिदं कार्यं रावणानर्थमिच्छतः।।5.2.42।।
explanation: 'If I am seen by the demons, the plan of Rama, possessor of selfknowledge, to kill Ravana, will be wasted.

content: न हि शक्यं क्वचित् स्थातुमविज्ञातेन राक्षसैः।अपि राक्षसरूपेण किमुतान्येन केनचित्।।5.2.43।।
explanation: 'It is difficult to stay with the demon anywhere here even in the disguise of a demon without being identified. It will not be possible to remain unidentified even by assuming any other form.

content: वायुरप्यत्र नाज्ञातश्चरेदिति मतिर्मम।न ह्य स्त्यविदितं किञ्चिद्राक्षसानां बलीयसाम्।।5.2.44।।
explanation: 'I think even the wind who has no form cannot move here without being detected. Nothing escapes the notice of powerful demons. There is nothing unknown to them.

content: इहाहं यदि तिष्ठामि स्वेन रूपेण संवृतः।विनाशमुपयास्यामि भर्तुरर्थश्च हीयते।।5.2.45।।
explanation: 'I will surely meet with death if I hide here in my original form and my master's mission also will be spoilt.

content: तदहं स्वेन रूपेण रजन्यां ह्रस्वतां गतः।लङ्कामभिपतिष्यामि राघवस्यार्थसिद्धये।।5.2.46।।
explanation: 'Therefore I shall transform myself into a tiny form and jump about the city of Lanka during night time in order to accomplish Raghava's purpose.

content: रावणस्य पुरीं रात्रौ प्रविश्य सुदुरासदाम्।विचिन्वन् भवनं सर्वं द्रक्ष्यामि जनकात्मजाम्।।5.2.47।।
explanation: 'Entering by night the inaccessible city of Ravana, I shall search all over the palace and find Sita'.

content: इति सञ्चिन्त्य हनुमान् सूर्यस्यास्तमयं कपिः।आचकाङ्क्षे तदा वीरो वैदेह्या दर्शनोत्सुकः।।5.2.48।।
explanation: Having planned in that manner the heroic Hanuman keen to see Sita waited for the Sunset.

content: सूर्ये चास्तं गते रात्रौ देहं सङ्क्षिप्य मारुतिः।पृषदंशकमात्रः सन् बभूवाद्भुतदर्शनः।।5.2.49।।
explanation: When Sun set, Maruti, the son of the Windgod, reduced himself at night to the small size of a cat, wonderful to behold.

content: प्रदोषकाले हनुमांस्तूर्णमुत्प्लुत्य वीर्यवान्।प्रविवेश पुरीं रम्यां सुविभक्तमहापथाम्।।5.2.50।।
explanation: As soon as dusk had set in, courageous Hanuman jumped in and entered the well laidout royal path of the beautiful city.

content: प्रासादमालाविततां स्तम्भैः काञ्चनराजतैः।शातकुम्भमयैर्जालैर्गन्थर्वनगरोपमाम्।।5.2.51।।सप्तभौमाष्टभौमैश्च स ददर्श महापुरीम्।तलैः स्फाटिकसंकीर्णैः कार्तस्वरविभूषितैः।।5.2.52।।
explanation: Hanuman saw the city stretched with rows of buildings all over,with seven or eight storied  mansions, which had pillars of gold and silver, windows with fretwork of gold, inlaid with crystals, floors decorated with gold, resembling the grand city of gandharvas.

content: वैडूर्यमणिचित्रैश्च मुक्ताजालविभूषितैः।तलैः शुशुभिरे तानि भवनान्यत्र रक्षसाम्।।5.2.53।।
explanation: Inlaid with precious gems and fretwork, and ornamented with pearls, the mansions of demons looked splendid.

content: काञ्चनानि च चित्राणि तोरणानि च रक्षसाम्।लङ्कामुद्योतयामासुः सर्वतः समलङ्कृताम्।।5.2.54।।
explanation: The golden archways of the demon were colourful. They illuminated the well   decorated Lanka from all sides.

content: अचिन्त्यामद्भुताकारां दृष्टवा लङ्कां महाकपिः।आसीद्विषण्णो हृष्टश्च वैदेह्या दर्शनोत्सुकः।।5.2.55।।
explanation: Beholding Lanka of unimaginable, wonderful glory, the great monkey keen to see Sita became sad as well as elated at once (He did not know how to find Sita in that city and felt sad. But he was also elated that he was going to meet her at any cost.)

content: स पाण्डुराविद्धविमानमालिनीं महार्हजाम्बूनदजालतोरणाम्।यशस्विनीं रावणबाहुपालितां क्षपाचरैर्भीमबलैः समावृताम्।।5.2.56।।
explanation: He found that famed place with a garland of tall, white mansions, conspicuous with archways latticed with gold strings, protected by mighty Ravana and surrounded by terrific demons.

content: चन्द्रोऽपि साचिव्यमिवास्य कुर्वंस्तारागणैर्मध्यगतो विराजन्।ज्योत्स्नावितानेन वितत्य लोक मुत्तिष्ठते नैकसहस्ररश्मि:।।5.2.57।।
explanation: Even the Moon rose with thousands of rays in the centre of multitudes of stars overspreading and illumining the world with a canopy of bright beams, as if to render ministerial help to Hanuman.

content: शङ्खप्रभं क्षीरमृणालवर्ण मुद्गच्छमानं व्यवभासमानम्।ददर्श चन्द्रं स हरिप्रवीरः पोप्लूयमानं सरसीव हंसम्।।5.2.58।।
explanation: The heroic vanara saw the rising Moon flitting in and out shining like a fresh white conch, in the colour of milk and lotus stalks, bright like a swan floating in the lakelike sky.  इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the second sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman's confrontation with Lankini, the spirit of Lanka.]स लम्बशिखरे लम्बे लम्बतोयदसन्निभे।सत्त्वमास्थाय मेधावी हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।।5.3.1।।निशि लङ्कां महासत्त्वो विवेश कपिकुञ्जरः।रम्यकाननतोयाढ्यां पुरीं रावणपालिताम्।।5.3.2।।
explanation: The mighty son of the Windgod, intelligent Hanuman, an elephant among vanaras, standing on the peak of the Lamba which looked like a high rainbearing cloud and relying on his energy, entered by night the city of Lanka, ruled by Ravana  rich in delightful forests, groves and water pools.

content: शारदाम्बुधरप्रख्यैर्भवनैरुपशोभिताम्।सागरोपमनिर्घोषां सागरानिलसेविताम्।।5.3.3।।सुपुष्टबलसम्पुष्टां यथैव विटपावतीम्।चारुतोरणनिर्यूहां पाण्डुरद्वारतोरणाम्।।5.3.4।।भुजगाचरितां गुप्तां शुभां भोगवतीमिव।तां स विद्युद्घनाकीर्णां ज्योतिर्मार्गनिषेविताम्।।5.3.5।।मन्दमारुतसञ्चारां यथेन्द्रस्यामरावतीम्।शातकुम्भेन महता प्राकारेणाभिसंवृताम्।।5.3.6।।किङ्किणीजालघोषाभिः पताकाभिरलङ्कृताम्।आसाद्य सहसा हृष्टः प्राकारमभिपेदिवान्।।5.3.7।।
explanation: Hanuman, happy to reach Lanka, stood on its rampart and surveyed the city of land which was splendid with beautiful mansions overcast with autumnal clouds pierced by glittering streaks of lightning, served by planets and stars with mild winds blowing (out of fear of Ravana), with the roaring sounds of the sea and with a wellfed army like Vitapavati (that is Alaka, the capital of Kubera, halfbrother of Ravana and the treasurer of celestials),  which had elephants sationed at the outer gates, provided with white archways and protected by serpents like the auspicious city of Bhogavati (capital of Patala). Surrounded by a golden rampart, the city resembled Amaravati, the capital of Indra, decorated with flags fluttering, echoing with the jingling sounds of small bells.

content: विस्मयाविष्टहृदयः पुरीमालोक्य सर्वतः।जाम्बूनदमयैर्द्वारैर्वैडूर्यकृतवेदिकैः।।5.3.8।।वज्रस्फटिकमुक्ताभिर्मणिकुट्टिमभूषितैः।तप्तहाटकनिर्यूहै राजतामलपाण्डुरैः।।5.3.9।।वैढूर्यकृतसोपानैः स्फाटिकान्तरपांसुभिः।चारुसंजवनोपेतैः खमिवोत्पतितैः शुभैः।।5.3.10।।क्रौञ्चबर्हिणसङ्घुष्टैः राजहंस निषेवितैः।तूर्याभरणनिर्घोषैः सर्वतः प्रतिनादिताम्।।5.3.11।।वस्वौकसाराप्रतिमां तां वीक्ष्य नगरीं ततः।खमिवोत्पतितुं कामां जहर्ष हनुमान् कपिः।।5.3.12।।
explanation: Surveying all over, Hanuman was wonderstruck to see as though it was leaping into the sky. The city had golden shutters, altars encrusted with vaidurya, mansions inlaid with diamonds, crystals, pearls and other gems, crowned with pure gold and silver. The staircases built with silver were studded with vaidurya. The beautiful quadrangles, coverd with grains of crystal were as though leaping into the air. It echoed with sounds of krauncha birds, peacocks and royal swans. Filled with sounds of musical instruments, it resembled the city of Vaswokasara.

content: तां समीक्ष्य पुरीं रम्यां राक्षसाधिपतेः शुभाम्।अनुत्तमामृद्धियुतां चिन्तयामास वीर्यवान्।।5.3.13।।
explanation: Gazing at the enchanting, auspicious, prosperous city of the king of demons mighty Hanuman began to reflect:

content: नेयमन्येन नगरी शक्या धर्षयितुं बलात्।रक्षिता रावणबलैरुद्यतायुधधारिभिः।।5.3.14।।
explanation: 'It is not possible to attack this city by to outsiders as it is protected by the forces of Ravana with their weapons ready(to attack).

content: कुमुदाङ्गदयोर्वापि सुषेणस्य महाकपेः।प्रसिद्धेयं भवेद्भूमिर्मैन्दद्विविदयोरपि।।5.3.15।।
explanation: 'This land can be reached by Kumuda and Angada or the great vanara Sushena and even by Mainda and Dvivida.

content:
विवस्वतस्तनूजस्य हरेश्च कुशपर्वणः।

ऋक्षस्य केतुमालस्य मम चैव गतिर्भवेत्।।5.3.16।।
explanation: 'Son of Vivaswan (Sugriva), the chief of vanaras, Kushaparva, Riksha (Jambavan), Ketumala and myself also will be able to reach this place.

content: समीक्ष्य तु महाबाहू राघवस्य पराक्रमम्।लक्ष्मणस्य च विक्रान्तमभवत् प्रीतिमान् कपिः।।5.3.17।।
explanation: Reflecting upon the valour of longarmed Rama and valiant advances of Lakshmana Hamuman felt pleased (within himself).

content: तां रत्नवसनोपेतां कोष्ठागारावतंसकाम्।यन्त्रागारस्तनीमृद्धां प्रमदामिव भूषिताम्।।5.3.18।।तां नष्टतिमिरां दीप्तैर्भास्वरैश्च महागृहैः।नगरीं राक्षसेन्द्रस्य स ददर्श महाकपिः।।5.3.19।।
explanation: Hanuman looked at the city of the demon king, whose darkness was dispelled by bright gems and mighty mansions as if it were a young maiden. The prosperous city was like a well decorated woman, adorned with ornaments having walls for her dress, the stables for her earrings, the armouries for her breasts.

content: थ सा हरिशार्दूलं प्रविशन्तं महाबलम्।नगरी स्वेन रूपेण ददर्श पवनात्मजम्।।5.3.20।।
explanation: Assuming her real form the presiding deity of Lanka noticed the son of the Windgod, the tiger among vanaras of great prowess entering the city.

content: सा तं हरिवरं दृष्ट्वा लङ्का रावणपालिता।स्वयमेवोत्थिता तत्र विकृताननदर्शना।।5.3.21।।
explanation: Seeing the best of vanaras, the deity of the city of Lanka, ruled by Ravana rose up before him in a distorted form.

content: पुरस्तात्कपिवर्यस्य वायुसूनोरतिष्ठत।मुञ्चमाना महानादमब्रवीत्पवनात्मजम्।।5.3.22।।
explanation: She stood in front of the son of the Windgod and spoke to him in a loud voice.

content: कस्त्वं केन च कार्येण इह प्राप्तो वनालय।कथयस्वेह यत्तत्त्वं यावत्प्राणा धरन्ति ते।।5.3.23।।
explanation: "O dweller of the forest, who are you? Why did you come here? Speak the truth about your identity, so long as you hold on to your life.

content: न शक्यं खल्वियं लङ्का प्रवेष्टुं वानर त्वया।रक्षिता रावणबलैरभिगुप्ता समन्ततः।।5.3.24।।
explanation: "O vanara this Lanka is a secret place protected by Ravana's army everywhere. It is surely not possible for you to enter this city".

content: अथ तामब्रवीद्वीरो हनुमानग्रतः स्थिताम्।कथयिष्यामि ते तत्त्वं यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि।।5.3.25।।
explanation: Then Hanuman who was standing in front of her said, "I will tell you the truth since you are asking me".

content: का त्वं विरूपनयना पुरद्वारेऽवतिष्ठसि।किमर्थं चापि मां रुद्ध्वा निर्भर्त्सयसि दारुणा।।5.3.26।।
explanation: "Who are you, terrible woman of ugly, distorted eyes? Why are you obstructing me at the gate of the city? Why do you impound upon me?

content: हनुमद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लङ्का सा कामरूपिणी।उवाच वचनं क्रुद्धा परुषं पवनात्मजम्।।5.3.27।।
explanation: The spirit of Lanka who could assume any form at her will got enraged on hearing the words of Hanuman and spake in a harsh tone.

content: अहं राक्षसराजस्य रावणस्य महात्मनः।आज्ञाप्रतीक्षा दुर्धर्षा रक्षामि नगरीमिमाम्।।5.3.28।।
explanation: "In obedience to the orders of the great demon king, Ravana, I am protecting this unassailable city.

content: न शक्या मामवज्ञाय प्रवेष्टुं नगरी त्वया।अद्य प्राणैः परित्यक्तः स्वप्स्यसे निहतो मया।।5.3.29।।
explanation: "It is not possible for you to enter this city ignoring my presence. Soon you will be killed. You will give up your life and attain eternal sleep.

content: अहं हि नगरी लङ्का स्वयमेव प्लवङ्गम।सर्वतः परिरक्षामि ह्येतत्ते कथितं मया।।5.3.30।।
explanation: "O monkey I am the presiding ogress of Lanka presenting myself personally. I  am to protect this city. This is my answer to you".

content: लङ्काया वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।यत्नवान्स हरिश्रेष्ठः स्थितश्शैल इवापरः।।5.3.31।।
explanation: On hearing the words of ogress of Lanka, the son of the Windgod stood up ready and appeared like another mountain.

content: स तां स्त्रीरूपविकृतां दृष्टवा वानरपुङ्गवः।आबभाषेऽथ मेधावी सत्त्ववान् प्लवगर्षभः।।5.3.32।।
explanation: Seeing the monster of a woman, the powerful Hanuman, bull among vanaras endowed with wisdom spoke to her.

content: द्रक्ष्यामि नगरीं लङ्कां साट्टप्राकारतोरणाम्।निर्विशङ्कमिमंलोकं पश्यन्त्यास्तवसांप्रतम्।इत्यर्थमिह संप्राप्तः परं कौतूहलं हि मे।।5.3.33।।
explanation: "I would like to see this Lanka with marketplaces, gateways and ramparts. I have come here for that purpose. My curiosity has been roused to see this place.

content: वनान्युपवनानीह लङ्कायाः काननानि च।सर्वतो गृहमुख्यानि द्रष्टुमागमनं हि मे।।5.3.34।।
explanation: "I have arrived here to see Lanka's gardens, groves and forests and also all the important houses".

content: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लङ्का सा कामरूपिणी।भूय एव पुनर्वाक्यं बभाषे परुषाक्षरम्।।5.3.35।।
explanation: On hearing Hanuman, the ogress of Lanka, who could assume any form, replied in harsh words:

content: मामनिर्जित्य दुर्बुद्धे राक्षसेश्वरपालितां।न शक्यमद्य ते द्रष्टुं पुरीयं वानराधम।।5.3.36।।
explanation: "O evilminded, foolish monkey It is not possible for you to enter the city ruled by Ravana, the king of demons without conquering me".

content: ततः स कपिशार्दूलस्तामुवाच निशाचरीम्।दृष्ट्वा पुरीमिमां भद्रे पुनर्यास्ये यथागतम्।।5.3.37।।
explanation: The tiger among monkeys said to the, the nightwalker "O noble Lanka I shall see this city and go back".

content: ततः कृत्वा महानादं सा वै लङ्का भयावहम्।तलेन वानरश्रेष्ठं ताडयामास वेगिता।।5.3.38।।
explanation: Then the ogress of Lanka made a loud and frightening sound and struck the most powerful vanara  with the palm of her hand.

content: ततः स कपिशार्दूलो लङ्कया ताडितो भृशम्।ननाद सुमहानादं वीर्यवान् पवनात्मजः।।5.3.39।।
explanation: At this strong slap, the heroic Hanuman, son of the Windgod roared loudly.

content: ततः संवर्तयामास वामहस्तस्य सोऽङ्गुलीः।मुष्टिनाऽऽभिजघानैनां हनुमान् क्रोधमूर्छितः।।5.3.40।।स्त्री चेति मन्यमानेन नातिक्रोधः स्वयं कृतः।
explanation: Overcome by anger, Hanuman clenched the fingers of his left hand and hit her with his fist. Considering her to be, after all, a woman he did not turn outrageous.

content: सा तु तेन प्रहारेण विह्वलाङ्गी निशाचरी।।5.3.41।।पपात सहसा भूमौ विकृताननदर्शना।
explanation: Struck by the blow of Hanuman the demoness fell down on the ground at once, her limbs shattered, her face distorted.

content: ततस्तु हनुमान् प्राज्ञस्तां दृष्ट्वा विनिपातिताम्।।5.3.42।।कृपां चकार तेजस्वी मन्यमानः स्त्रियं तु ताम्।
explanation: Wise and brilliant Hanuman, seeing the deity fallen down, left her (without killing her) out of compassion, thinking that she is a woman, after all.

content: ततो वै भृशसंविग्ना लङ्का सा गद्गदाक्षरम्।।5.3.43।।उवाचागर्वितं वाक्यं हनूमन्तं प्लवङ्गमम्।
explanation: Thereafter, the deflated demoness of Lanka with an agitated voice, said to Hanuman, the monkeyhero:

content: प्रसीद सुमहाबाहो त्रायस्व हरिसत्तम ।।5.3.44।।समये सौम्य तिष्ठन्ति सत्त्ववन्तो महाबलाः।
explanation: "O, strongshouldered great monkey be gracious. Save me. Heroes endowed with great strength stay back when the time comes.

content: अहं तु नगरी लङ्का स्वयमेव प्लवङ्गम।।5.3.45।।निर्जिताहं त्वया वीर विक्रमेण महाबल।
explanation: "O monkey I am Lanka incarnate. You have conquered me by your strength and valour.

content: इदं तु तथ्यं शृणु वै ब्रुवन्त्या मे हरीश्वर।।5.3.46।।स्वयंभुवा पुरा दत्तं वरदानं यथा मम।
explanation: "O lord of vanaras in the past Creator Brahma had given me a boon which has come true. I will tell you. listen.

content: यदा त्वां वानरः कश्चिद्विक्रमाद्वशमानयेत्।।5.3.47।।तदा त्वया हि विज्ञेयं रक्षसां भयमागतम्।
explanation: 'When a vanara vanquishes you by his prowess, you may know that destruction of ogres will set in.

content: स हि मे समयः सौम्य प्राप्तोऽद्य तव दर्शनात्।।5.3.48।।स्वयंभू विहितः सत्यो न तस्यास्ति व्यतिक्रमः।
explanation: "O gentle one the time ordained by Brahma has come today with your presence  here. The truth revealed by Brahma, the selfborn, cannot be proved otherwise.

content: सीतानिमित्तं राज्ञस्तु रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।।5.3.49।।रक्षसां चैव सर्वेषां विनाशः समुपागतः।
explanation: "The ruin of all demons and evilminded king Ravana will take place due to (the abduction of) Sita.

content: तत्प्रविश्य हरिश्रेष्ठ पुरीं रावणपालिताम्।।5.3.50।।विधत्स्व सर्वकार्याणि यानि यानीह वाञ्छसि।
explanation: "O great vanara enter the city ruled by Ravana and accomplish your purpose.

content: प्रविश्य शापोपहतां हरीश्वर शुभां पुरीं राक्षसमुख्यपालिताम्।यदृच्छया त्वं जनकात्मजां सतीं विमार्ग सर्वत्र गतो यथासुखम्।।5.3.51।।
explanation: "O lord of vanaras you may search for the chaste lady, daughter of king Janaka all over freely entering this doomed city, ruled by the chief of demons.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायाणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे तृतीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the third sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman witnesses Ravana's strength at Lanka.]स निर्जित्य पुरीं श्रेष्ठां लङ्कां तां कामरूपिणीम्।विक्रमेण महातेजा हनुमान् कपिसत्तमः।।5.4.1।।अद्वारेण च महाबाहुः प्राकारमभिपुप्लुवे।
explanation: Hanuman, the strongshouldered, mighty monkey chief having defeated the (presiding) deity of Lanka who could assume any form at her will, leaped over the boundary wall of the rear entrance of the excellent city by his prowess.

content: प्रविश्य नगरीं लङ्कां कपिराजहितंकरः।।5.4.2।।चक्रेऽथ पादं सव्यं च शत्रूणां स तु मूर्धनि।
explanation: Hanuman, a devotee of the king of monkeys entered the city of Lanka placing his left foot first on the forehead of the city and proceeded (by tradition one enters the enemy's dwelling by placing the left foot first to cause defeat of the enemy).

content: प्रविष्टः सत्त्वसम्पन्नो निशायां मारुतात्मजः।।5.4.3।।स महापथमास्थाय मुक्तापुष्पविराजितम्।ततस्तु तां पुरीं लङ्कां रम्यामभिययौ कपिः।।5.4.4।।
explanation: The son of the Windgod, endowed with great strength, entered the enchanting Lanka and walked along the highway set with flowers of pearls.

content: हसितोत्कृष्टनिनदैस्तूर्यघोषपुरस्सरैः।वज्रांकुशनिकाशैश्च वज्रजालविभूषितैः।।5.4.5।।गृहमेघैः पुरी रम्या बभासे द्यौरिवाम्बुदैः।
explanation: The houses reverberating with sounds of laughter and of musical instruments, decorated with lattice windows of diamonds resembled the sky shining with clouds with a goad made of diamond (thunderbolt of Indra).

content: प्रजज्वाल ततो लङ्का रक्षोगणगृहैः शुभैः।।5.4.6।।सिताभ्रसदृशैश्चित्रैः पद्मस्वस्तिकसंस्थितैः।वर्धमानगृहैश्चापि सर्वतः सुविभूषिता।।5.4.7।।
explanation: The city of Lanka appeared radiant with its tall mansions resembling white clouds. The  mansions had auspicious marks of lotus and swastika engraved on them and were opening in the direction of the south.

content: तां चित्रमाल्याभरणां कपिराजहितङ्करः।राघवार्थं चरन् श्रीमान् ददर्श च ननन्द च।।5.4.8।।
explanation: Glorious Hanuman, wellwisher of Sugriva, king of vanaras, looked around the city, decorated with colourful garlands. Surveying it for the cause of Raghava, he was greatly delighted.

content: भवनाद्भवनं गच्छन् ददर्श पवनात्मजः।विविधाकृतिरूपाणि भवनानि ततस्ततः।।5.4.9।।
explanation: Going from one building to another, Hanuman saw mansions of different kinds  structures.
