content: आपानशाला विचितास्तथा पुष्पगृहाणि च।।5.12.12।।चित्रशालाश्च विचिता भूयः क्रीडागृहाणि च।निष्कुटान्तररथ्याश्च विमानानि च सर्वशः।।5.12.13।।
explanation: 'I have searched the banquet halls, bowers of creepers, picture galleries and gymnasiums. I have searched everywhere through the paths of gardens and mansions, harems and the Pushpaka chariot also.

content: इति सञ्चिन्त्य भूयोऽपि विचेतुमुपचक्रमे।भूमीगृहांश्चैत्यगृहान् गृहातिगृहकानपि।।5.12.14।।
explanation: Thinking thus, he started searching once again the basement cells, temples, homes within homes.

content: उत्पतन्निष्पतंश्चापि तिष्ठन्गच्छन् पुनः पुनः।अपावृण्वंश्च द्वाराणि कवाटान्यवघाटयन्।।5.12.15।।प्रविशन्निष्पतंश्चापि प्रपतन्नुत्पतन्नपि।सर्वमप्यवकाशं स विचचार महाकपिः।।5.12.16।।
explanation: The great vanara searched all over again and again jumping up and down, stopping for a while and moving, opening and closing doors, by crossing, entering and exiting, jumping up and down. Thus he moved about and searched whereever there was scope to search

content: चतुरङ्गुलमात्रोऽपि नावकाशः स विद्यते।रावणान्तःपुरे तस्मिन् यं कपिर्न जगाम सः।।5.12.17।।
explanation: Even a space of four fingers in the inner chambers of Ravana was not left out in his search for Sita.

content: प्राकारान्तररथ्याश्च वेदिकाश्चैत्यसंश्रयाः।दीर्घिकाः पुष्करिण्यश्च सर्वं तेनावलोकितम्।।5.12.18।।
explanation: He moved in the lanes inside the boundary walls, around the shrines, altars, wells and tanks whereever it was possible to look for.

content: राक्षस्यो विविधाकारा विरूपा विकृतास्तथा।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न तु सा जनकात्मजा।।5.12.19।।
explanation: Hanuman could see only ogresses of different typesugly, deformed but could not find the daughter of Janaka.

content: रूपेणाप्रतिमा लोके वरा विद्याधरस्त्रियः।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न तु राघवनन्दिनी।।5.12.20।।
explanation: Hanuman could see even the women of vidyadharas who were matchless in beauty among women in the world but not Janaki the beloved of Raghava.

content: नागकन्या वरारोहाः पूर्णचन्र्दनिभाननाः।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न तु सीता सुमध्यमा।।5.12.21।।
explanation: Hanuman could see there moonfaced daughters of nagas with charming limbs but not the slimwaisted Sita.

content: प्रमथ्य राक्षसेन्द्रेण नागकन्या बलाद्धृताः।दृष्टा हनुमता तत्र न सा जनकनन्दिनी।।5.12.22।।
explanation: Hanuman saw the daghters of nagas kidnapped by Ravana forcibly after victory in war but not Sita, the delight of Janaka.

content: सोऽपश्यंस्तां महाबाहुः पश्यंश्चान्या वरस्त्रियः।विषसाद मुहुर्धीमान् हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।।5.12.23।।
explanation: The longarmed Hanuman, son of the Windgod was able to see other great women but not Sita. So he became despondent.

content: उद्योगं वानरेन्द्राणां प्लवनं सागरस्य च।व्यर्थं वीक्ष्यानिलसुतश्चिन्तां पुनरुपागमत्।।5.12.24।।
explanation: The son of the Wind god, the great monkey realised the futility of his efforts in crossing the sea. He brooded again.

content: अवतीर्य विमानाच्च हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।चिन्तामुपजगामाथ शोकोपहतचेतनः।।5.12.25।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, came out of the aerial chariot, mind stricken with grief and started thinking again.इत्यार्षे  श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman's soliloquy in despondency.]विमानात्तु सुसम्क्रम्य प्राकारं हरियूथपः।हनुमान्वेगवानासीद्यथा विद्युद्घनान्तरे।।5.13.1।।
explanation: Hanuman, the vanara leader, jumped from the aerial chariot to the boundary wall like a flash of lightning in the clouds.

content: सम्परिक्रम्य हनुमान्रावणस्य निवेशनात्।अदृष्ट्वा जानकीं सीतामब्रवीद्वचनं कपिः।।5.13.2।।
explanation: Going round the palace of Ravana, unable to see Janaka's daughter Sita, Hanuman spoke thus to himself:

content: भूयिष्ठं लोलिता लङ्का रामस्य चरता प्रियम्।न हि पश्यामि वैदेहीं सीतां सर्वाङ्गशोभनाम्।।5.13.3।।
explanation: "I have thoroughly surveyed the entire city of Lanka to please Rama, but I am unable to find Sita of flawless beauty.

content: पल्वलानि तटाकानि सरांसि सरितस्तथा।नद्योऽनूपवनान्ताश्च दुर्गाश्च धरणीधराः।।5.13.4।।लोलिता वसुधा सर्वा न तु पश्यामि जानकीम्।
explanation: "I have searched for Sita thoroughly in waterlogs, lakes, tanks, streams and rivers and all over the woods and among mountains that are difficult to reach. I have searched all over the land but have not been able to find Janaki.

content: इह सम्पातिना सीता रावणस्य निवेशने।।5.13.5।।आख्याता गृध्रराजेन न च पश्यामि तामहम्।
explanation: "Sampati, king of vultures had said that Sita is at Ravana's palace. But I have not been able to see her.

content: किं नु सीताऽथ वैदेही मैथिली जनकात्मजा।।5.13.6।।उपतिष्ठेत विवशा रावणं दुष्टचारिणम्।
explanation: "Can it be that Mythili, daughter of Janaka, dejected and helpless succumbed to the evil intentions of Ravana.

content: क्षिप्रमुत्पततो मन्ये सीतामादाय रक्षसः।।5.13.7।।बिभ्यतो रामबाणानामन्तरा पतिता भवेत्।
explanation: "Or, perhaps she might have been dropped midway from the hold of Ravana while he was flying at great speed, afraid of the deadly arrows of Rama?

content: अथवा ह्रियमाणायाः पथि सिद्धनिषेविते।।5.13.8।।मन्ये पतितमार्याया हृदयं प्रेक्ष्य सागरम्।
explanation: "Or, perhaps while being borne away on the path frequented by siddhas, the beloved of Rama might have fallen down (dead), heart broken, on seeing the (vast) sea.

content: रावणस्योरुवेगेन भुजाभ्यां पीडितेन च।।5.13.9।।तया मन्ये विशालाक्ष्या त्यक्तं जीवितमार्यया।
explanation: "He thinks, on account of the high speed during the flight of Ravana under the pressure of his arms, the noble, largeeyed lady might have given up her life.

content: उपर्युपरि वा नूनं सागरं क्रमतस्तदा।।5.13.10।।विवेष्टमाना पतिता सागरे जनकात्मजा।
explanation: "Surely, she might have fallen into the sea while wriggling in her effort to extricate herself from the hold of Ravana as he was flying over the sea.

content: अहो क्षुद्रेण वाऽनेन रक्षन्ती शीलमात्मनः।।5.13.11।।अबन्धुर्भक्षिता सीता रावणेन तपस्विनी।
explanation: "Oh poor Sita, distanced from relations, while protecting her chastity helplessly she might have been devoured by cruel Ravana.

content: अथवा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पत्नीभिरसितेक्षणा।।5.13.12।।अदुष्टा दुष्टभावाभिर्भक्षिता सा भविष्यति।
explanation: "Or else, the pious, blackeyed Sita might have been eaten by the the cruelnatured wives of the lord of demons.

content: सम्पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम्।।5.13.13।।रामस्य ध्यायती वक्त्रं पञ्चत्वं कृपणा गता।
explanation: "Or, she might have attained death, meditating on Rama, whose face resembles the fullmoon and eyes the lotus petals.

content: हा राम लक्ष्मणेत्येवं हाऽयोध्ये चेति मैथिली।।5.13.14।।विलप्य बहु वैदेही न्यस्तदेहा भविष्यति।
explanation: "Or, Vaidehi, the princess of Mithila might have cast off her life grieving intensely and crying, 'Alas, Rama, alas, Lakshmana, alas, Ayodhya'. (Mithila is the name of the  capital city and Videha is the country which was ruled by Janaka. Sita, the princess is known as Vaidehi, Mythili and Janaki).

content: अथवा निहिता मन्ये रावणस्य निवेशने।।5.13.15।।नूनं लालप्यते सीता पञ्जरस्थेव शारिका।
explanation: "Or, I think Sita might have been imprisoned in a cage like a myna in Ravana's palace. She will be surely crying.

content: जनकस्य सुता सीता रामपत्नी सुमध्यमा।।5.13.16।।कथमुत्पलपत्राक्षी रावणस्य वशं व्रजेत्।
explanation: "How could Janaki, the daughter of Janaka, Rama's wife, the lady with a beautiful waist and eyes like lotus petals, come under the fold of Ravana?

content: विनष्टा वा प्रणष्टा वा मृता वा जनकात्मजा।।5.13.17।।रामस्य प्रियभार्यस्य न निवेदयितुं क्षमम्।
explanation: "Whether Janaki is lost or irretrievable or dead is not known The news should not be  reported to Rama, who is very fond of his wife.

content: निवेद्यमाने दोषस्स्याद्दोषस्स्यादनिवेदने।।5.13.18।।कथं नु खलु कर्तव्यं विषमं प्रतिभाति मे।
explanation: "To carry or not to carry this news to Rama would be a mistake. What shall I do? I am facing a tough situation.

content: अस्मिन्नेवंगते कार्ये प्राप्तकालं क्षमं च किम्।।5.13.19।।भवेदिति मतं भूयो हनुमान्प्रविचारयत्।
explanation: "I wonder what the right course of action is when things have taken such a turn? What is proper for me to do? Hanuman once again deliberated.

content: यदि सीतामदृष्ट्वाऽहं वानरेन्द्रपुरीमितः।।5.13.20।।गमिष्यामि ततः को मे पुरुषार्थो भविष्यति।
explanation: "If I return to Kishkinda without seeing Sita of what use is my effort? What have I accomplished? What will happen? (Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha are the four Purusharthas or accomplishments in life)

content: ममेदं लङ्घनं व्यर्थं सागरस्य भविष्यति।।5.13.21।।प्रवेशश्चैव लङ्कायाः राक्षसानां च दर्शनम्।
explanation: "My crossing the ocean, my entry into Lanka and my survey of the demons are all futile.

content: किं मां वक्ष्यति सुग्रीवो हरयो वा समागताः।।5.13.22।।किष्किन्धां समनुप्राप्तं तौ वा दशरथात्मजौ।
explanation: "What will Sugriva or even the vanaras and the two sons of Dasaratha say when I reach Kishkinda?

content: गत्वा तु यदि काकुत्स्थं वक्ष्यामि परमप्रियम्।।5.13.23।।न दृष्टेति मया सीता ततस्तक्ष्यति जीवितम्।
explanation: "If I report the most unpleasant news that Sita was not found, Rama will give up his life.

content: परुषं दारुणं क्रूरं तीक्ष्णमिन्द्रियतापनम्।।5.13.24।।सीतानिमित्तं दुर्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा स न भविष्यति।
तं तु कृच्छ्रगतं दृष्ट्वा पञ्चत्वगतमानसम्।।5.13.25।।भृशानुरक्तो मेधावी न भविष्यति लक्ष्मणः।
explanation: "Seeing Rama in such a painful state, wise Lakshmana who has given his life to Rama, to whom he is deeply devoted will also not survive.

content: विनष्टौ भ्रातरौ श्रुत्वा भरतोऽपि मरिष्यति।।5.13.26।।भरतं च मृतं दृष्ट्वा शत्रुघ्नो न भविष्यति।
explanation: "On hearing the death of both the brothers Bharata will also die. On seeing this Satrughna will also not live.

content: पुत्रान्मृतान्समीक्ष्याथ न भविष्यन्ति मातरः।।5.13.27।।कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च कैकेयी च न संशयः।
कृतज्ञस्सत्यसन्धश्च सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः।।5.13.28।।रामं तथा गतं दृष्ट्वा ततस्त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।
explanation: "On seeing that Rama has ended his life, the grateful and truthful monkey leader, Sugriva will give up his life.

content: दुर्मना व्यथिता दीना निरानन्दा तपस्विनी।।5.13.29।।पीडिता भर्तृशोकेन रुमा त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।
explanation: "Distressed, disheartened, pained and grieved on account of her husband's death, the virtuous lady Ruma (wife of Sugriva) will be unhappy and die.

content: वालिजेन तु दुःखेन पीडिता शोककर्शिता।।5.13.30।।पञ्चत्वं च गते राज्ञि ताराऽपि न भविष्यति।
explanation: "Tara who is troubled by Vali's death and tortured with grief will not live when king Sugriva dies.

content: मातापित्रोर्विनाशेन सुग्रीवव्यसनेन च।।5.13.31।।कुमारोऽप्यङ्गदः कस्माद्धारयिष्यति जीवितम्।
explanation: "On account of his parents death and also because of Sugriva's calamity, Angada will give up his life.

content: भर्तृजेन तु दुःखेन ह्यभिभूता वनौकसः।।5.13.32।।शिरांस्यभिहनिष्यन्ति तलैर्मुष्टिभिरेव च।
explanation: "The grief due to the death of their king will make the vanaras hit their heads with their palms and fists.

content: सान्त्वेनानुप्रदानेन मानेन च यशस्विना।।5.13.33।।लालिताः कपिराजेन प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति वानराः।
explanation: "The vanaras who were reared by the king's kind words, gifts and care will give up their life.

content: न वनेषु न शैलेषु न निरोधेषु वा पुनः।।5.13.34।।क्रीडामनुभविष्यन्ति समेत्य कपिकुञ्जराः।
explanation: "The chiefs among vanaras together will not enjoy their life in the forest or mountains or caves.

content: सपुत्रदारास्सामात्या भर्तृव्यसनपीडिताः।।5.13.35।।शैलाग्रेभ्यः पतिष्यन्ति समेषु विषमेषु च।
explanation: "Tormented by their king's death the vanaras with their wives, sons and ministers will drop down from the mountain peaks on the rough ground and die.

content: विषमुद्बन्धनं वापि प्रवेशं ज्वलनस्य वा।।5.13.36।।उपवासमथो शस्त्रं प्रचरिष्यन्ति वानराः।
explanation: "The vanaras will put an end to their lives by poisoning or by hanging or by selfimmolation or by killing themselves with weapons or by fasting unto death.

content: घोरमारोदनं मन्ये गते मयि भविष्यति।।5.13.37।।इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाशश्च नाशश्चैव वनौकसाम्।
explanation: "If I go there (without finding Sita), it will cause destruction of the Ikshvakus and vanaras would weep. It would be dreadful.

content: सोऽहं नैव गमिष्यामि किष्किन्धां नगरीमितः।।5.13.38।।न च शक्ष्याम्यहं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं मैथिलीं विना।
explanation: "I will not go to the city of Kishkinda from here or to Sugriva without finding Mythili. It will not be possible for me to face him.

content: मय्यगच्छति चेहस्थे धर्मात्मानौ महारथौ।।5.13.39।।आशया तौ धरिष्येते वानराश्च मनस्विनः।
explanation: Both the highsouled warrior princes treading a righteous path as well as the vanaras will survive with a hope of my return if I stay back.

content: हस्तादानो मुखादानो नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः।।5.13.40।।वानप्रस्थो भविष्यामि ह्यदृष्ट्वा जनकात्मजाम्।सागरानूपजे देशे बहुमूलफलोदके।।5.13.41।।
explanation: "If Janaki is not found I will stay here and live like a hermit subsisting on whatever is available on this sea shore, which has abundance of roots, fruits and water.

content: चितां कृत्वा प्रवेक्ष्यामि समिद्धमरणीसुतम्।उपविष्टस्य वा सम्यग्लिङ्गिनीं साधयिष्यतः।।5.13.42।।शरीरं भक्षयिष्यन्ति वायसाः श्वापदानि च।
explanation: "I will prepare a pyre  and enter the fire  so that sea waves wash off the ashes or crows and beasts will eat up my body while i sit fasting unto death.

content: इदं महर्षिभिर्दृष्टं निर्याणमिति मे मतिः।।5.13.43।।सम्यगापः प्रवेक्ष्यामि न चेत्पश्यामि जानकीम्।
explanation: "I shall enter water and drown myself to death if I am not able to find Janaki. I think this way of ending life has been suggested by great ascetics.

content: सुजातमूला सुभगा कीर्तिमाला यशस्विनी।।5.13.44।।प्रभग्ना चिररात्रीयं मम सीतामपश्यतः।
explanation: My glory which had a good start (in the form of bringing Rama to Sugriva) and brought fortune to Sugriva and fame to me has been snapped as I could not find Sita.

content: तापसो वा भविष्यामि नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः।।5.13.45।।नेतः प्रतिगमिष्यामि तामदृष्ट्वासितेक्षणाम्।
explanation: "I will remain an ascetic and do penance under the tree practising selfcontrol and not go back without seeing the blackeyed Sita.

content: यदीतः प्रतिगच्छामि सीतामनधिगम्य ताम्।।5.13.46।।अङ्गदस्सह तैस्सर्वैर्वानरैर्न भविष्यति।
explanation: "Besides, if I go back without finding Sita all the vanaras including Angada will die.

content: विनाशे बहवो दोषा जीवन् भद्राणि पश्यति।।5.13.47।।तस्मात्प्राणान् धरिष्यामि ध्रुवो जीवितसङ्गमः।
explanation: "If I commit suicide, I will earn numerous sins. By being alive, I can witness auspicious events. Therefore, I will live, for, happiness can come only to the living.

content: एवं बहुविधं दुःखं मनसा धरायन्मुहुः।।5.13.48।।नाध्यगच्छत्तदा पारं शोकस्य कपिकुञ्चरः।
explanation: The elephant among monkeys (Hanuman) worrying over and over again, holding his head for long could not reach the end of his grief.

content: रावणं वा वधिष्यामि दशग्रीवं महाबलम्।।5.13.49।।काममस्तु हृता सीता प्रत्याचीर्णं भविष्यति।
explanation: "I will kill Ravana, this mighty, tenheaded demon. Sita was indeed carried away by him. This (killing him) can be a fitting reply to his evil action. My desire would be fulfilled.

content: अथवैनं समुत्क्षिप्य उपर्युपरि सागरम्।।5.13.50।।रामायोपहरिष्यामि पशुं पशुपतेरिव।
explanation: "Or else, I shall carry him across the sea and put him before Rama like a bull as if he is a sacrificial prey to lord Siva."

content: इति चिन्तां समापन्नः सीतामनधिगम्य ताम्।।5.13.51।।ध्यानशोकपरीतात्मा चिन्तयामास वानरः।
explanation: Distressed over his inability to find Sita, Hanuman's mind was overcome with anxiety and he started thinking further.

content: यावत्सीतां हि पश्यामि रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम्।।5.13.52।।तावदेतां पुरीं लङ्कां विचिनोमि पुनः पुनः।
explanation: "Till I find the virtuous Sita, wife of Rama in this Lanka, I shall keep searching everywhere again and again.

content: सम्पातिवचनाच्चापि रामं यद्यानयाम्यहम्।।5.13.53।।अपश्यन् राघवो भार्यां निर्धहेत्सर्ववानरान्।
explanation: "Had I brought Raghava following  the words of Sampati, Rama would have burnt all vanaras unable to find his wife.

content: इहैव नियताहारो वत्स्यामि नियतेन्द्रियः।।5.13.54।।न मत्कृते विनश्येयुः सर्वे ते नरवानराः।
explanation: "I will stay here itself, restricting my food and controlling my senses. Let not men and monkeys perish for my fault.

content: अशोकवनिका चेयं दृश्यते या महाद्रुमा।।5.13.55।।इमामधिगमिष्यामि न हीयं विचिता मया।
explanation: "Here is the Ashoka grove with huge trees. I will go there. I have not looked for her in this place.

content: वसून्रुद्रांस्तथाऽदित्यानश्विनौ मरुतोऽपि च।।5.13.56।।नमस्कृत्वा गमिष्यामि रक्षसां शोकवर्धनः।
explanation: "I shall offer salutations to Vasus, Rudras Adityas and Aswinis and proceed to  increase (cause) the sorrow of the demons. (There are eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, twelve Adityas, two Ashwins and fortynine Windgods).

content: जित्वा तु राक्षसान् सर्वानिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दिनीम्।।5.13.57।।सम्प्रदास्यामि रामाय यथा सिद्धिं तपस्विने।
explanation: "I will conquer all the ogres and pass them to Sita, the delight of the Ikshvaku family  as an offering and give Rama to her as the fruit of her austerities."

content: सः मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा चिन्तावग्रथितेन्द्रियः।।5.13.58।।उदतिष्ठन्महातेजा हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।
explanation: The brilliant son of the Windgod, Hanuman, whose senses were overwhelmed with worries, regained his senses in a short while and got up.

content: नमोऽस्तु रामाय सलक्ष्मणाय देव्यै च तस्यै जनकात्मजायै।नमोऽस्तु रुद्रेंद्रयमानिलेभ्यो नमोऽस्तु चन्द्रार्कमरुद्गणेभ्यः।।5.13.59।।
explanation: "My salutations to Lakshmana, Rama and divine daughter of Janaka. Salutations to Rudra, Indra, Yama and Vayu. Salutations to Sun, Moon and Maruts"

content: स तेभ्यस्तु नमस्कृत्य सुग्रीवाय च मारुतिः।दिशस्सर्वास्समालोक्य ह्यशोकवनिकां प्रति।।5.13.60।।
explanation: Having offered salutations to all gods as well as to Sugriva, he looked at all quarters and left for the Ashoka grove.

content: स गत्वा मनसा पूर्वमशोकवनिकां शुभाम्।उत्तरं चिन्तयामास वानरो मारुतात्मजः।।5.13.61।।
explanation: Hanuman started thinking again about his task after reaching the auspicious Ashoka grove.

content: ध्रुवं तु रक्षोबहुला भविष्यति वनाकुला।अशोकवनिका पुण्या सर्वसंस्कारसंस्कृता।।5.13.62।।
explanation: 'This Ashoka grove filled with many trees, guarded by many demons is carefully tended. It must be sacred.

content: रक्षिणश्चात्र विहिता नूनं रक्षन्ति पादपान्।भगवानपि सर्वात्मा नातिक्षोभं प्रवाति वै।।5.13.63।।संक्षिप्तोऽयं मयाऽत्मा च रामार्थे रावणस्य च।
explanation: "The guards posted there are surely protecting the grove. The divinity  pervading all over me (the wind) must also have been controlled as it is also not blowing violently. I have turned my body small for Rama's cause and also to save myself from Ravana.

content: सिद्धिं मे संविधास्यन्ति देवाः सर्षिगणास्त्विह।।5.13.64।।ब्रह्मा स्वयंभूर्भगवान् देवाश्चैव दिशन्तु मे।सिद्धिमग्निश्च वायुश्च पुरुहूतश्च वज्रभृत्।।5.13.65।।वरुणः पाशहस्तश्च सोमादित्यौ तथैव च।अश्विनौ च महात्मानौ मरुतः शर्व एव च।।5.13.66।।सिद्धिं सर्वाणि भूतानि भूतानां चैव यः प्रभुः।दास्यन्ति मम ये चान्ये ह्यदृष्टाः पथि गोचराः।।5.13.67।।
explanation: May all sages, gods, the selfborn Brahma, Windgod, Indra, the wielder of thunderbolt whose name is invoked in sacrifices, Yama, who carries a rope, Varuna give success and Lord Siva help me. May the Sun, Moon, Aswinis  Marutas assist me. May the gods of the quarters and the lord of all beings help me to succeed. May those whom I could not see also bring success to me.

content: तदुन्नसं पाण्डुरदन्तमव्रणं शुचिस्मितं पद्मपलाशलोचनम्।द्रक्ष्ये तदार्यावदनं कदान्वहं प्रसन्नताराधिपतुल्यदर्शनम्।।5.13.68।।
explanation: 'Oh when and how would I behold that beautiful noble lady of stainless character, with a Moonlike face, prominent nose, white teeth, pleasant smile and with eyes like lotus petals?

content: द्रेण पापेन नृशंसकर्मणा सुदारुणालङ्कृतवेषधारिणा।बलाभिभूता ह्यबला तपस्विनी कथं नु मे दृष्टिपथेऽद्य सा भवेत्।।5.13.69।।
explanation: "How will I set my eyes on that gentle, frail and suffering thing now, who has been abducted by that mean, cruel sinner of dreadful look?"इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman ascends the simsupa tree in the Ashoka grove and watches.]स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा मनसा चाधिगम्य ताम्।अवप्लुतो महातेजाः प्राकारं तस्य वेश्मनः।।5.14.1।।
explanation: Mighty Hanuman lost in thought for a moment, jumped down (the harem) to the boundary wall of the palace.

content: स तु संहृष्टसर्वाङ्गः प्राकारस्थो महाकपिः।पुष्पिताग्रान्वसन्तादौ ददर्श विविधान् द्रुमान्।।5.14.2।।सालानशोकान् भव्यांश्च चंपकांश्च सुपुष्पितान्।उद्दालकान्नागवृक्षांश्चूतान्कपिमुखानपि।।5.14.3।।
explanation: Standing on the boundary wall, the great vanara contracted his body and observed the blossoms on several tree tops---- Salas, lovely Ashoka trees and blossoms of champak, uddalaka, naga, mangoes with their fruits crimson as the snout of a monkey, it being the beginning of Spring.

content: अथाम्रवणसञ्छन्नां लताशतसमावृताम्।ज्यामुक्त इव नाराचः पुप्लुवे वृक्षवाटिकाम्।।5.14.4।।
explanation: He penetrated like an arrow released from a bow the cluster of trees covering mango grove and overgrown with hundreds of creepers.

content: स प्रविश्य विचित्रां तां विहगैरभिनादिताम्।राजतैः कांचनैश्चैव पादपैः सर्वतो वृताम्।।5.14.5।।विहगैर्मृगसङ्घैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम्।उदितादित्यसङ्काशां ददर्श हनुमान् कपिः।।5.14.6।।वृतां नानाविधैर्वृक्षैः पुष्पोपगफलोपगैः।कोकिलैर्भृङ्गराजैश्च मत्तैर्नित्यनिषेविताम्।।5.14.7।।प्रहृष्टमनुजे काले मृगपक्षिसमाकुले।मत्तबर्हिणसङ्घुष्टां नानाद्विजगणायुताम्।।5.14.8।।
explanation: Entering deep into the grove, Hanuman saw clusters of trees pleasing to look at, herds of animals and flocks of colourful birds singing melodious notes.The grove was surrounded on all sides by silvery and golden trees which looked colourful with flocks of birds and herds of deer. It was full of lovely thickets looking like the rising sun. It was fringed with various trees bearing abundance of fruits and flowers. It was inhabited by intoxicated cuckoos, bees,  proud peacocks and numerous lovely birds.

content: मार्गमाणो वरारोहां राजपुत्रीमनिन्दिताम्।सुखप्रसुप्तान्विहगान् बोधयामास वानरः।।5.14.9।।
explanation: The vanara who went searching for the paragon of virtue born of a noble family, awakened the birds who were happily asleep in their nests.

content: उत्पतद्भिर्द्विजगणैः पक्षैः सालास्समाहताः।अनेकवर्णा विविधा मुमुचुः पुष्पवृष्टयः।।5.14.10।।
explanation: As the birds flew away, the trees hit by the wings of birds showered flowers of different colours.

content: पुष्पावकीर्णश्शुशुभे हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।अशोकवनिकामध्ये यथा पुष्पमयो गिरिः।।5.14.11।।
explanation: Covered with flowers, Hanuman shone like a mountain of flowers in the midst of Ashoka grove.

content: दिशस्सर्वाः प्रधावन्तं वृक्षषण्डगतं कपिः।दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि वसन्त इति मेनिरे।।5.14.12।।
explanation: Beholding that sprightly monkey running in all directions, its body covered with variegated blossoms fallen from the trees, all living beings there thought that it was Spring personified

content: वृक्षेभ्यः पतितैः पुष्पैरवकीर्णा पृथग्विदैः।रराज वृक्षेभ्यः तत्र प्रमदेव ।।5.14.13।।
explanation: Strewn with flowers of various colours fallen from the trees of various kinds, the goddess of earth looked charming like a young woman profusely bedecked.

content: रस्विना ते तरवस्तरसाभिप्रकम्पिताः।कुसुमानि विचित्राणि ससृजुः कपिना तदा।।5.14.14।।
explanation: Shaken vigorously by Hanuman of great speed, the trees shed their blooms of variegated colours.

content: निर्धूतपत्रशिखराः शीर्णपुष्पफला द्रुमाः।निक्षिप्तवस्त्राभरणा धूर्ता इव पराजिताः।।5.14.15।।
explanation: The tree tops, shorn of their leaves and flowers and fruits fallen, appeared like gamblers who had lost their stakes and had to lay down their clothes and ornaments.

content: हनूमता वेगवता कम्पितास्ते नगोत्तमाः।पुष्पपर्णफलान्याशु मुमुचुः पुष्पशालिनः।।5.14.16।।
explanation: Shaken by the swift Hanuman, even the big trees dropped flowers, fruits and leaves.

content: विहङ्गसङ्घैर्हीनास्ते स्कन्धमात्राश्रया द्रुमाः।बभूवुरगमाः सर्वे मारुतेव निर्धुताः।5.14.17।।
explanation: Deserted by the flocks of birds resting on them (flowers and leaves also dropped from branches), the trees were left bare with trunks unable to move.

content: निर्धूतकेशी युवतिर्यथा मृदितवर्णका।निष्पीतशुभदन्तोष्ठी नखैर्दन्तैश्च विक्षता।।5.14.18।।तथा लाङ्गूलहस्तैश्च चरणाभ्यां च मर्दिता।बभूवाशोकवनिका प्रभग्नवरपादपा।।5.14.19।।
explanation: The garden of Ashoka with trees shattered and crushed by Hanuman's tail,  hands and feet, appeared like a woman with dishevelled hair, with her vermilion mark effaced, her bright teeth and lips faded for being kissed and wounded with nails and bitten with teeth (by her lover).

content: महालतानां दामानि व्यथमत्तरसा कपिः।यथा प्रावृषि विन्ध्यस्य मेघजालानि मारुतः।।5.14.20।।
explanation: Hanuman shook with tremendous speed the huge clusters of creepers hanging there just like stormy wind in rainy season scatters masses of clouds on the Vindhya mountain.

content: स तत्र मणिभूमीश्च राजतीश्च मनोरमाः।तथा काञ्चनभूमीश्च ददर्श विचरन्कपिः।।5.14.21।।
explanation: Roaming there the monkey noticed the beautiful floors paved with gems, gold and silver৷৷

content: वापीश्च विविधाकाराः पूर्णाः परमवारिणा।महार्हैर्मणिसोपानैरुपपन्नास्ततस्ततः।।5.14.22।।मुक्ताप्रवालसिकताः स्फाटिकान्तरकुट्टिमाः।काञ्चनैस्तरुभिश्चित्रैस्तीरजैरुपशोभितैः।।5.14.23।।फुल्लपद्मोत्पलवनाश्चक्रवाकोपकूजिताः।नत्यूहरुतसंघुष्टा हंससारसनादिताः।।5.14.24।।दीर्घाभिर्द्रुमयुक्ताभिः सरद्भिश्च समन्ततः।अमृतोपमतोयाभिश्शिवाभिरुपसंस्कृताः।।5.14.25।।लताशतैरवततास्सन्तानकुसुमावृताः।नानागुल्मावृतघनाः करवीरकृतान्तराः।।5.14.26।।
explanation: He observed ponds of different shapes filled with clear water with steps paved with rich gems, with sands of pearls and corals and bottoms of crystal, which  contained beds of lotuses in bloom, adorned with chakravaka birds and resonant with cacklings of swans and sarasas and vatyuhas rubbing their beaks. There were golden platforms built on banks and platforms built of crystals. There were trees on the bank of streams, and nectarlike sacred waters flowing in them surrounded by hundreds of creepers, and Ashoka blossoms scattered everywhere, with thickly grown bushes of different kinds, with lilies in bloom in tanks.

content: ततोऽम्बुधरसङ्काशं प्रवृद्धशिखरं गिरिम्।विचित्रकूटं कूटैश्च सर्वतः परिवारितम्।।5.14.27।।शिलागृहैरवततं नानावृक्षैः समावृतम्।ददर्श हरिशार्दूलो रम्यं जगति पर्वतम्।।5.14.28।।
explanation: The tiger among monkeys beheld a delightingful mountain, resembling the raincloud with tall, pleasing peaks, wonderful peaks spread all over the mountain. There were caves built of stone, with a variety of trees.

content: ददर्श च नगात्तस्मान्नदीं निपतितां कपिः।अङ्कादिव समुत्पत्य प्रियस्य पतितां प्रियाम्।।5.14.29।।जले निपतिताग्रैश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम्।वार्यमाणामिव क्रुद्धां प्रमदां प्रियबन्धुभिः।।5.14.30।।पुनरावृत्ततोयां च ददर्श स महाकपिः।प्रसन्नामिव कान्तस्य कान्तां पुनरुपस्थिताम्।।5.14.31।।
explanation: Hanuman, the great monkey saw a stream descending from the hill which looked like a beloved jumping down from the thighs of her lover. It was adorned with trees whose boughs touched the water and thus looking like an angry woman leaving her dear lover but detained by her relatives. With the water running backward in circles it appeared as if the beloved has returned to her lover pleased.

content: तस्या दूरात्सपद्मिन्यो नानाद्विजगणायुताः।ददर्श हरिशार्दूलो हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।।5.14.32।।
explanation: Not far from there, Hanuman, son of the Windgod sighted lotus ponds filled with different kinds of water birds.

content: कृत्रिमां दीर्घिकां चापि पूर्णां शीतेन वारिणा।मणिप्रवरसोपानां मुक्तासिकतशोभिताम्।।5.14.33।।विविधैर्मृगसङ्घैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम्।प्रासादैस्सुमहद्भिश्च निर्मितैर्विश्वकर्मणा।।5.14.34।।काननैः कृत्रिमैश्चापि सर्वतः समलङ्कृताम्।
explanation: Hanuman saw an oblong pond, full of cool water provided with steps, embellished with gems and beautified with pearl dust as sand on its bank.  Thronged with many kinds of animals, it looked colourful with large mansions constructed by Visvakarma in the artificial woodlands decorated all over.

content: ये केचित्पादपास्तत्र पुष्पोपगफलोपगाः।।5.14.35।।सच्छत्रास्सवितर्दीकास्सर्वे सौवर्णवैदिकाः।
explanation: There the trees had abundance of flowers and fruits. A few trees were full of leaves and branches spread like parasols. There were raised golden platforms.

content: लताप्रतानैर्बहुभिःपर्णैश्च बहुभिर्वृताम्।।5.14.36।।काञ्चनीं शिंशुपामेकां ददर्श हरियूथपः।वृतां हेममयीभिस्तु वेदिकाभिस्समन्ततः।।5.14.37।।
explanation: The monkey leader saw one simsupa tree covered all over with canopies of many climbers and leaves. The tree was surrounded by golden platforms.

content: सोऽपश्यद्भूमिभागांश्च गर्तप्रस्रवणानि च।सुवर्णवृक्षानपरान् ददर्श शिखिसन्निभान्।।5.14.38।।
explanation: He beheld several pieces of land and streams flowing out of the springs. He also noticed golden trees asresplendent as fire.

content: तेषां द्रुमाणां प्रभया मेरोरिव दिवाकरः।अमन्यत तदा वीरः काञ्चनोऽस्मीति वानरः।।5.14.39।।
explanation: He saw trees resplendent with golden radiance and thought that he was in the midst of gold like the Sungod getting golden hue by the radiance of Meru, the golden mountain.

content: तां काञ्चनैस्तरुगणैर्मारुतेन च वीजिताम्।किङ्किणीशतनिर्घोषां दृष्ट्वा विस्मयमागमत्।।5.14.40।।
explanation: Hanuman was wonderstruck to hear the sound produced by rows of golden trees which stood round the simsupa tree. This sound resembled the tinkling of a hundred anklets when the wind passed through (their leaves).

content: स पुष्पिताग्रां रुचिरां तरुणाङ्कुरपल्लवाम्।तामारुह्य महाबाहुश्शिंशुपां पर्णसंवृताम्।।5.14.41।।
explanation: Strongarmed Hanuman climbed up the simsupa tree shining with flowers on its top and surrounded by tender sprouts and leaves. (He said to himself):

content: इतो द्रक्ष्यामि वैदेहीं रामदर्शनलालसाम्।इतश्चेतश्च दुःखार्तां सम्पतन्तीं यदृच्छया।।5.14.42।।
explanation: "I may see by chance( from this point) Vaidehi tormented with grief anxiously waiting to see Rama while moving about here and there casually.

content: अशोकवनिका चेयं दृढं रम्या दुरात्मनः।चम्पकैश्चन्दनैश्चापि वकुलैश्च विभूषिता।।5.14.43।।
explanation: "Surely this beautiful Ashoka grove with delightful champak, chandan and bakula trees belongs to the wicked Ravana."

content: इयं च नलिनी रम्या द्विजसङ्घनिषेविता।इमां सा राममहिषी नूनमेष्यति जानकी।।5.14.44।।
explanation: "This lovely lotuspond is frequented by flocks of aquatic birds. Surely Rama's queen Janaki will come to this place.

content: सा रामा राममहिषी राघवस्य प्रिया सती।वनसञ्चारकुशला नूनमेष्यति जानकी।।5.14.45।।
explanation: "Beautiful Janaki, beloved queen of Rama loves to wander in forests. She will surely visit this grove.

content: अथवा मृगशाबाक्षी वनस्यास्य विचक्षणा।वनमेष्यति साऽर्येह रामचिन्तानुकर्शिता।।5.14.46।।
explanation: "Or may be that doeeyed noble lady brooding over Rama will come to this garden she   is familiar with.

content: रामशोकाभिसन्तप्ता सा देवी वामलोचना।वनवासे रता नित्यमेष्यते वनचारिणी।।5.14.47।।
explanation: "That lovelyeyed queen tormented with grief over separation from Rama will be coming here to stay as she always loves strolling in the forest.

content: वनेचराणां सततं नूनं स्पृहयते पुरा।रामस्य दयिता भार्या जनकस्यसुता सती।।5.14.48।।
explanation: "The daughter of Janaka, the  chaste wife of Rama,  used to for the company of those creatures wandering in the forest.

content: सन्ध्याकालमनाः श्यामा ध्रुवमेष्यति जानकी।नदीं चेमां शुभजलां सन्ध्यार्थे वरवर्णिनी।।5.14.49।।
explanation: Surely that lady of lovely complexion, the beautiful Janaki will come to this river flowing with sacred waters for performing the evening rituals.

content: तस्याश्चाप्यनुरूपेयमशोकवनिका शुभा।शुभा या पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य पत्नी रामस्य सम्मता।।5.14.50।।
explanation: To the auspicious Sita,the beloved of Rama, the lord of the world, this Ashoka grove is a befitting place.

content: यदि जीवति सा देवी ताराधिपनिभानना।आगमिष्यति साऽवश्यमिमां शिवजलां नदीम्।।5.14.51।।
explanation: "The moonfaced queen will certainly come to this stream of  auspicious water if she is surviving."

content: एवं तु मत्वा हनुमान्महात्मा प्रतीक्षमाणो मनुजेन्द्रपत्नीम्।अवेक्षमाणश्च ददर्श सर्वं सुपुष्पिते पर्णघने निलीनः।।5.14.52।।
explanation: Pondering thus, the highsouled Hanuman remained concealed on the tree loaded with flowers and leaves and waited, looking eagerly for the wife of the lord of the people. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman sees Sita.]स वीक्षमाणस्तत्रस्थो मार्गमाणश्च मैथिलीम्।अवेक्षमाणश्च महीं सर्वां तामन्ववैक्षत।।5.15.1।।
explanation: Hanuman looked out from the simsupa tree all around for Mythili scanning the ground below.

content: सन्तानकलताभिश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम्।दिव्यगन्धरसोपेतां सर्वतस्समलङ्कृताम्।।5.15.2।।तां स नन्दनसङ्काशां मृगपक्षिभिरावृताम्।हर्म्यप्रासादसम्बाधां कोकिलाकुलनिस्स्वनाम्।।5.15.3।।काञ्चनोत्पलपद्माभिर्वापीभिरुपशोभिताम्।बह्वासनकुथोपेतां बहुभूमिगृहायुताम्।।5.15.4।।सर्वर्तुकुसुमै रम्यां फलवद्भिश्च पादपैः।पुष्पितानामशोकानां श्रिया सूर्योदयप्रभाम्।।5.15.5।।प्रदीप्तामिव तत्रस्थो मारुतिस्समुदैक्षत।निष्पत्रशाखां विहगैः क्रियमाणामिवासकृत्।।5.15.6।।विनिष्पतद्भिः शतशश्चित्रैः पुष्पावतंसकैः।आमूलपुष्पनिचितैरशोकैश्शोकनाशनैः।।5.15.7।।पुष्पभारातिभारैश्च स्पृशद्भिरिव मेदिनीम्।कर्णिकारैः कुसुमितैः किंशुकैश्च सुपुष्पितैः।।5.15.8।।
explanation: Hanuman surveyed from the Simsupa tree the Ashoka grove of trees full of fine fragrance. It looked welldecorated  like the Nandana garden of Indra. It teemed with animals and birds. It was filled with the voices of the cuckoos. It had tall mansions and underground chamber. There were golden lilies and lotuses in the lakes, enchanting couches with rich coverings and trees full of blossoms of all seasons and fruits in abundance With the  Ashoka tree shedding showers of flowers from time to time the place shone with the splendour of Sunrise. It glittered like inflamed fire. The Ashoka tree had  hundreds of colourful birds on the branches. It appeared as if it had branches without leaves which made them look like earornaments (of the grove). Ashoka flowers in bloom hung down to the base of the tree as if to take away the grief of the onlookers. The blossoms of the Karnikara and kimsuka brightened the whole grove.

content: स देशः प्रभया तेषां प्रदीप्त इव सर्वतः।पुन्नागास्सप्तपर्णाश्च चम्पकोद्दालकास्तथा।।5.15.9।।विवृद्धमूला बहवश्शोभन्ते स्म सुपुष्पिताः।
explanation: The grove shone bright as if it were inflamed fire with beautiful trees like purnaga, saptaparna, champak and uddalaka in full bloom.

content: शातकुम्भनिभाः केचित्केचिदग्निशिखोपमाः।।5.15.10।।नीलाञ्जननिभाः केचित्तत्राशोकास्सहस्रशः।
explanation: There were thousands of ashoka trees some of which shone like gold, others like the flames of fire and some dark as collyrium.

content: नन्दनं विविधोद्यानं चित्रं चैत्ररथं यथा।।5.15.11।।अतिवृत्तमिवाचिन्त्यं दिव्यं रम्यं श्रिया वृतम्।वितीयमिव चाकाशं पुष्पज्योतिर्गणायुतम्।।5.15.12।।पुष्परत्नशतैश्चित्रं द्वितीयं सागरं यथा।सर्वर्तुपुष्पैर्निचितं पादपैर्मधुगन्धिभिः।।5.15.13।।नानानिनादैरुद्यानं रम्यं मृगगणैर्द्विजैः।अनेकगन्धप्रवहं पुण्यगन्धं मनोरमम्।।5.15.14।।
explanation: The grove with different types of gardens spread over looked like the Nandana garden of Indra and Chaitraratha garden of Kubera. It surpassed every other garden. It was unimaginable in splendour. It was divine and delightful filled with the radiance of countless varieties of blossoms shining like stars, like a second firmament. It was like another ocean filled with precious gems of flowers. It had trees with flowers of honeyscented fragrance. Sounds of animals and birds filled the air. It was pleasing to the heart with various divine fragrances wafted (by the breeze)৷৷

content: शैलेन्द्रमिव गन्धाढ्यं द्वितीयं गन्धमादनम्।अशोकवनिकायां तु तस्यां वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.15.15।।स ददर्शाविदूरस्थं चैत्यप्रासादमुच्छ्रितम्।मथ्ये स्तम्भसहस्रेण स्थितं कैलासपाण्डुरम्।।5.15.16।।प्रवालकृतसोपानं तप्तकाञ्चनवेदिकम्।मुष्णन्तमिव चक्षूंषि द्योतमानमिव श्रिया।।5.15.17।।विमलं प्रांशुभावत्वादुल्लिखन्तमिवाम्बरम्।
explanation: The monkey leader saw a lofty templelike structure in the midst of the Ashoka grove which was highly fragrant and appeared like another indescribable structure that stood on a thousand pillars like another Gandhamadana mountain. It gleamed white like mount Kailasa. Its stairs were paved with corals. The altars were made of brightly polished gold. This structure glowing with brilliance was as if stealing the eyes. It looked white with light and lofty as though scratching the sky.

content: ततो मलिनसंवीतां राक्षसीभिस्समावृताम्।।5.15.18।।उपवासकृशां दीनां निश्श्वसन्तीं पुनः पुनः।ददर्श शुक्लपक्षादौ चन्द्ररेखामिवामलाम्।।5.15.19।।
explanation: Then he beheld a lady surrounded by female demons. Clad in soiled clothes she looked dejected, emaciated through fasting and was sighing repeatedly. She appeared thin and pale like the crescent Moon at the beginning of the bright fortnight.

content: मन्दप्रख्यायमानेन रूपेण रुचिरप्रभाम्।पिनद्धां धूमजालेन शिखामिव विभावसोः।।5.15.20।।
explanation: Her form was faintly recognisable. She had a lovely radiance on account of her beautiful form. She looked like the tip of burning fire engulfed in a cloud of smoke.

content: पीतेनैकेन संवीतां क्लिष्टेनोत्तमवाससा।सपङ्कामनलङ्कारां विपद्मामिव पद्मिनीम्।।5.15.21।।
explanation: She was wearing an excellent single yellow cloth which was soiled. Unadorned, she looked like a muddy lotuspond bereft of lotuses.

content: व्रीडितां दुःखसन्तप्तां परिम्लानां तपस्विनीम्।ग्रहेणाङ्गारकेणेव पीडितामिव रोहिणीम्।।5.15.22।।
explanation: She was bashful, tormented with agony, dejected with a withered look. She appeared like the star Rohini oppressed by planet Mars.

content: अश्रुपूर्णमुखीं दीनां कृशामनशनेन च।शोकध्यानपरां दीनां नित्यं दुःखपरायणाम्।।5.15.23।।
explanation: Her face was filled with tears. She looked dejected and emaciated due to fasting. Always plunged in grief, she looked like one meditating in tears.

content: प्रियं जनमपश्यन्तीं पश्यन्तीं राक्षसीगणम्।स्वगणेन मृगीं हीनां श्वगणाभिवृतामिव।।5.15.24।।
explanation: Unable to see her dear kith and kin, she sat guarded by ogresses. She appeared like a doe separated from the herd and encircled by a pack of hounds.

content: नीलनागाभया वेण्या जघनं गतयैकया।नीलया नीरदापाये वनराज्या महीमिव।।5.15.25।।सुखार्हां दुःखसन्तप्तां व्यसनानामकोविदाम्।
explanation: She (from behind) appeared like the earth covered with a range of trees at the end of rainy season with her single long black braid touching her hips looking like a black serpent. She who deserved to be happy and had not experienced worries was burning in grief. (एकवेणी is a trait of a प्रोषितभर्तृका Sita who was forced to stay in Lanka was a प्रोषितभर्तृका नायिका.)

content: तां समीक्ष्य विशालाक्षीमधिकं मलिनां कृशाम्।।5.15.26।।तर्कयामास सीतेति कारणैरुपपादिभिः।
explanation: After seeing the largeeyed lady worn out and dressed in soiled clothes, Hanuman started deliberating in himself and guessed it was Sita for strong reasons.

content: ह्रियमाणा तदा तेन रक्षसा कामरूपिणा।।5.15.27।।यथारूपा हि दृष्टा वै तथारूपेयमङ्गना।
explanation: Beholding the form of the largeeyed lady, Hanuman guessed, 'This is similar to the form seen while the demon was kidnapping her'.

content: पूर्णचन्द्राननां सुभ्रूं चारुवृत्तपयोधराम्।।5.15.28।।कुर्वतीं प्रभयादेवीं सर्वा वितिमिरा दिशः।तां नीलकेशीं बिम्बोष्ठीं सुमध्यां सुप्रतिष्ठिताम्।।5.15.29।।सीतां पद्मपलाशाक्षीं मन्मथस्य रतिं यथा।
explanation: Her face resembled the fullmoon which dispelled the encircling gloom by its radiance. She had a slender waist, beautiful round breasts, shapely eyebrows, red lips, dark hair, and eyes like lotus petals with attractive limbs. She was comparable to Rati, consort of Cupid.

content: इष्टां सर्वस्य जगतः पूर्णचन्द्रप्रभामिव।।5.15.30।।भूमौ सुतनुमासीनां नियतामिव तापसीम्।
explanation: Just as the radiance of the full moon is cherished by all, this lady was liked by every one in this world. With her lovely figure she was seated on the ground like an austere ascetic.

content: निःश्वासबहुलां भीरुं भुजगेन्द्रवधूमिव।।5.15.31।।शोकजालेन महता विततेन न राजतीम्।
explanation: The timid lady was hissing (sighing) like the consort of the serpent king, who being caught in a widespread cobweb of grief was looking gloomy.

content: संसक्तां धूमजालेन शिखामिव विभावसोः।।5.15.32।।तां स्मृतीमिव सन्दिग्धामृद्धिं निपतितामिव।
explanation: She was like the flames of fire obscured by smoke. She appeared like the text of Smriti of doubtful meaning, a treasure that has been thrown away

content: विहतामिव च श्रद्धामाशां प्रतिहतामिव।।5.15.33।।सोपसर्गां यथा सिद्धिं बुद्धिं सकलुषामिव।
explanation: She was like faith shattered, hope frustrated, desires blocked by obstacles, success vitiated, fame marred and intellect blurred.

content: अभूतेनापवादेन कीर्तिं निपतितामिव।।5.15.34।।रामोपरोधव्यथितां रक्षोहरणकर्शिताम्।
explanation: She appeared like fame besmirched by false allegation. She was pained by the obstruction to meet Rama and emaciated by  abduction.

content: अबलां मृगशाबाक्षीं वीक्षमाणां ततस्ततः।।5.15.35।।बाष्पाम्बुपरिपूर्णेन कृष्णवक्राक्षिपक्ष्मणा।वदनेनाप्रसन्नेन निःश्वसन्तीं पुनः पुनः।।5.15.36।।
explanation: The fawneyed lady was looking here and there with her dark, curved eyelashes. Her unhappy face was streaming with tears.

content: मलपङ्कधरां दीनां मण्डनार्हाममण्डिताम्।प्रभां नक्षत्रराजस्य कालमेघैरिवावृताम्।।5.15.37।।
explanation: Covered with dirt and mud and shorn of adornments even though she deserved them, she looked wretched like the radiance of the Moon muffled by dark clouds.

content: तस्य संदिदिहे बुद्धिर्मुहुः सीतां निरीक्ष्य तु।आम्नायानामयोगेन विद्यां प्रशिथिलामिव।।5.15.38।।
explanation: Hanuman did recognise Sita after looking at her carefully again and again even as one is able to make out knowledge of shastriclore forgotten with lapse of time and lack of practice.

content: दुःखेन बुबुधे सीतां हनुमाननलङ्कृताम्।संस्कारेण यथा हीनां वाचमर्थान्तरं गताम्।।5.15.39।।
explanation: Just as an unclear expression which has undergone certain changes in meaning due to lack of usage over a long period is understood by virtue of previous practice so also Hanuman had difficulty in recognising Sita who was devoid of any decoration.

content: तां समीक्षय विशालाक्षीं राजपुत्रीमनिन्दिताम्।तर्कयामास सीतेति कारणैरुपपादिभिः।।5.15.40।।
explanation: After close observation of different signs and deliberation with reasons he came to the conclusion that the largeeyed lady is the same blameless princess Sita.

content: वैदेह्या यानि चाङ्गेषु तदा रामोऽन्वकीर्तयत्।तान्याभरणजालानि गात्रशोभीन्यलक्षयत्।।5.15.41।।सुकृतौ कर्णवेष्टौ च श्वदंष्ट्रौ च सुसंस्थितौ।मणिविद्रुमचित्राणि हस्तेष्वाभरणानि च।।5.15.42।।श्यामानि चिरयुक्तत्वात्तथा संस्थानवन्ति च।
explanation: Hanuman observed the ornaments worn by Vaidehi adding grace to her limbs which Rama had described.They were wellcrafted earrings and wellfit Savdamshtras. He noticed wonderful, variegated ornaments of corals and gems as well as those worn on hands. They were blackened for long wear and Sita had marks of wearing them on her body.(Note: This is a pair ornaments shaped like dog's teeth. It is not known on which part of the body they were worn).

content: तान्यैवेतानि मन्येऽहं यानि रामोऽन्वकीर्तयत्।।5.15.43।।तत्र यान्यवहीनानि तान्यहं नोपलक्षये।यान्यस्या नावहीनानि तानीमानि न संशयः।।5.15.44।।
explanation: "I think these ornaments are the same that were described by Rama. Those dropped (by Sita) are not found on her body. These were not dropped.There is no doubt."

content: पीतं कनकपट्टाभं स्रस्तं तद्वसनं शुभम्।उत्तरीयं नगासक्तं तदा दृष्टं प्लवङ्गमैः।।5.15.45।।
explanation: "The shining yellow upper garment like a golden cloth was torn. Flung down, it stuck to a tree which the monkeys noticed.

content: भूषणानि च मुख्यानि दृष्टानि धरणीतले।अनयैवापविद्धानि स्वनवन्ति महान्ति च।।5.15.46।।
explanation: "The jingling, choice ornaments were thrown down on the ground.

content: इदं चिरगृहीतत्वाद्वसनं क्लिष्टवत्तरम्।तथाऽपि नूनं तद्वर्णं तथा श्रीमद्यथेतरत्।।5.15.47।।
explanation: "This cloth worn long is crumpled. Even then it has retained its shine and looks fresh.

content: इयं कनकवर्णाङ्गी रामस्य महिषी प्रिया।प्रणष्टापि सती याऽस्य मनसो न प्रणश्यति।।5.15.48।।
explanation: "This lady of golden complexion is Rama's beloved queen who does not disappear from his mind, although away.

content: इयं सा यत्कृते रामश्चतुर्भिः परितप्यते।कारुण्येनानृशंस्येन शोकेन मदनेन च।।5.15.49।।स्त्री प्रणष्टेति कारुण्यादाश्रितेत्यानृशंस्यतः।पत्नी नष्टेति शोकेन प्रियेति मदनेन च।।5.15.50।।
explanation: "She is that same lady for whom Rama has been passing through compassion, benevolence, grief and passion. He is compassionate considering her a woman, kind and benevolent since she is his dependent, stricken with grief for losing a wife and passionate since she is his beloved.

content: अस्या देव्या यथा रूपमङ्गप्रत्यङ्गसौष्ठवम्।रामस्य च यथा रूपं तस्येयमसितेक्षणा।।5.15.51।।
explanation: "This blackeyed Sita and her divine,  charming body with perfect limbs are a match for Rama's figure.

content: अस्या देव्या मनस्तस्मिंस्तस्य चास्यां प्रतिष्ठितम्।तेनेयं स च धर्मात्मा मुहूर्तमपि जीवति।।5.15.52।।
explanation: "The divine queen's mind is firmly fixed on Rama and his mind, fixed on her. For this reason she and the righteous self (Rama) are able to survive till this moment.

content: दुष्करं कृतवान्रामो हीनो यदनया प्रभुः।धारयत्यात्मनो देहं न शोकेनावसीदति।।5.15.53।।
explanation: "Lord Rama had accomplished a difficult task in sustaining the body this way without allowing it to sink and perish during separation from her.

content: दुष्करं कुरुते रामो य इमां मत्तकाशिनीम्।सीतां विना महाबाहुर्मुहूर्तमपि जीवति।।5.15.54।।
explanation: "Rama, the strongarmed hero has accomplished a difficult task by surviving even for a moment without this Sita who has intoxicating lustre".

content: एवं सीतां तदा दृष्ट्वा हृष्टः पवनसम्भवः।जगाम मनसा रामं प्रशशंस च तं प्रभुम्।।5.15.55।।
explanation: On seeing Sita, the son of the Windgod, felt glad at heart and mentally reached Rama the lord of the world. Hanuman was full of praise for Rama.इत्यार्षे  श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चदशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fifteenth sarga in Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman's grief over Sita's state.]प्रशस्य तु प्रशस्तव्यां सीतां तां हरिपुङ्गवः।गुणाभिरामं रामं च पुनश्चिन्तापरोऽभवत्।।5.16.1।।
explanation: Hanuman, the bull among monkeys, admired the laudable Sita and the virtuous Rama and once again began to lament.

content: स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणः।सीतामाश्रित्य तेजस्वी हनूमान्विललाप ह।।5.16.2।।
explanation: Sagacious Hanuman, eyes dimmed with tears, thought for a short while on the plight of Sita and lamented

content: मान्या गुरुविनीतस्य लक्ष्मणस्य गुरुप्रिया।यदि सीताऽऽपि दुःखार्ता कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः।।5.16.3।।
explanation: "If Sita, who is worshipped by righteous Lakshmana and loved by Rama is tortured like this, it shows it is difficult to trangress the force of time.

content: रामस्य व्यवसायज्ञा लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः।नात्यर्थं क्षुभ्यते देवी गङ्गेव जलदागमे।।5.16.4।।
explanation: "Just as river Ganga is not agitated by the rainbearing clouds, this Sita is not perturbed as she is aware of the prowess of Rama and might of Lakshmana.

content: तुल्यशीलवयोवृत्तां तुल्याभिजनलक्षणाम्।राघवोऽऽर्हति वैदेहीं तं चेयमसितेक्षणा।।5.16.5।।
explanation: "Sri Rama matches Vaidehi perfectly in character, age, behaviour, birth and auspicious signs. She is aware that he is the right person for her. Rama deserves Vaidehi and this blackeyed lady deserves him."

content: तां दृष्ट्वा नवहेमाभां लोककान्तामिव श्रियम्।जगाम मनसा रामं वचनं चेदमब्रवीत्।।5.16.6।।
explanation: On seeing her glowing like fresh gold resembling goddess Lakshmi who is dear to the entire world, and thinking of Rama, Hanuman said:

content: अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्या हतो वाली महाबलः।रावणप्रतिमो वीर्ये कबन्धश्च निपातितः।।5.16.7।।
explanation: "It was for the sake of this largeeyed Sita that the powerful Vali and the heroic Kabandha who was equal to Ravana in heroism were killed.

content: विराधश्च हतः सङ्ख्ये राक्षसो भीमविक्रमः।वने रामेण विक्रम्य महेन्द्रेणेव शम्बरः।।5.16.8।।
explanation: "Rama  killed Viradha of fearsome valour in the forest like Sambara by Indra.

content: चतुर्दश सहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम्।निहतानि जनस्थाने शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः।।5.16.9।।
खरश्च निहतसङ्ख्ये त्रिशिराश्च निपातितः।दूषणश्च महातेजा रामेण विदितात्मना।।5.16.10।।
explanation: "Ogres like Khara and Trisira and the powerful Dooshana were kileed in battle by Rama endowed with selfknowledge.

content: ऐश्वर्यं वानराणां च दुर्लभं वालिपालितम्।अस्या निमित्ते सुग्रीवः प्राप्तवान् लोकसत्कृतम्।।5.16.11।।
explanation: On her account Sugriva obtained the coveted kingdom ruled by Vali which was a difficult proposition, and retained supremacy in the world.

content: सागरश्च मया क्रान्तश्श्रीमान्नदनदीपतिः।अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्याः पुरी चेयमवेक्षिता।।5.16.12।।
explanation: "On account of the largeeyed Sita I ventured to cross  the lord of rivers, the sea, and came to this city.

content: यदि रामः समुद्रान्तां मेदिनीं परिवर्तयेत्।अस्याः कृते जगच्चापि युक्तमित्येव मे मतिः।।5.16.13।।
explanation: "Even if Rama turns this land stretching to the ocean upside down or even the entire world on account of her, it is justifiable, according to me.

content: राज्यं वा त्रिषु लोकेषु सीता वा जनकात्मजा।त्रैलोक्यराज्यं सकलं सीताया नाप्नुयात्कलाम्।।5.16.14।।
explanation: "The sovereignty over the three worlds will weigh less than one sixteenth part of Janaka's daughter, Sita.

content: इयं सा धर्मशीलस्य मैथिलस्य महात्मनः।सुता जनकराजस्य सीता भर्तृदृढव्रता।।5.16.15।।उत्थिता मेदिनीं भित्त्वा क्षेत्रे हलमुखक्षते।पद्मरेणुनिभैः कीर्णा शुभैः केदारपाम्सुभिः।।5.16.16।।
explanation: She had risen from the land when tilled by the plough and was covered with auspicious paddy dust resembling the pollen grains of lotuses, this daughter of Janaka, the great righteous ruler of Mithila, This lady with unswerving devotion to her husband.

content: विक्रान्तस्यार्यशीलस्य संयुगेष्न्विवर्तिनः।स्नुषा दशरथस्यैषा ज्येष्ठा राज्ञो यशस्विनी।।5.16.17।।
explanation: "This celebrated lady is the eldest daughterinlaw of the noble, valiant king Dasaratha who never returned from the battleground without being victorious.

content: धर्मज्ञस्य कृतज्ञस्य रामस्य विदितात्मनः।इयं सा दयिता भार्या राक्षसीवशमागता।।5.16.18।।
explanation: "She is the loving wife of the righteous, grateful, wise and selfrealised Rama. She has fallen into the hands of these shedemons.

content: सर्वान् भोगान्परित्यज्य भर्तृस्नेहबलात्कृता।अचिन्तयित्वा दुःखानि प्रविष्टा निर्जनं वनम्।।5.16.19।।संतुष्टा फलमूलेन भर्तृशुश्रूषणे रता।या परां भजते प्रीतिं वनेऽऽपि भवने यथा।।5.16.20।।सेयं कनकवर्णाङ्गी नित्यं सुस्मितभाषिणी।सहते यातनामेतामनर्थानामभागिनी।।5.16.21।।
explanation: "On account of her immense love towards her husband she has given up all kinds of luxuries, not caring for suffering. She was satisfied with fruits and roots in the desolate forest. Engaged in serving her husband, she experienced utmost joy as in her own palace. A lady of golden complexion who had not experienced suffering earlier is subjected to sorrow and is tolerating calamities in this way

content: इमां तु शीलसम्पन्नां द्रष्टुमर्हति राघवः।रावणेन प्रमथितां प्रपामिव पिपासितः।।5.16.22।।
explanation: "Rama deserves to see her.Just as a thirsty man longs for the source of water, Rama pines for this highly virtuous lady who is tormented by Ravana.

content: अस्या नूनं पुनर्लाभाद्राघवः प्रीतिमेष्यति।राजा राज्यपरिभ्रष्टः पुनः प्राप्येव मेदिनीम्।।5.16.23।।
explanation: "Just as a king who had lost his kingdom feels happy on regaining it, surely Raghava will feel exhilarated when he gets her back.

content: कामभोगैः परित्यक्ता हीना बन्धुजनेन च।धारयत्यात्मनो देहं तत्समागमकाङ्क्षिणी।।5.16.24।।
explanation: Deprived of all sensual pleasures, and separated from her relatives, she is surviving with the hope of meeting them.

content: नैषा पश्यति राक्षस्यो नेमान्पुष्पफलद्रुमान्।एकस्थहृदया नूनं राममेवानुपश्यति।।5.16.25।।
explanation: She is looking at neither the shedemons nor these trees full of flowers and fruits. She is surely thinking of Rama with a singleminded  attention.

content: भर्ता नाम परं नार्या भूषणं भूषणादपि।एषा तु रहिता तेन भूषणार्हा न शोभते।।5.16.26।।
explanation: "Indeed, the husband is the greatest ornament for a married woman. Hence though deserving adornment she does not like it, bereft of her husband who is her only ornament.

content: दुष्करं कुरुते रामो हीनो यदनया प्रभुः।धारयत्यात्मनो देहं न दुःखेनावसीदति।।5.16.27।।
explanation: "Lord Rama indeed performs a difficult task in surviving without her. That he is not feeling despondent is a wonder.

content: इमामसितकेशान्तां शतपत्रनिभेक्षणाम्।सुखार्हां दुःखितां दृष्ट्वा ममापि व्यथितं मनः।।5.16.28।।
explanation: Sita who is endowed with beautiful dark hair and eyes like a hundredpetalled lotus, who deserves to be happy is in sorrow. I grieve to see her in this state.

content: क्षतिक्षमा पुष्करसन्निभाक्षी या रक्षिता राघवलक्ष्मणाभ्याम्।सा राक्षसीभिर्विकृतेक्षणाभिः संरक्ष्यते सम्प्रति वृक्षमूले।।5.16.29।।
explanation: She who has beautiful eyes like lotus petals, was protected by the arms of both Rama and Lakshmna, who is tolerant like the earth and is guarded by the female demons of hideous appearance under a tree.

content: हिमहतनलिनीव नष्टशोभा व्यसनपरम्परया निपीड्यमाना।सहचररहितेव चक्रवाकी जनकसुता कृपणां दशां प्रपन्ना।।5.16.30।।
explanation: "Deprived of her charm, she resembles a lotuscreeper blasted by frost. This daughter of Janaka has reached a pitiable condition afflicted by series of calamities. She resembles a famale Chakravaka separated from her mate.

content: अस्या हि पुष्पावनताग्रशाखाः शोकं दृढं वै जनयन्त्यशोकाः।हिमव्यपायेन च शीतरश्मि रभ्युत्थितो नैकसहस्ररश्मि:।।5.16.31।।
explanation: "The top branches of Ashoka trees bent down with blossoms and the Moon rising with thousands of cool rays at the end of winter (when spring sets in) beholding which she should be delighted intensfy her sorrow."

content: इत्येवमर्थं कपिरन्ववेक्ष्य सीतेयमित्येव निविष्टबुद्धि:।संश्रित्य तस्मिन्निषसाद वृक्षे बली हरीणामृषभस्तरस्वी।।5.16.32।।
explanation: Hanuman, the swiftfooted bull among monkeys, on his part waiting on the Simsupa  tree thus reflecting concluded in his mind that she was Sita.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षोडशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the sixteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman experiences the presence of ogresses hiding on the Simsupa tree.]ततः कमुदषण्डाभो निर्मलं निर्मलोदयः।प्रजगाम नभश्चन्द्रो हंसो नीलमिवोदकम्।।5.17.1।।
explanation: Then the Moon shining like a bed of lilies rose stainless, ascended the clear sky and looked like a swan swimming through blue water.

content: साचिव्यमिव कुर्वन् स प्रभया निर्मलप्रभः।चन्द्रमा रश्मिभिश्शीतैस्सिषेवे पवनात्मजम्।।5.17.2।।
explanation: The Moon shed clear lightas if with his brightness and his cool rays he wished to refresh the son of the Windgod.

content: स ददर्श ततः सीतां पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।शोकभारैरिव न्यस्तां भारैर्नावमिवाम्भसि।।5.17.3।।
explanation: Then he saw Sita whose face shone like the fullmoon. But she was as though sinking under the burden of sorrow, like a boat with heavy load sinking in water.

content: दिदृक्षमाणो वैदेहीं हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।स ददर्शाविदूरस्था राक्षसीर्घोरदर्शनाः।।5.17.4।।एकाक्षीमेककर्णां च कर्णप्रावरणां तथा।अकर्णां शङ्कुकर्णां च मस्तकोच्छ्वासनासिकाम्।।5.17.5।।अतिकायोत्तमाङ्गीं च तनुदीर्घशिरोधराम्।ध्वस्तकेशीं तथाऽकेशीं केशकम्बलधारिणीम्।।5.17.6।।लम्बकर्णललाटां च लम्बोदरपयोधराम्।लम्बोष्ठीं चुबुकोष्ठीं च लम्बास्यां लम्बजानुकाम्।।5.17.7।।ह्रस्वां दीर्घां तथा कुब्जां विकटां वामनां तथा।करालां भुग्नवक्त्रां च पिङ्गाक्षीं विकृताननाम्।।5.17.8।।
explanation: While Hanuman was eager to observe Sita he saw many shedemons in ugly appearance close by her. One of them was oneeyed, another with a single ear, a third had ears covering the body, yet another had pointed (spikelike) ears, one was breathing through the nose on the head, one had long thin neck, one was hairless another had hair covering like a blanket. One of them had hanging ears on the forehead, another had big hanging lips, still another had long lips hanging  up to the chin. So also one had protruding knees, one stunted, one tall, another had lips extending up to her chin, yet another was longfaced and another had long knees. There was one pigmy, one tall, one was humpbacked and another a dwarf.Similarly an ugly looking one, another with gaping mouth, still another with a distorted face, one with yellow eyes and one of deformed face were seen.

content: विकृताः पिङ्गलाः कालीः क्रोधनाः कलहप्रियाः।कालायसमहाशूलकूटमुद्गरधारिणीः।।5.17.9।।वराहमृगशार्दूलमहिषाजशिवामुखीः।गजोष्ट्रहयपादीश्च निखातशिरसोऽपराः।।5.17.10।।एकहस्तैकपादाश्च खरकर्ण्यश्वकर्णिकाः।गोकर्णीर्हस्तिकर्णीश्च हरिकर्णीस्तथापराः।।5.17.11।।अनासा अतिनासाश्च तिर्यङ्नासा विनासिकाः।गजसन्निभनासाश्च ललाटोच्छवासनासिकाः।।5.17.12।।हस्तिपादा महापादा गोपादाः पादचूलिकाः।अतिमात्रशिरोग्रीवा अतिमात्रकुचोदरीः।।5.17.13।।अतिमात्रास्यनेत्राश्च दीर्घजिह्वानखास्तथा।अजामुखीर्हस्तिमुखीर्गोमुखीस्सूकरीमुखीः।।5.17.14।।हयोष्ट्रखरवक्त्राश्च राक्षसीर्घोरदर्शनाः।शूलमुद्गरहस्ताश्च क्रोधनाः कलहप्रियाः।।5.17.15।।कराला धूम्रकेशीश्च राक्षसीर्विकृताननाः।पिबन्ती: सततं पानं सदा मांससुराप्रियाः।।5.17.16।।मांसशोणितदिग्धाङ्गीर्मांसशोणितभोजनाः।ता ददर्श कपिश्रेष्ठो रोमहर्षणदर्शनाः।।5.17.17।।स्कन्धवन्तमुपासीनाः परिवार्य वनस्पतिम्।
explanation: Hanuman, the leader of the monkeys saw there shedemons of several distorted forms. Some were brown in colour and some black and some quarrelsome some holding spears, mallets and hammers of black iron, some with faces like boars, deer, tigers, goats and jackals feet like those of elephants, camels and horses, some had their head sunk into the trunk, others having one hand or one leg likewise some having ears like that of a donkey or a horse or a cow some with elephant ears and some with monkey ears some with big nose, without nose,with crooked nose and some without nostrils breathing through their forehead and some with the trunk of an elephant. Some with elephantfeet, with huge feet, and feet like that of cows and some with hair on their feet. There were some with huge heads and necks, some having large breasts, bellies, some with hanging breasts, and some with long nails and tongues. Similarly there were some having faces of goats, mouths of horses, camels or donkeys. They were terrifying, armed with iron crowbars and tridents. Some were wrathful, some with uneven gaping mouth, and some with smoky hair and distorted faces. They were always found drinking, smeared with flesh and blood and feeding on flesh and blood. Their appearance was horripilating. All of them were seated around the trunk of massive tree.

content: तस्याधस्ताच्च तां देवीं राजपुत्रीमनिन्दिताम्।।5.17.18।।लक्षयामास लक्ष्मीवान् हनुमान् जनकात्मजाम्।
explanation: The illustrious Hanuman watched the blameless princess Janaki who was seated under that tree.

content: निष्प्रभां शोकसन्तप्तां मलसङ्कुलमूर्धजाम्।।5.17.19।।क्षीणपुण्यां च्युतां भूमौ तारां निपतितामिव।
explanation: Shorn of lustre, unkempt hair filled with dust, she appeared like a meteor slipped and fallen on land, merits exhausted.

content: चारित्रव्यपदेशाढ्यां भर्तृदर्शनदुर्गताम्।।5.17.20।।भूषणैरुत्तमैर्हीनां भर्तृवात्सल्यभूषणाम्।
explanation: She was rich by  her reputation for chastity but poor as she yearned to see her husband. Though devoid of all excellent ornaments, she looked adorned with love for her husband.

content: राक्षसाधिपसंरुद्धां बन्धुभिश्च विना कृताम्।।5.17.21।।वियूथां सिंहसंरुद्धां बद्धां गजवधूमिव।
explanation: Besieged by the demon king, deprived of her near and dear ones, Sita was looking like a fettered female elephant separated from its herd and besieged by lions.

content: चन्द्ररेखां पयोदान्ते शारदाभ्रैरिवावृताम्।।5.17.22।।क्लिष्टरूपामसंस्पर्शादयुक्तामिव वल्लकीम्।
explanation: She appeared like a streak (crescent) of Moon covered by autumnal clouds at the close of the rainy season. She looked haggard since she was out of contact with her husband an unused lute with its strings let loose.

content: सीतां भर्तृवशे युक्तामयुक्तां राक्षसीवशे।।5.17.23।।अशोकवनिकामथ्ये शोकसागरमाप्लुताम्।ताभिः परिवृतां तत्र सग्रहामिव रोहिणीम्।।5.17.24।।ददर्श हनुमान् देवीं लतामकुसुमामिव।
explanation: She deserves to be with Rama, but had fallen under the sway of shedemons. Sitting in the midst of Ashoka grove she was like a creeper without blossoms. Immersed in the ocean of sorrow the noble lady was like the star Rohini surrounded by unpropitious planets.

content: सा मलेन च दिग्धाङ्गी वपुषा चाप्यलङ्कृता।।5.17.25।।मृणाली पङ्कदिग्धेव विभाति न विभाति च।
explanation: Even though she was daubed with dirt, and had no ornaments on her, she looked bright like a lotus fibre smeared with mud.

content: मलिनेन तु वस्त्रेण परिक्लिष्टेन भामिनीम्।।5.17.26।।संवृतां मृगशाबाक्षीं ददर्श हनुमान् कपिः।तां देवीं दीनवदनामदीनां भर्तृतेजसा।।5.17.27।।रक्षितां स्वेन शीलेन सीतामसितलोचनाम्।
explanation: Hanuman saw the fawneyed lady clad in crushed and soiled clothes with a pathetic face. She felt no dejection when she thought of her husband's prowess. The blackeyed beauty was protected by her own chastity.

content: तां दृष्ट्वा हनुमान् सीतां मृगशाबनिभेक्षणाम्।मृगकन्यामिव त्रस्तां वीक्षमाणां समन्ततः।।5.17.28।।दहन्तीमिव निःश्वासैर्वृक्षान् पल्लवधारिणः।संघातमिव शोकानां दुःखस्योर्मिमिवोत्थिताम्।।5.17.29।।
explanation: Seeing the fawneyed Sita, a frightened female deer  looking all around (as if for some help) sighing hot breath, was as though burning the trees having tender leaves with her hot sighs. She looked like a collective mass of all sorrows, a high tide of suffering.

content: तां क्षमां सुविभक्ताङ्गी विनाभरणशोभिनीम्।।5.17.30।।प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे मारुतिः प्रेक्ष्य मैथिलीम्।
explanation: She was a tolerant lady. She had beautiful limbs which looked splendid even though she was not wearing ornaments. Hanuman experienced immeasurable joy on seeing Mythili.

content: हर्षजानि च सोऽश्रूणि तां दृष्ट्वा मदिरेक्षणाम्।मुमुचे हनुमांस्तत्र नमश्चक्रे च राघवम्।।5.17.31।।
explanation: Seeing that lady with eyes intoxicating, Hanuman shed tears of joy. At once he paid obeisance to Rama. (thinking he could trace Sita at last).

content: नमस्कृत्वा च रामाय लक्ष्मणाय च वीर्यवान्।सीतादर्शनसंहृष्टो हनुमान् संवृतोऽभवत्।।5.17.32।।
explanation: Heroic Hanuman felt happy when he saw Sita. He offered salutations to Rama and Lakshmana at heart and covered himself (with the leaves of the Simsupa tree) and waited.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तदशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the seventeenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana comes to see Sita.]तथा विप्रेक्ष्यमाणस्य वनं पुष्पितपादपम्।विचिन्वतश्च वैदेहीं किंचिच्छेषा निशाऽभवत्।।5.18.1।।
explanation: The night came to a close while Hanuman went searching and looking for Sita at Ashoka grove full of flowering trees.

content: षडङ्गवेदविदुषां क्रतुप्रवरयाजिनाम्।शुश्राव ब्रह्मघोषांश्च स विरात्रे ब्रह्मरक्षसाम्।।5.18.2।।
explanation: At dawn sounds of recitation of Vedas and the six auxillary sciences, (i.e .grammar, prosody, etymology, phonetics, astronomy and the science of rituals) by the brahmins among demons wellversed in performing exalted sacrificial ceremonies were heard.

content: अथ मङ्गलवादित्रशब्दैः श्रुतिमनोहरैः।प्राबुध्यत महाबाहुर्दशग्रीवो महाबलः।।5.18.3।।
explanation: By that time the strongarmed, powerful, tennecked Ravana was awakened by the delightful sounds of auspicious musical instruments.

content: विबुध्यतु यथाकालं राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान्।स्रस्तमाल्याम्बरधरो वैदेहीमन्वचिन्तयत्।।5.18.4।।
explanation: The chivalrous lord of demons woke up as usual.His raiment and garland were still in disarray and he thought of Vaidehi.

content: भृशं नियुक्तस्तस्यां च मदनेन मदोत्कटः।न स तं राक्षसः कामं शशाकात्मनि गूहितुम्।।5.18.5।।
explanation: The demon king who was unable to hide his great passion and control his senses was drawn towards Sita, in his state of intoxication.

content: स सर्वाभरणैर्युक्तो बिभ्रच्छ्रियमनुत्तमाम्।तां नगैर्बहुभिर्जुष्टां सर्वपुष्पफलोपगैः।।5.18.6।।
explanation: Adorned with all ornaments and glowing with excellent splendour he went through the path filled with trees flourishing with all kinds of flowers and fruits.

content: वृतां पुष्करिणीभिश्च नानापुष्पोपशोभिताम्।सदा मदैश्च विहगैर्विचित्रां परमाद्भुताम्।।5.18.7।।
explanation: Ponds covered with a variety of beautiful flowers and colourful birds always cheerful looked very wonderful.

content: ईहामृगैश्च विविधैर्जुष्टां दृष्टिमनोहरैः।वीधीः संप्रेक्षमाणश्च मणिकाञ्चनतोरणाः।।5.18.8।।नानामृगगणाकीर्णां फलैः प्रपतितैर्वृताम्।अशोकवनिकामेव प्राविशत्संततद्रुमाम्।।5.18.9।।
explanation: Watching the garden filled with trees, gateways ornamented with gold and gems, he entered through the pleasant pathways in the Ashoka garden. There were wonderful wolves and several herds of animals in the garden. Fruits dropped from trees were strewn all over.

content: अङ्गनाशतमात्रं तु तं व्रजन्तमनुव्रजत्।महेन्द्रमिव पौलस्त्यं देवगन्धर्वयोषितः।।5.18.10।।
explanation: Ravana, son of sage Paulasti, was followed by a hundred women, just as Indra is trailed by the females of gods and gandharvas.

content: दीपिकाः काञ्चनीः काश्चिज्जगृहुस्तत्र योषितः।वालव्यजनहस्ताश्च तालवृन्तानि चापराः।।5.18.11।।
explanation: Some women carried golden lamps, some held yalk tail fans in their hands while others bore palmleaf fans.

content: काञ्चनैरपि भृङ्गारैर्जह्रुः सलिलमग्रतः।मण्डलाग्रान् बृसीश्चापि गृह्यान्याः पृष्ठतो ययुः।।5.18.12।।
explanation: Some moved ahead of him carrying water in golden pitchers. Others followed him carrying circular couches (to be used as seats).

content: काचिद्रत्नमयीं स्थालीं पूर्णां पानस्य भामिनी।दक्षिणा दक्षिणेनैव तदा जग्राह पाणिना।।5.18.13।।
explanation: One glorious and compassionate lady carried in her right hand a gemstudded jar filled with wine.

content: राजहंसप्रतीकाशं छत्रं पूर्णशशिप्रभम्।सौवर्णदण्डमपरा गृहीत्वा पृष्ठतो ययौ।।5.18.14।।
explanation: Another shedemon moved behind him holding an umbrella with a golden handle which was white like a royal swan and bright like the fullmoon.

content: निद्रामदपरीताक्ष्यो रावणस्योत्तमाः स्त्रियः।अनुजग्मुः पतिं वीरं घनं विद्युल्लता इव।।5.18.15।।
explanation: The chief wives of Ravana with eyes dizzy with sleep and drinking followed their heroic husband like streaks of lightning follow a thunder cloud. (Ravana who was dark looked like a cloud and the women with dazzling golden complexion appeared like lightning.)

content: व्याविद्धहारकेयूराः समामृदितवर्णकाः।समागळितकेशान्तास्सस्वेदवदनास्तथा।।5.18.16।।घूर्णन्त्यो मदशेषेण निद्रया च शुभाननाः।स्वेदक्लिष्टाङ्गकुसुमास्सुमाल्याकुलमूर्धजाः।।5.18.17।।प्रयान्तं नैऋतपतिं नार्यो मदिरलोचनाः।बहुमानाच्च कामाच्च प्रिया भार्यास्तमन्वयुः।।5.18.18।।
explanation: The necklaces and armlets (of the wives) disarrayed, the sandal paste and other unguents on the body smudged, hair hanging down their faces, the sweating damsels followed Ravana. They were dizzy with leftover intoxication and sleep and were swaying from side to side. Their dishevelled hair was loose and faces filled with sweat, their flower garlands on the body had wilted due to sweat on their limbs. The drunken wives of Ravana, actuated by their high regard and passion for him followed as he advanced with drunken eyes.

content: स च कामपराधीन: पतिस्तासां महाबलः।सीतासक्तमना मन्दो मन्दाञ्चितगतिर्बभौ।।5.18.19।।
explanation: Their husband, powerful Ravana under the control of passion looking dull, absorbed in the  thoughts of Sita walked slowly as though counting his steps.

content: ततः काञ्चीनिनादं च नूपुराणां च निस्वनम्।शुश्राव परमस्त्रीणां स कपिर्मारुतात्मजः।।5.18.20।।
explanation: Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod, heard their jingling golden girdles and anklets.

content: तं चाप्रतिमकर्माणमचिन्त्यबलपौरुषम्।द्वारदेशमनुप्राप्तं ददर्श हनुमान् कपिः।।5.18.21।।
explanation: Then Hanuman, the Vanara saw Ravana of extraordinary deeds, and of unimaginable strength and valour at the entrance (of Ashoka garden)

content: दीपिकाभिरनेकाभिः समन्तादवभासितम्।गन्धतैलावसिक्ताभिर्ध्रियमाणाभिरग्रतः।।5.18.22।।
explanation: Hanuman saw him in the glow of lamps wet with fragrant oil carried by many shedemons all over.

content: कामदर्पमदैर्युक्तं जिह्मताम्रायतेक्षणम्।समक्षमिव कन्दर्पमपविद्धशरासनम्।।5.18.23।।
explanation: Hanuman saw him, who was possessed of lust, arrogance and intoxication. He appeared like Cupid setting aside his quiver and arrows with his curved, big, red eyes.

content: मथितामृतफेनाभमरजोवस्त्रमुत्तमम्।सलीलमनुकर्षन्तं विमुक्तं सक्तमङ्गदे।।5.18.24।।
explanation: He was playfully pulling up his upper garment that slipped and stuck to his armlet. This excellent unsoiled robe was looking like the foam of churned nectar.

content: तं पत्रविटपे लीनः पत्रपुष्पघनावृतः।समीपमिव संक्रान्तं निध्यातुमुपचक्रमे।।5.18.25।।
explanation: Hanuman seated on a leafy branch (of the simsupa tree) thickly covered with leaves and flowers started scanning the identity of Ravana who was drawing nearer.

content: अवेक्षमाणस्तु ततो ददर्श कपिकुञ्जरः।रूपयौवनसम्पन्ना रावणस्य वरस्त्रियः।।5.18.26।।
explanation: The leader of the monkeys started gazing at the chief wives of Ravana endowed with youth and beauty৷৷

content: ताभिः परिवृतो राजा सुरूपाभिर्महायशाः।तन्मृगद्विजसङ्घुष्टं प्रविष्टः प्रमदावनम्।।5.18.27।।
explanation: Surrounded by beauties, the glorious king entered the grove meant for women, reverberating with the sounds of beasts and birds.

content: क्षीबो विचित्राभरणः शङ्कुकर्णो महाबलः।तेन विश्रवसः पुत्रः स दृष्टो राक्षसाधिपः।।5.18.28।।वृतः परमनारीभिस्ताराभिरिव चन्द्रमाः।तं ददर्श महातेजास्तेजोवन्तं महाकपिः।।5.18.29।।
explanation: The brilliant vanara looked at the son of Visravas (Ravana), the demon king  adorned with wonderful ornaments. He had long tapering ears. He was intoxicated with drink. Encircled by damsels, he was looking like the Moon surrounded by stars.

content: रावणोऽयं महाबाहुरिति सञ्चिन्त्य वानरः।अवप्लुतो महातेजा हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।।5.18.30।।
explanation: The brilliant vanara (Hanuman), son of the Windgod recognising the strongarmed Ravana got down a little, saying 'This is truly the strongarmed Ravana.'

content: स तथाप्युग्रतेजाः सन्निर्धूतस्तस्य तेजसा।पत्रगुह्यान्तरे सक्तो हनुमान् संवृतोऽभवत्।।5.18.31।।
explanation: Hanuman, possessed of extraordinary energy, was taken aback at the might of Ravana. He remained hiding covered over with leaves.

content: स तामसितकेशान्तां सुश्रोणीं संहतस्त्नीम्।दिदृक्षुरसितापाङ्गामुपावर्तत रावणः।।5.18.32।।
explanation: With the desire to see Sita endowed with black hair, beautiful hips, plump breasts and dark sideglances, Ravana returned (to Ashokavana).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Description of Sita who was overcome with grief.]तस्मिन्नेव ततः काले राजपुत्री त्वनिन्दिता।रूपयौवनसम्पन्नं भूषणोत्तमभूषितम्।।5.19.1।।ततो दृष्ट्वैव वैदेही रावणं राक्षसाधिपम्।प्रावेपत वरारोहा प्रवाते कदली यथा।।5.19.2।।
explanation: On just seeing Ravana, the lord of demons from a distance, adorned with the best of ornaments the charming, young, blameles princess Vaidehi of beautiful waist trembled like a banana plant shaken by a strong wind.

content: आच्छाद्योदरमूरुभ्यां बाहुभ्यां च पयोधरौ।उपविष्टा विशालाक्षी रुदन्ती वरवर्णिनी।।5.19.3।।
explanation: Largeeyed, faircomplexioned Sita seated there with her belly, thighs and breasts covered with arms cried.

content: दशग्रीवस्तु वैदेहीं रक्षितां राक्षसीगणैः।ददर्श सीतां दुःखार्तां नावं सन्नामिवार्णवे।।5.19.4।।
explanation: The tennecked Ravana, too, on his part saw Sita, tormented with grief, guarded by the shedemons like a boat sunk in the sea.

content: असंवृतायामासीनां धरण्यां संशितव्रताम्।छिन्नां प्रपतितां भूमौ शाखामिव वनस्पतेः।।5.19.5।।
explanation: She looked woeful seated on the bare earth like the broken branch of a tree cut and fallen down on the ground.

content: मलमण्डनचित्राङ्गीं मण्डनार्हाममण्डिताम्।मृणाली पङ्कदिग्धेव विभाति न विभाति च।।5.19.6।।
explanation: Her body looked colourful with dust. Although she deserved adornment, she had none. She was like a lotus stem in mud looking bright yet dull (with mud).

content: समीपं राजसिंहस्य रामस्य विदितात्मनः।सङ्कल्पहयसंयुक्सैर्यान्तीमिव मनोरथैः।।5.19.7।।
explanation: She was as though moving towards the knower of the self, the supreme king, Rama with the horses of her resolution yoked to the chariot of her mind.

content: शुष्यन्तीं रुदतीमेकां ध्यानशोकपरायणाम्।दुःखस्यान्तमपश्यन्तीं रामां राममनुव्रताम्।।5.19.8।।
explanation: She was emaciated, absorbed in thought of Rama alone and crying and unable to find the end to her grief.

content: वेष्टमानां तथाऽविष्टां पन्नगेन्द्रवधूमिव।धूप्यमानां ग्रहेणेव रोहिणीं धूमकेतुना।।5.19.9।।
explanation: Sitting in that manner she resembled a coiled serpent queen, the star Rohini overshadowed by a smoking comet (that is Ravana).

content: वृत्तशीलकुले जातामाचारवति धार्मिके।पुनःसंस्कारमापन्नां जातामिव च दुष्कुले।।5.19.10।।
explanation: Though born in a traditional righteous and virtuous family, she was as though passing through a purificatory process like a lowbred woman.

content: अभूतेनापवादेन कीर्तिं निपतितामिव।आम्नायानामयोगेन विद्यां प्रशिथिलामिव।।5.19.11।।
explanation: She resembled reputation besmirched by scandals, like Vedic studies  slackened by lack of aplication. (Knowledge is verified with a suitable statment of the Veda which is the ultimate test of ones finding. This method is adopted in all Astika sastras which accept the authority of the Veda).

content: सन्नामिव महाकीर्तिं श्रद्धामिव विमानिताम्।पूजामिव परिक्षीणामाशां प्रतिहतामिव।।5.19.12।।
explanation: She was like great fame grown dim, faith slighted, worship meddled and hope frustrated.(Note: Sita's condition is being compared with abstract concepts such as fame, faith, reverence and hope which are hit by reverses in fate. She was the personification of all such suffering.)

content: आयतीमिव विध्वस्तामाज्ञां प्रतिहतामिव।दीप्तामिव दिशं काले पूजामपहृतामिव।।5.19.13।।
explanation: She was like a prospect blasted, command flouted, entire direction set on flames at the time of catastrophe and articles of worship abducted by evil forces at the sacrificial ceremony.

content: पद्मिनीमिव विध्वस्तां हतशूरां चमूमिव।प्रभामिव तमोध्वस्तामुपक्षीणामिवापगाम्।।5.19.14।।
explanation: She was like a lotuscreeper blighted, an army with its gallant warriors killed, radiance of light blocked by darkness and a stream run dry.

content: वेदीमिव परामृष्टां शान्तामग्निशिखामिव।पौर्णमासीमिव निशां राहुग्रस्तेन्दुमण्डलाम्।।5.19.15।।
explanation: (She was) like the altar of worship defiled, blazing fire extinguished, and the Moon eclipsed by Rahu in the full moon night.

content: उत्कृष्टपर्णकमलां वित्रासितविहङ्गमाम्।हस्तिहस्तपरामृष्टामाकुलां पद्मिनीमिव।।5.19.16।।
explanation: (She appeared) like a lotuspond the excellent leaves of whose lotuses surrounded by frightened birds are destroyed by the trunks of elephants.

content: पतिशोकातुरां शुष्कां नदीं विस्रावितामिव।परया मृजया हीनां कृष्णपक्षनिशामिव।।5.19.17।।
explanation: Stricken with grief caused by separation from her husband, she appeared like a river gone thin and dry, not fit for ablution, like a night during dark fortnight of the month deprived of all its glow.

content: सुकुमारीं सुजाताङ्गीं रत्नगर्भगृहोचिताम्।तप्यमानामिवोष्णेन मृणालीमचिरोद्धृताम्।।5.19.18।।
explanation: A delicate lady with beautiful limbs who deserved to be in a gemcrusted house was (now) like a lotus stem just plucked out and  scorched by the Sun's heat.

content: गृहीतामालितां स्तम्भे यूथपेन विनाकृताम्।निःश्वसन्तीं सुदुःखार्तां गजराजवधूमिव।।5.19.19।।
explanation: She was sighing heavily in intense grief like a royal female elephant tied to a pillar and separated from her lord, the leader of the herd.

content: एकया दीर्घया वेण्या शोभमानामयत्नतः।नीलया नीरदापाये वनराज्या महीमिव।।5.19.20।।
explanation: She was lovely even with a single braid of unkempt hair like the earth with a single row of dark trees covering its surface at the end of the rainy season.

content: उपवासेन शोकेन ध्यानेन च भयेन च।परिक्षीणां कृशां दीनामल्पाहारां तपोधनाम्।।5.19.21।।
explanation: She was wasted and emaciated through fasting and grief, depressed due to brooding and threatenings. She ate very little but was rich with  austerities.

content: आयाचमानां दुःखार्तां प्राञ्जलिं देवतामिव।भावेन रघुमुख्यस्य दशग्रीवपराभवम्।।5.19.22।।
explanation: Tormented with grief, Sita looked like a goddess begging Rama, the foremost of the Raghu family with folded hands in her mind to destroy Ravana, the tennecked demon.

content: समीक्षमाणां रुदतीमनिन्दितां सुपक्ष्मताम्रायतशुक्ललोचनाम्।अनुव्रतां राममतीव मैथिलीं प्रलोभयामास वधाय रावणः।।5.19.23।।
explanation: Blameless Mythili with clear, large eyes and beautiful eyelashes with a reddish tint at the corners was looking around, crying. Ravana tried to allure Sita who was deeply faithful to Rama and threatened to kill her (when he found her unflinching).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana attempts to tempt Sita]स तां परिवृतां दीनां निरानन्दां तपस्विनीम्।साकारैर्मधुरैर्वाक्यैर्न्यदर्शयत रावणः।।5.20.1।।
explanation: Ravana expressed his intention in sweet words to the depressed and griefstricken ascetic Sita surrounded by demon guards:

content: मां दृष्ट्वा नागनासोरु गूहमाना स्तनोदरम्।अदर्शनमिवात्मानं भयान्नेतुं त्वमिच्छसि।।5.20.2।।
explanation: "On seeing me, Sita, you want to conceal your thighs, belly and breasts through fear of me. I think you do not want me to see you.

content: कामये त्वां विशालाक्षि बहुमन्यस्व मां प्रिये।सर्वाङ्गगुणसम्पन्ने सर्वलोकमनोहरे।।5.20.3।।
explanation: "O largeeyed one  you are endowed with beauty in all limbs. You are the delight of all worlds. I desire you, dear  Oblige me.

content: नेह केचिन्मनुष्या वा राक्षसाः कामरूपिणः।व्यपसर्पतु ते सीते भयं मत्तः समुत्थितम्।।5.20.4।।
explanation: "O Sita no human or demon. who can take any form at their will can relieve your fear born of me.

content: स्वधर्मो रक्षसां भीरु सर्वथैव न संशयः।गमनं वा परस्त्रीणां हरणं सम्प्रमथ्य वा।।5.20.5।।
explanation: "O timid lady having an unrighteous approach to wives of others or their abduction by force is natural to demons, There is no doubt.

content: एवं चैतदकामां तु न त्वां स्प्रक्ष्यामि मैथिलि।कामं कामः शरीरे मे यथाकामं प्रवर्तताम्।।5.20.6।।
explanation: "Mythili  let passion hold its sway over my body as it will. But I shall not force you or touch you since you do not love me.

content: देवि नेह भयं कार्यं मयि विश्वसि हि प्रिये।प्रणयस्व च तत्त्वेन मैवं भूः शोकलालसा।।5.20.7।।
explanation: "O reverend lady, fear not me on that account. Have confidence in me. Show your love. Do not be swayed by grief .

content: एकवेणी धराशय्या ध्यानं मलिनमम्बरम्।अस्थानेऽप्युपवासश्च नैतान्यौपयिकानि ते।।5.20.8।।
explanation: "O Lady, to wear a single braid, sleep on the ground, brooding, wearing soiled clothes and fasting without proper occasion does not suit you.

content: विचित्राणि च माल्यानि चन्दनान्यगरूणि च।विविधानि च वासांसि दिव्यान्याभरणानि च।।5.20.9।।महार्हाणि च पानानि शयनान्यासनानि च।गीतं नृत्तं च वाद्यं च लभ मां प्राप्य मैथिलि।।5.20.10।।
explanation: "O Mythili having secured me, you get all these comforts wonderful garlands, sandal, incense, garments and beautiful ornaments, rich drinks, beds and seats.You can enjoy songs, dances accompanied by musical instruments.

content: स्त्रीरत्नमसि मैवं भूः कुरु गात्रेषु भूषणम्।मां प्राप्य हि कथं नु स्वास्त्वमनर्हा सुविग्रहे।।5.20.11।।
explanation: "You are a, a jewel among women. You should not  remain like this. You  should adorn yourself properly. How can you remain deprived after having me?

content: इदं ते चारु सञ्जातं यौवनं व्यतिवर्तते।यदतीतं पुनर्नैति स्रोतः शीघ्रमपामिव।।5.20.12।।
