explanation: "Your charming youth should not pass away (uselessly). A past event does not come back like a current of stream.

content: त्वां कृत्वोपरतो मन्ये रूपकर्ता स विश्वसृक्।न हि रूपोपमा त्वन्या तवास्ति शुभदर्शने।।5.20.13।।
explanation: "O lady  with auspicious looks Me thinks, the creator must have retired after creating your beautiful form. For there is no one comparable to you in beauty.

content: त्वां समासाद्य वैदेहि रूपयौवनशालिनीम्।कः पुमानतिवर्तेत साक्षादपि पितामहः।।5.20.14।।
explanation: "O Vaidehi you have (extraordinary) beauty  and (exuberant) youth. Who would not lose his balance of mind even if he were Brahma the grandsire himself after getting you?

content: यद्यत्पश्यामि ते गात्रं शीतांशुसदृशानने।तस्मिंस्तस्मिन् पृथुश्रोणि चक्षुर्मम निबध्यते।।5.20.15।।
explanation: "O one with a face like the cool fullmoon, with heavy hips. I am unable to extricate my eyes from any limb (of your body) I see.

content: भव मैथिलि भार्या मे मोहमेनं विसर्जय।बह्वीनामुत्तमस्त्रीणामाहृतानामितस्ततः।।5.20.16।।सर्वासामेव भद्रं ते ममाग्रमहिषी भव।
explanation: "O Mythili  be my wife. Give up this (folly due to) delusion. Be my chief consort among the several excellent women I have picked up here and there. Be blessed.

content: लोकेभ्यो यानि रत्नानि सम्प्रमथ्याहृतानि वै।।5.20.17।।तानि मे भीरु सर्वाणि राज्यं चैतदहं च ते।
explanation: "O timid lady, gems brought forcibly from all the worlds, this kingdom as well as myself are yours.

content: विजित्य पृथिवीं सर्वां नानानगरमालिनीम्।।5.20.18।।जनकाय प्रदास्यामि तव हेतोर्विलासिनि।
explanation: "O lovely lady I will win all the cities and lands and give them to Janaka for your sake.

content: नेह पश्यामि लोकेऽन्यं यो मे प्रतिबलो भवेत्।पश्य मे सुमहद्वीर्यमप्रतिद्वन्द्वमाहवे।।5.20.19।।
explanation: "I'm unrivalled in this entire world. Behold my matchless virility which permits no rival in war.

content: असकृत्संयुगे भग्ना मया विमृदितध्वजाः।।5.20.20।।अशक्ताः प्रत्यनीकेषु स्थातुं मम सुरासुराः।
explanation: "The gods and demons were unable to withstand my power in wars fought against me. They were often shattered and defeated with their flags crushed in war.

content: इच्छ मां क्रियतामद्य प्रतिकर्म तवोत्तमम्।।5.20.21।।सप्रभाण्यवसज्यन्तां तवाङ्गे भूषणानि च।साधु पश्यामि ते रूपं संयुक्तं प्रतिकर्मणा।।5.20.22।।
explanation: "Offer your love to me. Get yourself decorated in an excellent way. Wear glowing ornaments on your limbs. Let me see you in pleasingly decorated form.

content: प्रतिकर्माभिसंयुक्ता दाक्षिण्येन वरानने।भुंक्ष्व भोगान्यथाकामं पिब भीरु रमस्व च।।5.20.23।।
explanation: "O charming lady decorate yourself liberally. Enjoy these pleasures as you please. Drink and make merry.

content: यथेष्टं च प्रयच्छ त्वं पृथिवीं वा धनानि च।ललस्व मयि विस्रब्धा धृष्टमाज्ञापयस्व च।।5.20.24।।
explanation: "Give away land and wealth as you wish. Enjoy with me freely and command me boldly. I will obey you by all means.

content: मत्प्रसादाल्ललन्त्याश्च ललन्तां बान्धवास्तव।ऋद्धिं ममानुपश्य त्वं श्रियं भद्रे यशश्च मे।।5.20.25।।
explanation: "O blessed lady, see my affluence and my fame. Seeing you enjoy (life) by my grace all your kinsmen will follow.

content: किं करिष्यसि रामेण सुभगे चीरवाससा।निक्षिप्तविजयो रामो गतश्रीर्वनगोचरः।।5.20.26।।व्रती स्थण्डिलशायी च शङ्के जीवति वा न वा।
explanation: "O beautiful lady Rama has renounced victory, he has lost his fortune. Clad in bark, he is wandering in the forest following asceticism and sleeping on the ground. What can he do  for you? I am in doubt if he is alive or not.

content: न हि वैदेहि रामस्त्वां द्रष्टुं वा प्युपलप्स्यते।पुरोबलाकैरसितैर्मेघैर्ज्योत्स्नामिवावृताम्।।5.20.27।।
explanation: "O Vaidehi I wonder if Rama can see you at all. You are like moonlight veiled by dark clouds and  cannot  be seen even by the flying cranes.

content: न चापि मम हस्तात्त्वां प्राप्तुमर्हति राघवः।।5.20.28।।हिरण्यकशिपुः कीर्तिमिन्द्रहस्तगतामिव।
explanation: "Surely Raghava will not be able to win you back from my hands any more than the demon Hiranyakasipu was able to usurp the fame of Indra.

content: चारुस्मिते चारुदति चारुनेत्रे विलासिनि।।5.20.29।।मनो हरसि मे भीरु सुपर्णः पन्नगं यथा।
explanation: "O lovely, timid lady your smile, your teeth and your eyes are bewitching. Just as Garuda snatches away a serpent, you ravish my mind by your beauty.

content: क्लिष्टकौशेयवसनां तन्वीमप्यनलङ्कृताम्।।5.20.30।।त्वां दृष्ट्वा स्वेषु दारेषु रतिं नोपलभाम्यहम्।
explanation: "Even when you are attired in soiled silk and are bereft of ornaments, I find no interest in my own wives.

content: अन्तःपुरनिवासिन्यः स्त्रियः सर्वगुणान्विताः।।5.20.31।।यावन्त्यो मम सर्वासामैश्वर्यम् कुरु जानकि।
explanation: "O Janaki There are a number of virtuous consorts residing in the harem of my royal palace. You may exercise your authority on all of them.

content: मम ह्यसितकेशान्ते त्रैलोक्यप्रवराः स्त्रियः।।5.20.32।।तास्त्वां परिचरिष्यन्ति श्रियमप्सरसो यथा।
यानि वैश्रवणे सुभ्रु रत्नानि च धनानि च।।5.20.33।।तानि लोकांश्च सुश्रोणि मां च भुङ्क्ष्व यथासुखम्।
explanation: "O Sita of heavy hips and beautiful brows Be happy. Enjoy all the worlds of mine, the gems and wealth of Ravana.

content: न रामस्तपसा देवि न बलेन न विक्रमैः।।5.20.34।।न धनेन मया तुल्यस्तेजसा यशसापि वा।
explanation: "O queen Rama is not equal to me  either in penance or prowess or valour or wealth or brilliance or even in fame.

content: पिब विहर रमस्व भुङ्क्ष्व भोगान् धननिचयं प्रदिशामि मेदिनीं च।मयि लल ललने यथासुखं त्वं त्वयि च समेत्य ललन्तु बान्धवास्ते।।5.20.35।।
explanation: "O delightful one I will bestow you with heaps of riches and land. Therefore, enjoy with me drinking, sporting, and revelling. Accept me and be happy to sport with me.Let your elatives join you and enjoy all my wealth.

content: कुसुमिततरुजालसन्ततानि भ्रमरयुतानि समुद्रतीरजानि।कनकविमलहारभूषिताङ्गी विहर मया सह भीरु काननानि।।5.20.36।।
explanation: "O timid lady embellish yourself with necklaces of pure gold and enjoy with me in the enchanting seaside forest groves full of trees with blossoms and swarming bees.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे विंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita spurns Ravana's submission.]तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सीता रौद्रस्य रक्षसः।आर्ता दीनस्वरा दीनं प्रत्युवाच शनैर्वचः।।5.21.1।।
explanation: On hearing the demon's haughty words, oppressed, pitiable Sita replied slowly in a sorrowful tone.

content: दुःखार्ता रुदती सीता वेपमाना तपस्विनी।चिन्तयन्ती वरारोहा पतिमेव पतिव्रता।।5.21.2।।तृणमन्तरतः कृत्वा प्रत्युवाच शुचिस्मिता।
explanation: Sita, austere, beautiful and chaste afflicted by grief kept sobbing. Brooding over her husband and trembling in fear, she placed a blade of grass in between her and Ravana and replied with a gentle smile on her face.

content: निवर्तय मनो मत्तः स्वजने क्रियतां मनः।।5.21.3।।न मां प्रार्थयितुं युक्तं सुसिद्धिमिव पापकृत्।
explanation: "Turn your mind away from me and fix it on your wives. You should not expect to seek me just as a sinner cannot hope to seek blessedness.

content: अकार्यं न मया कार्यमेकपत्न्या विगर्हितम्।।5.21.4।।कुलं सम्प्राप्तया पुण्यं कुले महति जातया।
explanation: "I was born of high lineage and joined a meritorious family by virtue of my marriage. I am devoted only to my husband. I should not commit this contemptible, forbidden act."

content: एवमुक्त्वा तु वैदेही रावणं तं यशस्विनी।।5.21.5।।राक्षसं पृष्ठतः कृत्वा भूयो वचनमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Glorious Vaidehi having thus spoken to the demon turned her back and continued:

content: नाहमौपयिकी भार्या परभार्या सती तव।।5.21.6।।साधु धर्ममवेक्षस्व साधु साधुव्रतं चर।
explanation: "I cannot be your lawful wife obtainable by your personal efforts. I am a chaste woman married to another man. (Being a king) examine the dharma honestly and adopt a pious way of life.

content: यथा तव तथान्येषां दारा रक्ष्या निशाचर।।5.21.7।।आत्मानमुपमां कृत्वा स्वेषु दारेषु रम्यताम्।
explanation: "O nightranger Enjoy your wives. Take care of them. Taking your example, others' wives also deserve to be protected.

content: अतुष्टं स्वेषु दारेषु चपलं चलितेन्द्रियम्।।5.21.8।।नयन्ति निकृतिप्रज्ञं परदाराः पराभवम्।
explanation: "The wives of others will insult an evilminded man who is not satisfied with his own wives, is fickleminded and has no control over his senses.

content:
इह सन्तो न वा सन्ति सतो वा नानुवर्तसे।।5.21.9।।

तथाहि विपरीता ते बुद्धिराचारवर्जिता।
explanation: "Are there no pious men around or are you not heeding their words? Your mind is perverted and inclined to commit a forbidden act.

content: वचो मिथ्याप्रणीतात्मा पथ्यमुक्तं विचक्षणैः।।5.21.10।।राक्षसानामभावाय त्वं वा न प्रतिपद्यसे।
explanation: "You are indulging in unrighteous act and not listening to the advice of wise men who have a sense of discrimination. You are the cause of the destruction of demons.

content: अकृतात्मानमासाद्य राजानमनये रतम्।।5.21.11।।समृद्धानि विनश्यन्ति राष्ट्राणि नगराणि च।
explanation: "Even prosperous countries and cities are destroyed on account of indiscreet rulers engaged in unfair means.

content: तथेयं त्वां समासाद्य लङ्का रत्नौघसङ्कुला।।5.21.12।।अपराधात्तवैकस्य नचिराद्विनशिष्यति।
explanation: "Having got you as its ruler, this Lanka filled with gems (riches) will perish without delay for the crime of one individual.

content: स्वकृतैर्हन्यमानस्य रावणादीर्घदर्शिनः।।5.21.13।।अभिनन्दन्ति भूतानि विनाशे पापकर्मणः।
explanation: "O Ravana living beings will welcome and enjoy the destruction of a shortsighted sinner killed by his own vile act.

content: एवं त्वां पापकर्माणं वक्ष्यन्ति निकृता जनाः।।5.21.14।।दिष्ट्यैतद्व्यसनं प्राप्तो रौद्र इत्येव हर्षिताः।
explanation: "Seeing you, getting ruined this way for your sin, those who were angry with you for their humiliation in your hands will feel glad and say 'Luckily this terrible fellow has met with his doom' .

content: शक्या लोभयितुं नाहमैश्वर्येण धनेन वा।।5.21.15।।अनन्या राघवेणाहं भास्करेण प्रभा यथा।
explanation: "I cannot be lured by your power or wealth. I am inseparable from Raghava like light from the Sun.

content: उपधाय भुजं तस्य लोकनाथस्य सत्कृतम्।।5.21.16।।कथं नामोपधास्यामि भुजमन्यस्य कस्य चित्।
explanation: "How can I pillow on somebody's arm after resting on the honourable arm of the great lord of the worlds ?

content: अहमौपयिकी भार्या तस्यैव वसुधापतेः।।5.21.17।।व्रतस्नातस्य विप्रस्य विद्येव विदितात्मनः।
explanation: "I am alone the lawful wife of the lord of the earth like the knowledge of the Vedas which rightfully belongs to a wise brahmin who has realised the self after having had his ceremonial bath (as a token of celibacy) and having observed strict vows during the period of his study.

content: साधु रावण रामेण मां समानय दुःखिताम्।।5.21.18।।वने वाशितया सार्धं करेण्वेव गजाधिपम्।
explanation: "O Ravana it is proper for you to unite me in distress with Rama as one would unite a female elephant with the lordly elephant from which it is separated in the wilderness.

content: मित्रमौपयिकं कर्तुं रामः स्थानं परीप्सता।।5.21.19।।वधं चानिच्छता घोरं त्वयासौ पुरुषर्षभः।
explanation: "I wish you to build friendship with Rama, the bull among men. Surely it is the right thing for you to do, if you are desirous of avoiding a dreadful death.

content: विदितः स हि धर्मज्ञः शरणागतवत्सलः।।5.21.20।।तेन मैत्री भवतु ते यदि जीवितुमिच्छसि।
explanation: "He is famous as a knower of dharma and is compassionate to those who seek his protection. If you desire to preserve your life build friendship with him.

content: प्रसादयस्व त्वं चैनं शरणागतवत्सलम्।।5.21.21।।मां चास्मै नियतो भूत्वा निर्यातयितुमर्हसि।
explanation: "Propitiate him. He is compassionate to those who seek refuge. Exercise control over your senses for your sake and it is proper for you to return me to him.

content: एवं हि ते भवेत्स्वस्ति सम्प्रदाय रघूत्तमे।।5.21.22।।अन्यथा त्वं हि कुर्वाणो वधं प्राप्स्यसि रावण।
explanation: "It is good for you to give me back to Rama, the foremost in the Raghu dynasty. Otherwise you will face death.

content:
वर्जयेद्वज्रमुत्सृष्टं वर्जयेदन्तकश्चिरम्।।5.21.23।।

त्वद्विधं तु न सङ्कृद्धो लोकनाथः स राघवः।
explanation: "A thunderbolt may spare its target, Yama, lord of death may spare for a long time the life of a person doomed. But Rama, the lord of the world, will not spare any one when enraged.

content: रामस्य धनुषः शब्दं श्रोष्यसि त्वं महास्वनम्।।5.21.24।।शतक्रतुविसृष्टस्य निर्घोषमशनेरिव।
explanation: "You will hear the terrible twang of Rama's bow resembling the rumble of the thunderbolt released by Indra who performed a hundred yajnas.

content:
इह शीघ्रं सुपर्वाणो ज्वलितास्या इवोरगा: ।।5.21.25।।

इषवो निपतिष्यन्ति रामलक्ष्मणलक्षणाः।
explanation: "Arrows marked with Rama and Lakshmana will soon rain on Lanka like the poisonous snakes with flaming fangs.

content: रक्षांसि परिनिघ्नन्तः पुर्यामस्यां समन्ततः।।5.21.26।।असंपातं करिष्यन्ति पतन्तः कङ्कवाससः।
explanation: "The shafts bound with feathers of Kanka birds (released by Rama and Lakshmana) will be killing the demons all over this Lanka. They will not give a chance for any other weapon to fall.

content: राक्षसेन्द्रमहासर्पान् स रामगरुडो महान्।।5.21.27।।उद्धरिष्यति वेगेन वैनतेय इवोरगान्।
explanation: "Just as Garuda swiftly extirpates the serpents, Rama will exterminate the demon leaders.

content: अपनेष्यति मां भर्ता त्वत्तः शीघ्रमरिन्दमः।।5.21.28।।असुरेभ्यः श्रियं दीप्तां विष्णुस्त्रिभिरिव क्रमैः।
explanation: "My husband, the subduer of enemies, will soon take me away just as Lord Visnu in the form of Vamana took away the glowing prosperity from the demons with three strides.

content: जनस्थाने हतस्थाने निहते रक्षसां बले।।5.21.29।।अशक्तेन त्वया रक्षः कृतमेतदसाधु वै।
explanation: "When the army of demons as killed you had no capacity to protect and was destroyed at Janasthana, the place of death. You acted in this dishonest way.

content: आश्रमं तु तयोः शून्यं प्रविश्य नरसिंहयोः।।5.21.30।।गोचरं गतयोर्भ्रात्रोरपनीता त्वयाधम।
explanation: "You are a mean creature. Finding me in the vacant hut, when the two brothers, lions among men, were away, you  abducted me.

content: न हि गन्धमुपाघ्राय रामलक्ष्मणयोस्त्वया।।5.21.31।।शक्यं संदर्शने स्थातुं शुना शार्दूलयोरिव।
explanation: "Had you smelt the presence of Rama and Lakshmna, it would not have been possible for you to stand there, like a dog under the gaze of a pair of tigers.

content: तस्य ते विग्रहे ताभ्यां युगग्रहणमस्थिरम्।।5.21.32।।वृत्रस्येवेन्द्रबाहुभ्यां बाहोरेकस्य विग्रहे।
explanation: "You will not be able to withstand them in a battle. You will meet the same fate as the onearmed Vritra in a battle with the twoarmed Indra.

content: क्षिप्रं तव स नाथो मे रामः सौमित्रिणा सह।।5.21.33।।तोयमल्पमिवादित्यः प्राणानादास्यते शरैः।
explanation: "My lord Rama accompanied by Saumitri will draw out your life by his arrows swiftly as Aditya sucks up shallow water at once by his radiance.

content: गिरिं कुबेरस्य गतोऽथ वालयं सभां गतो वा वरुणस्य राज्ञः।असंशयं दाशरथेर्न मोक्ष्यसे महाद्रुमः कालहतोऽशनेरिव।।5.21.34।।
explanation: "Even if you fly to Kubera's mountain (Kailasa) or the residence of king Varuna (ocean) you will not escape Rama's arrows like a mighty tree cannot evade lightning.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Ravana appeals to Sita -- asks the demon guards to change her mind -- gives ultimatum to Sita] सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा परुषं राक्षसाधिपः।प्रत्युवाच ततः सीतां विप्रियं प्रियदर्शनाम्।।5.22.1।।
explanation: Hearing the sharp words of pleasing Sita, the lord of demons replied in unpleasant terms:

content: यथा यथा सान्त्वयिता वश्यः स्त्रीणां तथा तथा।यथा यथा प्रियं वक्ता परिभूतस्तथा तथा।।5.22.2।।
explanation: "The more the lover is courteous and loving and pleasing to women the more he is humiliated by them.

content: सन्नियच्छति मे क्रोधं त्वयि कामः समुत्थितः।द्रवतोऽमार्गमासाद्य हयानिव सुसारथिः।।5.22.3।।
explanation: "My love for you has restrained my anger, just as a good charioteer controls the horses galloping on a wrong path.

content: वामः कामो मनुष्याणां यस्मिन् किल निबध्यते।जने तस्मिंस्त्वनुक्रोशः स्नेहश्च किल जायते।।5.22.4।।
explanation: "Love is partial. It gets bound to those in whomsoever compassion and friendship is generated, even though they are punishable.

content: एतस्मात्कारणान्न त्वां घातयामि वरानने।वधार्हामवमानार्हां मिथ्याप्रव्रजिते रताम्।।5.22.5।।
explanation: "O beautiful one it is on this account that I do not kill you even though you deserve to be killed and insulted (for the words used),  even as you are engaged in a pseudoascetic life.

content: परुषाणीह वाक्यानि यानि यानि ब्रवीषि माम्।तेषु तेषु वधो युक्तस्तव मैथिलि दारुणः।।5.22.6।।
explanation: "O Mythili for each of the piercing statements made you deserve dreadful death."

content: एवमुक्त्वा तु वैदेहीं रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।क्रोधसंरम्भसंयुक्तः सीतामुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.22.7।।
explanation: Ravana, the lord of demons, said these words in reply to Vaidehi who was overcome with  anger and exitement.

content: द्वौ मासौ रक्षितव्यौ मे योऽवधिस्ते मया कृतः।ततः शयनमारोह मम त्वं वरवर्णिनि।।5.22.8।।
explanation: "I shall wait for two months, the deadline fixed. O lady of beautiful hue thereafter you have to share my bed.

content: ऊर्ध्वं द्वाभ्यां तु मासाभ्यां भर्तारं मामनिच्छतीम्।मम त्वां प्रातराशार्थमालभन्ते महानसे।।5.22.9।।
explanation: "If you are still reluctant to accept me as your husband after two months you will be sent to kitchen to be cooked as morning breakfast for me".

content: तां तर्ज्यमानां सम्प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसेन्द्रेण जानकीम्।देवगन्धर्वकन्यास्ता विषेदुर्विकृतेक्षणाः।।5.22.10।।
explanation: Observing Janaki, threatened by the demon king the daughters of gods and gandharvas shed tears with distressful eyes.

content: ओष्ठप्रकारैरपरा वक्त्रनेत्रैस्तथापराः।सीतामाश्वासयामासुस्तर्जितां तेन रक्षसा।।5.22.11।।
explanation: When Sita was threatened by the demon king, the daughters of gods and gandharvas there consoled her through gestures of their lips and eyes.

content: ताभिराश्वासिता सीता रावणं राक्षसाधिपम्।उवाचात्महितं वाक्यं वृत्तशौण्डीर्यगर्वितम्।।5.22.12।।
explanation: Having thus been consoled, Sita, proud of the power of her virtues, said this to Ravana in selfdefence:

content: नूनं न ते जनः कश्चिदस्ति निःश्रेयसे स्थित:।निवारयति यो न त्वां कर्मणोऽस्माद्विगर्हितात्।।5.22.13।।
explanation: "Obviously there is no one among your people keen on your welfare since nobody is preventing you from this reproachable act.

content: मां हि धर्मात्मनः पत्नीं शचीमिव शचीपतेः।त्वदन्यस्त्रिषु लोकेषु प्रार्थयेन्मनसापि कः।।5.22.14।।
explanation: "Who in all the three worlds other than you would, even in mind, seek this consort of the righteous self (Sri Rama) like  Sachi to Indra? .

content: राक्षसाधम रामस्य भार्याममिततेजसः।उक्तवानसि यत्पापं क्व गतस्तस्य मोक्ष्यसे।।5.22.15।।
explanation: "O stupid demon where can you go to escape the consequences of your sinful words spoken against Rama's consort of undimmed brilliance?

content: यथा दृप्तश्च मातङ्गः शशश्च सद्दृशो युधि।तथा मातङ्गवद्रामस्त्वं नीच: शशवत् स्मृतः।।5.22.16।।
explanation: "It is like a proud elephant fighting in war with a rabbit. Rama is like an elephant and you are like an ordinary rabbit people speak of.

content: स त्वमिक्ष्वाकुनाथं वै क्षिपन्निह न लज्जसे।चक्षुषोर्विषयं तस्य न तावदुपगच्छसि।।5.22.17।।
explanation: "You are not ashamed of belittling Rama in his absence. You have not yet walked into his sight.

content: इमे ते नयने क्रूरे विरूपे कृष्णपिङ्गले।क्षितौ न पतिते कस्मान्मामनार्य निरीक्षितः।।5.22.18।।
explanation: "O ignoble wretch I wonder why your dark brown, distorted eyes do not fall off (the socket) when you look at me (lustfully).

content: तस्य धर्मात्मनः पत्नीं स्नुषां दशरथस्य च।कथं व्याहरतो मां ते न जिह्वा व्यवशीर्यते।।5.22.19।।
explanation: "Why does not your tongue drop down while you speak such words against this consort of the righteous king (Rama) and daughterin law of Dasaratha?

content: असन्देशात्तु रामस्य तपसश्चानुपालनात्।न त्वां कुर्मि दशग्रीव भस्म भर्मार्ह तेजसा।।5.22.20।।
explanation: "O Ravana I can reduce you to ashes through the fire of my chastity. But I do not have Rama's permission and I want to preserve my power of ascetism even though you are fit to be consigned to the flames.

content: नापहर्तुमहं शक्या त्वया रामस्य धीमतः।विधिस्तव वधार्थाय विहितो नात्र संशयः।।5.22.21।।
explanation: "When I was with wise Rama, it was not possible for you to abduct me. No doubt Providence has ordained this to bring about your death.

content: शूरेण धनदभ्रात्रा बलैः समुदितेन च।अपोह्य रामं कस्माद्धि दारचौर्यं त्वया कृतम्।।5.22.22।।
explanation: "You are a (great) warrior and a brother of Kubera. You possess an army. Then why did you abduct Rama's wife bypassing him?"

content: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसाधिपः।विवृत्य नयने क्रूरे जानकीमन्ववैक्षत।।5.22.23।।
explanation: On hearing Janaki, the lord of demons, Ravana looked at her with his cruel eyes opened wide and rolling.

content: नीलजीमूतसङ्काशो महाभुजशिरोधरः।सिंहसत्त्वगतिः श्रीमान् दीप्त जिह्वाग्रलोचनः।।5.22.24।।
explanation: Prosperous Ravana looked like a mass of dark cloud, with strong arms, stout neck, gait of a lion, a blazing tongue and burning eyes

content: चलाग्रमकुटप्रांशुश्चित्रमाल्यानुलेपनः।रक्तमाल्याम्बरधर तत्सङ्गदविभूषणः।।5.22.25।।
explanation: He appeared taller with an unsteady crown. He was wearing wonderful red flower garlands and clothes and was smeared with unguents, shining in ornamental armlets.

content: श्रोणिसूत्रेण महता मेचकेन सुसंवृतः।अमृतोत्पादनद्धेन भुजगेनेव मन्दरः।।5.22.26।।
explanation: Wrapped well with a big black thread around his hips, he appeared like mount Mandara encompassed by a black serpent at the time of churning the milkocean for nectar.

content: ताभ्यां स परिपूर्णाभ्यां भुजाभ्यां राक्षसेश्वरः।शुशुभेऽचलसङ्काशः शृङ्गाभ्यामिव मन्दरः।।5.22.27।।
explanation: The lord of demons shone like mount Mandara, both his long two arms like two mountain peaks.

content: तरुणादित्यवर्णाभ्यां कुण्डलाभ्यां विभूषितः।रक्तपल्लवपुष्पाभ्यामशोकाभ्यामिवाचलः।।5.22.28।।
explanation: He stood like a mountain with two Ashoka trees clothed with red leaves and flowers in the form of earrings of the colour of the rising Sun.

content: स कल्पवृक्षप्रतिमो वसन्त इव मूर्तिमान्।श्मशानचैत्यप्रतिमो भूषितोऽपि भयङ्करः।।5.22.29।।
explanation: He was comparable to the wishfulfilling tree grown in heaven, a personified spring season and a memorial structure raised on the cremation ground. He looked frightening even though  welladorned.

content: अवेक्षमाणो वैदेहीं कोपसंरक्तलोचनः।उवाच रावणः सीतां भुजङ्ग इव निःश्वसन्।।5.22.30।।
explanation: Looking at Vaidehi, eyes red with anger, and breathing heavily like a histing snake, Ravana replied:

content: अनयेनाभिसम्पन्नमर्थहीनमनुव्रते।नाशयाम्यहमद्य त्वां सूर्यः सन्ध्यामिवौजसा।।5.22.31।।
explanation: "O Sita you are following a vow of chastity and treading a meaningless, wrong path. I will destroy you as the Sun dispels the morning twilight with his lustre".

content: इत्युक्त्वा मैथिलीं राजा रावणः शत्रुरावणः।सन्दिदेश ततः सर्वा राक्षसीर्घोरदर्शनाः।।5.22.32।।
explanation: King Ravana, a tormentor of enemies, having thus threatened Mythili commanded the shedemons women of fiecrceful appearance as follows:

content: एकाक्षीमेककर्णां च कर्णप्रावरणां तथा।गोकर्णीं हस्तिकर्णीं च लम्बकर्णीमकर्णिकाम्।।5.22.33।।हस्तिपाद्यश्वपाद्यौ च गोपादीं पादचूलिकाम्।एकाक्षीमेकपादीं च पृथुपादीमपादिकाम्।।5.22.34।।अतिमात्रशिरोग्रीवामतिमात्रकुचोदरीम्।अतिमात्रास्यनेत्रां च दीर्घजिह्वामजिह्विकाम्।।5.22.35।।अनासिकां सिंहमुखीं गोमुखीं सूकरीमुखीम्।
explanation: Of them one had one eye, the other one ear, another with ears covered, one had the ear of a cow, another had ears of an elephant and yet another, long, hanging ears. One had the feet of an elephant, another, hoofs of a horse and still another of a cow. While one had a single foot, another had broad feet and yet another no feet at all. One had a long neck and a large head. One had large breasts and belly. One had a big face and eyes, another had a long tongue and yet another no tongue at all. One had no nose and still another had a lion face and yet another the face of a cow.

content: यथा मद्वशगा सीता क्षिप्रं भवति जानकी।।5.22.36।।तथा कुरुत राक्षस्यः सर्वाः क्षिप्रं समेत्य च।
explanation: "O demonesses, all of you jointly dispose Janaki towards me. See that she submits to me at once.

content: प्रतिलोमानुलोमैश्च सामदानादिभेदनैः।।5.22.37।।आवर्जयत वैदेहीं दण्डस्योद्यमनेन च।
explanation: "By adopting means favourable or contrary to her will or through persuasion or coercion or through reward or punishment, draw Vaidehi's mind towards me." (said Ravana).

content: इति प्रतिसमादिश्य राक्षसेन्द्रः पुनः पुनः।।5.22.38।।काममन्युपरीतात्मा जानकीं पर्यतर्जयत्।
explanation: The demon king repeatedly commanded the ogresses burning in anger and passion and threatened Sita again and again, pointing his finger at her.

content: उपगम्य ततः शीघ्रं राक्षसी धान्यमालिनी।।5.22.39।।परिष्वज्य दशग्रीवमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
explanation: An ogress called Dhanyamalini at once approached the tenheaded Ravana and embracing him, said:.

content: मया क्रीड महाराज सीतया किं तवानया।।5.22.40।।विवर्णया कृपणया मानुष्या राक्षसेश्वर।
explanation: "O king of demons, sport with me, my lord. What purpose will be served with this pale wretched Sita, a human being after all?

content: नूनमस्या महाराज न दिव्यान् भोगसत्तमान्।।5.22.41।।विदधात्यमरश्रेष्ठस्तव बाहुबलार्जितान्।
explanation: "O king surely she is not ordained by Brahma, the foremost among the immortals to enjoy the luxuries earned by the strength of your arms.

content: अकामां कामयानस्य शरीरमुपतप्यते।।5.22.42।।इच्छन्तीं कामयानस्य प्रीतिर्भवति शोभना।
एवमुक्तस्तु राक्षस्या समुत्क्षिप्तस्ततो बली।।5.22.43।।प्रहसन्मेघसङ्काशो राक्षसः स न्यवर्तत।
explanation: Having heard her words, the demon king who resembled a fierce dark cloud turned away, laughing heartily.

content: प्रस्थितः स दशग्रीवः कम्पयन्निव मेदिनीम्।।5.22.44।।ज्वलद्भास्करवर्णाभं प्रविवेश निवेशनम्।
explanation: Thereupon the tennecked demon departed, as if he was shaking the earth and entered his residence which was shining like the blazing midday Sun.

content: देवगन्धर्वकन्याश्च नागकन्याश्च सर्वतः।।5.22.45।।परिवार्य दशग्रीवं विविशुस्तं गृहोत्तमम्।
explanation: Then the daughters of gods, gandharvas and nagas gathered round and followed him into his excellent palace.

content: स मैथिलीं धर्मपरामवस्थितां प्रपेपमानां परिभर्त्स्य रावणः।विहाय सीतां मदनेन मोहितः स्वमेव वेश्म प्रविवेश भास्वरम्।।5.22.46।।
explanation: Having derided Mythili trembling in fear yet steadfast in treading the righteous path, Ravana, overpowered with passion left her and entered his glittering mansion.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वाविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends twentysecond sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [The demonesses attempt to convince Sita]इत्युक्त्वा मैथिलीं राजा रावणः शत्रुरावणः।सन्दिश्य च ततः सर्वा राक्षसीर्निर्जगाम ह।।5.23.1।।
explanation: King Ravana, tormentor of enemies, having thus spoken to Mythili commanded the demonesses and departed.

content: निष्क्रान्ते राक्षसेन्द्रे तु पुनरन्तःपुरं गते।राक्षस्यो भीमरूपास्ताः सीतां समभिदुद्रुवुः।।5.23.2।।
explanation: As the demon king left for his abode all the demonesses of hideous looks rushed towards Sita and crowded around her.

content: ततः सीतामुपागम्य राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः।परं परुषया वाचा वैदेहीमिदमब्रुवन्।।5.23.3।।
explanation: The demonesses, overcome with anger, approached Sita and harshly said:

content: पौलस्त्यस्य वरिष्ठस्य रावणस्य महात्मनः।दशग्रीवस्य भार्या त्वं सीते न बहुमन्यसे।।5.23.4।।
explanation: 'O Sita don't you think it is a privilege to be the  wife of the highsouled, tennecked Ravana, who is the distinguished king of a high family of sage Paulastya?

content: ततस्त्वेकजटा नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।आमन्त्य्र क्रोधाताम्राक्षी सीतां करतलोदरीम्।।5.23.5।।
explanation: Then Ekajata, a shedemon of hideous looks, eyes red with anger and a belly of the size of the palm said to Sita:

content: प्रजापतीनां षण्णां तु चतुर्थो यः प्रजापतिः।मानसो ब्रह्मणः पुत्रः पुलस्त्य इति विश्रुतः।।5.23.6।।
explanation: 'The mindborn son of Brahma is well known as Paulastya. He was the fourth  among the six Prajapatis (Maricha, Atri, Angira, Pulastya, Plaha, Kratu).

content: पुलस्त्यस्य तु तेजस्वी महर्षिर्मानसः सुतः।नाम्ना स विश्रवा नाम प्रजापतिसमप्रभः।।5.23.7।।
explanation: 'This glorious mindborn sage Pulastya's son is the famous Vishrava who, in glory and splendour was equal to Prajapatis.

content: तस्य पुत्रो विशालाक्षि रावणः शत्रुरावणः।तस्य त्वं राक्षसेन्द्रस्य भार्या भवितुमर्हसि।।5.23.8।।मयोक्तं चारुसर्वाङ्गिः वाक्यं किं नानुमन्यसे।
explanation: 'O largeeyes lady to become the wife of the lord of demons is a stroke of good luck. You deserve to be one. O lady of beautiful limbs why don't you accept his proposal?'

content: ततो हरिजटा नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.23.9।।विवर्त्य नयने कोपान्मार्जारसदृशेक्षणा।
explanation: Then an ogress called Harijata said this in anger, her cateyes rolling:

content: येन देवास्त्रयस्त्रिंशद्देवराजश्च निर्जिताः।।5.23.10।।तस्य त्वं राक्षसेन्द्रस्य भार्या भवितुमर्हसि।
explanation: 'You ought to be the wife of the lord of ogres who has vanquished thirty three crores of gods including Indra, their king.'

content: ततस्तु प्रघसा नाम राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता।।5.23.11।।भर्त्सयन्ती तदा घोरमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Then an ogress named Praghasa, overwhelmed with anger, deriding Sita said these terrible words:

content: वीर्योत्सिक्तस्य शूरस्य सङ्ग्रामेषु निवर्तिनः।।5.23.12।।बलिनो वीर्ययुक्तस्य भार्यात्वं किं न लप्स्यसे।
explanation: 'Why don't you wish to be the wife of such a mighty and powerful king, a valiant hero who has never beaten a retreat in war?

content: प्रियां बहुमतां भार्यां त्यक्त्वा राजा महाबलः।।5.23.13।।सर्वासां च महाभागां त्वामुपैष्यति रावणः।
explanation: 'Even renouncing his highly respectable,  favourite wife among all, mighty Ravana is prepared to accept you.

content: समृद्धं स्त्रीसहस्रेण नानारत्नोपशोभितम्।।5.23.14।।अन्तःपुरं समुत्सृज्य त्वामुपैष्यति रावणः।
explanation: 'Ravana is prepared to abandon a thousand wives in his prosperous harem  decorated with all kinds of gems in order to accept you.'

content: अन्या तु विकटा नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.23.15।।असकृद्देवता युद्धे नागगन्धर्वदानवाः।निर्जिताः समरे येन स ते पार्श्वमुपागतः।।5.23.16।।
explanation: Another ogress called Vikata said, ' Know that he who has often defeated gods in war and has vanquished nagas, gandharvas and demons has come to you (seeking your favour)'.

content: तस्य सर्वसमृद्धस्य रावणस्य महात्मनः।किमद्य राक्षसेन्द्रस्य भार्यात्वं नेच्छसेऽधमे।।5.23.17।।
explanation: 'O foolish woman why don't you seek the wifehood of a glorious king of demons who has abundance of wealth?'

content: ततस्तु दुर्मुखी नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।यस्य सूर्यो न तपति भीतो यस्य च मारुतः।।5.23.18।।न वाति स्मायतापाङ्गे किं त्वं तस्य न तिष्ठसि।
explanation: Then an ogress called Durmukhi said, 'O lady of long sideglances why don't you yield to him, afraid of whom the Sun scorches not and strong winds blow not?

content: पुष्पवृष्टिं च तरवो मुमुचुर्यस्य वै भयात्।।5.23.19।।शैलाश्च सुभ्रु पानीयं जलदाश्च यदेच्छति।तस्य नैरृतराजस्य राजराजस्य भामिनि ।।5.23.20।।किं त्वं न कुरुषे बुद्धिं भार्यार्थे रावणस्य हि।
explanation: 'O lady of beautiful brows why don't you make up your mind to accept the king of kings, afraid of whom the trees rain flowers, the mountains and clouds release water at his will? Ravana is the king of the southwest, direction Why don't you wish to be his wife?

content: साधु ते तत्त्वतो देवि कथितं साधु भामिनि।।5.23.21।।गृहाण सुस्मिते वाक्यमन्यथा न भविष्यसि।
explanation: 'O beautiful lady with a gentle smile we have tendered good advice to you wishing you well. Accept this advice or else you may not be alive.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयोविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [The ogresses chide Sita who resolutely condemned Ravana.]ततः सीतामुपागम्य राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः।परुषं परुषा नार्य ऊचुस्तां वाक्यमप्रियम्।।5.24.1।।
explanation: Then the hideous ogresses approached Sita and spoke these harsh words in an unbecoming manner:

content: किं त्वमन्तःपुरे सीते सर्वभूतमनोहरे।महार्हशयनोपेते न वासमनुमन्यसे।।5.24.2।।
explanation: 'O Sita why don't you agree to dwell in Ravana's inner apartment furnished with fine bedsteads, and which is delightful?

content: मानुषी मानुषस्यैव भार्यात्वं बहुमन्यसे।प्रत्याहर मनो रामान्न त्वं जातु भविष्यसि।।5.24.3।।
explanation: 'You are  a woman, wife of Rama, an ordinary mortal you are holding in high esteem. Withdraw your mind from Rama or else you will not survive.

content:
त्रैलोक्यवसुभोक्तारं रावणं राक्षसेश्वरम्।

भर्तारमुपसङ्गम्य विहरस्व यथासुखम्।।5.24.4।।
explanation: "Accept Ravana as your husband and after uniting with him enjoy all the pleasures of the three worlds.

content: मानुषी मानुषं तं तु राममिच्छसि शोभने।राज्याद्भ्र्रष्टमसिद्धार्थं विक्लबं त्वमनिन्दिते।।5.24.5।।
explanation: 'O charming lady you have an irreproachable beauty and grace. Why do you think of human Rama only who has been dethroned from the kingdom. He is only a human being who is unsuccessful and distressful.'

content:
राक्षसीनां वचः श्रुत्वा सीता पद्मनिभेक्षणा।

नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यामिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.24.6।।
explanation: Hearing the words of the ogresses, Sita with eyes like lotus petals full of tears replied this way:

content:
यदिदं लोकविद्विष्टमुदाहरथ सङ्गताः।

नैतन्मनसि वाक्यं मे किल्बिषं प्रतिभाति वः।।5.24.7।।
explanation: "All of you joined together and spoke such words that are not acceptable to the world. Your sinful words of advice do not appeal to me.

content:
न मानुषी राक्षसस्य भार्या भवितुमर्हति।

कामं खादत मां सर्वा न करिष्यामि वो वचः।।5.24.8।।
explanation: ' A human being ought not to become wife of a demon. Devour me if you want. I refuse to accept your advice.'

content: दीनो वा राज्यहीनो वा यो मे भर्ता स मे गुरुः।तं नित्यमनुरक्तास्मि यथा सूर्यं सुवर्चला।।5.24.9।।
explanation: 'Dejected or dethroned from the kingdom, Rama is my lawful husband. I will ever remain devoted to Rama as Suvarchala, wife of the Sungod is to him.

content: यथा शची महाभागा शक्रं समुपतिष्ठति।अरुन्धती वसिष्ठं च रोहिणी शशिनं यथा।।5.24.10।।लोपामुद्रा यथागस्त्यं सुकन्या च्यवनं यथा।सावित्री सत्यवन्तं च कपिलं श्रीमती यथा।।5.24.11।।सौदासं मदयन्तीव केशिनी सगरं यथा।नैषधं दमयन्तीव भैमी पतिमनुव्रता।।5.24.12।।तथाऽहमिक्ष्वाकुवरं रामं पतिमनुव्रता।
explanation: 'I am steadfast (in love) to my husband Rama, the foremost of the Ikshvaku family in the same manner as noble Sachi to Indra, Arundhati to Vasistha, Rohini to the Moon, Lopamudra to Agastya, Sukanya to sage Chyavana, Savitri to Satyavan, Srimati to Kapilamuni Madayanti to Soudasu, Kesini to king Sagara and Bhima's daughter Damayanti to her lord Nala, (the king of Nishadas)'.

content:
सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः।।5.24.13।।

भर्त्सयन्ति स्म परुषैर्वाक्यै रावणचोदिताः।
explanation: Hearing the reply of Sita, the ogresses ordered by Ravana and overtaken by anger again began to threaten Sita using harsh words.

content: अवलीनः स निर्वाक्यो हनूमान् शिंशुपाद्रुमे।।5.24.14।।यसीतां सन्तर्जयन्तीस्ता राक्षसीरशृणोत् कपिः।
explanation: Hanuman who kept himself concealed on the simsupa tree speechlessly listened to the ogresses threatening Sita.

content: तामभिक्रम्य सङ्कृद्धा वेपमानां समन्ततः।।5.24.15।।भृशं संलिलिहुर्दीप्तान् प्रलम्बान् दशनच्छदान्।
explanation: Sita was trembling in fear. The  enraged ogresses went on licking their lips hanging, again and again.

content: ऊचुश्च परमक्रुद्धाः प्रगृह्याशु परश्वधान्।।5.24.16।।नेयमर्हति भर्तारं रावणं राक्षसाधिपम्।
explanation: The enraged ogresses immediately picked up the axes and rose up saying, 'she is unfit to have the demon king, Ravana as her husband'.

content: सा भर्त्स्यमाना भीमाभी राक्षसीभिर्वरानना।।5.24.17।।सबाष्पमप सर्पन्ती शिंशुपां तामुपागमत्।
explanation: As the charming Sita was threatened by the fierce ogresses, she moved towards the simsupa tree with eyes full of tears.

content: ततस्तां शिंशुपां सीता राक्षसीभिः समावृता।।5.24.18।।अभिगम्य विशालाक्षी तस्थौ शोकपरिप्लुता।
explanation: Then the largeeyed Sita, drowned in sorrow surrounded by the ogresses went near the simsupa tree and stood there.

content: तां कृशां दीनवदनां मलिनाम्बरधारिणीम्।।5.24.19।।भर्त्सयाञ्चक्रिरे सीतां राक्षस्यस्तां समन्ततः।
explanation: The ogresses started intimidating Sita who was dressed in soiled clothes and emaciated with a dejected look on her face.

content: ततस्तां विनता नाम राक्षसी भीमदर्शना।।5.24.20।।अब्रवीत्कुपिताकारा कराला निर्णतोदरी।
explanation: Then a dark ogress called Vinata with a terryfying look, loathsome appearance and a large sunken belly said to Sita:

content: सीते पर्याप्तमेतावद्भर्तुः स्नेहो निदर्शितः।।5.24.21।।सर्वात्रातिकृतं भद्रे व्यसनायोपकल्पते
explanation: 'O Sita you have shown your love for your husband to this extent. It is enough. O auspicious lady anything carried to excess leads to adversity.

content: परितुष्टास्मि भद्रं ते मानुषस्ते कृतो विधिः।।5.24.22।।ममापि तु वचः पथ्यं ब्रुवन्त्याः कुरु मैथिलि।
explanation: "O Mythili I beseech you (to oblige Ravana). You have discharged your duty as a human being. Be happy. But you should also heed my advice which is, after all, salutary.

content:
रावणं भज भर्तारं भर्तारं सर्वरक्षसाम्।।5.24.23।।

विक्रान्तं रूपवन्तं च सुरेशमिव वासवम्।

दक्षिणं त्यागशीलं च सर्वस्य प्रियदर्शनम्।।5.24.24।।
explanation: 'Accept as your husband the demon king Ravana, courageous and handsome like Indra, king of the gods generous, sacrificing and pleasing.

content: मानुषं कृपणं रामं त्यक्त्वा, रावणमाश्रय।दिव्याङ्गरागा वैदेहि दिव्याभरणभूषिता।।5.24.25।।अद्यप्रभृति सर्वेषां लोकानामीश्वरी भव।
explanation: 'Leave the helpless human Rama and seek Ravana's refuge. O Vaidehi, using the heavenly unguents and adorned with imposing ornaments from now on, be the queen of all people.

content:
अग्नेः स्वाहा यथा देवी शची वेन्द्रस्य शोभने।।5.24.26।।

किं ते रामेण वैदेहि कृपणेन गतायुषा।
explanation: O beautiful Sita Just like Swaha, queen to the Firegod and Sachi to Indra, accept Ravana. Why are you still thinking of Rama who is helpless and whose life span is coming to an end soon.

content: एतदुक्तं च मे वाक्यं यदि त्वं न करिष्यसि।।5.24.27।।अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते सर्वास्त्वां भक्षयिष्यामहे वयम्।
explanation: 'If you do not heed our words of advice, all of us will eat you at this very moment.'

content: अन्या तु विकटा नाम लम्बमानपयोधरा।।5.24.28।।अब्रवीत्कुपिता सीतां मुष्टिमुद्यम्य गर्जती।
explanation: Now Vikata another ogress with hanging breasts raised her fist up in anger and roared at Sita.

content:
बहून्यप्रियरूपाणि वचनानि सुदुर्मते।।5.24.29।।

अनुक्रोशान्मृदुत्वाच्च सोढानि तव मैथिलि।
explanation: O wicked Mythili! we have tolerated many unpleasant words uttered by you due to our kindness and mildness..

content: न च नः कुरुषे वाक्यं हितं कालपुरस्कृतम्।।5.24.30।।आनीतासि समुद्रस्य पारमन्यैर्दुरासदम्।रावणान्तःपुरं घोरं प्रविष्टा चासि मैथिलि।।5.24.31।।
explanation: 'O Mythili you have heeded not our good and timely advice tendered in your interest. You have been brought to the other shore of the ocean and to the inner chambers of Ravana which is very difficult for others to access.

content: रावणस्य गृहे रुद्धामस्माभिस्तु सुरक्षिताम्।न त्वां शक्तः परित्रातुमपि साक्षात्पुरन्दरः।।5.24.32।।
explanation: 'You are in Ravana's house, wellguarded by us. It is not possible even for Indra, destroyer of citadels, to come to your rescue (let alone Rama).

content: कुरुष्व हितवादिन्या वचनं मम मैथिलि।अलमश्रुप्रपातेन त्यज शोकमनर्थकम्।।5.24.33।।
explanation: 'Mythili, act according to our advice. I am your wellwisher. Give up sorrow and stop shedding useless tears.

content: भज प्रीतिं च हर्षं च त्यजैतां नित्यदैन्यताम्।सीते राक्षसराजेन सह क्रीड यथासुखम्।।5.24.34।।
explanation: 'O Sita offer your love to Ravana, adore him and be happy. Give up this continuous dejection. Enjoy all pleasures along with the king of demons.

content: जानासि हि यथा भीरु स्त्रीणां यौवनमध्रुवम्।यावन्न ते व्यतिक्रामेत्तावत्सुखमवाप्नुहि।।5.24.35।।
explanation: 'O timid Sita know that youth of women is fleeting and transient. Before it is over, enjoy all kinds of pleasures.

content: उद्यानानि च रम्याणि पर्वतोपवनानि च।सह राक्षसराजेन चर त्वं मदिरेक्षणे।।5.24.36।।
explanation: 'O lady of intoxicating eyes range in the company of the demon king, the delightful gardens and mountain ranges filled with gardens.

content: स्त्री सहस्राणि ते सप्त वशे स्थास्यन्ति सुन्दरि।रावणं भज भर्तारं भर्तारं सर्वरक्षसाम्।।5.24.37।।
explanation: 'O beautiful Sita seven thousand ogresses will be at your beck and call. (Therefore) accept Ravana, the lord of all ogres as your husband.

content: उत्पाट्य वा ते हृदयं भक्षयिष्यामि मैथिलि।यदि मे व्याहृतं वाक्यं न यथावत्करिष्यसि।।5.24.38।।
explanation: 'O Mythili if you heed not my words of advice, I will pluck out your heart and eat it up'.

content: ततश्चण्डोदरी नाम राक्षसी क्रोधमूर्छिता।भ्रामयन्ती महच्छूलमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.24.39।।
explanation: Next spoke a fiercelooking ogress called Chandodari, overcome with anger taking up a huge trident and rotating.

content: इमां हरिणलोलाक्षीं त्रासोत्कम्पिपयोधराम्।रावणेन हृतां दृष्टवा दौहृदो मे महानभूत्।।5.24.40।।
explanation: 'I have developed a morbid desire to feast upon this woman with eyes flashing like doe's, whose breasts heave with stress and fear after she was abducted by Ravana.

content: यकृत्प्लीहमथोत्पीडं हृदयं च सबन्धनम्।आन्त्राण्यपि तथा शीर्षं खादेयमिति मे मतिः।।5.24.41।।
explanation: 'I thought of feasting on your spleen, liver, heart, all the joints, head and intestines.'

content: ततस्तु प्रघसा नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।कण्ठमस्या नृशंसायाः पीडयाम किमास्यते।।5.24.42।।
explanation: Next spoke an ogress called Praghasa, saying 'Why not we twist and squeeze the neck of this heartless lady. Why are you sitting idle still? Come on.'

content: निवेद्यतां ततो राज्ञे मानुषी सा मृतेति ह।नात्र कश्चन संदेहः खादतेति स वक्ष्यति।।5.24.43।।
explanation: 'Thereafter we will announce that such a human being is dead. Then Ravana will simply say 'eat her up'. There is no doubt .'

content: ततस्त्वजामुखी नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।विशस्येमां ततः सर्वाः समान् कुरुत पिण्डकान्।।5.24.44।।
explanation: Then an ogress called Ajamukhi said, 'Let her body be cut into lumps of equal pieces.

content: विभजाम ततः सर्वा विवादो मे न रोचते।पेयमानीयतां क्षिप्रं लेह्यमुच्चावचं बहु।।5.24.45।।
explanation: 'We shall share them. I do not like disputes in this regard. Go swiftly and get drinks and food to lick. Let the accompanying  dishes of all variety and quality be brought.'

content: ततः शूर्पणखा नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत्।अजामुख्या यदुक्तं हि तदेव मम रोचते।।5.24.46।।
explanation: Then an ogress called Surpanakha said, 'I too like the proposal of Ajamukhi.'

content: सुरा चानीयतां क्षिप्रं सर्वशोकविनाशिनी।मानुषं मांसमास्वाद्य नृत्यामोऽथ निकुम्भिलाम्।।5.24.47।।
explanation: 'Get the wine quickly, destroyer of all sorrows. After relishing the human flesh we will start Nikumbhila dance.'

content: एवं संभर्त्स्यमाना सा सीता सुरसुतोपमा।राक्षसीभिः सुघोराभिर्दैर्यमुत्सृज्य रोदिति।।5.24.48।।
explanation: Threatened by the ogresses in that manner, Sita who was like the daughter of a god, cried aloud.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita wails over her misery.]अथ तासां वदन्तीनां परुषं दारुणं बहु।राक्षसीनामासौम्यानां रुरोद जनकात्मजा।।5.25.1।।
explanation: On hearing the many harsh words of dire threat by the ugly ogresses, the daughter of Janaka wept.

content: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही राक्षसीभिर्मनस्विनी।उवाच परमत्रस्ता भाष्पग्द्गदया गिरा।।5.25.2।।
explanation: In reply to the ogresses who thus spoke, noble Vaidehi, terribly frightened, said in a voice choked with tears.

content:
न मानुषी राक्षसस्य भार्या भवितुमर्हति।

कामं खादत मां सर्वा न करिष्यामि वो वचः।।5.25.3।।
explanation: 'A human ought not to become the wife of a demon. You can eat me up. I will not follow your advice.'

content: सा राक्षसीमध्यगता सीता सुरसुतोपमा।न शर्म लेभे दुःखार्ता रावणेन च तर्जिता।।5.25.4।।
explanation: Surrounded by the ogresses, distressed Sita, who was like the daughter of a divine, did not get any solace.

content: वेपते स्माधिकं सीता विशन्ती वाङ्गमात्मनः।वने यूथपरिभ्रष्टा मृगी कोकैरिवार्दिता।।5.25.5।।
explanation: 'Like a doe that strayed from the herd in the forest and tormented by  wolves around, Sita had withdrawn into herself all her limbs through fear, she was trembling excessively.

content: सा त्वशोकस्य विपुलां शाखामालम्ब्य पुष्पिताम्।चिन्तयामास शोकेन भर्तारं भग्नमानसा।।5.25.6।।
explanation: Laying hold on a large blossoming branch of the Ashoka tree, Sita thought of her husband with a broken heart.

content: सा स्नापयन्ती विपुलौ स्तनौ नेत्रजलस्रवैः।चिन्तयन्ती न शोकस्य तदान्तमधिगच्छति।।5.25.7।।
explanation: Her large breasts bathed with the flow of tears, she continued to brood over her plight  and found no end to it.

content: सा वेपमाना पतिता प्रवाते कदली यथा।राक्षसीनां भयत्रस्ता विवर्णवदनाभवत्।।5.25.8।।
explanation: Trembling like a banana tree uprooted by the stormy wind, Sita who was seized with fear of the ogresses looked pale and desperate.

content: तस्याः सा दीर्घविपुला वेपन्त्या सीतया तदा।ददृशे कम्पिनी वेणी व्यालीव परिसर्पती।।5.25.9।।
explanation: The long, luxuriant braid of hair of the trembling Sita waving (in the wind), appeared like a crawling female serpent.

content: सा निःश्वसन्ती दुःखार्ता शोकोपहतचेतना।आर्ता व्यसृजदश्रूणि मैथिली विललाप च।।5.25.10।।
explanation: The distressed Mythili, her consciousness drowned in grief, sighing, shed streams of tears.

content: हा रामेति च दुःखार्ता हा पुनर्लक्ष्मणेति च।हा श्वश्रु मम कौसल्ये हा सुमित्रेति भामिनी।।5.25.11।।
explanation: 'The bright, beautiful Sita began to wail, alas, "Rama alas, Lakshmana alas, my motherinlaw, Kausalya alas, Sumitra

content: लोकप्रवादः सत्योऽयं पण्डितैः समुदाहृतः।अकाले दुर्लभो मृत्युः स्त्रिया वा पुरुषस्य वा।।5.25.12।।यदहमेवं क्रूराभी राक्षसीभिरिहार्दिता।जीवामि हीना रामेण मुहूर्तमपि दुःखिता।।5.25.13।।
explanation: 'There is a famous popular saying among the learned that untimely death is not possible  either for a woman or a man.It is true that I am living in this miserable condition, deprived of Rama's company and tormented by these cruel ogresses here. Living in such conditions even for a moment is impossible. But nobody dies an untimely death.

content: एषाल्पपुण्या कृपणा विनशिष्याम्यनाथवत्।समुद्रमध्ये नौः पूर्णा वायुवेगैरिवाहता।।5.25.14।।
explanation: 'I am a woman of low merit, a wretched woman, an orphan. I will be ruined like the loaded boat that gets hit in the midst of the ocean by the stormy wind.

content: भर्तारं तमपश्यन्ती राक्षसीवशमागता।सीदामि खलु शोकेन कूलं तोयहतं यथा।।5.25.15।।
explanation: 'Unable to find my husband and seized by these ogresses, I am collapsing on account of grief like a riverbank under the current of water.

content: तं पद्मदलपत्राक्षं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम्।धन्याः पश्यन्ति मे नाथं कृतज्ञं प्रियवादिनम्।।5.25.16।।
explanation: 'Blessed are those who are in touch with my husband with eyes like lotus petals, whose walk is majestic like a lion's, who has a sense of gratitude and is pleasing in words.

content: सर्वथा तेन हीनाया रामेण विदितात्मना।तीक्ष्णं विषमिवास्वाद्य दुर्लभं मम जीवितम्।।5.25.17।।
explanation: 'Separated from Rama endowed with selfknowledge, it is impossible for me to live like one who has drunk venom.

content: कीदृशं तु महापापं मया जन्मान्तरे कृतम्।यनेदं प्राप्यते दुःखं मया घोरं सुदारुणम्।।5.25.18।।
explanation: 'I do not know what great sin I have committed in my past life for which I experience this terrific, cruel affliction?

content: जीवितं त्यक्तुमिच्छामि शोकेन महता वृता।राक्षसीभिश्च रक्षन्त्या रामो नासाद्यते मया।।5.25.19।।
explanation: 'I long to give up my life, afflicted with great grief, as I, wellguarded by these ogresses, have no hope  to reach Rama.

content: धिगस्तु खलु मानुष्यं धिगस्तु परवश्यताम्।न शक्यं यत्परित्यक्तुमात्मच्छन्देन जीवितम्।।5.25.20।।
explanation: 'Fie upon this human life. Fie upon this dependence. What a pitiable situation I am placed in. It is not possible for me, a human, to give up life at my free will.'           इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita decides to end her sad life.] प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखीत्यवं ब्रुवन्ती जनकात्मजा।आधोगतमुखी बाला विलप्तुमुपचक्रमे।।5.26.1।।
explanation: The young daughter of king Janaka thus speaking, began to cry, her face bent down.

content: उन्मत्तेव प्रमत्तेव भ्रान्तचित्तेव शोचती।उपावृत्ता किशोरीव विवेष्टन्ती महीतले।।5.26.2।।
explanation: Bewildered or distracted or intoxicated, this young lady wailed, wallowing round on the ground like a young female horse:

content:
राघवस्य प्रमत्तस्य रक्षसा कामरूपिणा।

रावणेन प्रमथ्याहमानीता क्रोशती बलात्।।5.26.3।।
explanation: When Rama was engaged (in deer hunt) and I was screaming, I was brought forcibly by Ravana who can assume any form at his will.

content: राक्षसीवशमापन्ना भर्त्स्यमाना सुदारुणम्।चिन्तयन्ती सुदुःखार्ता नाहं जीवितुमुत्सुहे।।5.26.4।।
explanation: "Having fallen under the clutches of the dreadful demonesses and threatened by them, I am so full of woes and worries that I don't want to live.

content: न हि मे जीवितेनार्थो नैवार्थेर्न च भूषणैः।वसन्त्या राक्षसीमध्ये विना रामं महारथम्।।5.26.5।।
explanation: "In the absence of the great charioteer Rama, of what use is my living in the midst of ogresses? I need no wealth, no ornaments.

content: अश्मसारमिदं नूनमथवाप्यजरामरम्।हृदयं मम येनेदं न दुःखेनावशीर्यते।।5.26.6।।
explanation: "It may be, that my heart is made of stone or it has no age or death since it does not riven even with grief.

content: धिङ्मामनार्यामसतीं याहं तेना विना कृता।मुहूर्तमपि रक्षामि जीवितं पापजीविता।।5.26.7।।
explanation: "I am preserving this sinful life like this though separated from Rama. Fie on me, for this wretched, infidel life

content: का च मे जीविते श्रद्धा सुखे वा तं प्रियं विना।भर्तारं सागरान्ताया वसुधायाः प्रियंवदम्।।5.26.8।।
explanation: "How can I have interest in any kind of pleasure without my sweettongued husband, the lord of the whole earth extending up to the ocean.

content: भिद्यतां भक्ष्यतां वापि शरीरं विसृजाम्यहम्।न चाप्यहं चिरं दुःखं सहेयं प्रियवर्जिता।।5.26.9।।
explanation: "I will give up my body. Break me  into pieces or eat me up. I cannot bear the sorrow of separation from my dear Rama any longer.

content: चरणेनापि सव्येन न स्पृशेयं निशाचरम्।रावणं किं पुनरहं काममेयं विगर्हितम्।।5.26.10।।
explanation: "I will not even touch that vile nightranger Ravana with my left foot. What to speak of loving him.

content:
प्रत्याख्यातं न जानाति नात्मानं नात्मनः कुलम्।

यो नृशंसस्वभावेन मां प्रार्थयितुमिच्छति।।5.26.11।।
explanation: 'As Ravana has no heart, he pleads to gain me. He is aware of neither his own self nor his family.

content: छिन्ना भिन्ना विभक्ता वा दीप्तेवाग्नौ प्रदीपिता।रावणं नोपतिष्ठेयं किं प्रलापेन वश्चिरम्।।5.26.12।।
explanation: "Even if I am cut, broken to pieces or burnt in glowing fire, I will not accept Ravana. Why do you shout for so long?

content: ख्यातः प्राज्ञः कृतज्ञश्च सानुक्रोशश्च राघवः।सद्वृत्तो निरनुक्रोशश्शङ्के मद्भाग्यसङ्क्षयात्।।5.26.13।।
explanation: "Rama is renowned, wise, grateful and kindly. It is due to my misfortune that he has turned pitiless to me. There is no doubt.

content: राक्षसानां सहस्राणि जनस्थाने चतुर्दश।येनैकेन निरस्तानि स मां किं नाभिपद्यते।।5.26.14।।
explanation: "He who destroyed fourteen thousand demons singlehanded has not come to protect me. I do not know why.

content: निरुद्धा रावणेनाहमल्पवीर्येण रक्षसा।समर्थः खलु मे भर्ता रावणं हन्तुमाहवे।।5.26.15।।
explanation: "Rama, my husband, for sure, is capable of killing in battle this Ravana who has held me captive and who is a demon of inferior valour.

content: विराधो दण्डकारण्ये येन राक्षसपुङ्गवः।रणे रामेण निहतस्स मां किं नाभिपद्यते।।5.26.16।।
explanation: "Why is Rama who killed Viradha, a bull among demons, in Dandaka forest in the fight not coming to rescue me?

content: कामं मध्ये समुद्रस्य लङ्केयं दुष्प्रधर्षणा।न तु राघवबाणानां गतिरोधो भविष्यति ।।5.26.17।।
explanation: "This Lanka in the middle of the ocean is unassailable. But there is nothing which can resist the arrows of Rama.

content: किन्नु तत्कारणं येन रामो दृढपराक्रमः।रक्षसापहृतां भार्यामिष्टां नाभ्यवपद्यते।।5.26.18।।
explanation: "What may be the reason that my loving husband, Rama who is highly powerful has not reached this place to which I was abducted by the demon.

content: इहस्थां मां न जानीते शङ्के लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।जानन्नपि हि तेजस्वी धर्षणं मर्षयिष्यति।।5.26.19।।
explanation: "The elder brother of Lakshamana does not know that I am here. Or, I'm afraid, the glorious Rama knows and yet tolerates such an outrageous act.

content: हृतेति योऽधिगत्वा मां राघवाय निवेदयेत्।गृध्रराजोऽपि स रणे रावणेन निपातितः।।5.26.20।।
explanation: "Even the king of vultures knows I was borne away. He could have informed Rama. But he has also been thrashed down on the earth by Ravana in the fight.

content: कृतं कर्म महत्तेन मां तथाऽभ्यवपद्यता।तिष्ठता रावणद्वन्द्वे वृद्धेनापि जटायुषा।।5.26.21।।
explanation: "Though old, Jatayu did a great help to me by resisting Ravana in the duel and advancing (to confront him.).

content: यदि मामिह जानीयाद्वर्तमानां स राघवः।अद्य बाणैरभिक्रुद्धः कुर्याल्लोकमराक्षसम्।।5.26.22।।
explanation: "Had only Raghava known that I was here he would have freed this world of demons with his anger.

content: विधमेच्च पुरीं लङ्कां शोषयेच्च महोदधिम्।रावणस्य च नीचस्य कीर्तिं नाम च नाशयेत्।।5.26.23।।
explanation: "Had Rama known that I am in Lanka he would have blown up this city, dried up the ocean and destroyed the name and fame of the mean Ravana.

content: ततो निहतनाथानां राक्षसीनां गृहे गृहे।यथाहमेवं रुदती तथा भूयो न संशयः।।5.26.24।।
explanation: "Like me weeping, the cry of ogresses with lost husbands will be heard in every house in Lanka. There is no doubt.

content: अन्विष्य रक्षसां लङ्कां कुर्याद्रामस्सलक्ष्मणः।न हि ताभ्यां रिपुर्दृष्टो मुहूर्तमपि जीवति।।5.26.25।।
explanation: "If only Lakshmana and Rama in their quest for Lanka reach here, it is  not possible within their sight for the enemy to survive  even a moment.

content: चिताधूमाकुलपथा गृध्रमण्डलसङ्कुला।अचिरेण तु लङ्केयं श्मशानसदृशी भवेत्।।5.26.26।।
explanation: "Very soon this Lanka will be enveloped with smoke from funeral pyres and thronged with flocks of vultures moving in circles. It will be like a burial ground.

content: अचिरेणैव कालेन प्राप्स्याम्येव मनोरथम्।दुष्प्रस्थानोऽयामाख्याति सर्वेषां वो विपर्ययम्।।5.26.27।।
explanation: "Your bad behaviour forebodes illluck for you.I shall have my desire fulfilled in a short time.

content: यादृशानीह दृश्यन्ते लङ्कायामशुभानि वै।अचिरेणैव कालेन भविष्यति हतप्रभा।।5.26.28।।
explanation: "Inauspicious signs are seen here in Lanka. In a short time this city will lose its splendour.

content: नूनं लङ्का हते पापे रावणे राक्षसाधमे।शोषं यास्यति दुर्धर्षा प्रमदा विधवा यथा।।5.26.29।।
explanation: "Surely this impregnable Lanka will wither up (lose its splendour) and appear like a widow when this sinful Ravana, a mean demon is killed.

content: पुण्योत्सवसमुत्था च नष्टभर्त्री सराक्षसी।भविष्यति पुरी लङ्का नष्टभर्त्री यथाङ्गना।।5.26.30।।
explanation: "This city of Lanka with many auspicious celebrations will lose its king and all mean ogresses will remain like widows.

content: नूनं राक्षसकन्यानां रुदन्तीनां गृहे गृहे।श्रोष्यामि नचिरादेव दुःखार्तानामिह ध्वनिम्।।5.26.31।।
explanation: "I shall surely hear very soon sounds of distressful cry of young ogresses in every household.

content: सान्थकारा हतद्योता हतराक्षसपुङ्गवा।भविष्यति पुरी लङ्का निर्दग्धा रामसायकैः।।5.26.32।।
explanation: "Totally burnt by Rama's arrows, this Lanka will be filled with darkness, and its splendour lost and preeminent demons destroyed.

content: यदि नाम स शूरो मां रामो रक्तान्तलोचनः।जानीयाद्वर्तमानां हि रावणस्य निवेशने।।5.26.33।।अनेन तु नृशंसेन रावणेनाधमेन मे।समयो यस्तु निर्दिष्टस्तस्य कालोऽयमागतः।।5.26.34।।स च मे विहितो मृत्युरस्मिन् दुष्टे न वर्तते।
explanation: "If the heroic Rama of bloodshot eyes comes to know that I am here at Ravana's, the expiry of time limit fixed by this cruel, lowly, foolish Ravana has arrived, this wicked fellow's death is inevitable.

content:
अकार्यं ये न जानन्ति नैर्ऋताः पापकारिणः।।5.26.35।।

अधर्मात्तु महोत्पातो भविष्यति हि सांप्रतम्।

नैते धर्मं विजानन्ति राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः।।5.26.36।।
explanation: Nothing is forbidden for sinful demons. A calamity will befall now due to this adharma. The flesheating ogres are aware of neither dharma nor adharma.

content: ध्रुवं मां प्रातराशार्थे राक्षसः कल्पयिष्यति।साहं कथं करिष्यामि तं विना प्रियदर्शनम्।।5.26.37।।रामं रक्तान्तनयनमपश्यन्ती सुदुःखिता।
explanation: "This demon is determined to make me his morning meal. How can I do anything in the absence of my lord of pleasing countenance. I am distressed very much by not seeing Rama, possessed of eyes with a reddish tinge in the corners.

content: यदि कश्चित् प्रदाता मे विषस्याद्य भवेदिह।।5.27.38।।क्षिप्रं वैवस्वतं देवं पश्येयं पतिना विना।
explanation: "If I can find some one who can give me poison now I shall soon see the lord of death without my lord.

content: नाजानाज्जीवतीं रामस्स मां लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः।।5.26.39।।जानन्तौ तौ न कुर्यातां नोर्य्वां हि मम मार्गणम्।
explanation: "Neither Lakshmana nor his elder brother knows that I am here alive. (Had they known) both of them would have ransacked this earth.

content: नूनं ममैव शोकेन स वीरो लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।।5.26.40।।देवलोकमितो यातस्त्यक्त्वा देहं महीतले।
explanation: "Would it be that the heroic elder brother of Lakshmana has gone to the abode of gods unable to find me on this earth?

content: धन्या देवास्सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।।5.26.41।।मम पश्यन्ति ये नाथं रामं राजीवलोचनम्।
explanation: "Blessed are the gods, gandharvas, and siddhas and great sages who are able to see my lotuseyed lord Rama.

content:
अथवा न हि तस्यार्थो धर्मकामस्य धीमतः।।5.26.42।।

मया रामस्य राजर्षेर्भार्यया परमात्मनः।
explanation: Or that royal sage, wise Rama who always seeks dharma having become one with the supreme spirit has no longer any interest in me?

content: दृश्यमाने भवेत्प्रीति स्सौहृदं नास्त्यपश्यतः।।5.26.43।।नाशयन्ति कृतघ्नास्तु न रामो नाशयिष्यति।
explanation: "Love attaches itself to one who remains before one's eyes.Friendship fades with separation. The ungrateful destroy love and friendship (as their love is conditioned by frequent meetings). But it cannot happen in case of Rama.

content: किं नु मे न गुणाः केचित्किं वा भाग्यक्षयो मम।।5.26.44।।                                                                                                       याहं सीदामि रामेण हीना मुख्येन भामिनी।
explanation: "Do I, a charming lady, not have any good fortune because of my past deeds? I wonder how a foremost woman like me seperated from my husband is sinking in grief without Rama. Has my fortune diminished?

content:
श्रेयो मे जीवितान्मर्तुं विहीनाया महात्मनः।।5.26.45।।

रामादक्लिष्टचारित्राच्छूराच्छत्रुनिबर्हणात्।
explanation: Instead of living separated from noble and brave Rama, a blemishless character and a destroyer of enemies, it is better for me to die.

content: अथवा न्यस्तशत्रौ तौ वने मूलफलाशिनौ।।5.26.46।।भ्रातरौ हि नरश्रेष्ठौ संवृत्तौ वनगोचरौ।
explanation: "May be both the brothers, foremost among men, have laid down their arms, and taken to asceticism, subsisting on roots and fruits.

content: अथवा राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.26.47।।छद्मना घातितौ शूरौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।
explanation: "Or else, has this wicked demon king slain both the brothers Rama and Lakshmana by some deceptive means?

content: साऽहमेवङ्गते काले मर्तुमिच्छामि सर्वथा।।5.26.48।।न च मे विहितो मृत्युरस्मिन् दुःखेऽपि वर्तते।
explanation: "By all means I wish to die in these circumstances. However, death is not ordained for me even in this sorrowful state.

content:
धन्याः खलु महात्मानो मुनयस्त्यक्तकिल्बिषाः।।5.26.49।।

जितात्मनो महाभागा येषां न स्तः प्रियाप्रिये।
explanation: Blessed are the exhalted sages who have not committed any sin. They have self control and have subdued their senses. There is no pleasure or displeasure for them.

content: प्रियान्न संभवेद्दुःखमप्रियादधिकं भयम्।।5.26.50।।ताभ्यां हि ये वियुज्यन्ते नमस्तेषां महात्मनाम्।
explanation: "Salutations to those exalted souls who have distanced themselves from pleasure and displeasure. Pleasures may not lead to suffering or displeasure to excessive, meaningless fear for such great souls.

content: साहं त्यक्ता प्रियार्हेण रामेण विदितात्मना।।5.26.51।।प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यामि पापस्य रावणस्य गता वशम्।
explanation: "Separated from the wise Rama who deserves pleasant things I will give up life being under the clutches of the sinful Ravana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षडिवंश स्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Trijata narrates her dream]इत्युक्तास्सीतया घोरं राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः।काश्चिज्जग्मुस्तदाख्यातुं रावणस्य तरस्विनः।।5.27.1।।
explanation: Hearing Sita's words, some terrifying demonesses, overwhelmed with anger, went to inform Ravana, who was quick to act.

content: ततः सीतामुपागम्य राक्षस्यो घोरदर्शनाः।पुनः परुषमेकार्थमनर्थार्थमथाब्रुवन्।।5.27.2।।
explanation: The dreadfullooking demonesses once again approached Sita and conveyed her categorically in harsh words the terrible consequences (ahead)

content: अद्येदानीं तवानार्ये सीते पापविनिश्चये।राक्षस्यो भक्षयिष्यन्ति मांसमेतद्यथासुखम्।।5.27.3।।
explanation: "O vile one you are determined in your evil ways. Today these shedemons will eat away your flesh to their heart's content ".

content: सीतां ताभिरनार्याभिर्दृष्टवा सन्तर्जितां तदा।राक्षसी त्रिजटा वृद्धा शयाना वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.27.4।।
explanation: Then seeing the ignoble shedemons threatening Sita, an old demoness called Trijata, who was lying down there, said:

content: आत्मानं खादतानार्या न सीतां भक्षयिष्यथ।जनकस्य सुतामिष्टां स्नुषां दशरथस्य च।।5.27.5।।
explanation: "Devour yourselves now, O ignoble ones, if you will. Do not eat Janaka's favourite daughter, the daughterinlaw of Dasaratha.

content: स्वप्नो ह्यद्य मया दृष्टो दारुणो रोमहर्षणः।राक्षसानामभावाय भर्तुरस्या भवाय च।।5.27.6।।
explanation: "Tonight I had a terrific, horriplating nightmare in which I saw the annihilation of all demons and the triumph of Sita's husband".

content:
एवमुक्तास्त्रिजटया राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः।

सर्वा एवाब्रुवन्भीतास्त्रिजटां तामिदं वचः।।5.27.7।।
explanation: Seized with fear, the shedemons, overcome with wrath on hearing Trijata's words said to her.

content: कथयस्व त्वया दृष्टः स्वप्नोऽयं कीदृशो निशि।तासां श्रुत्वा तु वचनं राक्षसीनां मुखाच्युतम्।।5.27.8।।उवच वचनं काले त्रिजटा स्वप्नसंश्रितम्।
explanation: "O Trijata, tell us the kind of dream you dreamt last night", they insisted. Hearing the words from the mouth of the shedemons, Trijata told them all about her dream.

content: गजदन्तमयीं दिव्यां शिबिकामन्तरिक्षगाम्।।5.27.9।।युक्तां हंससहस्रेण स्वयमास्थाय राघवः।शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरो लक्ष्मणेन सहागतः।।5.27.10।।
explanation: "Rama, in white attire, wearing a garland of white flowers, ascending a palanquin made of ivory drawn by a thousand swans and coursing through the sky with Lakshmana arrived.

content: स्वप्ने चाद्य मया दृष्टा सीता शुक्लाम्बरावृता।सागरेण परिक्षिप्तं श्वेतं पर्वतमास्थिता।।5.27.11।।
explanation: "I also saw Sita in my dream wearing white robes and perched on a white mountain surrounded by the ocean.

content: रामेण सङ्गता सीता भास्करेण प्रभा यथा।राघवश्च मया दृष्टश्चतुर्दष्ट्रं महागजम्।।5.27.12।।आरूढ श्शैलसङ्काशं चचार सहलक्ष्मणः।
explanation: "Just as light is united with the Sun, I saw Sita united with Rama. I saw Rama with Lakshmana riding a huge, mountainlike elephant having four tusks.

content: ततस्तौ नरशार्दूलौ दीप्यमानौ स्वतेजसा।।5.27.13।।शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरौ जानकीं पर्युपस्थितौ।
explanation: "Dressed in white garlands and clothes, the two brothers, tigers among men, glowing in their effulgence approached Janaki.

content: ततस्तस्य नगस्याग्रे ह्याकाशस्थस्य दन्तिनः।।5.27.14।।भर्त्रा परिगृहीतस्य जानकी स्कन्धमाश्रिता।
explanation: "Then from the front of the mountain Janaki shifted to the back of the elephant held by her husband waiting in the sky.

content: भर्तुरङ्कात्समुत्पत्य ततः कमललोचना।।5.27.15।।चन्द्रसूर्यौ मया दृष्टा पाणिना परिमार्जती।
explanation: "Then I saw the lotuseyed Sita springing up from the lap of her husband and playfully caressing the Moon and Sun with her palms.

content: ततस्ताभ्यां कुमाराभ्यामास्थित: स गजोत्तमः।।5.27.16।।सीतया च विशालाक्ष्या लङ्काया उपरिस्थितः।
explanation: "Then the excellent elephant was seen halted in the city of Lanka with both princes and the largeeyed Sita mounted on the elephant.

content: पाण्डुरर्षभयुक्तेन रथेनाष्टयुजा स्वयम्।।5.27.17।।इहोपयातः काकुत्स्थ स्सीतया सह भार्यया।
explanation: "Rama accompanied by his wife Sita came on a chariot yoked to eight white oxen.

content: लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया सह वीर्यवान्।।5.27.18।।आरुह्य पुष्पकं दिव्यं विमानं सूर्यसन्निभम्।उत्तरां दिशमालोक्य जगाम पुरुषोत्तमः।।5.27.19।।
explanation: "Valiant Rama, foremost among men, accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and wife Sita went towards the northerly direction in the wonderful Pushpaka chariot that resembled the Sun.

content: एवं स्वप्ने मया दृष्टो रामो विष्णुपराक्रमः।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया सह राघवः।।5.27.20।।
explanation: "In this way I saw in my dream Rama as valiant as Lord Visnu accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and his wife Sita.

content: न हि रामो महातेजाश्शक्यो जेतुं सुरासुरैः।राक्षसैर्वापि चान्यैर्वा स्वर्गः पापजनैरिव।।5.27.21।।
explanation: "Just as a sinner cannot attain heaven Rama cannot be won by gods or demons, even rakshasas and others.

content: रावणश्च मया दृष्टः क्षितौ तैलसमुक्षितः।रक्तवासाः पिबन्मत्तः करवीरकृतस्रजः।।5.27.22।।
explanation: "I saw the body of Ravana lying on the ground smeared with oil, clad in red, wearing a garland of lilies and intoxicated with drinking.

content: विमानात्पुष्पकादद्य रावणः पतितो भुवि।कृष्यमाणः स्त्रिया दृष्टो मुण्डः कृष्णाम्बरः पुनः।।5.27.23।।
explanation: "Tonight I saw (in another dream) Ravana with shaven head, clad in black clothes, fallen down on the ground from the Pushpaka chariot, being dragged by a woman.

content: रथेन खरयुक्तेन रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः।पिपंस्तैलं हसन्नृत्यन् भ्रान्तचित्ताकुलेन्द्रियः।।5.27.24।।
explanation: "He was wearing red garlands and unguents, his body smeared with oil. He was drinking, laughing and dancing, his mind and senses perplexed. He was driving on a chariot yoked to donkeys.

content: गर्दभेन ययौ शीघ्रं दक्षिणां दिशमास्थितः।पुनरेव मया दृष्टो रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः।।5.27.25।।पतितोऽ वाक्चिरा रा भूमौ गर्दभाद्भयमोहितः।
explanation: "I saw the demon king Ravana running behind the chariot driven by donkeys in the southerly direction. He was falling with his head bent down and deluded by the fear of the donkey.

content: सहसोत्थाय संभ्रान्तो भयार्तो मदविह्वलः।।5.27.26।।उन्मत्त इव दिग्वासा दुर्वाक्यं प्रलपन्बहु।दुर्गन्धं दुस्सहं घोरं तिमिरं नरकोपमम्।।5.27.27।।मलपङ्कं प्रविश्याशु मग्नस्तत्र स रावणः।
explanation: "I saw Ravana, getting up quickly, in a bewildered state, terrorstricken, totally confused in intoxication. He had gone almost insane, naked uttering words of abuse. Plunged into a pool of filth and emitting foul smell he disappeared into a helllike dark chamber.

content:
कण्ठे बद्ध्वा दशग्रीवं प्रमदा रक्तवासिनी।।5.27.28।।

काली कर्दमलिप्ताङ्गी दिशं याम्यां प्रकर्षति।
explanation: A dark woman clad in red, body smeared with wet mud was seen dragging the ten-necked Ravana by his neck towards the abode of Yama in the southerly direction.

content: एवं तत्र मया दृष्टः कुम्भकर्णो निशाचरः।।5.27.29।।रावणस्य सुतास्सर्वे दृष्टास्तैलसमुक्षिताः।
explanation: "There I saw the nightranger, Kumbhakarna and also Ravana's sons, their bodies smeared with oil.

content: वराहेण दशग्रीवश्शिंशुमारेण चेन्द्रजित्।।5.27.30।।उष्ट्रेण कुम्भकर्णश्च प्रयाता दक्षिणां दिशम्।
explanation: "The tennecked Ravana was seen (this time) riding on a boar, Indrajit on a crocodile and Kumbhakarna on a camel all set towards the southerly direction.

content: एकस्तत्र मया दृष्टः श्वेतच्छत्रो विभीषणः।।5.27.31।।शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरः शुक्लगन्धानुलेपनः।
explanation: "Only Vibhishana was under a white umbrella clad in white, with white garlands and white sandal paste.

content: शङ्खदुन्धुभिनिर्घोषैर्नृत्तगीतैरलङ्कृतः।।5.27.32।।आरुह्य शैलसङ्काशं मेघस्तनितनिस्स्वनम्।चतुर्दन्तं गजं दिव्यमास्ते तत्र विभीषणः।।5.27.33।।चतुर्भिस्सचिवैः सार्थं वैहायसमुपस्थितः।
explanation: "(Hailed by) the sounds of conches and drums, and of musicians and dancers, Vibhishana was seen ascending on to a decorated fourtust elephant which was huge like a mountain and trumpting like a thundering cloud. He stood there along with four ministers and reached the aerial region.

content:
समाजश्च मया दृष्टो गीतवादित्रनिःस्वनः।।5.27.34।।

पिबतां रक्तमाल्यानां रक्षसां रक्तवाससाम्।
explanation: " A large group of demons was seen collected together, drinking, wearing red garlands and red clothes, singing and playing musical instruments.

content: लङ्का चेयं पुरी रम्या सवाजिरथकुञ्जराः।।5.27.35।।सागरे पतिता दृष्टा भग्नगोपुरतोरणा।
explanation: "I saw this delightful Lanka teeming with horses, chariots and elephants, archways and towers crumbling and falling into the ocean.

content:
लङ्का दृष्टा मया स्वप्ने रावणेनाभिरक्षिता।।5.27.36।।

दग्धा रामस्य दूतेन वानरेण तरस्विना।
explanation: In my dream I saw this city of Lanka protected by Ravana burnt down by a powerful vanara, a messenger of Rama.

content:
पीत्वा तैलं प्रनृत्ताश्च प्रहसन्त्यो महास्वनाः।।5.27.37।।

लङ्कायां भस्मरूक्षायां सर्वा राक्षसस्त्रियः।
explanation: "All the demonesses in the city of Lanka which had turned dry, reduced to ashes, were dancing, laughing and shouting loudly drunk with oil..

content: कुम्भकर्णादयश्चेमे सर्वे राक्षसपुङ्गवाः।।5.27.38।।रक्तं निवसनं गृह्य प्रविष्टा गोमयह्रदे।
explanation: "Kumbhakarna and other demon leaders wearing red clothes entered into a pool of cow dung.

content: अपगच्छत नश्यध्वं सीतामाप्नोति राघवः।।5.27.39।।घातयेत्परमामर्षी युष्मान्सार्थं हि राक्षसैः।
explanation: "(Therefore) go away from here. You will be totally destroyed by Rama who will secure his wife and will kill  all of you along with others in great anger.

content: प्रियां बहुमतां भार्यां वनवासमनुव्रताम्।।5.27.40।।भर्त्सितां तर्जितां वापि नानुमंस्यति राघवः।
explanation: "Rama will not approve of any one abusing or threatening his venerable, beloved wife, who had led a life of exile with him.

content: तदलं क्रूरवाक्यैश्च सान्त्वमेवाभिधीयताम्।।5.27.41।।अभियाचाम वैदेहीमेतद्धि मम रोचते।
explanation: "Give up these cruel taunts. Speak to her in a cordial manner. We will beg Vaidehi's forgiveness. I like this kind of action.

content: यस्यामेवंविधः स्वप्नो दुःखितायां प्रदृश्यते।।5.27.42।।सा दुःखैर्विविधैर्मुक्ता प्रियं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम्।
explanation: "When any demoness in a sorrowful state dreams this kind of dream, she will be relieved of sorrow and will obtain supreme joy.

content: भर्त्सितामपि याचध्वं राक्षस्यः किं विवक्षया।।5.27.43।।राघवाद्धि भयं घोरं राक्षसानामुपस्थितम्।
explanation: "O demonesses beg her (pardon) now even though you had threatened her earlier. Where is the need to hesitate? There is cause for concern for demons from Rama.

content: प्रणिपातप्रसन्ना हि मैथिली जनकात्मजा।।5.27.44।।अलमेषा परित्रातुं राक्षस्यो महतो भयात्।
explanation: "O shedemons, this Janaka's daughter from Mithila who is capable of protecting you against great dangers will be pleased by your submission.

content: अपि चास्या विशालाक्ष्या न किंचिदुपलक्षये।।5.27.45।।विरूपमपि चाङ्गेषु सुसूक्ष्ममपि लक्षणम्।
explanation: "Look at the signs on her body. There is not a little inauspiciousness in the limbs of the largeeyed princess from Mithila.

content:
छायावैगुण्यमात्रं तु शङ्के दुःखमुपस्थितम्।।5.27.46।।

अदुःखार्हामिमां देवीं वैहायसमुपस्थिताम्।
explanation: A great suffering has befallen a lady who does not deserve to suffer. Therefore, a change in her complexion has occured.

content: अर्थसिद्धिं तु वैदेह्याः पश्याम्यहमुपस्थिताम्।।5.27.47।।राक्षसेन्द्रविनाशं च विजयं राघवस्य च।
explanation: "I see the day of fulfilment for Vaidehi has drawn near. I can also foresee the destruction of the demon king and the triumph of Rama.

content: निमित्तभूतमेतत्तु श्रोतुमस्या महत्प्रियम्।।5.27.48।।दृश्यते च स्फुरच्चक्षुः पद्मपत्रमिवायतम्।
explanation: "This dream indeed served as an augery for good news about her. Look, her (left) eye which is large like a lotus petal is throbbing.

content: ईषच्छ हृषितो वास्या दक्षिणाया ह्यदक्षिणः।।5.27.49।।अकस्मादेव वैदेह्या बाहुरेकः प्रकम्पते।
explanation: "The left shoulder of this great Vaidehi has started suddenly throbbing, indicating that she is feeling a bit happy.

content: करेणुहस्तप्रतिम स्सव्यश्चोरुरनुत्तमः।।5.27.50।।वेपमानः सूचयति राघवं पुरतः स्थितम्।
explanation: "Her excellent left thigh, comparable to a female elephant's trunk is trembling, as though indicating that Rama is standing in her presence.

content: पक्षी च शाखानिलयं प्रविष्टःपुनः पुनश्चोत्तमसान्त्ववादी।सुस्वागतां वाचमुदीरयानः पुनःपुनश्चोदयतीव हृष्टः।।5.27.51।।
explanation: "One can see the bird which utters excellent sweet notes indicating happy tidings, entering again and again the foliage of the tree, a delightful bird, as if prompting Sita again and again to rejoice.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita's wailings -- finaly finds some auspicious signs.]सा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य वचो निशम्य तद्रावणस्याप्रियमप्रियार्ता।सीता वितत्रास यथा वनान्ते सिंहाभिपन्ना गजराजकन्या।।5.28.1।।
explanation: After hearing the unpleasant words spoken by the king of demons, which caused restlessness and sorrow to Sita, she was terrified like the young calf of a lordly elephant fallen into the clutches of a lion in the midst of the forest.

content:
सा राक्षसीमध्यगता च भीरु

र्वाग्भिर्भृशं रावणतर्जिता च।

कान्तारमध्ये विजने विसृष्टा

बालेव कन्या विललाप सीता।।5.28.2।।
explanation: Encircled by the demonesses, Sita was repeatedly humiliated by Ravana's cruel words.She wept like a young girl deserted in a desolate forest.

content: सत्यं बतेदं प्रवदन्ति लोके नाकालमृत्युर्भवतीति सन्तः।यत्राहमेवं परिभर्त्स्यमानाजीवामि दीना क्षणमप्यपुण्या।।5.28.3।।
explanation: "Even though I am threatened like this, I am living pitiably because of lack of merit. Indeed I regret my survival due to my bad luck. Elders say that death will not ocurr before its time. It seems to be true.

content: सुखाद्विहीनं बहुदुःखपूर्णमिदं तु नूनं हृदयं स्थिरं मे।विशीर्यते यन्न सहस्रधाऽद्य वज्राहतं शृङ्गमिवाचलस्य।।5.28.4।।
explanation: "Even though I am devoid of joy, and living in deep agony, my heart bursts not into a thousand pieces like the summit of a mountain hit by thunderbolt (lightning).

content: नैवास्ति दोषो मम नूनमत्र वध्याहमस्याप्रियदर्शनस्य।भावं न चास्याहमनुप्रदातु मलं द्विजो मन्त्रमिवाद्विजाय।।5.28.5।।
explanation: "I will not be blamed if I commit suicide now.I stand condemned to death in the hands of this ugly Ravana. I cannot bestow my affection on him or surender to his desire like a brahmin would not like to impart Vedic knowledge to a nonbrahmin. (Better die of my own accord than be killed by a sinful ogre).

content: नूनं ममाङ्गान्यचिरादनार्यः शस्त्रैश्शितैश्छेत्स्यति राक्षसेन्द्रः।तस्मिननागच्छति लोकनाथे गर्भस्थजन्तोरिव शल्यकृन्तः।।5.28.6।।
explanation: "If the lord of the world does not come here before that (time fixed by Ravana) the vile lord of demons will cut me into pieces with weapons just as a barber would cut to pieces the foetus with a sharp knife (in order to save a pregnant woman).

content:
दुःखं बतेदं मम दुःखिताया

मासौ चिरायाधिगमिष्यतो द्वौ।

बद्धस्य वध्यस्य तथा निशान्ते

राजापराधादिव तस्करस्य।।5.28.7।।
explanation: "Alas, two months is too long a time to wait in grief. I am like a thief captured for offending a king and waiting overnight for execution at day-break.

content:
हा राम हा लक्ष्मण हा सुमित्रे

हा राममातः सह मे जनन्या।

एषा विपद्याम्यहमल्पभाग्या

महार्णवे नौरिव मूढवाता।।5.28.8।।
explanation: "Alas! Rama, Alas! Lakshmana, Alas! Sumitra, Alas! my mother, Alas! Rama's mother, I am an ill-starred woman going to perish in this way like a light boat capsized in the midst of an ocean when the whirl-wind blows.

content: तरस्विनौ धारयता मृगस्यसत्त्वेन रूपं मनुजेन्द्रपुत्रौ।नूनं विशस्तौ मम कारणात्तौ सिंहर्षभौ द्वाविव वैद्युतेन।।5.28.9।।
explanation: "Just like two mighty lions are killed by a bolt of lightning, the two princes must have been killed by a creature in the guise of a deer on my account.

content: नूनं स कालो मृगरूपधारीमामल्पभाग्यां लुलुभे तदानीम्।यत्रार्यपुत्रं विससर्ज मूढा रामानुजं लक्ष्मणपूर्वजं च।।5.28.10।।
explanation: "Verily, it is the spirit of the time that assumed the form of deer and tempted this unfortunate soul. It was foolish of me to send away, the sons of a noble king, Lakshmana and his elder brother.

content:
हा राम सत्यव्रत दीर्घबाहो

हा पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमानवक्त्र।

हा जीवलोकस्य हितः प्रियश्च

वध्यां न मां वेत्सि हि राक्षसानाम्।।5.28.11।।
explanation: "Alas, O long-armed one unfailing in vows, whose face shines like the full moon. Alas, beloved of all the worlds! you are dear to every one. How is it that you are not aware that I am going to be killed by the demons?

content: अनन्य दैवत्वमियं क्षमा चभूमौ च शय्या नियमश्च धर्मे।पतिव्रतात्वं विफलं ममेदंकृतं कृतघ्नेष्विव मानुषाणाम्।।5.28.12।।
explanation: "I am devoted to you and to no other god. My hardship in sleeping on the ground, my righteousness, my discipline and chastity have all proved futile like the devotion of an ungrateful person.

content: मोघो हि धर्मश्चरितो मयायंतथैकपत्नीत्वामिदं निरर्थम्।या त्वां न पश्यामि कृशा विवर्णा हीना त्वया सङ्गमने निराशा।।5.28.13।।
explanation: "This righteousnes practised by me is in vain like my devotion to you, as I am unable to see you. I am a separated, emaciated, pale with no hope of reuniting with you.

content: पितुर्निदेशं नियमेन कृत्वा  वनान्निवृत्तश्चरितव्रतश्च।स्त्रीभिस्तु मन्ये विपुलेक्षणाभिस्त्वं रंस्यसे वीतभयः कृतार्थः।।5.28.14।।
explanation: "Having truly fulfilled your pledge given to your father, you will return from the forest to Ayodhya, rid of all fear, as an accomplished person, will and revel in the company of largeeyed damsels, I think.

content: अहं तु राम त्वयि जातकामा चिरं विनाशाय निबद्धभावा।मोघं चरित्वाथ तपो व्रतञ्च त्यक्ष्यामिधिग्जीवितमल्पभाग्याम्।।5.28.15।।
explanation: "O RamaI loved you and concentrated all my love on you for a long time only for my doom. I have observed vows and austerities in vain. I cannot continue it for long. Here I am giving up my life. Fie upon this luckless one (me).

content: सा जीवितं क्षिप्रमहं त्यजेयं विषेण शस्त्रेण शितेन वापि।विषस्य दाता न हि मेऽस्ति कश्चि च्छस्त्रस्य वा वेश्मनि राक्षसस्य।।5.28.16।।
explanation: "I will end my life at once by taking poison or else by a sharp weapon. Alas There is none to give get me poison or a weapon at this demon's residence".

content: इतीव देवी बहुधा विलप्य सर्वात्मना राममनुस्मरन्ती।प्रवेपमाना परिशुष्कवक्त्रा नगोत्तमं पुष्पितमाससाद।।5.28.17।।
explanation: Queen Sita was wailing in many ways, constantly remembering Rama, the soul of all. Shivering, her face pales as she approached the great Simsupa tree in bloom.

content: सा शोकतप्ता बहुधा विचिन्त्यसीताऽथ वेण्युद्ग्रथनं गृहीत्वा।उद्बुध्य वेण्युद्ग्रथनेन शीघ्रमहंगमिष्यामि यमस्य मूलम्।।5.28.18।।
explanation: "Burning in grief, worrying in many ways, Sita took hold of her braid and said", by tying myself with this braid I shall quickly reach the presence of the lord of death".

content: उपस्थिता सा मृदुसर्वगात्री शाखां गृहत्वाऽध नगस्य तस्य।तस्यास्तु रामं प्रविचिन्तयन्त्या रामानुजं स्वं च कुलं शुभाङ्ग्या:।।5.28.19।।शेकानिमित्तानि तथा बहूनिधैर्यार्जितानि प्रवराणि लोके।प्रादुर्निमित्तानि तदा बभूवुः  पुरापि सिद्धान्युपलक्षितानि।।5.28.20।।
