explanation: Sita of delicate limbs approached the Simsupa tree and held on to a branch and stood. While she was thinking of Rama and Lakshmana and their noble family many  omens of proven results appeared on her auspicious charming body. These omens were dispellers of grief, and harbingers of courage in the world as declared from ancient times. (Now) they manifested themselves.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टाविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyeigth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita feels happy seeing auspicious signs.] तथागतां तां व्यथितामनिन्दितां व्यपेतहर्षां परिदीनमानसाम्।शुभां निमित्तानि शुभानि भेजिरे नरं श्रिया जुष्टमिवोपजीविनः।।5.29.1।।
explanation: Like wellwishers flocking round a person on whom fortune is smiling, omens foretelling auspicious happenings in near future appeared to Sita. She was unimpeachable. She was in agony, distressed in mind, bereft of all joy (now) standing under that Simsupa tree.

content: तस्याः शुभं वाममरालपक्ष्म राजीवृतं कृष्णविशालशुक्लम्।प्रास्पन्दतैकं नयनं सुकेश्या मीनाहतं पद्ममिवाभिताम्रम्।।5.29.2।।
explanation: Her left eye with a row of curved eyelashes, the black pupils of the eye in white throbbed in an auspicious manner. The lady  with her long tresses, and throbbing eye appeared like a red lotus gently struck by a fish.

content: भुजश्च चार्वञ्चितपीनवृत्तःपरार्थ्यकालागरुचन्दनार्हः।अनुत्तमेनाध्युषितः प्रियेण चिरेण वामः समवेपताऽशु।।5.29.3।।
explanation: Her stout left arm curved beautifully, fit for excellent agaru and sandal paste once the pillow by her beloved lord for long, throbbed suddenly.

content: गजेन्द्रहस्तप्रतिमश्च पीनस्तयोर्द्वयोः सम्हतयोः सुजातः।प्रस्पन्दमानः पुनरूरुरस्यारामं पुरस्तात् स्थितमाचचक्षे।।5.29.4।।
explanation: Again her roundshaped left thigh resembling an elephant's trunk started throbbing, presaging union with Rama.

content: शुभं पुनर्हेमसमानवर्ण मीषद्रजोध्वस्तमिवामलाक्ष्याः।वास स्स्थिताया श्शिखराग्रदन्त्याः किञ्चित्परिस्रंसत चारुगात्य्राः।।5.29.5।।
explanation: Her eyes were pristine, teeth wellshaped. The goldhued auspicious sari on her charming limbs was now a little soiled on account of dust. It slipped slightly as she stood up. This augured well for her.

content: एतैर्निमित्तैरपरैश्च सुभ्रूः सम्बोधिता प्रागपि साधु सिद्धैः।वातातपक्लान्तमिव प्रणष्टं वर्षेण बीजं प्रतिसंजहर्ष।।5.29.6।।
explanation: Reassured by such omens which augured well as tested by time, Sita, with beautiful eyebrows, and deep foresight experienced great joy, like a seed blighted by the wind and the Sun comes back to joyful life through a pleasing shower. (A foreteller is addressed as siddha in sanskrit dramas)

content: तस्याः पुनर्बिम्बफलाधरोष्ठंस्वक्षिभ्रुकेशान्तमरालपक्ष्म।वक्त्रं बभासे सितशुक्लदंष्ट्रंराहोर्मुखाच्चन्द्र इव प्रमुक्तः।।5.29.7।।
explanation: Her face shining with beautiful red lips like bimba fruit, sparkling teeth, and curved eyelashes with lovely brows extending up to her hair, she appeared like a Moon released from the mouth of Rahu.

content: सा वीतशोका व्यपनीततन्द्रीशान्तज्वरा हर्षविबुद्धसत्त्वा।अशोभतार्या वदनेन शुक्ले शीतांशुना रात्रिरिवोदितेन।।5.29.8।।
explanation: Revered Sita, completely relieved of grief, exhaustion gone, fears allayed, mind illumined with joy, looked charming with her countenance as a night with the Moon fully risen during the bright fortnight.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकोनत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyninth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic compsed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman  decides to  praise Rama within Sita's earshot.]हनुमानपि विक्रान्तः सर्वं शुश्राव तत्त्वतः।सीतायास्त्रिजटायाश्च राक्षसीनां च तर्जनम्।।5.30.1।।
explanation: The valiant hero Hanuman heard everything including the lamentation of Sita and the dream of Trijata and the threats of the demonesses.

content: अवेक्षमाणस्तां देवीं देवतामिव नन्दने।ततो बहुविधां चिन्तां चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.30.2।।
explanation: The sight of Sita who seemed a deity in the Nandana garden of Indra, set a chain of reflections in his mind :

content: यां कपीनां सहस्राणि सुबहून्ययुतानि च।दिक्षु सर्वासु मार्गन्ते सेयमासादिता मया।।5.30.3।।
explanation: "This is Sita whom thousands of vanaras are searching in all directions.

content: चारेण तु सुयुक्तेन शत्रोश्शक्तिमवेक्षता।गूढेन चरता तावदवेक्षितमिदं मया।।5.30.4।।
explanation: "Roaming everywhere incognito to ascertain carefully the strength of the enemy, I have seen everything.

content: राक्षसानां विशेषश्च पुरी चेयमवेक्षिता।राक्षसाधिपतेरस्य प्रभावो रावणस्य च।।5.30.5।।
explanation: "I have seen the ability of the demons and the citadel of Lanka. I have seen the power of Ravana the demon king.

content: युक्तं तस्याप्रमेयस्य सर्वसत्त्वदयावतः।समाश्वासयितुं भार्यां पतिदर्शनकाङ्क्षिणीम्।।5.30.6।।
explanation: "It is the opportune time for me to comfort Sita eagerly waiting to see her husband who is of immeasurable prowess and who is compassionate to all beings.

content: अहमाश्वासयाम्येनां पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम्।अदृष्टदुःखां दुःखार्तां दुःखस्यान्तमगच्छतीम्।।5.30.7।।
explanation: "The moonfaced Sita had never experienced sorrow before. She sees no end to her sorrow and suffering. I will console her.

content: यद्यप्यहमिमां देवीं शोकोपहतचेतनाम्।अनाश्वास्य गमिष्यामि दोषवद्गमनं भवेत्।।5.30.8।।
explanation: "If I should return to Kishkindha without reassuring Sita, whose understanding has been clouded in grief I would be blamed.

content: गते हि मयि तत्रेयं राजपुत्री यशस्विनी।परित्राणमविन्दन्ती जानकी जीवितं त्यजेत्।।5.30.9।।
explanation: "If I so back, this illustrious princess, Janaki will give up her life, finding no means of deliverance (from this tragic situation).

content: मया च स महाबाहुः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननः।समाश्यासयितुं न्याय्यस्सीतादर्शनलालसः।।5.30.10।।
explanation: "I should provide some comfort to the strongarmed Rama with a face like the fullmoon yearning to see Sita.

content: निशाचरीणां प्रत्यक्षमनर्हं चाभिभाषितम्।कथन्नु खलु कर्तव्यमिदं कृच्छ्रगतो ह्यहम्।।5.30.11।।
explanation: "I cannot talk to her in the presence of these nightroamers. How can I  discharge my duty in this predicament?

content: अनेन रात्रिशेषेण यदि नाश्वास्यते मया।सर्वथा नास्ति सन्देहः परित्यक्ष्यति जीवितम्।।5.30.12।।
explanation: "If I do not comfort her before the remaining part of the night ends, she will give up her life. There is no doubt about it.

content: रामश्च यदि पृच्छेन्मां किं मां सीताब्रवीद्वचः।किमहं तं प्रति ब्रूयामसंभाष्य सुमध्यमाम्।।5.30.13।।
explanation: "If Rama enquires about the message of Sita, this lady of beautiful waist, what can I speak without meeting and talking to her?

content: सीतासन्देशरहितं मामितस्त्वरयाऽगतम्।निर्दहेदपि काकुत्स्य क्रुद्धस्तीव्रेण चक्षुषा।।5.30.14।।
explanation: "If I leave this place without any message from Sita, Rama will burn me with his eyes full of great anger.

content: यदि चोद्योजयिष्यामि भर्तारं रामकारणात्।व्यर्थमागमनं तस्य ससैन्यस्य भविष्यति।।5.30.15।।
explanation: "If I get the lord of vanaras and his army for the cause of Rama (without talking to Sita), their arrival will be useless (if Sita would have given up her life by then).

content: अन्तरं त्वहमासाद्य राक्षसीनामिह स्थितः।शनैराश्वासयिष्यामि सन्तापबहुळामिमाम्।।5.30.16।।
explanation: "I shall wait and speak to her slowly and console this deeply distressed lady when I get a chance to speak to her (when  these ogresses are asleep).

content:
अहं त्वतितनुश्चैव वानरश्च विशेषतः।

वाचं चोदाहरिष्यामि मानुषीमिह संस्कृताम्।।5.30.17।।
explanation: I am indeed of small size and that too a monkey. Nevertheless I shall speak in Sanskrit, a language of the common people. (as the she-demons cannot understand that language).

content: यदि वाचं प्रदास्यामि द्विजातिरिव संस्कृताम्।रावणं मन्यमाना मां सीता भीता भविष्यति।।5.30.18।।वानरस्य विशेषेण कथं स्यादभिभाषणम्।
explanation: "If I speak like a brahmin in sanskrit language she would be frightened thinking that I am Ravana and how would a vanara speak?

content: अवश्यमेव वक्तव्यं मानुषं वाक्यमर्थवत्।।5.30.19।।मया सान्त्वयितुं शक्या नान्यथेयमनिन्दिता।
explanation: "I will certainly speak to her meaningfully in the language of the people. Otherwise it is not possible to pacify the sinless Sita.

content: सेयमालोक्य मे रूपं जानकी भाषितं तथा।।5.30.20।।रक्षोभिस्त्रासिता पूर्वं भूयस्त्रासं गमिष्यति।
explanation: "Since Janaki has already been frightened by the demons, she will be even more terrified seeing me in this form and hearing me speaking this way.

content: ततो जातपरित्रासा शब्दं कुर्यान्मनस्विनी।।5.30.21।।जानमाना  विशालाक्षी रावणं कामरूपिणम्।
explanation: By seeing me in this form, sensitive largeeyed Sita will scream loudly thinking that I am Ravana who can assume any form at his free will.

content: सीतया च कृते शब्दे सहसा राक्षसीगणा:।नानाप्रहरणो घोर: समेयादन्तकोपम:।।5.30.22।।
explanation: "If Sita screams, the  horde of terrific ogresses will at once gather, armed with dreadful weapons like Yama, the god of death.

content: ततो मां सम्परिक्षिप्य सर्वतो विकृताननाः।।5.30.23।।वधे च ग्रहणे चैव कुर्युर्यत्नं यथाबलम्।
explanation: "Then all these hideous ogresses will swarm round me and make efforts to capture me with all their strength and kill me.

content: गृह्य शाखाः प्रशाखाश्च स्कन्धांश्चोत्तमशाखिनाम्।।5.30.24।।दृष्ट्वा विपरिधावन्तं भवेयुर्भयशङ्किताः।
explanation: "Seeing me holding big and small branches of large trees and leaping from one place to the other, the ogresses will get scared.

content: मम रूपं च सम्प्रेक्ष्य वने विचरतो महत्।।5.30.25।।राक्षस्यो भयवित्रस्ता भवेयुर्विकृताननाः।
explanation: "These ogresses with their hideous faces will be frightened on looking at my huge form moving in this grove.

content: ततः कुर्युस्समाह्वानं राक्षस्यो रक्षसामपि।।5.30.26।।राक्षसेन्द्रनियुक्तानां राक्षसेन्द्रनिवेशने।
explanation: "Thereafter the ogresses will draw the attention of demon guards engaged by the king of demons at his residence towards me.

content: ते शूलशक्तिनिस्त्रिंशविविधायुधपाणयः।।5.30.27।।आपतेयुर्विमर्देऽस्मिन्वेगेनोद्वेगकारणात्।
explanation: "Those ogresses due to fear will come speedily, armed with spears, tridents, swords and different kinds of weapons for a combat.

content: समृद्धस्तैस्तु परितो विधमन् रक्षसां बलम्।।5.30.28।।शक्नुयां न तु संप्राप्तुं परं पारं महोदधेः।
explanation: "With them around me, I may not be able to  reach the other end of the ocean (my strength spent in the combat.)

content: मां वा गृह्णीयुराप्लुत्य बहवश्शीघ्रकारिणः।।5.30.29।।स्यादियं चागृहीतार्था मम च ग्रहणं भवेत्।
explanation: "The ogres who are in large numbers, here are very prompt to act. They will jump into the sky and bind me. Sita will not receive the message and I will be taken into custody by the demons.

content: हिंसाभिरुचयो हिंस्युरिमां वा जनकात्मजाम्।।5.30.30।।विपन्नं स्यात्ततः कार्यं रामसुग्रीवयोरिदम्।
explanation: "These demons who are keen on indulging in violence will harm Janaka's daughter. Then the mission of Rama and Sugriva will also fail.

content: उद्देशे नष्टमार्गेऽस्मिन् राक्षसैः परिवारिते।।5.30.31।।सागरेण परिक्षिप्ते गुप्ते वसति जानकी।
explanation: "Janaki is staying in this untraceable location surrounded by demons. And this location is a secret place surrounded by the ocean .

content: विशस्ते वा गृहीते वा रक्षोभिर्मयि संयुगे।।5.30.32।।नान्यं पश्यामि रामस्य सहायं कार्यसाधने।
explanation: "If I am killed in the combat or captured by the demons, I do not see another person who can help in accomplishing this task.

content: विमृशंश्च न पश्यामि यो हते मयि वानरः।।5.30.33।।शतयोजनविस्तीर्णं लङ्घयेत महोदधिम्।
explanation: "When I am killed here, I cannot see any other vanara who can leap over a hundred yojanas of the ocean (to reach this place).

content: कामं हन्तुं समर्थोऽस्मि सहस्राण्यपि रक्षसाम्।।5.30.34।।न तु शक्ष्यामि सम्प्राप्तुं परं पारं महोदधेः।
explanation: "I may be capable of killing even thousands of demons but thereafter (thoroughly exhausted) reach the other side of the ocean.

content: असत्यानि च युद्धानि संशयो मे न रोचते।।5.30.35।।कश्च निस्संशयं कार्यं कुर्यात्प्राज्ञः ससंशयम्।
explanation: "Battles, no doubt, are unpredictable. Which wise man with a sound intellect will take up a doubtful work unhesitatingly?

content: प्राणत्यागश्च वैदेह्या भवेदनभिभाषणे।।5.30.36।।एष दोषो महान्हि स्यान्मम सीताभिभाषणे।
explanation: "If I talk to Vaidehi it will be a great mistake on my part.If I do not speak to Vaidehi she may give up her life.

content: भूताश्चार्था विनश्यन्ति देशकालविरोधिताः।।5.30.37।।विक्लबं दूतमासाद्य तमः सूर्योदये यथा।
explanation: "Even well planned diplomatic missions fail like darkness dispelled at Sunrise if the messenger is confused and if the place and time are not propitious for them.

content: अर्थानर्थान्तरे बुद्धिनिश्चितापि न शोभते।।5.30.38।।घातयन्ति हि कार्याणि दूताः पण्डितमानिनः।
explanation: "Swinging from a course of action or an action leading to calamity is not proper. Messengers who assume that they are scholars (blinded by ego) destroy their mission.

content: न विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं वैक्लब्यं न कथं भवेत्।।5.30.39।।लङ्घनं च समुद्रस्य कथं नु न वृथा भवेत्।
explanation: "How can the mission succeed? How can failure of mission be avoided? How can the crossing of the great ocean be not wasted?"

content: कथं नु खलु वाक्यं मे शृणुयान्नोद्विजेत वा।इति सञ्चिन्त्य हनुमांश्चकार मतिमान्मतिम्।।5.30.40।।
explanation: Wise Hanuman came to a decision after reflecting in his mind about how not to create fear in Sita (while communicating with her.)

content: राममक्लिष्टकर्माणं सुबन्धुमनुकीर्तयन्।।5.30.41।।नैनामुद्वेजयिष्यामि तद्बन्धुगतमानसाम्।
explanation: "By praising Rama who is very dear, who is judicious in action and in whom her mind is absorbed, I will not create fear.

content: इक्ष्वाकूणां वरिष्ठस्य रामस्य विदितात्मनः।।5.30.42।।शुभानि धर्मयुक्तानि वचनानि समर्पयन्।श्रावयिष्यामि सर्वाणि मधुरां प्रब्रुवन् गिरम्।।5.30.43।।श्रद्धास्यति यथाहीयं तथा सर्वं समादधे।
explanation: "I shall present in auspicious words the esteemed Rama of Ikshvaku family who is a knower of self and make her listen to everything in such a sweet manner that she will trust me.

content: इति स बहुविधं महानुभावोजगतिपतेः प्रमदामवेक्षमाणः।मधुरमवितथं जगाद वाक्यं द्रुमविटपान्तरमास्थितो हनूमान्।।5.30.44।।
explanation: Highsouled Hanuman seated on the branch of the tree without being seen began to speak faithfully in praise of the lord of the universe in many ways while looking at her. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman sings the story of glory of Rama within Sita's hearing.]एवं बहुविधां चिन्तां चिन्तयित्वा महाकपिः।संश्रवे मधुरं वाक्यं वैदेह्या व्याजहार ह।।5.31.1।।
explanation: After deliberating in several ways the great Hanuman spoke these sweet words to Vaidehi:

content: राजा दशरथो नाम रथकुञ्जरवाजिमान्।पुण्यशीलो महाकीर्तिरिक्ष्वाकूणां महायशाः।।5.31.2।।
explanation: "There was an illustrious king called Dasaratha in Ikshvaku race, a master of chariots, elephants and horses. He was highly meritorious and renowned.

content: राजर्षीणां गुणश्रेष्ठस्तपसा चर्षिभि स्समः।चक्रवर्तिकुले जातः पुरन्दरसमो बले।।5.31.3।।
explanation: "He was the most virtuous among royal sages, equal to sages in austerity, born in the race of emperors and equal to Indra in might.

content: अहिंसारतिरक्षुद्रो घृणी सत्यपराक्रमः।मुख्यश्चेक्ष्वाकुवंशस्य लक्ष्मीवान् लक्ष्मिवर्धनः।।5.31.4।।
explanation: "He was committed to nonviolence, magnanimous, compassionate and one whose strength was truth. He was not only a prosperous king of Ikshvaku family but also a promoter of prosperity of others too.

content: पार्थिवव्यञ्जनैर्युक्तः पृथुश्रीः पार्थिवर्षभः।पृथिव्यां चतुरन्तायां विश्रुतस्सुखदस्सुखी।।5.31.5।।
explanation: "Endowed with signs of kingship and vast wealth, he was a bull among rulers of the vast earth, surrounded by the sea. A happy king himself, he was wellknown as a provider of happiness.

content: तस्य पुत्रः प्रियो ज्येष्ठस्ताराधिपनिभाननः।रामो नाम विशेषज्ञः श्रेष्ठ स्सर्वधनुष्मताम्।।5.31.6।।
explanation: "His beloved eldest son Rama, whose countenance is like the full moon, is a scholar of all branches of knowledge and is foremost among the bowmen on earth.

content: रक्षिता स्वस्य धर्मस्य स्वजनस्य च रक्षिता।रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य धर्मस्य च परन्तपः।।5.31.7।।
explanation: "The scourage of enemies, he is a protector of righteousness and of his kins and all living creatures. He is an embodiment of righteousness.

content: तस्य सत्याभिसन्धस्य वृद्धस्य वचनात्पितुः।सभार्यस्सह च भ्रात्रा वीरः प्रव्राजितो वनम्।।5.31.8।।
explanation: "Honouring the word of his aged father who was ever steadfast in truth, Rama left for the forest along with his wife and brother.

content: तेन तत्र महारण्ये मृगयां परिधावता।राक्षसा निहताश्शूरा बहवः कामरूपिणः।।5.31.9।।
explanation: "In the deep forest he went round hunting animals and killing the demon warriors who assumed any form at their free will.

content: जनस्थानवधं श्रुत्वा हतौ च खरदूषणौ।ततस्त्वमर्षापहृता जानकी रावणेन तु।।5.31.10।।वञ्चयित्वा वने रामं मृगरूपेण मायया।
explanation: "Ravana having heard about the killing of all demons at Janasthana including Khara and Dooshana in the forest, deceived Rama in the guise of a deer and abducted Janaki in anger.

content: स मार्गमाणस्तां देवीं रामस्सीतामनिन्दिताम्।।5.31.11।।आससाद वने मित्रं सुग्रीवं नाम वानरम्।
explanation: "While looking for the goddesslike lady, the sinless Sita in the forest, Rama met a monkey called Sugriva and made friendship with him

content: तत स्स वालिनं हत्वा रामः परपुरञ्जयः।।5.31.12।।प्रायच्छत्कपिराज्यं तत्सुग्रीवाय महाबलः।
explanation: "Rama, a powerful king, who can win enemy forts killed Vali and offered the monkey kingdom to Sugriva.

content: सुग्रीवेणापि सन्दिष्टा हरयः कामरूपिणः।।5.31.13।।दिक्षु सर्वासु तां देवीं विचिन्वन्ति सहस्रशः।
explanation: "Having received Sugriva's orders thousands of monkeys who can assume any form went searching for that divine queen in all directions.

content: अहं सम्पातिवचनाच्छतयोजनमायतम्।।5.31.14।।अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्याः सागरं वेगवान्प्लुतः।
explanation: "On hearing the words of Sampati I leaped the wide ocean swiftly crossing a hundred yojanas in quest of the largeeyed Sita.

content: यथारूपां यथावर्णां यथालक्ष्मीवतीं च निश्चिताम्।।5.31.15।।अश्रौषं राघवस्याहं सेयमासादिता मया।
explanation: "Surely I have seen here a lady of similar body, of similar complexion, of similar glow and beauty as described by Rama".

content: विररामैवमुक्त्वासौ वाचं वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.31.16।।जानकी चापि तच्छ्रुत्वा परं विस्मयमागता।
explanation: Having spoken thus, the great vanara stopped speaking after that. Janaki was wonderstruck by the words of the vanara.

content: ततस्सा वक्रकेशान्ता सुकेशी केशसंवृतम्।।5.31.17।।उन्नम्य वदनं भीरुश्शिंशुपावृक्षमैक्षत।
explanation: Then Sita looked up at the Simsupa tree timidly, her face covered with beautiful curly hair.

content: निशम्य सीता वचनं कपेश्च दिशश्च सर्वाः प्रदिशश्च वीक्ष्य।स्वयं प्रहर्षं परमं जगाम सर्वात्मना राममनुस्मरन्ती ।।5.31.18।।
explanation: On hearing Hanuman's words Sita looked at all directions and quarters while quietly contemplating on Rama, the self of all and experienced supreme joy.

content: सा तिर्यगूर्ध्वं च तथाप्यधस्तान्निरीक्षमाणा तमचिन्त्यबुद्धिम्।ददर्श पिङ्गाधिपतेरमात्यं वातात्मजं सूर्यमिवोदयस्थम्।।5.31.19।।
explanation: She looked obliquely, up, and down and saw Hanuman of unimaginable intelligence, the minister of the monkey lord, son of the Windgod, who looked like the rising Sun.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita's conjucture]ततश्शाखान्तरे लीनं दृष्ट्वा चलितमानसा।वेष्टितार्जुनवस्त्रं तं विद्युत्सङ्घातपिङ्गलम्।।5.32.1।।
explanation: Sita got perplexed on seeing him (Hanuman), who was tawny in complexion and looked like a cluster of lightnings, clad in white  and hidden in between the branches.

content: सा ददर्श कपिं तत्र प्रश्रितं प्रियवादिनम्।फुल्लाशोकोत्कराभासं तप्तचामीकरेक्षणम्।।5.32.2।।
explanation: There (on the tree) she noticed a monkey like a cluster of fully blossomed Ashoka flower, shining bright, whose eyes were glowing like pure molten gold, speaking softly and pleasingly.

content: मैथिली चिन्तयामास विस्मयं परमं गता।अहो भीममिदं रूपं वानरस्य दुरासदम्।।5.32.3।।दुर्निरीक्षमिति ज्ञात्वा पुनरेव मुमोह सा।
explanation: Astonisted Mythili began thinking. 'Oh this vanara's appearance is frightening. He is terrible to look at. He is inaccessible'. Thinking over this again and again, she fainted.

content: विललाप भृशं सीता करुणं भयमोहिता।।5.32.4।।रामरामेति दुःखार्ता लक्ष्मणेति च भामिनी।रुरोद बहुधा सीता मन्दं मन्दस्वरा सती।।5.32.5।।
explanation: Overcome with sorrow and fear, noble Sita sobbed pitiably muttering repeatedly. 'O Rama, O Rama, O Lakshmana'.

content: सा तं दृष्ट्वा हरिश्रेष्ठं विनीतवदुपस्थितम्।मैथिली चिन्तयामास स्वप्नोऽयमिति भामिनी।।5.32.6।।
explanation: Noble Sita, seeing the best of vanaras who stood near humbly, began reflecting 'Is this a dream'?

content: सा वीक्षमाणा पृथुभुग्नवक्त्रं शाखामृगेन्द्रस्य यथोक्तकारम्।ददर्श पिङ्गाधिपते रमात्यं वातात्मजं बुद्धिमतां वरिष्ठम्।।5.32.7।।
explanation: Looking here and there, she saw a monkey with a large, curved face, an obedient servant and a minister of the monkeylord, the foremost among the intelligentia and the son of the Windgod.

content: सा तं समीक्ष्यैव भृशं विसंज्ञा गतासुकल्पेन बभूव सीता।चिरेण संज्ञां प्रतिलभ्य भूयो विचिन्तयामास विशालनेत्रा।।5.32.8।।
explanation: The largeeyed Sita lost her senses looking at him. She got back her senses after a long time and started thinking again:

content: स्वप्ने मयाऽयं विकृतोऽद्य दृष्टश्शाखामृगश्शास्त्रगणैर्निषिद्धः।स्वस्त्यस्तु रामाय स लक्ष्मणाय तथा पितुर्मे जनकस्य राज्ञः।।5.32.9।।
explanation: 'Today I saw an ugly monkey in my dream. Its sight in a dream is inauspicious according to sastras. Let it be auspicious for Lakshmana and Rama for the sake of my father Janaka.

content: स्वप्नोऽपि नायं नहि मेऽस्ति निद्रा शोकेन दुःखेन च पीडितायाः।सुखं हि मे नास्ति यतोऽस्मि हीना तेनेन्दुपूर्णप्रतिमाननेन।।5.32.10।।
explanation: "But no, it was not a dream for tormented by grief and sorrow I cannot have a dream. When separated from the moonfaced Rama I have no sleep or pleasure, how can I have dream?

content: रामेति रामेति सदैव बुद्ध्या विचिन्त्य वाचा ब्रुवती तमेव।तस्यानुरूपां च कथां तदर्थमेवं प्रपश्यामि तथा शृणोमि।।5.32.11।।
explanation: "I am always meditating upon Rama and thinking of him alone. I am talking about things related to him. Because of that I see him and hear him.

content: अहं हि तस्याद्य मनोभवेन सम्पीडिता तद्गतसर्वभावा।विचिन्तयन्ती सततं तमेव तथैव पश्यामि तथा शृणोमि।।5.32.12।।
explanation: "I am tormented by intense love for Rama, with all my thoughts immersed in him. Since I am constantly thinking of him I see him and hear words about him. (She thinks it is all hallucination.)

content: मनोरथस्स्यादिति चिन्तयामि तथापि बुद्ध्या च वितर्कयामि।किं कारणं तस्य हि नास्ति रूपं सुव्यक्तरूपश्च वदत्ययं माम्।।5.32.13।।
explanation: "I feel it is only the desire in my mind. Desire has no form. But the one who is addressing me has a form. I cannot understand this.

content: नमोऽस्तु वाचस्पतये सवज्रिणे स्वयंभुवे चैव हुताशनाय च।अनेन चोक्तं यदिदं ममाग्रतो वनौकसा तच्छ तथास्तु नान्यथा।।5.32.14।।
explanation: "My salutations to Indra, Brihaspati, Brahma the creator and also to the firegod. Let all those words spoken by the vanara here in front of me be true and not other than that."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sita reveals her story to Hanuman.]सोऽवतीर्य द्रुमात्तस्माद्विद्रुमप्रतिमाननः।विनीतवेषः कृपणः प्रणिपत्योपसृत्य च।।5.33.1।।तामब्रवीन्महातेजा हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः।शिरस्यञ्जलिमाधाय सीतां मधुरया गिरा।।5.33.2।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod whose face shone like coral, dressed in a sober manner climbed down the tree, went close to Sita, offered salutations with his palms on his head and spoke in sweet words:

content: का नु पद्मपलाशाक्षि क्लिष्टकौशेयवासिनि।द्रुमस्य शाखामालम्ब्य तिष्ठसि त्वमनिन्दिते।।5.33.3।।
explanation: "O blameless lady with eyes like lotus petals, in crumpled silk, holding a branch, and standing, who are you?

content: किमर्थम् तव नेत्राभ्यां वारि स्रवति शोकजम्।पुण्डरीकपलाशाभ्यां विप्रकीर्णमिवोदकम्।।5.33.4।।
explanation: "Why are tears of grief flowing from your eyes like water trickling down a pair of petals of white lotuses?

content: सुराणामसुराणां वा नागगन्धर्वरक्षसाम्।यक्षाणां किन्नराणां वा का त्वं भवसि शोभने।।5.33.5।।
explanation: "O noble lady, are you a goddess or a demoness, a naga, a gandharva, a rakshasa, a yaksha or a kinnera?

content: का त्वं भवसि रुद्राणां मरुतां वा वरानने।वसूनां हि वरारोहे देवता प्रतिभासि मे।।5.33.6।।
explanation: "O beautiful lady Do you belong to the race of Rudras, or Marutas, or Vasus?. O noble lady, you appear a goddess to me.

content:
कि नु चन्द्रमसा हीना पतिता विबुधालयात्।

रोहिणी ज्योतिषां श्रेष्ठा श्रेष्ठसर्वगुणान्विता।।5.33.7।।
explanation: "are you Rohini, embellished with best virtues among the constellations? Have you come down from the abode of the luminaries separated from the Moon, her lord?

content: का त्वं भवसि कल्याणि त्वमनिन्दितलोचने।कोपाद्वा यदि वा मोहाद्भर्तारमसितेक्षणे।।5.33.8।।वसिष्ठं कोपयित्वा त्वं नासि कल्याण्यरुन्धती।
explanation: "O lady of lovely black eyes who are you? Have you by any chance offended your husband out of anger or out of delusion? Are you the auspicious Arundhati dislodged for making your lord Vasistha angry?

content: को नु पुत्रः पिता भ्राता भर्ता वा ते सुमध्यमे।।5.33.9।।अस्माल्लोकादमुं लोकं गतं त्वमनुशोचसि।
explanation: "O woman of beautiful waist from which world have you come here? For whom are you worrying? Who is your son, father, brother or husband? Are you worrying about some one dead?.

content: रोदनादतिनिश्श्वासाद्भूमिसंस्पर्शनादपि।।5.33.10।।न त्वां देवीमहं मन्ये राज्ञ स्सर्वज्ञावधारणात्।
explanation: "From your weeping, your sighing and your touching the earth (gods do not touch the earth) and your signs of sovereignty, I do not think you are a goddess (meaning otherwise she posessed divine grace).

content: व्यञ्जनानि च ते यानि लक्षणानि च लक्षये।।5.33.11।।महिषी भूमिपालस्य राजकन्या च मे मता।
explanation: "On the basis of your royal signs and other qualities I infer that you are the daughter of a king or his consort.

content: रावणेन जनस्थानाद्बलादपदहृता यदि।।5.33.12।।सीता त्वमसि भद्रं ते तन्ममाचक्ष्व पृच्छतः।
explanation: "If you are Sita, who was forcefully borne away by Ravana from Janasthana you may kindly reveal to me freely. May god bless you.

content: यथा हि तव वै दैन्यं रूपं चाप्यतिमानुषम्।।5.33.13।।तपसा चान्वितो वेषस्त्वं राममहिषी ध्रुवम्।
explanation: "Indeed your plight, the superhuman beauty and your robes marked with asceticism, surely tell me that you are Rama's queen."

content: सा तस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा रामकीर्तनहर्षिता।।5.33.14।।उवाच वाक्यं वैदेही हनुमन्तं द्रुमाश्रितम्।
explanation: Happy to have heard words of praise of Rama, Vaidehi spoke this to Hanuman, who got up the tree:

content: पृथिव्यां राजसिंहानां मुख्यस्य विदितात्मनः।।5.33.15।।स्नुषा दशरथस्याहं शत्रुसैन्यप्रतापिनः।
explanation: "I am daughterinlaw of king Dasaratha, knower of the self, the foremost among kings on earth and a slayer of enemy army.

content: दुहिता जनकस्याहं वैदेहस्य महात्मनः।।5.33.16।।सीतेति नाम नाम्नाऽहं भार्या रामस्य धीमतः।
explanation: "I am daughter of the great soul, Janaka, king of Videha, known as Sita. I am the wife of that sagacious Rama.

content: समा द्वादश तत्राहं राघवस्य निवेशने।।5.33.17।।भुञ्जाना मानुषान्भोगान्सर्वकामसमृद्धिनी।
explanation: "I enjoyed worldly pleasures in abundance for twelve years at Rama's abode.

content: तत्र त्रयोदशे वर्षे राज्येनेक्ष्वाकुनन्दनम्।।5.33.18।।अभिषेचयितुं राजा सोपाध्यायः प्रचक्रमे।
explanation: "Then in the thirteenth year king Dasaratha along with the royal preceptor arranged to  coronate Rama, delight of the Ikshvaku family, in the kingdom.

content: तस्मिन्सम्भ्रियमाणे तु राघवस्याभिषेचने।।5.33.19।।कैकयी नाम भर्तारं देवी वचनमब्रवीत्।
explanation: "While preparations for the coronation were on, queen Kaikeyi said to her husband:

content: न पिबेयं न खादेयं प्रत्यहं मम भोजनम्।।5.33.20।।एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते।
explanation: 'I shall not drink or eat food, if Rama is coronated. I shall end my life this moment.

content: यत्तदुक्तं त्वया वाक्यं प्रीत्या नृपतिसत्तम।।5.33.21।।तच्छेन्न वितथं कार्यं वनं गच्छतु राघवः।
explanation: 'O Dasaratha, the foremost among kings if the promise lovingly made by you earlier is not going to be false, Rama should go to the forest'.

content: स राजा सत्यवाग्देव्या वरदानमनुस्मरन्।।5.33.22।।मुमोह वचनं श्रुत्वा कैकेय्याः क्रूरमप्रियम्।
explanation: "Remembering the boons the ever truthful king had granted to Kaikeyi, he fainted after hearing her cruel and harsh words.

content: ततस्तु स्थविरो राजा सत्ये धर्मे व्यवस्थितः।।5.33.23।।ज्येष्ठं यशस्विनं पुत्रं रुदन्राज्यमयाचत।
explanation: "The aged king who held on to truthfulness and righteousness begged his famed eldest son Rama to return the kingdom.

content: स पितुर्वचनं श्रीमानभिषेकात्परं प्रियम्।।5.33.24।।मनसा पूर्वमासाद्य वाचा प्रतिगृहीतवान्।
explanation: "The illustrious Rama who valued his father's word more than sovereignty, bowed to the command of the father.

content: दद्यान्न प्रतिगृह्णीयान्न ब्रूयात्किञ्चिदप्रियम्।।5.33.25।।अपि जीवितहेतोर्वा रामस्सत्यपराक्रमः।
explanation: "Rama, whose strength was his truthfulness, gave whatever others sought but would not accept anything in return. He would not speak a harsh word.

content: स विहायोत्तरीयाणि महार्हाणि महायशाः।।5.33.26।।विसृज्य मनसा राज्यं जनन्यै मां समादिशत्।
explanation: "Having given up the kingdom  voluntarily, Rama, a highly renowned king cast off his luxurious upper garments and asked me to take care of his mother.

content: साहं तस्याग्रतस्तूर्णं प्रस्थिता वनचारिणी।।5.33.27।।न हि मे तेन हीनाया वासस्स्वर्गेऽपि रोचते।
explanation: "I, however resolved to live in the forest, marched ahead of him quickly as I did not prefer even heaven without him.

content: प्रागेव तु महाभागस्सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः।।5.33.28।।पूर्वजस्यानुयात्रार्थे द्रुमचीरैरलङ्कृतः।
ते वयं भर्तुरादेशं बहुमान्य दृढव्रताः।।5.33.29।।प्रविष्टास्स्म पुरादृष्टं वनं गम्भीरदर्शनम्।
explanation: "Respecting the king's order and determined firmly, we entered the impenetrable forest.

content: वसतो दण्डकारण्ये तस्याहममितौजसः।।5.33.30।।रक्षसाऽपहृता भार्या रावणेन दुरात्मना।
explanation: "While the most valiant Rama was living in the Dandaka forest, I, his wife was borne away by the evilminded Ravana.

content: द्वौ मासौ तेन मे कालो जीवितानुग्रहः कृतः।।5.33.31।।ऊर्ध्वं द्वाभ्यां तु मासाभ्यां ततस्तक्ष्यामि जीवितम्।
explanation: "He has allowed me two months time to live. After two months I will have to give up my life."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman tells the story of Rama to Sita.]तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान्हरिपुङ्गवः।दुःखाद्दुःखाभिभूताया स्सान्त्वमुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.34.1।।
explanation: Hearing the words of Sita who was overwhelmed with grief, the monkey leader Hanuman felt sad and thus spoke comforting her:

content: अहं रामस्य सन्देशाद्देवि दूतस्तवागतः।वैदेहि कुशली रामस्त्वां च कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.2।।
explanation: "By the command of Rama I am here as a messenger. He is keeping well. He is well and wishes you well.

content: यो ब्रह्ममस्त्रं वेदांश्च वेद वेदविदांवरः।स त्वां दाशरथी रामो देवि कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.3।।
explanation: "O godlike lady Rama, son of Dasaratha, master of the Vedas, wielder of Brahmastra wishes you well.

content: लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजा भर्तुस्तेऽनुचरः प्रियः।कृतवान्शोकसन्तप्तश्शिरसा तेऽभिवादनम्।।5.34.4।।
explanation: "The mighty Lakshmana too, a dear brother and follower of your husband is immersed in grief, and sends salutations to you."

content: सा तयोः कुशलं देवी निशम्य नरसिंहयोः।प्रीतिसंहृष्टसर्वाङ्गी हनुमन्तमथाब्रवीत्।।5.34.5।।
explanation: On hearing the wellbeing of Rama and Lakshman, lions among men, Sita experienced thrill all over her body. She then  spoke to Hanuman:

content: कल्याणी बत गाथेयं लौकिकी प्रतिभाति मा।एति जीवन्तमानन्दो नरं वर्षशतादपि।।5.34.6।।
explanation: "The adage that 'joy comes to a living being even though it be at the end of  a hundred years' is popular. It appears true in my case".

content: तया समागते तस्मिन्प्रीतिरुत्पादिताऽद्भुता।परस्परेण चालापं विश्वस्तौ तौ प्रचक्रतुः।।5.34.7।।
explanation: Hanuman thus created a sense of wonderful joy in her as they came together. Both of them started to converse restoring confidence in each other.

content: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान्हरियूथपः।सीतायाश्शोकदीनायास्समीपमुपचक्रमे।।5.34.8।।
explanation: Hearing the reply of Sita, who was crying piteously, stricken with grief, the monkey leader, Hanuman moved close to her.

content: यथा यथा समीपं स हनुमानुपसर्पति।तथा तथा रावणं सा तं सीता परिशङ्कते।।5.34.9।।
explanation: As Hanuman started slowly drawing close, Sita suspected he might be Ravana.

content: अहो धिग्दुष्कृतमिदं कथितं हि यदस्य मे।रूपान्तरमुपागम्य स एवायं हि रावणः।।5.34.10।।
explanation: "Ohshame on me. I have told him my story which should not have been said. This is verily Ravana come in a disguise".

content: तामशोकस्य शाखां सा विमुक्त्वा शोककर्शिता।तस्यामेवानवद्याङ्गी धरण्यां समुपाविशत्।।5.34.11।।
explanation: So saying Sita of flawless limbs, emaciated with grief, left the branch of Ashoka tree held by her and squatted on the ground.

content: हनुमानपि दुःखार्तां तां दृष्ट्वा भयमोहिताम्।अवन्दत महाबाहुस्ततस्तां जनकात्मजाम्।।5.34.12।।सा चैनं भयवित्रस्ता भूयो नैवाभ्युदैक्षत।
explanation: The longarmed Hanuman saw Sita, who was stricken with grief and deluded with fear. He prostrated to her. But out of fear she did not look at him.

content: तं दृष्ट्वा वन्दमानं तु सीता शशिनिभानना।।5.34.13।।अब्रवीद्धीर्घमुच्छवस्य वानरं मधुरस्वरा।
explanation: On seeing the vanara prostrated, the moonfaced lady, sighed deeply and spoke to him in a sweet voice:

content: मायां प्रविष्टो मायावी यदि त्वं रावणस्स्वयम्।।5.34.14।।उत्पादयसि मे भूयस्सन्तापं तन्न शोभनम्।
explanation: "If you are that trickster Ravana who appears incognito before me, it is not good for you. You are causing grief again.

content: स्वं परित्यज्य रूपं यः परिव्राजकरूपध्रुत्।जनस्थाने मया दृष्टस्त्वं स एवासि रावणः।।5.34.15।।
explanation: "You are the same Ravana who took the guise of a mendicant, giving up your real form and came to Janasthana.

content: उपवासकृशां दीनां कामरूप निशाचर।सन्तापयसि मां भूयस्सन्तप्तां तन्न शोभनम्।।5.34.16।।
explanation: "Oh you are one who can assume any form at will. You are a nightstalker. It is not good for you to cause pain to me who is already emaciated through fasting, who is pitiable and who is already afflicted.

content: अथवा नैतदेवं हि यन्मया परिशङ्कितम्।।5.34.17।।मनसो हि मम प्रीतिरुत्पन्ना तव दर्शनात्।
explanation: "May be my suspicion is not correct Because I am experiencing pleasure in my mind in your presence.

content: यदि रामस्य दूतस्त्वमागतो भद्रमस्तु ते।।5.34.18।।पृच्छामि त्वां हरिश्रेष्ठ प्रिया रामकथा हि मे।
explanation: "O great vanara, If on the other hand you have come here as Rama's messenger I wish you well. I love Rama's story. Tell me.

content: गुणान्रामस्य कथय प्रियस्य मम वानर।।5.34.19।।चित्तं हरसि मे सौम्य नदीकूलं यथा रयः।
explanation: "O vanara Rama's virtues are dear to me to hear. O gentle one just as the current of the river wears away its banks, my mind is lured by your presence.

content: अहो स्वप्नस्य सुखता याहमेवं चिराहृता।।5.34.20।।प्रेषितं नाम पश्यामि राघवेण वनौकसम्।
explanation: "Oh I have been seeing the person sent by Rama in my dream for a long time. This is a pleasant dream to me.

content: स्वप्नेऽपि यद्यहं वीरं राघवं सहलक्ष्मणम्।।5.34.21।।पश्येयं नावसीदेयं स्वप्नोऽपि मम मत्सरी।
explanation: "Even if I can see the heroic Rama together with Lakshmana in my dream my pain will be gone. Even the dream is inimical to me (I cannot sleep and thus cannot dream.)

content: नाहं स्वप्नमिमं मन्ये स्वप्ने दृष्ट्वा हि वानरम्।।5.34.22।।न शक्योऽभ्युदयः प्राप्तुं प्राप्तश्चाभ्युदयो मम।
explanation: "I do not think it is a dream. Pleasure cannot be experienced by seeing a vanara in a dream. I experience pleasure now (seeing a monkey in a dream is a bad omen).

content: किन्नु स्याचित्तमोहोऽयं भवेद्वातगतिस्त्वियम्।।5.34.23।।उन्मादजो विकारो वा स्यादियं मृगतृष्णिका।
explanation: "Can this be a delusion of my mind or a mental imbalance (resulting in movement of the mind in the body). Is it a malady born of  my madness? Or is it a mirage?

content: अथवा नायमुन्मादो मोहोऽप्युन्मादलक्षणः।।5.34.24।।सम्बुध्ये चाहमात्मानमियं चापि वनौकसम्।
explanation: "No, this cannot be insanity. nor even delusion. But I recognise this vanara well"

content: इत्येवं बहुधा सीता सम्प्रधार्य बलाबलम्।।5.34.25।।रक्षसां कामरूपत्वान्मेने तं राक्षसाधिपम्।
explanation: Considering the strength and weakness of demons in that manner Sita thought that Hanuman was none other than the king of demons who can asume any form at will.

content: एतां बुद्धिं तदा कृत्वा सीता सा तनुमध्यमा।।5.34.26।।न प्रतिव्याजहाराथ वानरं जनकात्मजा।
explanation: Having entertained such thoughts, Sita, the lady with a fairwaist, daughter of Janaka,  did not respond to the vanara.

content: सीतायाश्चिन्तितं बुद्ध्वा हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।।5.34.27।।श्रोत्रानुकूलैर्वचनैस्तदा तां संप्रहर्षयत्।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod understood what was going on in Sita's mind and spoke pleasing words that brought joy in her.

content: आदित्य इव तेजस्वी लोककान्तश्शशी यथा।।5.34.28।।राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य देवो वैश्रवणो यथा।विक्रमेणोपपन्नश्च यथा विष्णुर्महायशाः।।5.34.29।।
explanation: "Rama is glorious as the Sun, brings delight to the whole world like the Moon, is the king of kings like Vaisravana,  and renowned like Visnu endowed with valour.

content: सत्यवादी मधुरवाग्देवो वाचस्पतिर्यथा।रूपवान्सुभग श्रीमान् कन्दर्प इव मूर्तिमान्।।5.34.30।।
explanation: "He is truthful in speech like Brihaspati, prosperous (like Kubera), sweettongued, handsome, graceful like Kamadeva.

content: स्थानक्रोधः प्रहर्ता च श्रेष्ठो लोके महारथः।बाहुच्छायामवष्टब्धो यस्य लोको महात्मनः।।5.34.31।।
explanation: "He shows anger to one who deserves it, he is the foremost charioteer of the world and he is a great self under the shadow of whose shoulders the whole world takes refuge.

content: अपकृष्याश्रमपदान्मृगरूपेण राघवम्।शून्ये येनापनीतासि तस्य द्रक्ष्यसि यत्फलम्।।5.34.32।।
explanation: "You will see the consequences of the action of Ravana who abducted you deceitfully in the form of deer when Rama was away from the hermitage.

content: न चिराद्रावणं संख्ये यो वधिष्यति वीर्यवान्।रोषप्रमुक्तैरिषुभिर्ज्वलद्भिरिव पावकैः।।5.34.33।।तेनाहं प्रेषितो दूत स्त्वत्सकाशमिहागतः।त्वद्वियोगेन दुःखार्त स्स त्वां कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.34।।
explanation: "Heroic Rama will soon release many scorching, fiery arrows in anger and kill Ravana. I seek your permission as an envoy of Rama. Filled with grief by your separation, he has made inquiries about your welfare.

content: लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजास्सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः।अभिवाद्य महाबाहुस्स त्वां कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.35।।
explanation: "The brilliant, longarmed Lakshmana, delight of Sumitra enquires about your welfare and offers salutations to you.

content: रामस्य च सखा देवि सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः।राजा वानरमुख्यानां स त्वां कौशलमब्रवीत्।।5.34.36।।
explanation: "O goddess like lady Rama's friend Sugriva, king of vanara chieftans inquires about your wellbeing.

content: नित्यं स्मरति रामस्त्वां ससुग्रीव स्सलक्ष्मणः।दिष्ट्या जीवसि वैदेहि राक्षसीवशमागता।।5.34.37।।
explanation: "O Vaidehi Rama, Lakshmana and Sugriva always remember you. Luckily you are alive even though you are under the clutches of shedemons.

content: नचिराद्द्रक्ष्यसे रामं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।मध्ये वानरकोटीनां सुग्रीवं चामितौजसम्।।5.34.38।।
explanation: "Very soon you will see mighty Rama, Lakshmana and Sugriva of unlimited prowess surrounded by crores of vanaras.

content: अहं सुग्रीवसचिवो हनुमान्नाम वानरः।प्रविष्टो नगरीं लङ्कां लङ्घयित्वा महोदधिम्।।5.34.39।।
explanation: "I am Sugriva's minister known as Hanuman, a vanara who entered the city of Lanka after leaping over the great ocean.

content: कृत्वा मूर्ध्नि पदन्यासं रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।त्वां द्रष्टुमुपयातोऽहं समाश्रित्य पराक्रमम्।।5.34.40।।
explanation: "Setting my foot with my valour on the head of the cruelminded Ravana, using my valour,  I came here to see you.

content: नाहमस्मि तथा देवि यथा मामवगच्छसि।विशङ्का त्यज्यतामेषा श्रद्धत्स्व वदतो मम।।5.34.41।।
explanation: "O goddesslike lady I am not  a deceitful person as you suppose me to be. Shake off your suspicion as I speak to you and trust me."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman further narrates his story to Sita -- Gives description of Rama and Lakshmana] तां तु रामकथां श्रुत्वा वैदेही वानरर्षभात्।उवाच वचनं सान्त्वमिदं मधुरया गिरा।।5.35.1।।
explanation: On hearing about Rama from the bull among vanaras, thus spoke Vaidehi politely in a sweet voice:

content: क्व ते रामेण संसर्गः कथं जानासि लक्ष्मणम्।वानराणां नराणां च कथमासीत्समागमः।।5.35.2।।
explanation: "Where did you come in contact with Rama? How did you assess Lakshmana? How did an alliance of vanaras and humans take place?

content: यानि रामस्य लिङ्गानि लक्ष्मणस्य च वानर।तानि भूयस्समाचक्ष्व न मां शोकस्समाविशेत्।।5.35.3।।
explanation: "O vanara tell me all about the identification marks of Rama and Lakshmana again so that grief does not enter my mind.

content: कीदृशं तस्य संस्थानं रूपं रामस्य कीदृशम्।कथमूरू कथं बाहू लक्ष्मणस्य च शंस मे।।5.35.4।।
explanation: "What does Rama look like? And Laksmana? How are his thighs, arms? Tell me".

content: एवमुक्तस्तु वैदेह्या हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।ततो रामं यथातत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे।।5.35.5।।
explanation: Questioned thus by Vaidehi, Hanuman, son of the Windgod started describing Rama's physique as it is.

content: जानन्ती बत दिष्ट्या मां वैदेहि परिपृच्छसि।भर्तुः कमलपत्त्राक्षि संस्थानं लक्ष्मणस्य च।।5.35.6।।
explanation: "O Vaidehi with eyes like lotus petals although you know your husband's and Lakshmana's form and distinguishing marks, it is my good fortune that you asked me (to describe them).

content: यानि रामस्य चिह्नानि लक्ष्मणस्य च यानि वै।लक्षितानि विशालाक्षि वदतश्शृणु तानि मे।।5.35.7।।
explanation: "O largeeyed lady I will describe those distinguishing marks of Rama and Lakshmana Listen.

content: रामः कमलपत्त्राक्ष स्सर्वसत्त्वमनोहरः।रूपदाक्षिण्यसम्पन्नः प्रसूतो जनकात्मजे।।5.35.8।।
explanation: "O daughter of Janaka Rama with eyes like lotus petals is a person born with a delightful form, richly endowed with indescribable charm and politeness.

content: तेजसाऽदित्य सङ्काशः क्षमया पृथिवीसमः।बृहस्पतिसमो बुद्ध्या यशसा वासवोपमः।।5.35.9।।
explanation: "He vies with the Sun in effulgence, with earth in forbearance, with Brihaspati in intelligence, and in fame with Indra.

content: रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य स्वजनस्याभिरक्षिता।रक्षिता स्वस्य वृत्तस्य धर्मस्य च परन्तपः।।5.35.10।।
explanation: "Rama is a protector of the entire world of living beings not to speak of his own people. He is a protector of his own race. He guards righteousness. He is a scorcher of enemies.

content: रामो भामिनि लोकस्य चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य रक्षिता।मर्यादानां च लोकस्य कर्ता कारयिता च सः।।5.35.11।।
explanation: "O beautiful lady Rama is a protector of the four classes of society (Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaisya and Sudra) in the world. He follows codes of conduct and makes others follow them.

content: अर्चिष्मानर्चितोऽत्यर्थं ब्रह्मचर्यव्रते स्थितः।साधूनामुपकारज्ञः प्रचारज्ञश्च कर्मणाम्।।5.35.12।।
explanation: "He is luminous and highly revered. He observes vow of selfcontrol. He is steadfast and recognises services rendered by sages. He is aware of the rites and the ways of administration.

content: राजविद्याविनीतश्च ब्राह्मणानामुपासिता।श्रुतवान्शीलसम्पन्नो विनीतश्च परन्तपः।।5.35.13।।
explanation: "He is welltrained in statecraft. He is devoted to brahmins. Endowed with an excellent conduct, he is learned in scriptures and a scorcher of enemies.

content: यजुर्वेदविनीतश्च वेदविद्भिस्सुपूजितः।धनुर्वेदे च वेदेषु वेदाङ्गेषु च निष्ठितः।।5.35.14।।
explanation: "He is versed in Yajurveda and is respected by Vedic scholars. He has mastered Dhanurveda and other Vedas and auxillary Vedas as well.

content: विपुलांसो महाबाहुः कम्बुग्रीवश्शुभाननः।गूढजत्रुस्सुताम्राक्षो रामो देवि जनै श्श्रुतः।।5.35.15।।
explanation: "O godlike lady Rama has broad shoulders, strong arms, conchshaped neck and an auspicious countenance. With his fleshy round arms and copperyred eyes, he is renowned in all the worlds.

content: दुन्दुभिस्वननिर्घोष स्स्निग्धवर्णः प्रतापवान्।सम स्समविभक्ताङ्गो वर्णं श्यामं समाश्रितः।।5.35.16।।
explanation: "His tone is resonant like drums, he has a beautiful, dark, shining complexion. He has symmetrical, well proportioned limbs. He is neither too tall nor too short.

content: त्रिस्थिरस्त्रिप्रलम्बश्च त्रिसमस्त्रिषु चोन्नतः।त्रिताम्रस्त्रिषु च स्निग्धो गम्भीरस्त्रिषु नित्यशः।।5.35.17।।
explanation: "He has three stiff parts, three long parts, three even parts, three shining parts, elevated in three parts, has three raised parts, his body has lines in three parts and is  of coppery reddish colour in three parts. He has a majestic look.

content: त्रिवलीवांस्त्र्यवनतश्चतुर्व्यङ्गस्त्रिशीर्षवान्।चतुष्कलश्चतुर्लेखश्चतुष्किष्कुश्चतु स्समः।।5.35.18।।
explanation: "He has three folds in the skin of his neck and belly, is depressed in the middle of his soles and the nipples, undersized at four placesthe neck, penis, shanks and back, has three spirals on his head, has four lines under his thumb, has four lines on his forehead, he is a person with four cubits in height and symmetrical arms, cheeks and thighs.

content: चतुर्दशसमद्वन्द्वश्चतुर्दंष्ट्रश्चतुर्गतिः।महोष्ठहनुनासश्च पञ्चस्निग्धोऽष्टवंशवान्।।5.35.19।।
explanation: "He is a person with his pairs of eyebrows, nostrils, eyes, ears, lips, nipples, elbows, wrists, knees, testicles, loins, arms, legs and buttocks in good symmetry he has four sharp teeth. He walks in different gaits like a lion, leopard, elephant and bull as occasion demands he has sharp nose, charming lips and jaws. He has smooth hair, eyes, skin, teeth and feet and his eight parts of his body namely back, trunk, limbs, fingers, toes, eyes and testicles are long.

content: दशपद्मो दशबृहत्त्रिभिर्व्याप्तो द्विशुक्लवान्।षडुन्नतो नवतनुस्त्रिभिर्व्याप्नोति राघवः।।5.35.20।।
explanation: "Ten limbs of the body resemble lotuses. He has proportionate limbs. He is known by the virtue of his spledour, fame and glory. Both his teeth and eyes are fair. Six parts of his body are elevated, nine parts of his body are fine and sharp. He pursues spiritual merit, worldly comfort and sensual delight in three periods of the dayforenoon, midday and evening. He always adopts the righteous way of life.

content: सत्यधर्मपरश्श्रीमान् सङ्ग्रहानुग्रहे रतः।देशकालविभागज्ञस्सर्वलोकप्रियंवदः।।5.35.21।।
explanation: "He is ever established in truth and righteousness. He is prosperous and desires to accumulate wealth in order to shower favour on others. He knows the right use of time and place in discharging his duties. He has endeared himself to all by his words.

content: भ्राता तस्य च द्वैमात्रस्सौमित्रिरपराजितः।अनुरागेण रूपेण गुणैश्चैव तथाविधः।।5.35.22।।
explanation: "His invincible brother Saumitri born of a different mother is a replica of Rama in affection, charm and virtues.

content: तावुभौ नरशार्दूलौ त्वद्दर्शनसमुत्सुकौ।विचिन्वन्तौ महीं कृत्स्नामस्माभिरभिसङ्गतौ।।5.35.23।।
explanation: "While earnestly searching for you all over the earth both tigers among men came in contact with us.

content: त्वामेव मार्गमाणौ तौ विचरन्तौ वसुन्धराम्।ददर्शतुर्मृगपतिं पूर्वजेनावरोपितम्।।5.35.24।।ऋश्यमूकस्य पृष्ठे तु बहुपादपसङ्कुले।भ्रातुर्भयार्तमासीनं सुग्रीवं प्रियदर्शनम्।।5.35.25।।
explanation: "While both of them were wandering, searching for you all over the earth they saw Sugriva, the lord of animals who had been thrown out of kingship by his elder brother and was living on the mountain Rshyamuka frightened of him.

content: वयं तु हरिराजं तं सुग्रीवं सत्यसङ्गरम्।परिचर्यामहे राज्यात्पूर्वजेनावरोपितम्।।5.35.26।।
explanation: "Sugriva, king of vanaras who is committed to defend truth has been deposed from the kingdom by his elder brother. We keep attending on him.

content: ततस्तौ चीरवसनौ धनुः प्रवरपाणिनौ।ऋश्यमूकस्य शैलस्य रम्यं देशमुपागतौ।।5.35.27।।
explanation: "Both the princes clad in bark robes and armed with powerful bows reached the beautiful location of Rshyamukha mountain.

content: स तौ दृष्ट्वा नरव्याघ्रौ धन्विनौ वानरर्षभः।अवप्लुतो गिरेस्तस्य शिखरं भयमोहितः।।5.35.28।।
explanation: "On seeing the tigers among men armed with bows, Sugriva, the bull among vanaras jumped from the mountain deluded with fear and reached the peak.

content: ततस्स शिखरे तस्मिन्वानरेन्द्रो व्यवस्थितः।तयोस्समीपं मामेव प्रेषयामास सत्वरम्।।5.35.29।।
explanation: "Thereafter the lord of vanaras staying on the mountain top quickly sent me to meet both of them.

content: तावहं पुरुषव्याघ्रौ सुग्रीववचनात्प्रभू।रूपलक्षणसम्पन्नौ कृताञ्जलिरुपस्थितः।।5.35.30।।
तौ परिज्ञाततत्त्वार्थौ मया प्रीतिसमन्वितौ।पृष्ठमारोप्य तं देशं प्रापितौ पुरुषर्षभौ।।5.35.31।।
explanation: "I recognised the true status of  both the mighty men who were filled with joy, placed them on my back, and reached the mountaintop.

content: निवेदितौ च तत्त्वेन सुग्रीवाय महात्मने।तयोरन्योन्यसल्लापाद्भृशं प्रीतिरजायत।।5.35.32।।
explanation: "I reported faithfully about both the highsouled men to Sugriva. As they got to know each other through conversation a fast friendship developed between them.

content: ततस्तौ प्रीतिसम्पन्नौ हरीश्वरनरेश्वरौ।परस्परकृताश्वासौ कथया पूर्ववृत्तया।।5.35.33।।
ततस्स सान्त्वयामास सुग्रीवं लक्ष्मणाग्रजः।स्त्रीहेतोर्वालिना भ्रात्रा निरस्तमुरुतेजसा।।5.35.34।।
explanation: "Then Rama, consoled Sugriva who was dethroned and abandoned on acount of a woman by his brother Vali, endowed with great prowess.

content: ततस्त्वन्नाशजं शोकं रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः।लक्ष्मणो वानरेन्द्राय सुग्रीवाय न्यवेदयत्।।5.35.35।।
explanation: "Then Lakshmana spoke to the lord of vanaras, Sugriva about your loss and the grief caused to Rama, who is adept in accomplishing difficult deeds with ease.

content: स श्रुत्वा वानरेन्द्रस्तु लक्ष्मणेनेरितं वचः।तदासीन्निष्प्रभोऽत्यर्थं ग्रहग्रस्त इवांशुमान्।।5.35.36।।
explanation: "Having heard the words of Lakshmana, the king of vanaras became extremely lustreless like the Sun overshadowed by the planet Rahu.

content: ततस्त्वद्गात्रशोभीनि रक्षसा ह्रियमाणया।यान्याभरणजालानि पातितानि महीतले।।5.35.37।।तानि सर्वाणि रामाय आनीय हरियूथपाः।संहृष्टा दर्शयामासुर्गतिं तु न विदुस्तव।।5.35.38।।
तानि रामाय दत्तानि मयैवोपहृतानि च।स्वनवन्त्यवकीर्णानि तस्मिन्विगतचेतसि।।5.35.39।।
explanation: "I collected the ornaments and gave them to Rama. He lost his senses on seeing the jingling ornaments scattered.

content: तान्यङ्के दर्शनीयानि कृत्वा बहुविधं तव।तेन देवप्रकाशेन देवेन परिदेवितम्।।5.35.40।।
explanation: "The divine self who is effulgent like god wailed in many ways placing the beautiful ornaments on his lap.

content: पश्यतस्तानि रुदतस्ताम्यतश्च पुनः पुनः।प्रादीपयन्दाशरथेस्तानि शोकहुताशनम्।।5.35.41।।
explanation: "Rama looked at them and wept clasping them again and again in grief which inflamed like fire.

content: शयितं च चिरं तेन दुःखार्तेन महात्मना।मयापि विविधैर्वाक्यैः कृच्छ्रादुत्थापितः पुनः।।5.35.42।।
explanation: "Rama, the great self, immersed in sorrow lay down on the ground. I also consoled him with great difficulty and helped him to get up.

content: तानि दृष्ट्वा महाबाहुर्दर्शयित्वा मुहुर्मुहुः।राघवस्सह सौमित्रिस्सुग्रीवे स न्यवेदयत्।।5.35.43।।
explanation: "Longarmed Rama along with Lakshmana looked at them again and again and gave them to the care of Sugriva.

content: स तवादर्शनादार्ये राघवः परितप्यते।महता ज्वलता नित्यमग्निनेवाग्निपर्वतः।।5.35.44।।
explanation: "O divine lady on account of your separation he is ever blazing like a mountain of fire (Samvartaka).

content: त्वत्कृते तमनिद्रा च शोकश्चिन्ता च राघवम्।तापयन्ति महात्मानमग्न्यगारमिवाग्नयः।।5.35.45।।
explanation: "Rama is burning like a furnace by (three fires) sleeplessness, grief and intense anxiety just as the three sacred fires keep a firesanctuary intensely heated.

content: तवादर्शनशोकेन राघवः प्रविचाल्यते।महता भूमिकम्पेन महानिव शिलोच्चयः।।5.35.46।।
explanation: "On account of sorrow caused by not being able to see you, Rama of Raghu dynasty is shaken up like a lofty mountain is shaken by earthquake.

content: काननानि सुरम्याणि नदीः प्रस्रवणानि च।चरन्न रतिमाप्नोति त्वामपश्यन्नृपात्मजे।।5.35.47।।
explanation: "Oh princess unable to see you, Rama has found no joy in roaming delightful forests, rivers and streams.

content: स त्वां मनुजशार्दूलः क्षिप्रं प्राप्स्यति राघवः।समित्रबान्धवं हत्वा रावणं जनकात्मजे।।5.35.48।।
explanation: "Oh daughter of Janaka after killing Ravana, along with his friends and relatives Rama, the tiger among men, will meet you.

content: सहितौ रामसुग्रीवावुभावकुरुतां तदा।समयं वालिनं हन्तुं तव चान्वेषणं तथा।।5.35.49।।
explanation: "(Having become friends) Rama and Sugriva together reached an agreement to kill Vali and search for you.

content: ततस्ताभ्यां कुमाराभ्यां वीराभ्यां स हरीश्वरः।किष्किन्धां समुपागम्य वाली युद्धे निपातितः।।5.35.50।।
explanation: "Thereafter both the princes together arrived at Kishkinda and killed Vali, king of vanaras in a combat.

content: ततो निहत्य तरसा रामो वालिनमाहवे।सर्वर्क्षहरिसङ्घानां सुग्रीवमकरोत्पतिम्।।5.35.51।।
explanation: "Then Rama quickly killed Vali in a combat and made Sugriva the lord of all troops of vanaras and bears.

content: रामसुग्रीवयोरैक्यं देव्येवं समजायत।हनुमन्तं च मां विद्धि तयोर्दूतमिहागतम्।।5.35.52।।
explanation: "Oh Illustrious lady In that manner alliance was established between Rama and Sugriva. Know me to be Hanuman, arrived here as their messenger.

content: स्वराज्यं प्राप्य सुग्रीवस्समानीय हरीश्वरान्।त्वदर्थं प्रेषयामास दिशो दश महाबलान्।।5.35.53।।
explanation: "Having obtained his kingdom Sugriva despatched the vanara leaders to all ten directions (to search for you).

content: आदिष्टा वानरेन्द्रेण सुग्रीवेण महौजसा।अद्रिराजप्रतीकाशास्सर्वतः प्रस्थितौ महीम्।।5.35.54।।
explanation: "Following Sugriva's orders, the powerful monkey leaders huge as the Himalayas, king of mountains went all over the earth (searching).

content: ततस्ते मार्गमाणा वै सुग्रीववचनातुराः।चरन्ति वसुधां कृत्स्नां वयमन्ये च वानराः।।5.35.55।।
explanation: "Following Sugriva's orders, we, the monkeys, since then are moving about searching the entire earth eager to find you or to carry out Sugriva's orders.

content: अङ्गदो नाम लक्ष्मीवान्वालिसूनुर्महाबलः।प्रस्थितः कपिशार्दूलस्त्रिभागबलसंवृतः।।5.35.56।।
तेषां नो विप्रणष्टानां विन्ध्ये पर्वतसत्तमे।भृशं शोकपरीतानामहोरात्रगणा गताः।।5.35.57।।
explanation: "We wasted many nights and days immersed in disappointment (for not being able to find you) and we missed our path in the great Vindhya mountain.

content: ते वयं कार्यनैराश्यात्कालस्यातिक्रमेण च।भयाच्च कपिराजस्य प्राणांस्त्यक्तुं व्यवस्थिताः।।5.35.58।।
explanation: "We decided to give up our lives due to disappointment, transgression of the time limit  fixed for us and fear of the monkey lord (fear of facing the king without finding you).

content: विचित्य वनदुर्गाणि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च।अनासाद्य पदं देव्याः प्राणांस्त्यक्तुं समुद्यताः।।5.35.59।।
explanation: "We decided to give up our lives since we were unable to see the feet of the queen (Sita) even after searching the forest fortresses and the (banks of) mountain streams.

content: दृष्ट्वा प्रायोपविष्टांश्च सर्वान्वानरपुङ्गवान्।भृशं शोकार्णवे मग्नः पर्यदेवयदङ्गदः।।5.35.60।।तव नाशं च वैदेहि वालिनश्च वधं तथा।प्रायोपवेशमस्माकं मरणं च जटायुषः।।5.35.61।।
तेषां नस्वामिसन्देशान्निराशानां मुमूर्षताम्।कार्यहेतोरिवायातश्शकुनिर्वीर्यवान्महान्।।5.35.62।।
explanation: "When we were disappointed (in tracing you) and were at the point of death having been commanded by the king (that whosoever overstays would be killed) a gigantic powerful bird appeared to fulfil our task.

content: गृध्रराजस्य सोदर्यः सम्पातिर्नाम गृध्रराट्।श्रुत्वा भ्रातृवधं कोपादिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।5.35.63।।
explanation: "That king of vultures, Sampati was the brother of king of birds Jatayu. Hearing about the death of his younger brother Sampati felt distresed and spoke in anger:

content: यवीयान्केन मे भ्राता हतः क्व च निपातितः।एतदाख्यातुमिच्छामि भवद्भिर्वानरोत्तमाः।।5.35.64।।
explanation: 'O best of vanaras by whom was my younger brother killed? Where was he dropped down? I wish you to tell me all about that.

content: अङ्गदोऽकथयत्तस्य जनस्थाने महद्वधम्।रक्षसा भीमरूपेण त्वामुद्दिश्य यथातथम्।।5.35.65।।
जटायुषो वधं श्रुत्वा दुःखितस्सोऽरुणात्मजः।त्वां शशंस वरारोहे वसन्तीं रावणालये।।5.35.66।।
explanation: "Having heard about the death of Jatayu, O charming lady that Sampati Aruna's son felt sad and told us that you are at Ravana's palace.

content: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सम्पातेः प्रीतिवर्धनम्।अङ्गदप्रमुखास्तूर्णं ततस्सम्प्रस्थिता वयम्।।5.35.67।।
explanation: "Having heard Sampati's encouraging words all of us led by Angada departed immediately.

content: विन्ध्यादुत्थाय सम्प्राप्ता स्सागरस्यान्तमुत्तरम्।त्वद्धर्शनकृतोत्साहा हृष्टास्तुष्टाः प्लवङ्गमाः।।5.35.68।।
explanation: "The happy monkeys were satisfied. Enthusiastic about seeing you, they rose from the Vindhya mountain and reached the limit of the sea  shore in the north.

content: अङ्गदप्रमुखास्सर्वे वेलोपान्तमुपस्थिताः।चिन्तां जग्मुः पुनर्भीतास्त्वद्दर्शनसमुत्सुकाः।।5.35.69।।
अथाहं हरिसैन्यस्य सागरं प्रेक्ष्य सीदतः।व्यवधूय भयं तीव्रं योजनानां शतं प्लुतः।।5.35.70।।
explanation: "When the vanara army was feeling despondent at the sight of the ocean, I leaped across the sea, a hundred yojanas, pushing aside  all my fear.

content: लङ्का चापि मया रात्रौ प्रविष्टा राक्षसाकुला।रावणश्च मया दृष्टस्त्वं च शोकपरिप्लुता।।5.35.71।।
explanation: "I entered at night the city of Lanka teeming with demons and saw Ravana and saw you immersed in sorrow.

content: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथावृत्तमनन्दिते।अभिभाषस्व मां देवि दूतो दाशरथेरहम्।।5.35.72।।
explanation: "O sinless lady I have given you a faithful account. I am a messenger of Dasaratha's son. And you may speak now, O divine lady

content: तं मां रामकृतोद्योगं त्वन्निमित्तमिहागतम्।सुग्रीवसचिवं देवि बुद्ध्यस्व पवनात्मजम्।।5.35.73।।
explanation: "O divine lady Know that I have come here for your cause carrying out the mission of Rama. I am Sugriva'a minister and son of the Windgod.

content: कुशली तव काकुत्स्थस्सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः।गुरोराराधने युक्तो लक्ष्मणश्च सुलक्षणः।।5.35.74।।
explanation: "Your lord Rama of Kakutstha race, supreme among wielders of weapons is doing well. So is venerable Lakshmana endowed with auspicious signs engaged in serving him.

content: तस्य वीर्यवतो देवि भर्तुस्तव हिते रतः।अहमेकस्तु सम्प्राप्त स्सुग्रीववचनादिह।।5.35.75।।
explanation: "O queen seeking the welfare of your Valiant husband I came here at the behest of Sugriva all alone.

content: मयेयमसहायेन चरता कामरूपिणा।दक्षिणा दिगनुक्रान्ता त्वन्मार्गविचयैषिणा।।5.35.76।।
explanation: "I can assume any form at my will. I searched for you without any help moving in the southern direction and reached this place .

content: दिष्ट्याहं हरिसैन्यानां त्वन्नाशमनुशोचताम्।अपनेष्यामि सन्तापं तवाभिगमशंसनात्।।5.35.77।।
explanation: "Fortunately for me I can finally dispel the fear of the vanara chiefs who are regretting your loss, by letting them know that you have been found.

content: दिष्ट्या हि मम न व्यर्थं देवि सागरलङ्घनम्।प्राप्स्याम्यहमिदं दिष्ट्या त्वद्दर्शनकृतं यशः।।5.35.78।।
explanation: "Oh queen luckily for me, crossing the ocean has not gone in vain. I am fortunate because I will attain fame of finding you.

content: राघवश्च महावीर्यः क्षिप्रं त्वामभिपत्स्यते।समित्रबान्धवं हत्वा रावणं राक्षसाधिपम्।।5.35.79।।
explanation: "Mighty Raghava will take you after killing Ravana, the king of demons along with his kith and kin.

content: माल्यवान्नाम वैदेहि गिरीणामुत्तमो गिरिः।ततो गच्छति गोकर्णं पर्वतं केसरी हरिः।।5.35.80।।
explanation: "Oh Vaidehi there is a famous mountain called Malyavan. From there a monkey called Kesari went to mount Gokarna.

content: स च देवर्षिभिर्दिष्टः पिता मम महाकपिः।तीर्थे नदीपतेः पुण्ये शम्बसादनमुद्धरत्।।5.35.81।।
explanation: "He (Kesari) is said to be my father by the divine sages. He retrieved a piece of land in a holy spot of that sea shore and killed Sambasadana, a demon who was oppressing righteous people.

content: तस्याहं हरिणः क्षेत्रे जातो वातेन मैथिलि।हनुमानिति विख्यातो लोके स्वेनैव कर्मणा।।5.35.82।।
explanation: "O Mythili I was born in that land retrieved by the Windgod. I am known as Hanuman by virtue of my own action.

content: विश्वासार्थं तु वैदेहि भर्तुरुक्ता मया गुणाः।अचिराद्राघवो देवि त्वामितो नयिताऽनघे।।5.35.83।।
explanation: "In order to inspire confidence in you about me I have narrated the virtues of your husband. O sinless queen Rama will take you from here very soon".

content: एवं विश्वासिता सीता हेतुभिश्शोककर्शिता।उपपन्नैरभिज्ञानैर्दूतं तमवगच्छति।।5.35.84।।
explanation: The griefstricken Sita trusted him by his logical presentation of reasons as well as identifications. She believed that he was a messenger (of Rama).

content: अतुलं च गता हर्षं प्रहर्षेण च जानकी।नेत्राभ्यां वक्रपक्ष्माभ्यां मुमोचानन्दजं जलम्।।5.35.85।।
explanation: Janaki experienced immeasurable happiness and shed tears of joy through her curved eyes.

content: चारु तद्वदनं तस्यास्ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम्।अशोभत विशालाक्ष्या राहुमुक्त इवोडुराट्।।5.35.86।।
explanation: Her face with large eyes with a tinge of red corners shone like the Moon released from Rahu.

content: हनुमन्तं कपिं व्यक्तं मन्यते नान्यथेति सा।अथोवाच हनूमांस्तामुत्तरं प्रियदर्शनाम्।।5.35.87।।
explanation: She realised that the monkey was none other than Hanuman. Then he looked at her who was pleasing to see and spoke again:

content: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं समाश्वसिहि मैथिलि।किं करोमि कथं वा ते रोचते प्रतियाम्यहम्।।5.35.88।।
explanation: "Mythili, everything I intended to say has been narrated to you. Calm yourself down. What shall I do? Or else, tell me what pleases you. I shall go back.

content: हतेऽसुरे संयति शम्बसादने कपिप्रवीरेण महर्षिचोदनात्।ततोऽस्मि वायुप्रभवो हि मैथिलि प्रभावतस्तत्प्रतिमश्च वानरः।।5.35.89।।
explanation: "(My father) a mighty monkey killed Sambasadana in a battle on the command of a great seer. I am a vanara (born to a monkey) by the impact of the Windgod. I am equal to the Windgod in power."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman hands over the signet ring to Sita]भूय एव महातेजा हनूमान्पवनात्मजः।अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सीताप्रत्ययकारणात्।।5.36.1।।
explanation: Mighty Hanuman, the son of the Windgod again spoke to Sita humbly to inspire confidence in her.

content: वानरोऽहं महाभागे दूतो रामस्य धीमतः।रामनामाङ्कितं चेदं पश्य देव्यङ्गुलीयकम्।।5.36.2।।
explanation: "O noble lady I am a vanara, an envoy of learned Rama. You see this ring with Rama's name inscribed on it, O godlike lady

content: प्रत्ययार्थं तवाऽनीतं तेन दत्तं महात्मना।समाश्वसिहि भद्रं ते क्षीणदुःखफला ह्यसि।।5.36.3।।
explanation: "Be calm. Be blessed. Your sorrows have come to an end. This (the ring) is given by the great self, Rama, to make you trust me.

content: गृहीत्वा प्रेक्षमाणा सा भर्तुः करविभूषणम्।भर्तारमिव सम्प्राप्ता जानकी मुदिताऽभवत्।।5.36.4।।
explanation: She received the ornament that adorned her husband's hand and gazed at it and felt delighted as though her husband had arrived.

content: चारु तद्वदनं तस्यास्ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम्।अशोभत विशालाक्ष्या राहुमुक्त इवोडुराट्।।5.36.5।।
explanation: Her beautiful countenance with large white eyes with a reddish tinge in the corners shone like the Moon released from Rahu.

content: ततस्सा ह्रीमती बाला भर्तृसन्देशहर्षिता।परितुष्टा प्रियं कृत्वा प्रशशंस महाकपिम्।।5.36.6।।
explanation: Young Sita felt delighted about her husband's news and blushed. By praising him for his action, she pleased the great monkey.

content: विक्रान्तस्त्वं समर्थस्त्वं प्राज्ञस्त्वं वानरोत्तम।येनेदं राक्षसपदं त्वयैकेन प्रधर्षितम्।।5.36.7।।
explanation: "O foremost among the vanaras you have trespassed the abodes of demons all alone. You are mighty and capable and wise.

content: शतयोजनविस्तीर्ण स्सागरो मकरालयः।विक्रमश्लाघनीयेन क्रमता गोष्पदीकृतः।।5.36.8।।
explanation: "You with your admirable prowess have reduced this ocean which is an abode of crocodiles stretching over a hundred yojanas to a cow's hoof mark.

content: न हि त्वां प्राकृतं मन्ये वानरं वानरर्षभ।यस्य ते नास्ति सन्त्रासो रावणान्नापि सम्भ्रमः।।5.36.9।।
explanation: "I do not think you are an ordinary monkey. You have no fear or excitement about Ravana. You are a bull among vanaras.

content: अर्हसे च कपिश्रेष्ठ मया समभिभाषितुम्।यद्यसि प्रेषितस्तेन रामेण विदितात्मना।।5.36.10।।
explanation: "O best of monkeys As you have been sent by Rama, the knower of the self, it is proper for me to converse with you.

content: प्रेषयिष्यति दुर्धर्षो रामो न ह्यपरीक्षितम्।पराक्रममविज्ञाय मत्सकाशं विशेषतः।।5.36.11।।
explanation: "The formidable Rama will not send any one specially to me without testing him or knowing his valour.

content:
दिष्ट्या च कुशली रामो धर्मात्मा सत्यसङ्गरः।

लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजास्सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः।।5.36.12।।
explanation: "To my luck, righteous Rama who abides in truth and glorious Lakshmana who enhances the joy of Sumitra are keeping well.

content: कुशली यदि काकुत्स्थः किं नु सागरमेखलाम्।महीं दहति कोपेन युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः।।5.36.13।।
explanation: "Indeed if Kakutstha is well wherefore does he not burn the oceangirdled earth in his rage as (the earth is burnt) at the time of dissolution of the era?

content: अथवा शक्तिमन्तौ तौ सुराणामपि निग्रहे।ममैव तु न दुःखानामस्ति मन्ये विपर्ययः।।5.36.14।।
explanation: "Both of them are capable of subduing even the gods. I think the reversal of  my fate is reason for their inaction.

content: कच्चिन्न व्यथितो रामः कच्चिन्न परितप्यते।उत्तराणि च कार्याणि कुरुते पुरुषोत्तमः।।5.36.15।।
explanation: "Is Rama the greatest among men not depressed? Does he not feel helpless? He is (perhaps) taking necessary steps (for my recovery).

content: कच्चिन्न दीन स्सम्भ्रान्तः कार्येषु न च मुह्यति।कच्चित्पुरुषकार्याणि कुरुते नृपतेस्सुतः।।5.36.16।।
explanation: "I suppose prince Rama is not too depressed or perplexed to attend to his work. He will (perhaps) be doing the duties expected of a manly person.

content:
द्विविधं त्रिविधोपायमुपायमपि सेवते।

विजिगीषुस्सुहृत्कच्चिन्मित्रेषु च परन्तपः।।5.36.17।।
explanation: "Tell me if Rama, scorcher of enemies, desirous of victory is following a two-fold policy (confrontation and conciliation) A tough enemy cannot be defeated by following this method. A three-fold strategy has to be adopted in this case (confrontation, conciliation and creation of dissension among his foes) to be victorious. I hope he is well-disposed to his friends and has a good team!

content: कच्चिन्मित्राणि लभते मित्रैश्चाप्यभिगम्यते।कच्चित्कल्याणमित्त्रश्च मित्रत्त्रैश्चापि पुरस्कृतः।।5.36.18।।
explanation: "I hope he is making new friends, who desire his friendship. Hopefully, Rama is well honoured  by his allies.

content: कच्चिदाशास्ति देवानां प्रसादं पार्थिवात्मजः।कच्चित्पुरुषकारं च दैवं च प्रतिपद्यते।।5.36.19।।
explanation: "Does the prince ever seek the blessings of gods or fall back upon personal effort as well as providence?

content: कच्चिन्न विगतस्नेहः प्रवासान्मयि राघवः।कच्चिन्मां व्यसनादस्मान्मोक्षयिष्यति वानर।।5.36.20।।
explanation: "I hope Rama is not devoid of love towards me by  my separation. O Vanara, hope he will liberate me from this misery.

content: सुखानामुचितो नित्यमसुखानामनौचितः।दुःखमुत्तरमासाद्य कच्चिद्रामो न सीदति।।5.36.21।।
explanation: "I hope Rama who deserves happiness and not suffering has not become depressed now , having experienced a spate of sorrows.

content: कौसल्यायास्तथा कच्चित्सुमित्रायास्तथैव च।अभीक्ष्णं श्रूयते कच्चित्कुशलं भरतस्य च।।5.36.22।।
explanation: "I hope he regularly receives news about the welfare of Kausalya, Sumitra and Bharata.

content: मन्निमित्तेन मानार्हः कच्चिच्छोकेन राघवः।कच्चिन्नान्यमना रामः कच्चिन्मां तारयिष्यति।।5.36.23।।
explanation: "I hope respectable Rama is not too absentminded for being immersed in sorrow on my account. Hope he will save me.

content: कच्चिदक्षौहिणीं भीमां भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।ध्वजिनीं मन्त्रिभिर्गुप्तां प्रेषयिष्यति मत्कृते।।5.36.24।।
explanation: "Will Bharata, the devoted brother, send his formidable army of one akshavhini protected by ministers for my cause? I trust he will. (Akshauhini  109350 foot soldiers  65610 horse soldiers  21860 elephants soldiers on chariot)

content: वानराधिपतिश्शीमान्सुग्रीवः कच्चिदेष्यति।मत्कृते हरिभिर्वीरैर्वृतो दन्तनखायुधैः।।5.36.25।।
explanation: "I trust that the illustrious Sugriva surrounded  by valiant vanaras who use their teeth and nails as weapons will reach this place.

content: कच्चिच्छ लक्ष्मणश्शूरस्सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः।अस्त्रविच्छरजालेन राक्षसान्विधमिष्यति।।5.36.26।।
explanation: "Hope heroic Lakshmana, enhancer of the joy of Sumitra, who has mastered the use of weapons will blow away the demons through a network of arrows.

content: रौद्रेण कच्चिदस्त्रेण ज्वलता निहतं रणे।द्रक्ष्याम्यल्पेन कालेन रावणं ससुहृज्जनम्।।5.36.27।।
explanation: "Can I hope to see Ravana and his relatives slain in the battle by fiery weapons in a short time?

content: कच्चिन्न तद्धेमसमानवर्णं तस्याननं पद्मसमानगन्धि।मया विना शुष्यति शोकदीनं जलक्षये पद्ममिवातपेन।।5.36.28।।
explanation: "Hope, Rama's moonlike face without me with its golden complexion and lotus fragrance must not have been pale and withered with tears like the lotus in a pond scorched by the heat.

content: धर्मापदेशात्त्यजतश्च राज्यं मां चाप्यरण्यं नयतः पदातिम्।नासीद्व्यथा यस्य न भीर्न शोकः कच्चित्स धैर्यं हृदये करोति।।5.36.29।।
explanation: "Rama has given up sovereignty for the sake of establishing righteousness and led me into the forest on foot.He had not then felt any fear, anxiety or grief at heart.Rama showed patience, instead. Hope he retains them.

content: न चास्य माता न पिता च नान्यः स्नेहाद्विशिष्टोऽस्ति मया समो वा।तावत्त्वहं दूत जिजीविषेयं यावत्प्रवृत्तिं शृणुयां प्रियस्य।।5.36.30।।
explanation: "His love for me is superior to his love for his father, mother or any one else. O messenger, I wish to survive till I hear any  news from my dear lord."

content: इतीव देवी वचनं महार्थं तं वानरेन्द्रं मधुरार्थमुक्त्वा।श्रोतुं पुनस्तस्य वचोऽभिरामं रामार्थयुक्तं विरराम रामा।।5.36.31।।
explanation: The godlike lady, having spoken to the vanara leader in a very meaningful and sweet manner about her beloved Rama, she remained silent, waiting to hear Hanuman's attractive words of description of Rama once again.

content: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा मारुतिर्भीमविक्रमः।शिरस्यञ्जलिमाधाय वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.36.32।।
explanation: Having heard Sita, Hanuman endowed with fearsome power placed his folded hands on his head and said this:

content: न त्वामिहस्थां जानीते रामः कमललोचने।तेन त्वां नानयत्याशु शचीमिव पुरन्दरः।।5.36.33।।
explanation: "O lotuseyed one Rama knows not that you are here. Therefore he has not taken you away immediately as did Indra to rescue his wife Sachi.

content:
श्रुत्वैव तु वचो मह्यं क्षिप्रमेष्यति राघवः।

चमूं प्रकर्षन्महतीं हर्यृक्षगणसङ्कुलाम्।।5.36.34।।
explanation: "As soon as he hears your words from me, Rama will reach (here), leading a huge army of powerful troops of vanaras and bears.

content: विष्टम्भयित्वा बाणौघैरक्षोभ्यं वरुणालयम्।करिष्यति पुरीं लङ्कां काकुत्स्थः शान्तराक्षसाम्।।5.36.35।।
explanation: "Kakutstha Rama will still the imperturbable abode of Varuna (ocean) by the torrent of his arrows and rid the city of Lanka of all the demons.

content: तत्र यद्यन्तरा मृत्युर्यदि देवास्सहासुराः।स्थास्यन्ति पथि रामस्य स तानपि वधिष्यति।।5.36.36।।
explanation: "Thereafter, whoever comes Rama's way,  be it  gods or demons or even death or any one else he will destroy them.

content: तवादर्शनजेनार्ये शोकेन स परिप्लुतः।न शर्म लभते रामस्सिंहार्दित इव द्विपः।।5.36.37।।
explanation: "O noble lady not being able to see you, Rama is immersed in an ocean of sorrow, he has no solace like an elephant tormented by a lion.

content: मलयेन च विन्ध्येन मेरुणा मन्दरेण च।दर्दुरेण च ते देवि शपे मूलफलेन च।।5.36.38।।यथा सुनयनं वल्गु बिम्बोष्ठं चारु कुण्डलम् ।मुखं द्रक्ष्यसि रामस्य पूर्णचन्द्रमिवोदितम्।।5.36.39।।
explanation: "O Sita I swear in the name of mountains like Malaya, Vindhya, Meru, and Dardura (the abodes of monkeys and bears) and  by the roots and fruits as well (which are the food of vanaras). you will soon behold Rama with beautiful eyes, red lips like bimba fruit, lovely earrings and a countenance resembling the full moon.

content: क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि वैदेहि रामं प्रस्रवणे गिरौ।शतक्रतुमिवासीनं नागराजस्य मूर्धनि।।5.36.40।।
explanation: "O Vaidehi, you will soon see Rama seated on the Prasravana mountain just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) seated on the back of the king of elephants.

content: न मांसं राघवो भुङक्ते न चाऽपि मधु सेवते।वन्यं सुविहितं नित्यं भक्तमश्नाति पञ्चमम्।।5.36.41।।
explanation: "Rama is not eating meat, nor drinking wine. He takes only the one fifth of a meal (sanctioned for an ascetic) available in the forest.

content: नैव दंशान्न मशकान्न कीटान्न सरीसृपान्।राघवोऽपनयेद्गात्रात्त्वद्गतेनान्तरात्मना।।5.36.42।।
explanation: "Since you left, Rama has been always thinking sincerely of you, no longer drives away flies or mosquitoes nor insects or serpents from his body (his mind entirely fixed on you).

content: नित्यं ध्यानपरो रामो नित्यं शोकपरायणः।नान्यच्चिन्तयते किञ्चित्स तु कामवशं गतः।।5.36.43।।
explanation: "Rama is always lost in thought. He is totally given to grief. Absorbed in love for you, he thinks of none else৷৷

content: अनिद्रस्सततं रामस्सुप्तोऽपि च नरोत्तमः।सीतेति मधुरां वाणीं व्याहरन्प्रतिबुध्यते।।5.36.44।।
explanation: "Rama, the best of men never goes to sleep and even if he drops off to sleep he mutters 'Sita, Sita' in a sweet voice in his sleep.

content: दृष्ट्वा फलं वा पुष्पं वा यद्वाऽन्यत्सुमनोहरम्।बहुशो हा प्रियेत्येवं श्वसंस्त्वामभिभाषते।।5.36.45।।
explanation: "Sighing deeply whenever Rama sees a fruit or a flower or any such delightful thing, he remembers you and calls you out again and again, saying, 'alas, my darling '

content: स देवि नित्यं परितप्यमान स्त्वामेव सीतेत्यभिभाषमाणः।धृतव्रतो राजसुतो महात्मा तवैव लाभाय कृतप्रयत्नः।।5.36.46।।
explanation: "O divine lady prince Rama is ceaselessly suffering. He keeps talking to you in air. The determined Rama is only thinking of your recovery ".

content: सा रामसङ्कीर्तनवीतशोका रामस्य शोकेन समानशोका।शरन्मुखे साम्बुदशेषचन्द्रा निशेव वैदेहसुता बभूव।।5.36.47।।
explanation: Her sorrow was mitigated by references made by Hanuman about Rama.She felt equally sad when she heard about Rama's agony. The princess from Videha appeared like a night at the advent of autumn, with the Moon looking partly muffled by clouds and partly bright.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content:
[Hanuman offers to carry Sita back to RamaSita politely Sita declines -- appeals to Hanuman to get Rama to take her.]

सीता तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पूर्णचन्द्रनिभानना।

हनूमन्तमुवाचेदं धर्मार्थसहितं वचः।।5.37.1।।
explanation: To the righteous words (about Rama's grief) of Hanuman, Sita with a face like the full moon replied.

content: अमृतं विषसंसृष्टं त्वया वानर भाषितम्।यच्च नान्यमना रामो यच्च शोकपरायणः ।।5.37.2।।
explanation: "O vanara you have told me that Rama has his mind always fixed on me, not on others and you have also said that he is sad. It is like offering me poison mixed with nectar.

content: ऐश्वर्ये वा सुविस्तीर्णे व्यसने वा सुदारुणे।रज्ज्वेव पुरुषं बद्ध्वा कृतान्तः परिकर्षति।।5.37.3।।
explanation: "Death snatches a man tied with a cord, whether he is rolling in luxury or sinking in adversity.

content: विधिर्नूनमसंहार्यः प्राणिनां प्लवगोत्तम।सौमित्रिं मां च रामं च व्यसनै: पश्य मोहितान्।।5.37.4।।
explanation: "O best of vanaras surely it is not possible for living beings to overcome destiny. You see how Sri Rama, Saumitri, and my own self are all   afflicted with grief.

content: शोकस्यास्य कदा पारं राघवोऽधिगमिष्यति।प्लवमानः परिश्रान्तो हतनौ स्सागरे यथा।।5.37.5।।
explanation: "When will Raghava reach the shore of this ocean of grief? He is like a man who has suffered a ship wreck, trying to swim?

content: राक्षसानां वधं कृत्वा सूदयित्वा च रावणम्।लङ्कामुन्मूलितां कृत्वा कदा द्रक्ष्यति मां पतिः।।5.37.6।।
explanation: "When will my husband see me after killing the demons including Ravana and uprooting Lanka?

content: स वाच्यस्संत्वरस्वेति यावदेव न पूर्यते।अयं संवत्सरः कालस्तावद्धि मम जीवितम्।।5.37.7।।
explanation: "One year's time has been given (by Ravana) to me.  Rama should be informed to be quick in reaching before the completion of the time limit and that I will survive till then only.

content: वर्तते दशमो मासो द्वौ तु शेषौ प्लवङ्गम।रावणेन नृशंसेन समयो यः कृतो मम।।5.37.8।।
explanation: "O vanara this is the end of the tenth month. Only two more months are left. This is the condition laid by the wicked Ravana in my case.

content: विभीषणेन च भ्रात्रा मम निर्यातनं प्रति।अनुनीतः प्रयत्नेन न च तत्कुरुते मतिम्।।5.37.9।।
explanation: "Vibhisana made efforts to advise Ravana for my restoration. But Ravana has not agreed to that.

content: मम प्रतिप्रदानं हि रावणस्य न रोचते।रावणं मार्गते संख्ये मृत्युः कालवशं गतम्।।5.37.10।।
explanation: "Ravana did not like to return me having fallen into the death trap. Death lies in wait for him in battle.

content: ज्येष्ठा कन्या नला नाम विभीषणसुता कपे।तया ममेदमाख्यातं मात्रा प्रहितया स्वयम्।।5.37.11।।
explanation: "O vanara Nala the eldest daughter of Vibhisana sent by her mother came here personally and reported this to me.

content: असंशयं हरिश्रेष्ठ क्षिप्रं मां प्राप्स्यते पतिः।अन्तरात्मा च मे शुद्धस्तस्मिंश्च बहवो गुणाः।।5.37.12।।
explanation: "O eminent vanara no doubt my lord will soon reach this place. My pure conscience tells me that Rama has many virtues.

content: उत्साहः पौरुषं सत्त्वमानृशंस्यं कृतज्ञता।विक्रमश्च प्रभावश्च सन्ति वानर राघवे।।5.37.13।।
explanation: "O vanara Rama is endowed with perseverance, manliness, prowess, kindness, gratitude, competence and power.

content:
चतुर्दशसहस्राणि राक्षसानां जघान यः।

जनस्थाने विना भ्रात्रा शत्रुः कस्तस्य नोद्विजेत् ।।5.37.14।।
explanation: "At Janasthana without the help of his brother also he slew fourteen thousand demons. Which enemy will not tremble before him?

content: न स शक्यस्तुलयितुं व्यसनैः पुरुषर्षभः।अहं तस्य प्रभावज्ञा शक्रस्येव पुलोमजा ।।5.37.15।।
explanation: "O bull among men he will not be shaken by calamities. Just as Sachi, the daughter of Puloma knows Indra's might I know Rama's.

content: शरजालांशुमान्शूरः कपे रामदिवाकरः।शत्रुरक्षोमयं तोयमुपशोषं नयिष्यति।।5.37.16।।
explanation: "O monkey the valiant Rama is like the Sungod shoofing a dazzling volley of arrows which will dry up the sea of enemy forces."

content: इति सञ्जल्पमानां तां रामार्थे शोककर्शिताम्।आश्रुसम्पूर्णनयनामुवाच वचनं कपिः।।5.37.17।।
explanation: While Sita, tormented with grief on account of Rama was thus speaking, her eyes filled with tears, the monkey said:

content: श्रुत्वैव तु वचो मह्यं क्षिप्रमेष्यति राघवः।चमूं प्रकर्षन्महतीं हर्यृक्षगणसङ्कुलाम्।।5.37.18।।
explanation: "On hearing me Rama will reach soon with a huge army of vanaras and bears.

content: अथवा मोचयिष्यामि त्वामद्यैव वरानने।अस्माद्धुःखादुपारोह मम पृष्ठमनिन्दिते।।5.37.19।।
explanation: "O beautiful lady, if you please, I shall redeem you today itself from grief. You may ride on my back, O blameless lady.

content: त्वां हि पृष्ठगतां कृत्वा सन्तरिष्यामि सागरम्।शक्तिरस्ति हि मे वोढुं लङ्कामपि सरावणाम् ।।5.37.20।।
