explanation: When the tail was burning, the vanara wondered how the fire ablaze on every side was not burning him:

content: दृश्यते च महाज्वालः करोति न च मे रुजम्।।5.53.35।।शिशिरस्येव सङ्घातो लाङ्गूलाग्रे प्रतिष्ठितः।
explanation: 'This huge flame is not hurting me. It  is as though a mass of ice is placed at the end of my tail. (The fire did not torture nor extend beyond the tip of my tail.)

content: अथवा तदिदं व्यक्तं यद्दृष्टं प्लवता मया।।5.53.36।।रामप्रभावादाश्चर्यं पर्वत स्सरितां पतौ।
explanation: 'It must be due to the power of Rama, by which I found a wonderful mountain  emerging from the sea to give me protection while I was crossing the ocean. Now evidently this is due to Rama's power (that my tail is not burning me).

content: यदि तावत्समुद्रस्य मैनाकस्य च धीमतः।।5.53.37।।रामार्थं सम्भ्रमस्तादृक्किमग्निर्न करिष्यति।
explanation: 'If the anxiety of the ocean and the wise Mainaka mountain is to serve Rama what is it that the fire cannot do?

content: सीतायाश्चानृशंस्येन तेजसा राघवस्य च।।5.53.38।।पितुश्च मम सख्येन न मां दहति पावकः।
explanation: 'Because of Sita's steadfast loyalty, Rama's power and my father's friendship with the Firegod, the fire is not burning me.'

content: भूयस्स चिन्तयामास मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः।।5.53.39।।उत्पपाताथ वेगेन ननाद च महाकपिः।
explanation: Once more a thought came to the great Hanuman,the elephant among monkeys. He sprang up and shouted loud.

content: पुरद्वारं ततश्श्रीमान् शैलशृङ्गमिवोन्नतम्।।5.53.40।।विभक्तरक्षस्सम्बाधमाससादानिलात्मजः।
explanation: Then the illustrious Hanuman reached the entrance of the lofty city, which was  like the peak of a mountain and turned away the demons.

content: स भूत्वा शैलसङ्काशः क्षणेन पुनरात्मवान्।।5.53.41।।ह्रस्वतां परमां प्राप्तो बन्धनान्यवशातयत्।
explanation: From his mountainlike form he assumed his original small figure within a moment casting off the bonds.

content: विमुक्तश्चाभवछ्रचीमान् पुनः पर्वतसन्निभः।।5.53.42।।वीक्षमाणश्च ददृशे परिघं तोरणाश्रितम्।
explanation: Illustrious Hanuman was relieved of the bond and once again grew to a mountain size. Looking around he saw an iron club near the archway.

content: स तं गृह्य महाबाहुः कालायसपरिष्कृतम्।।5.53.43।।रक्षिणस्तान् पुनस्सर्वान्सूदयामास मारुतिः।
explanation: Seizing the black Iron club again, the strongarmed Hanuman killed all the demon guards.

content: स तान्निहत्त्वा रणचण्डविक्रम स्समीक्षमाणः पुनरेव लङ्काम्।प्रदीप्तलाङ्गूलकृतार्चिमाली प्रकाशतादित्य इवार्चिमाली।।5.53.44।।
explanation: Hanuman, who was of fearsome valour in war with the demons, having killed them, gazed at Lanka once again. Garlanded by the flames of his tail around, he shone like the Sun covered with garlands of rays. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman destroys the Ashoka garden -- sets fire to Lanka -- kills demons]वीक्षमाणस्ततो लङ्कां कपिः कृतमनोरथः।।5.54.1।।वर्धमानसमुत्साहः कार्यशेषमचिन्तयत्।
explanation: With his objectives achieved, the monkey gazed at Lanka with growing zeal and pondered over the remaining work.

content: किन्नु खल्ववशिष्टं मे कर्तव्यमिह साम्प्रतम्।।5.54.2।।यदेषां रक्षसां भूयः सन्तापजननं भवेत्।
explanation: 'Is there anything still left which can further torment the demons here?

content:
वनं तावत्प्रमथितं प्रकृष्टा राक्षसा हताः।।5.54.3।

बलैकदेशः क्षपितश्शेषं दुर्गविनाशनम्।
explanation: 'All the trees of the garden are broken, powerful demons have been killed, and a contingent of the army is destroyed. Only the destruction of the citadel is left.

content: दुर्गे विनाशिते कर्म भवेत्सुखपरिश्रमम्।अल्पयत्नेन कार्येऽस्मिन् मम स्यात्सफलश्श्रमः।।5.54.4।।
explanation: 'If the citadel is destroyed it would be a happy conclusion with a little effort. I can successfully complete my task.

content: यो ह्ययं मम लाङ्गूले दीप्यते हव्यवाहनः।अस्य सन्तर्पणं न्याय्यं कर्तुमेभिर्गृहोत्तमैः।।5.54.5।।
explanation: 'It would be proper to satiate this fire at the end of my tail  by offering it to these excellent mansions (I shall set fire to these houses).

content: ततः प्रदीप्तलाङ्गूलस्सविद्युदिव तोयदः।भवनाग्रेषु लङ्काया विचचार महाकपिः।।5.54.6।।
explanation: The great Hanuman, with his burning tail wandered on tops of the mansions of Lanka, which looked like clouds with lightning.

content: गृहाद्गृहं राक्षसानामुद्यानानि च वानरः।वीक्षमाणो ह्यसन्त्रस्तः प्रासादांश्च चचार सः।।5.54.7।।
explanation: The vanara moved from one house to the other, looking at the gardens and houses of the demons without fear.

content: अवप्लुत्य महावेगः प्रहस्तस्य निवेशनम्।अग्निं तत्र स निक्षिप्य श्वसनेन समो बली।।5.54.8।।ततोऽन्यत्पुप्लुवे वेश्म महापार्श्वस्य वीर्यवान्।मुमोच हनुमानग्निं कालानलशिखोपमम्।।5.54.9।।
explanation: Powerful and brave Hanuman who was equal to the Windgod in speed jumped down on the house of Prahasta and set fire to it. From there he jumped on to Mahaparsva's house and set it ablaze. Hanuman appeared like the fireflame at the time of dissolution.

content: वज्रदंष्ट्रस्य च तदा पुप्लुवे स महाकपिः।शुकस्य च महातेजास्सारणस्य च धीमतः।।5.54.10।।
explanation: The great, brilliant vanara bounded on to Vajradamstra's, of Suka's and wise Sarana's.

content: तथा चेन्द्रजितो वेश्म ददाह हरियूथपः।जम्बुमाले स्सुमालेश्च ददाह भवनं ततः।।5.54.11।।
explanation: Thus Hanuman, the chief of the vanaras set fire to Indrajit's residence and then to Jambumali's and Sumali's building.

content: रश्मिकेतोश्च भवनं सूर्यशत्रोस्तथैव च।ह्रस्वकर्णस्य दंष्ट्रस्य रोमशस्य च रक्षसः।।5.54.12।।युद्धोन्मत्तस्य मत्तस्य ध्वजग्रीवस्य रक्षसः।विद्युज्जिह्वस्य घोरस्य तथा हस्तिमुखस्य च।।5.54.13।।करालस्य पिशाचस्य शोणिताक्षस्य चैव हि।कुम्भकर्णस्य भवनं मकराक्षस्य चैव हि।।5.54.14।।यज्ञशत्रोश्च भवनं ब्रह्मशत्रोस्तथैव च।नरान्तकस्य कुम्भस्य निकुम्भस्य दुरात्मनः।।5.54.15।।वर्जयित्वा महातेजा विभीषणगृहं प्रति।क्रममाणः क्रमेणैव ददाह हरिपुङ्गवः।।5.54.16।।
explanation: The brilliant monkey leader bypassed Vibhishanas's house and avoiding it that way set fire to the mansions of other ogres, Rasmiketu, Suryasatru, Hrasvakarna, Vajradamshtra, Romasa, Yuddhonmatta, Matta, Dhwajagriva, Vidyujjihva, Hastimukha, Karala, Pisacha, Sonitaksha, Kumbhakarna, Makaraksha, Yagnasatru, Brahmasatru, Naranthaka, Kumbha, and wicked Nikumbha.

content: तेषु तेषु महार्हेषु भवनेषु महायशाः।गृहेष्वृद्धिमतामृद्धिं ददाह स महाकपिः।।5.54.17।।
explanation: Moving among those highly luxurious mansions the glorious Vanara burnt away the wealth of all the rich demons.

content: सर्वेषां समतिक्रम्य राक्षसेन्द्रस्य वीर्यवान्।आससादाथ लक्ष्मीवान् रावणस्य निवेशनम्।।5.54.18।।
explanation: Heroic and illustrious Hanuman, having crossed all the residences of the ogres finally reached the palace of Ravana, the king.

content: ततस्तस्मिन्गृहे मुख्ये नानारत्नविभूषिते।मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशे सर्वमङ्गळशोभिते।।5.54.19।।प्रदीप्तमग्निमुत्सृज्य लाङ्गूलाग्रे प्रतिष्ठितम्।ननाद हनुमान्वीरो युगान्तजलदो यथा।।5.54.20।।
explanation: Then Hanuman, the hero with the burning tail set fire to the chief palace of Ravana that resembled mountains Meru and Mandara, decorated with different kinds of gems and exquisite with several auspicious articles. While the flames were rising up, he roared like the thundering cloud at the time of dissolution.

content: श्वसनेन च संयोगादतिवेगो महाबलः।कालाग्निरिव जज्वाल प्रावर्धत हुताशनः।।5.54.21।।
explanation: The windgod's association made the fire spread at great speed. It appeared like fire at the time of dissolution.

content: प्रदीप्तमग्निं पवनस्तेषु वेश्मस्वचारयत्।अभूच्छ्वसनसंयोगादतिवेगो हुताशनः।।5.54.22।।
explanation: Combined with the wind the fire began to spread, burning the houses with great speed.

content: तानि काञ्चनजालानि मुक्तामणिमयानि च।भवनान्यवशीर्यन्त रत्नवन्ति महान्ति च।।5.54.23।।
explanation: The palatial structures with windows of golden meshwork, embedded with pearls and gems and other precious stones tumbled.

content: संजज्ञे तुमुलश्शब्दो राक्षसानां प्रधावताम्।स्वगृहस्य परित्राणे भग्नोत्साहोर्जितश्रियाम्।।5.54.24।।नूनमेषोऽग्निरायातः कपिरूपेण हा इति।
explanation: Unable to protect their rich houses, and thoroughly disappointed the demons said, 'Alas, the Firegod came in the form of a vanara' A tumultuous sound arose.

content: क्रन्दन्त्यस्सहसा पेतुः स्तनन्धयधराः स्त्रियः।।5.54.25।।काश्चिदग्निपरीतेभ्यो हर्मेभ्यो मुक्तमूर्धजाः।पतन्त्यो रेजिरेऽभ्रेभ्यस्सौदामन्य इवाम्बरात्।।5.54.26।।
explanation: A few shedemons at once jumped out of their burning mansions surrounded by fire. They held their breastfeeding babies in their arms, their hair let loose shouting as they jumped. As they were alighting, they glowed like lightnings dropping from the clouds.

content: वज्रविद्रुमवैदूर्यमुक्तारजतसंहितान्।विचित्रान्भवनाद्धातून् स्यन्दमानान्ददर्श सः।।5.54.27।।
explanation: Hanuman saw many colourful molten minerals mixed with diamonds, corals vaiduryas, pearls and silver flowing (dropping) from every mansion.

content: नाग्निस्तृप्यति काष्ठानां तृणानां च यथा तथा।हनूमान् राक्षसेन्दाणां विशस्तानां न तृप्यति।।5.54.28।।
explanation: Just as fire is not satisfied with dry sticks and grass Hanuman was not satisfied with the dead demons.

content: क्वचित्किंशुकसङ्काशाः क्वचिच्छाल्मलिसन्निभाः।।5.54.29।।क्वचित्कुङ्कुमसङ्काशाश्शिखा वह्नेश्चकाशिरे।
explanation: The flames of fire were shining like kimsuka flowers here, like salmali wood there, and like saffron flowers elsewhere.

content: हनूमता वेगवता वानरेण महात्मना।लङ्कापुरं प्रदग्धं तद्रुद्रेण त्रिपुरं यथा।।5.54.30।।
explanation: Hanuman, endowed with great speed, burnt Lanka just as Tripurari, or Rudra burnt theTripuras (three cities of gold, silver and iron).

content: ततस्तु लङ्कापुरपर्वताग्रे समुत्थितो भीमपराक्रमोऽग्निः।प्रसार्य चूडावलयं प्रदीप्तो हनूमता वेगवता विसृष्टः।।5.54.31।।
explanation: The fierce fire lit by Hanuman, the hero endowed with great speed, spread around in circles and shot up flying high to the top of the Trikuta mountain on which Lanka was located.

content: युगान्तकालानलतुल्यवेग स्समारुतोऽग्निर्ववृधे दिविस्पृक्।विधूमरश्मिर्भवनेषु सक्तो रक्षश्शरीराज्यसमर्पतार्चिः।।5.54.32।।
explanation: Fanned by the wind, inflamed by the fat from the corpses of the demons, the fire spread in the mansions burning without smoke. It spread with great speed like the fire at the end of the universe.

content: आदित्यकोटीसदृशस्सुतेजा लङ्कां समस्तां परिवार्य तिष्ठन्।शब्दैरनेकैरशनिप्ररूढैर्भिन्दन्निवाण्डं प्रबभौ महाग्निः।।5.54.33।।
explanation: The highly radiant fire stood like a crore of Suns surrounding the entire Lanka. It was glowing, cracking like Indra's thunderbolt as though the whole universe was collapsing.

content: तत्राम्बरादग्निरतिप्रवृद्धो रूक्षप्रभः किंशुकपुष्पचूडः।निर्वाणधूमाकुलराजयश्च नीलोत्पलाभाः प्रचकाशिरेऽभ्राः।।5.54.34।।
explanation: The dazzling flames of fire red like kimsuka flowers shot up violently into the sky. The clouds engulfed by the smoke rising from the subsiding fire was shining like the lustre of blue lotuses .

content: वज्री महेन्द्रस्त्रिदशेश्वरो वा साक्षाद्यमो वा वरुणोऽनिलो वा।रुद्रोऽग्निरर्को धनदश्च सोमो न वानरोऽयं स्वयमेव कालः।।5.54.35।।
explanation: 'Is this the wielder of thunderbolt Indra, who is the king of gods? Is it Yama himself? Is It the Windgod, or Firegod, or Varuna or Rudra? Is it Kubera or Sun or Moon or is it the god of death himself? He cannot be a mere monkey, indeed.

content: किं ब्रह्मणस्सर्वपितामहस्य सर्वस्य धातुश्चतुराननस्य।इहाऽऽगतो वानररूपधारी रक्षोपसंहारकरः प्रकोपः।।5.54.36।।
explanation: 'Or is it Grandfather Brahma, the supreme fourfaced god enraged and arrived in the form of vanara to kill the clan of demons?

content: किं वैष्णवं वा कपिरूपमेत्य रक्षोविनाशाय परं सुतेजः।अनन्तमव्यक्तमचिन्त्यमेकं स्वमायया साम्प्रतमागतं वा।।5.54.37।।
explanation: 'Can he be the vast boundless energy, the unthinkable and infinite lord Visnu assuming the monkeyform? Is he the peerless, unmanifest form beyond all imagination who has arrived here by virtue of his Maya (illusory power) in order to destroy the demons'?

content: इत्येवमूचुर्बहवो विशिष्टा रक्षोगणास्तत्र समेत्य सर्वे।सप्राणिसङ्घां सगृहां सवृक्षां दग्धां पुरीं तां सहसा समीक्ष्य।।5.54.38।।
explanation: All eminent demons having collected together, quickly surveyed the situation.Seeing the burnt city, with  all its living creatures, houses and trees consigned to the flames, they spoke to one another.

content: ततस्तु लङ्का सहसा प्रदग्धा सराक्षसा साश्वरथा सनागा।सपक्षिसङ्घा समृगा सवृक्षा रुरोद दीना तुमुलं सशब्दम्।।5.54.39।।
explanation: Lanka with its chariots horses, elephants, flocks of birds, animals and trees burnt all of a sudden, the ogres cried loudly and piteously.

content: हा तात हा पुत्रक कान्त मित्र हा जीवितं भोगयुतं सुपुण्यम्।रक्षोभिरेवं बहुधा ब्रुवद्भि श्शब्दः कृतो घोरतरस्सुभीमः।।5.54.40।।
explanation: "O father dear O son O my dear O friend alas, the life which is enjoyable, sacred and prosperous is destroyed in this way". Saying this, the demons cried out dreadfully and loudly.

content: हुताशनज्वालसमावृता सा हतप्रवीरा परिवृत्तयोधाहनूमतः क्रोधबलाभिभूता बभूव शापोपहतेव लङ्का।।5.54.41।।
explanation: With the Fire god spreading flames all over, heroes dead, retreating troops shattered by Hanuman's anger, Lanka appeared as though it was cursed.

content: स सम्भ्रमत्रस्तविषण्णराक्षसां समुज्ज्वलज्ज्वालहुताशनाङ्किताम्।ददर्श लङ्कां हनुमान्महामनाः स्वयम्भूकोपोपहतामिवावनिम्।।5.54.42।।
explanation: Highly sensitive Hanuman saw the city of Lanka filled with perplexed, scared and sorrowful demons, Lanka succumbed to the flames of firegod and looked as if it was  hit by the anger of Brahma, the selfborn god.

content: भङ्क्त्वा वनं पादपरत्नसङ्कुलं हत्वा तु रक्षांसि महान्ति संयुगे।दग्ध्वा पुरीं तां गृहरत्नमालिनीं तस्थौ हनूमान्पवनात्मजः कपिः।।5.54.43।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod stood at ease having shattered the garden that was full of excellent trees, and killed the demons and burnt down rows of beautiful houses in the city.

content: त्रिकूटशृङ्गाग्रतले विचित्रे प्रतिष्ठितो वानरराजसिंहः।प्रदीप्तलाङ्गूलकृतार्चिमाली व्यराजताऽऽदित्य इवांशुमाली।।5.54.44।।
explanation: Standing on the peak of Trikuta mountain with his tail burning like the aura of the Sun, the lion among vanaras looked resplendent like the Sun surrounded by his rays.

content: स राक्षसांस्तान्सुबहूंश्च हत्वा वनं च भङ्क्त्वा बहुपादपं तत्।विसृज्य रक्षोभवनेषु चाग्निं जगाम रामं मनसा महात्मा।।5.54.45।।
explanation: Great Hanuman, sought Rama's presence in his mind after killing many demons, breaking down many trees of the garden, and setting fire to the mansions of demons.

content: ततस्तु तं वानरवीरमुख्यं महाबलं मारुततुल्यवेगम्।महामतिं वायुसुतं वरिष्ठं प्रतुष्टुवुर्देवगणाश्च सर्वे।।5.54.46।।
explanation: All the gods praised the vanara chief, son of the Windgod, who was powerful, wise and efficient and had the speed of the Wind.

content: भङ्क्त्वा वनं महातेजा हत्वा रक्षांसि संयुगे।दग्ध्वा लङ्कापुरीं रम्यां रराज स महाकपिः।।5.54.47।।
explanation: Hanuman destroyed the garden, killed the demons, burnt the city of Lanka and was shining with delight

content: तत्र देवास्सगन्धर्वास्सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः।दृष्ट्वा लङ्कां प्रदग्धां तां विस्मयं परमं गताः।।5.54.48।।
explanation: The gandharvas, gods, siddhas and great sages were amazed at seeing the burning city of Lanka৷৷

content: तं दृष्ट्वा वानरश्रेष्ठं हनुमन्तं महाकपिम्।कालाग्निरिति सञ्चिन्त्य सर्वभूतानि तत्रसुः।।5.54.49।।
explanation: All beings were afraid of Hanuman thinking that he was the fatal fire, consuming worlds at the hour of dissolution .

content: देवाश्च सर्वे मुनिपुङ्गवाश्च गन्धर्वविद्याधरनागयक्षाः।भूतानि सर्वाणि महान्ति तत्र जग्मुः परां प्रीतिमतुल्यरूपाम्।।5.54.50।।
explanation: All gods, great sages, gandharvas, vidyadharas, nagas and yakshas and all great beings experienced supreme joy.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुःपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman perceiving the damage caused by him to the City of Lanka, thinks of Sita and begins to blame himself -- on seeing good omens he presumes that Sita would have been protected by her chastity]लङ्कां समस्तां सन्दीप्य लाङ्गूलाग्निं महाबलः।निर्वापयामास तदा समुद्रे हरिसत्तमः।।सन्दीप्यमानां विध्वस्तां त्रस्तरक्षोगणां पुरीम्।आवेक्ष्य हनुमान् लङ्कां चिन्तयामास वानरः।।5.55.1।।
explanation: Powerful Hanuman, having burnt the entire city of Lanka, put out the fire on his tail in the ocean. Beholding the burning city, the destroyed gardens and the panic stricken ogres, he began to think:

content: तस्याभूत्सुमहांस्त्रासः कुत्सा चात्मन्यजायत।लङ्कां प्रदहता कर्म किंस्वित्कृतमिदं मया।।5.55.2।।
explanation: Overtaken by great fear, Hanuman felt a sense of selfreproach seeing Lanka reduced to ashes, and said, ' Lanka is burnt. What a heinous action has been perpetrated by me'.

content: धन्यास्ते पुरुषश्रेष्ठा ये बुद्ध्या कोपमुत्थितम्।निरुन्धन्ति महात्मानो दीप्तमग्निमिवाम्भसा।।5.55.3।।
explanation: 'Blessed indeed are the highsouled men, who in their wisdom restrain their own anger as one would put off  burning fire with water.

content: क्रुद्धः पापं न कुर्यात्कः क्रुद्धो हन्याद्गुरूनपि।क्रुद्धः परुषया वाचा नरस्साधूनधिक्षिपेत्।।5.55.4।।
explanation: 'Which sinful act an angry man will not commit? He will even kill his respectable elders or insult sages with his harsh tongue.

content:
वाच्यावाच्यं प्रकुपितो न विजानाति कर्हिचित्।

नाकार्यमस्ति क्रुद्धस्य नावाच्यं विद्यते क्वचित्।।5.55.5।।
explanation: 'An angry person knows not what he should utter and what he should not. No act appears wrong for an angry man. Nothing is unutterable for him at any time, anywhere.

content:
यस्समुत्पतितं क्रोधं क्षमयैव निरस्यति।

यथोरगस्त्वचं जीर्णां स वै पुरुष उच्यते।।5.55.6।।
explanation: 'A man who drives away his rising anger with tolerance just as a snake casts off its slough is alone called a truly wise man.

content: धिगस्तु मां सुदुर्बुद्धिं निर्लज्जं पापकृत्तमम्।अचिन्तयित्वा तां सीतामग्निदं स्वामिघातुकम्।।5.55.7।।
explanation: 'Fie upon me, a wicked, shameless person and the greatest sinner for betraying the  master and setting fire to the city without thinking of Sita.

content: यदि दग्धा त्वियं लङ्का नूनमार्याऽपि जानकी।दग्धा तेन मया भर्तुर्हितं कार्यमजानता।।5.55.8।।
explanation: 'If this Lanka is burnt, even noble Janaki is burnt, my master's work is spoilt by me unknowingly.

content: यदर्थमयमारम्भस्तत्कार्यमवसादितम्।मया हि दहता लङ्कां न सीता परिरक्षिता।।5.55.9।।
explanation: 'My very mission is foiled. Sita has not been protected by me for no part of Lanka has escaped unburnt.

content:
ईषत्कार्यमिदं कार्यं कृतमासीन्न संशयः।

तस्य क्रोधाभिभूतेन मया मूलक्षयः कृतः।।5.55.10।।
explanation: 'A small work is done, no doubt. But the very root of my achievement has been destroyed in my anger.

content: विनष्टा जानकी नूनं न ह्यदग्धः प्रदृश्यते।लङ्कायां कश्चिदुद्धेशस्सर्वा भस्मीकृता पुरी।।5.55.11।।
explanation: 'Surely Janaki has perished in Lanka, for not even a little place is left unburnt. The entire city is reduced to ashes.

content: यदि तद्विहतं कार्यं मम प्रज्ञाविपर्ययात्।इहैव प्राणसंन्यासो ममापि ह्यद्य रोचते।।5.55.12।।
explanation: 'If my work has been destroyed by my perversity of judgement, I will give up my life now  and here itself'.

content: किमग्नौ निपताम्यद्य आहोस्विद्बडबामुखे।शरीरमाहो सत्त्वानां दद्मि सागरवासिनाम्।।5.55.13।।
explanation: 'Shall I end my life by jumping into fire just now, or else into the mouth of submarine fire? Should I offer my body to the living creatures of the ocean as their food?

content: कथं हि जीवता शक्यो मया द्रष्टुं हरीश्वरः।तौ वा पुरुषशार्दूलौ कार्यसर्वस्वघातिना।।5.55.14।।
explanation: 'Having spoilt the entire work how can I show my face to the king of monkeys? How is it possible to see both the tigers among men?

content: मया खलु तदेवेदं रोषदोषात्प्रदर्शितम्।प्रथितं त्रिषु लोकेषु कपित्वमनवस्थितम्।।5.55.15।।
explanation: 'On account of my mistake of yielding to anger, I have exhibited the unstable monkeynature and made it well established in the three worlds.

content: धिगस्तु राजसं भावमनीशमनवस्थितम्।ईश्वरेणापि यद्रागान्मया सीता न रक्षिता।।5.55.16।।
explanation: 'Fie upon my hasty action commited due to lack of selfcontrol. I did not save Sita eventhough the entire situation was under my control. (I had the  capacity to save her. But I failed due to anger.)

content: विनष्टायां तु सीतायां तावुभौ विनशिष्यतः।तयोर्विनाशे सुग्रीवः सबन्धुर्विनशिष्यति।।5.55.17।।
explanation: 'If the two princes know about Sita's loss they will die and when they are dead Sugriva would perish along with all his relatives.

content: एतदेव वचश्श्रुत्वा भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः।धर्मात्मा सहशत्रुघ्नः कथं शक्ष्यति जीवितुम्।।5.55.18।।
explanation: 'How will the loving righteous brother, Bharata along with Satrughna survive after hearing this?

content: इक्ष्वाकुवंशे धर्मिष्ठे गते नाशमसंशयम्।भविष्यन्ति प्रजास्सर्वाश्शोकसन्तापपीडिताः।।5.55.19।।
explanation: 'When the righteous Ikshvaku race perishes the people would be tormented by grief and remorse. There is no doubt.

content: तदहं भाग्यरहितो लुप्तधर्मार्थसङ्ग्रहः।।5.55.20।।रोषदोषपरीतात्मा व्यक्तं लोकविनाशनः।
explanation: 'I have failed in seeking dharma and artha. It is evident is that I am a destroyer of the world because I was overtaken by anger. How unfortunate I am'

content: इति चिन्तयतस्तस्य निमित्तान्युपपेदिरे।पूर्वमप्युपलब्धानि साक्षात्पुनरचिन्तयत्।।5.55.21।।
explanation: When Hanuman was thus bemoaning, good omens as in the past appeared before him. He started reflecting once again:

content: अथवा चारुसर्वाङ्गी रक्षिता स्वेन तेजसा।न नशिष्यति कल्याणी नाग्निरग्नौ प्रवर्तते।।5.55.22।।
explanation: 'On the other hand a beautiful and auspicious lady like Sita will be protected by her own splendour and will not perish as fire cannot extinguish fire. (Sita is pure like fire. Here the great sage Valmiki is suggesting the future incident in which Sita emerged safe from 'Agnipariksha' or fireordeal.)

content: न हि धर्मात्मनस्तस्य भार्याममिततेजसः।स्वचारित्राभिगुप्तां तां स्प्रष्टुमर्हति पावकः।।5.55.23।।
explanation: 'Fire cannot touch that lady who is protected by her own chastity and who is wedded to the righteous man of immasureable glory.

content: नूनं रामप्रभावेण वैदेह्यास्सुकृतेन च।यन्मां दहनकर्मायं नादहद्धव्यवाहनः।।5.55.24।।
explanation: 'Fire, the consumer of oblations who has the property of burning has not burnt me and this is surely on account of Rama's power and Vaidehi's merits.

content: त्रयाणां भरतादीनां भ्रात्रूणां देवता च या।रामस्य च मन: कान्ता सा कथं विनशिष्यति।।5.55.25।।
explanation: 'To Bharata, Lakshmana and Satrughna she is a goddess and she is dear to Rama's heart, how would she perish?

content: यद्वा दहनकर्मायं सर्वत्र प्रभुरव्ययः।न मे दहति लाङ्गूलं कथमार्यां प्रधक्ष्यति।।5.55.26।
explanation: 'If not so, the firegod who never fails in burning has not burnt my tail. How will he burn noble Sita?'

content: पुनश्चाचिन्तयत्तत्र हनुमान्विस्मितस्तदा।हिरण्यनाभस्य गिरेर्जलमध्ये प्रदर्शनम्।।5.55.27।।
explanation: Then Hanuman thought of the appearance of mountain Hiranyanabha in the midst of water, a wonderful phenomenon.

content: तपसा सत्यवाक्येन अनन्यत्वाच्च भर्तरि।अपि सा निर्दहेदग्निं न तामग्निः प्रधक्ष्यति।।5.55.28।।
explanation: 'By virtue of her power of asceticism, power of truthfulness and exclusive devotion towards her husband, she may consume the fire. Fire will not burn her'.

content: स तथा चिन्तयंस्तत्र देव्या धर्मपरिग्रहम्।शुश्राव हनुमान्वाक्यं चारणानां महात्मनाम्।।5.55.29।।
explanation: As Hanuman was thinking so, he heard the words of the great charanas who were praising the queen's power of righteousness.

content: अहो खलु कृतं कर्म दुष्करं हि हनूमता।अग्निं विसृजताऽभीक्ष्णं भीमं राक्षसवेश्मनि।।5.55.30।।
explanation: 'Oh Hanuman has indeed accomplished the marvellous task of spreading the terrific fire on the demons buildings.

content: प्रपलायितरक्षः स्त्रीबालवृद्धसमाकुला।जनकोलाहलाध्माता क्रन्दन्तीवाद्रिकन्दरै: ।।5.55.31।।
explanation: The city is crowded with women, children and old demons running (in a bid to save themselves). The loud wails of demons resounded in the mountaincaves. It was as if the city was shrieking loudly.

content: दग्धेयं नगरी सर्वा साट्टप्राकारतोरणा।जानकी न च दग्धेति विस्मयोऽद्भुत एव नः।।5.55.32।।
explanation: 'The city with its towering markets, ramparts and portals is burnt, but Janaki is not. It is really wonderful, strange

content: स निमित्तैश्च दृष्टार्थैः कारणैश्च महागुणैः।ऋषिवाक्यैश्च हनुमानभवत्प्रीतमानसः।।5.55.33।।
explanation: With omens that proved to be right and for good reasons and from the words of the sages (charanas), Hanuman felt happy.

content: ततः कपिः प्राप्तमनोरथार्थस्तामक्षतां राजसुतां विदित्वा।प्रत्यक्षतस्तां पुनरेव दृष्टवा प्रतिप्रयाणाय मतिं चकार।।5.55.34।।
explanation: Hanuman, having fulfilled his desires and knowing that Sita is not hurt, thought of departing after meeting Sita once again (to testify that she is really safe).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda  of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman takes leave of Sita -- sets out for the northern shore -- Description of Arishta mountain]ततस्तु शिंशुपामूले जानकीं पर्युपस्थिताम्।अभिवाद्याब्रवीद्दिष्ट्या पश्यामि त्वामिहाक्षताम्।।5.56.1।।
explanation: Then Hanuman offered salutations to Janaki, stationed at the foot of the simsupa tree, and said, "Luckily I see you unscathed."

content: ततस्तं प्रस्थितं सीता वीक्षमाणा पुनः पुनः।भर्तृस्नेहान्वितं वाक्यं हनुमन्तमभाषत।।5.56.2।।
explanation: Looking at Hanuman again and again, as he was ready to start on his return journey, thus spoke Sita expressing her love for her husband:

content: काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने।पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते बलोदयः।।5.56.3।।
explanation: "O destroyer of foes, you are capable of rescuing me singlehanded. Your success will  raise your strength and bring glory.

content: शरैस्तु सङ्कुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः।मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थस्तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत्।।5.56.4।।
explanation: "If Kakutstha Rama, the slayer of enemy forces comes to Lanka, fills it with his arrows and takes me back, it will be worthy of him.

content: तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः।भवत्याहवशूरस्य तथा त्वमुपपादय।।5.56.5।।
explanation: "You should act in such a manner that the exalted Rama, who is chivalrous in the battlefield, exhibits his valour worthy of his stature".

content: तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम्।निशम्य हनुमांस्तस्या वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.56.6।।
explanation: Hearing her meaningful reply which was welldisposed and reasonable, Hanuman replied:

content: क्षिप्रमेष्यति काकुत्स्थः हर्यृक्षप्रवरैर्वृतः।यस्ते युधि विजित्यारीन् शोकं व्यपनयिष्यति।।5.56.7।।
explanation: "Rama will come soon with the best of vanaras and bears. He would win the battle and remove your sorrrow.

content: एवमाश्वास्य वैदेहीं हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।गमनाय मतिं कृत्वा वैदेहीमभ्यवादयत्।।5.56.8।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod having consoled Vaidehi, saluted her respectfully and decided to depart.

content: ततस्स कपिशार्दूलः स्वामिसन्दर्शनोत्सुकः।आरुरोह गिरिश्रेष्ठमरिष्टमरिमर्दनः।।5.56.9।।
explanation: Then Hanuman, the crusher of enemies, a tiger among vanaras anxious to see his lord ascended the mount Arishta.

content: तुङ्गपद्मकजुष्टाभिर्नीलाभिर्वनराजिभिः।सोत्तरीयमिवाम्भोदैः शृंगान्तरविलम्बिभिः।।5.56.10।।
explanation: Mount Arishta was full of blue forestranges with choicest tall padmaka trees. With clouds hanging on the slopes of mountain peaks, it appeared as though the mountain was wrapped in an upper garment.

content: बोध्यमानमिव प्रीत्या दिवाकरकरैश्शुभैः।उन्मिषन्तमिवोद्धूतैर्लोचनैरिव धातुभिः।।5.56.11।।
explanation: As if the mountain was awakened from sleep by the rays of the blessed Sun. With the colour of glowing minerals exuding, it was as if the mountain was looking out with his eyes open. (The minerals underneath the mud appear when wind blows removing the dust covering them. The glowing minerals are fancied to be eyes of the mountain.)

content: तोयौघननिस्स्वनैर्मन्द्रैः प्राधीतमिव पर्वतम्।प्रगीतमिव विस्पष्टैर्नानाप्रस्रवणस्वनैः।।5.56.12।।
explanation: With the loud sounds of masses of gurgling waters, the mountain appeared as though it was standing and reciting (the Vedas) loudly. With murmuring sounds of different waterfalls, it appeared as though the mountain was singing. (The sage differentiates the steadily trickling watersound from the rhythmic musical sounds of waterfalls.)

content: देवदारुभिरत्युच्चैरूर्ध्वबाहुमिव स्थितम्।प्रपातजलनिर्घोषैः प्राक्रुष्टमिव सर्वतः।।5.56.13।।
explanation: With the tall devadaru trees on the mountain, it appeared as if the sages were standing with shoulders lifted up and performing penance. The sounds of waterfalls filled all over with reverberations.

content: वेपमानमिव श्यामैः कम्पमानैश्शरद्वनैः।वेणुभिर्मारुतोद्धूतैः कूजन्तमिव कीचकैः।।5.56.14।।
explanation: The mountain appeared as if trembling with the dark clouds of autumn. The shrill sounds pasing through the hollow bamboos filled with air appeared as if it was producing sweet musical notes.

content: निश्श्वसन्तमिवामर्षाद्घोरैराशीविषोत्तमैः।नीहारकृतगम्भीरैर्ध्यायन्तमिव गह्वरैः।।5.56.15।।
explanation: The mountain was as though hissing like a dreadful, poisonous snake. With the caves standing majestically covered with mist, the mountain appeared as if it was meditating.

content: मेघपादनिभैः पादैः प्रक्रान्तमिव सर्वतः।जृंम्भमाणमिवाऽकाशे शिखरैरभ्रमालिभिः।।5.56.16।।
explanation: With the ranges of foothills appearing like the feet of clouds traversing, with its peaks like garlands of clouds traversing over the mountain, it made one feel it was yawning.

content: कूटैश्च बहुधा कीर्णैश्शोभितं बहुकन्दरैः।सालतालाश्वकर्णैश्च वंशैश्च बहुभिर्वृतम्।।5.56.17।।
explanation: With many kinds of caves and peaks scattered all over, the mountain looked delightful. It was canopied with numerous trees like Sal, palms, Aswakarnas and bamboos.

content: लतावितानैर्विततैः पुष्पवद्भिरलङ्कृतम्।नानामृगगणाकीर्णं धातुनिष्यन्दभूषितम्।।5.56.18।।
explanation: It was spread with creepers filled with beautiful flowers and herds of animals. The colourful minerals flowing down decorated the mountain.

content: बहुप्रस्रवणोपेतं शिलासञ्चयसङ्कटम्।महर्षियक्षगन्धर्वकिन्नरोरगसेवितम्।।5.56.19।।
explanation: There were many streams of water flowing and rocks making it difficult for the streams to flow. The mountain was inhabited by sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas, and uragas.

content: लतापादपसङ्घातं सिंहाध्युषितकन्दरम्।व्याघ्रसङ्घसमाकीर्णं स्वादुमूलफलद्रुमम्।।5.56.20।।
explanation: The clusters of creepers, and trees bearing tasty fruits and roots were uprooted. There were caves inhabited by lions. Herds of tigers were scattered all over (by the impetus of Hanuman's pressure on the mountain).

content: तमारुरोह हनुमान् पर्वतं पवनात्मजः।रामदर्शनशीघ्रेण प्रहर्षेणाभिचोदितः।।5.56.21।।
explanation: Anxious to see Rama soon, the son of the Windgod ascended the mountain happily.

content: तेन पादतलाक्रान्ता रम्येषु गिरिसानुषु।सघोषास्समशीर्यन्त शिलाश्चूर्णीकृतास्ततः।।5.56.22।।
explanation: Crushed under Hanuman's feet the rocks making a loud noise on the beautiful mountain ranges rolled down, reduced to powder.

content: स तमारुह्य शैलेन्द्रं व्यवर्धत महाकपिः।दक्षिणादुत्तरं पारं प्रार्थयन् लवणाम्भसः।।5.56.23।।
explanation: On ascending the king of mountains, desiring to reach the northern shore of the saltwater ocean from the Southern shore, he enlarged his body (in preparation to leap).

content: अधिरुह्य ततो वीरः पर्वतं पवनात्मजः।ददर्श सागरं भीमं मीनोरगनिषेवितम्।।5.56.24।।
explanation: Then the heroic son of the Windgod, who had ascended the mountain saw the dreadful ocean inhabited by fishes and snakes.

content: स मारुत इवाऽकाशं मारुतस्यात्मसम्भवः।प्रपेदे हरिशार्दूलो दक्षिणादुत्तरां दिशम्।।5.56.25।।
explanation: Hanuman, the tiger among monkeys leaped into the sky like the Windgod from the south to the north shore.

content: स तदा पीडितस्तेन कपिना पर्वतोत्तमः।ररास सह तैर्भूतैः प्रविशन्वसुधातलम्।।5.56.26।।कम्पमानैश्च शिखरैः पतद्भिरपि च द्रुमैः।
explanation: Pressed under the feet of Hanuman, the great mountain made loud sound sinking into the earth along with all its creatures, with its shaken mountain peaks and uprooted trees dropping down.

content: तस्योरुवेगोन्मथिताः पादपाः पुष्पशालिनः।।5.56.27।।निपेतुर्भूतले रुग्णाश्शक्रायुधहता इव।
explanation: Shaken by the violent force of Hanuman's thighs, the blossoming trees fell on the ground like sickmen hit by Indra's thunderbolt.

content: कन्दरान्तरसंस्थानां पीडितानां महौजसाम्।।5.56.28।।सिंहानां निनदो भीमो नभो भिन्दन् स शुश्रुवे।
explanation: The dreadful roar of strong lions, lying in mountaincaves was heard cracking the sky when they were crushed in the turmoil.

content: त्रस्तव्यावृत्तवसना व्याकुलीकृतभूषणाः।।5.56.29।।विद्याधर्यः समुत्पेतुस्सहसा धरणीधरात्।
explanation: The Vidyadharis with their clothes slipped and ornaments disarrayed in fear, at once flew from the mountain.

content: अतिप्रमाणा बलिनो दीप्तजिह्वा महाविषाः।।5.56.30।।निपीडितशिरोग्रीवा व्यचेष्टन्त महाहयः।
explanation: Highly powerful, huge and poisonous snakes with their glowing tongues protruded, pressed on their heads and necks (by Hanuman).

content: किन्नरोरगन्धर्वयक्षविद्याधरास्तदा।।5.56.31।।पीडितं तं नगवरं त्यक्त्वा गगनमास्थिता:।
explanation: Then the kinnaras, uragas, gandhravas, yakshas and vidyadharas left the tortured mountain and occupied the sky.

content: स च भूमिधरः श्रीमान्बलिना तेन पीडितः।।5.56.32।।सवृक्षशिखरोदग्रः प्रविवेश रसातलम्।
explanation: Crushed by the powerful Hanuman, that prosperous mountain with its trees standing and tall peaks sank into the underworld.

content: दशयोजनविस्तारस्त्रिंशद्योजनमुच्छ्रितः।।5.56.33।।धरण्यां समतां यातः स बभूव धराधरः।
explanation: That mountain of ten yojanas in width and thirty yojanas in height got levelled with the earth.

content: स लिलङ्घयिषुर्भीमं सलीलं लवणार्णवम्।।5.56.34।।कल्लोलास्फालवेलान्तमुत्पपात नभो हरिः।
explanation: Eager to leap the terrific ocean lashed by huge waves hitting the shore Hanuman rose up effortlessly and jumped into the sky.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the  fiftysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman reaches the northern shore -- announces to vanaras, Angada and Jambavan about his seeing Sita -- every one rejoices to hear the news of Sita.]स चन्द्रकुमुदं रम्यं सार्ककारण्डवं शुभम्।तिष्यश्रवणकादम्बमभ्रशैवालशाद्वलम्।।5.57.1।।पुनर्वसुमहामीनं लोहिताङ्गमहाग्रहम्।ऐरावतमहाद्वीपं स्वातिहंसविलोलितम्।।5.57.2।।वातसङ्घातजातोर्मि चन्द्रांशुशिशिराम्बुमत्।भुजङ्गयक्षगन्धर्वप्रबुद्धकमलोत्पलम्।।5.57.3।।हनुमान्मारुतगतिर्महानौरिव सागरम्।अपारमपरिश्रान्तः पुप्लुवे गगनार्णवम् ।।5.57.4।।
explanation: Hanuman leaped ike the Windgod, unwearied across the sky, as a huge boat crosses an ocean. The ocean was graced with a swan, the sky with constellation of Swati with fullblown lotuses and water lilies, like the nagas, yakshas, and gandharvas gathered together. The Moon in the sky was like a white lotus, the Sun like a waterfowl, the auspicious Tishya and Shravana like the sweetvoiced swans, and the clouds like duckweeds and green grassy spots on the shore. The Punarvasu star was like a large fish and the planet Mars was like a crocodile. Airavata was like the great island. The waves produced by the wind were like cool moonlight in the cold water.

content: ग्रसमान इवाकाशं ताराधिपमिवोल्लिखन्।हरन्निव सनक्षत्रं गगनं सार्कमण्डलम्।।5.57.5।।मारुतस्यात्मजः श्रीमान्कपिर्व्योमचरो महान्।हनुमान्मेघजालानि विकर्षन्निव गच्छति।।5.57.6।।
explanation: Great Hanuman, son of the Windgod, flew through the abode of the Windgod as if he was swallowing the space, scratching the  Moon, lord of the stars, as if seizing the heavens along with the constellation of Sun and stars and as though he was drawing the clusters of clouds.

content: पाण्डुरारुणवर्णानि नीलमाञ्जिष्ठकानि च।हरितारुणवर्णानि महाभ्राणि चकाशिरे।।5.57.7।।
explanation: (In contact with Hanuman) the clouds shone forth brilliantly in white and black, in blue and yellow and in greenish red colour.

content: प्रविशन्नभ्रजालानि निष्पतंश्च पुनः पुनः।प्रच्छन्नश्च प्रकाशश्च चन्द्रमा इव लक्ष्यते।।5.57.8।।
explanation: With his exist and entrances into the mass of clouds, his appearances and disappearances among the clouds, he looked like the Moon.

content: विविधाभ्रघनापन्नगोचरो धवलाम्बरः।दृश्यादृश्यतनुर्वीरस्तदा चन्द्रायतेऽम्बरे।।5.57.9।।
explanation: Passing through the clouds, appearing and disappearing, the heroic Hanuman clad in white was like the Moon in the white sky.

content: तार्क्ष्यायमाणो गगने बभासे वायुनन्दनः।दारयन्मेघबृन्दानि निष्पतंश्च पुनः पुनः।।5.57.10।।नदन्नादेन महता मेघस्वनमहास्वनः।
explanation: As he made his way through flakes of clouds, again and again appearing and disappearing, Hanuman the delight of the Windgod shone in the sky roaring like a thundering cloud. He looked like Garuda.

content: प्रवरान्राक्षसान् हत्वा नाम विश्राव्य चात्मनः।।5.57.11।।आकुलां नगरीं कृत्वा व्यथयित्वा च रावणम्।अर्दयित्वा बलं घोरं वैदेहीमभिवाद्य च।।5.57.12।।आजगाम महातेजाः पुनर्मध्येन सागरम्।
explanation: The glorious Hanuman, having killed eminent ogres and thereby making himself widely known, having caused havoc to the city of Lanka and  terrific sorrow to Ravana by tormenting the army, offered salutations to Vaidehi from midocean and continued his journey.

content: पर्वतेन्द्रं सुनाभं च समुपस्पृश्य वीर्यवान्।।5.57.13।।ज्यामुक्त इव नाराचो महावेगोऽभ्युपागतः।
explanation: The valiant Hanuman touched the lord of mountains fondly and went with great speed just as an arrow released from the centre of a powerful bowstring.

content: स किञ्चिदनुसम्प्राप्तः समालोक्य महागिरिम्।।5.57.14।।महेन्द्रं मेघसङ्काशं ननाद हरिपुङ्गवः।
explanation: The chief of the monkeys arrived near, and beholding the face of the Mahendra mountain, which resembled a mass of clouds, thundered.

content: स पूरयामास कपिर्दिशो दश समन्ततः।।5.57.15।।नदन्नादेन महता मेघस्वनमहास्वनः।
explanation: The thundering noise of Hanuman filled all the ten directions with great sound.

content: स तं देशमनुप्राप्तः सुहृद्धर्शनलालसः।।5.57.16।।ननाद हरिशार्दूलो लाङ्गूलं चाप्यकम्पयत्।
explanation: Having sighted the place of his companions and waiting to see them for long that tiger among monkeys made a loud noise and shook his tail in joy.

content: तस्य नानद्यमानस्य सुपर्णचरिते पथि।।5.57.17।।फलतीवास्य घोषेण गगनं सार्कमण्डलम्।
explanation: By the terrific sounds made by Hanuman in joy, it seemed as though the pathway of Garuda, the sky along with the Sun's orbit was splitting.

content: ये तु तत्रोत्तरे तीरे समुद्रस्य महाबलाः।।5.57.18।।पूर्वं संविष्ठिताश्शूरा वायुपुत्रदिदृक्षवः।महतो वातनुन्नस्य तोयदस्येव गर्जितम्।।5.57.19।।शुश्रुवुस्ते तदा घोषमूरुवेगं हनूमतः।
explanation: Thereafter the brave and powerful monkeys waiting on the northern shore of the ocean for the arrival of the son of the Windgod, heard the roar and thundering sound of the stormy cloud produced by the sweeping motion of Hanuman's thighs propelled by the speed of his movement.

content: ते दीनमनसस्सर्वे शुश्रुवुः काननौकसः।।5.57.20।।वानरेन्द्रस्य निर्घोषं पर्जन्यनिनदोपमम्।
explanation: All the vanaras who were feeling dejected and waiting anxiously heard the noise of Hanuman that sounded like a thundering cloud.

content: निशम्य नदतो नादं वानरास्ते समन्ततः।।5.57.21।।बभूवुरुत्सुकास्सर्वे सुहृद्धर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः।
explanation: On hearing the loud voice of Hanuman, all the vanaras were longing to see their friend.

content: जाम्बवान् स हरिश्रेष्ठः प्रीतिसंहृष्टमानसः।।5.57.22।।उपामन्त्र्य हरीन् सर्वानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
explanation: Jambavan the chief of vanaras became very happy at heart and called all the vanaras and spoke:

content: सर्वथा कृतकार्योऽसौ हनुमान्नात्र संशयः।।5.57.23।।न ह्यस्याकृतकार्यस्य नाद एवंविधो भवेत्।
explanation: "Oh Hanuman is always successful. If he has not, he would not make sounds in this manner".

content: तस्य बाहूरुवेगं च निनादं च महात्मनः।।5.57.24।।निशम्य हरयो हृष्टाः समुत्पेतुस्ततस्ततः।
explanation: Hearing the sound of his dashing movements of arms and thighs the vanaras jumped about in joy, then and there.

content: ते नगाग्रान्नगाग्राणि शिखराच्छिखराणि च।।5.57.25।।प्रहृष्टाः समपद्यन्त हनूमन्तं दिदृक्षवः।
explanation: The vanaras were very happy. Longing to see Hanuman, they jumped from one tree top to another and from one peak of a mountain to the other.

content: ते प्रीताः पादपाग्रेषु गृह्य शाखाः सुविष्ठिताः।।5.57.26।।वासांसीव प्रशाखाश्च समाविध्यन्त वानराः।
explanation: Waiting for Hanuman, the vanaras jumped from the tree tops holding the branches. They shook the branches just like clothes to welcome friends.

content: गिरिगह्वरसंलीनो यथा गर्जति मारुतः।।5.57.27।।एवं जगर्ज बलवान् हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।
explanation: Hanuman, the powerful son of the Windgod roared like the wind captured in a mountain cave would.

content: तमभ्रघनसङ्काशमापतन्तं महाकपिम्।।5.57.28।।दृष्ट्वा ते वानरास्सर्वे तस्थुः प्राञ्जलयस्तदा।
explanation: (On seeing) Hanuman, who was resembling a heavy cloud approaching, the vanaras stood with folded hands.

content: ततस्तु वेगवांस्तस्य गिरेर्गिरिनिभः कपिः।।5.57.29।।निपपात महेन्द्रस्य शिखरे पादपाकुले।
explanation: Thereafter the vanara, who resembled a mountain, descended with great speed on the summit of mount Mahendra full of trees.

content: हर्षेणापूर्यमाणोऽसौ रम्ये पर्वतनिर्झरे।।5.57.30।।छिन्नपक्ष इवाऽकाशात्पपात धरणीधरः।
explanation: Overwhelmed with immeasurable joy, Hanuman descended from the sky like the mountain with its wings cut off and dropped on the bank of a mountain stream.

content: ततस्ते प्रीतमनसस्सर्वे वानरपुङ्गवाः।।5.57.31।।हनुमन्तं महात्मानं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे।परिवार्य च ते सर्वे परां प्रीतिमुपागताः।।5.57.32।।
explanation: Feeling very happy at heart all the vanara leaders gathered around Hanuman. They  stood motionless with extreme happiness.

content: प्रहृष्टवदना स्सर्वे तमरोगमुपागतम्।उपायनानि चादाय मूलानि च फलानि च।।5.57.33।।प्रत्यर्चयन् हरिश्रेष्ठं हरयो मारुतात्मजम्।
explanation: The vanaras were filled with joy seeing Hanuman who returned unhurt. They offered roots and fruits to him. Hanuman on his part offered salutations to the foremost of the monkeys.

content: हनुमांस्तु गुरून् वृद्धाञ्जाम्बवत्प्रमुखांस्तदा।।5.57.34।।कुमारमङ्गदं चैव सोऽवन्दत महाकपिः।
explanation: The great Hanuman also offered salutations to elders, preceptors such as Jambavan and other leaders. He also saluted the young Angada.

content: स ताभ्यां पूजितः पूज्यः कपिभिश्च प्रसादितः।।5.57.35।।दृष्टा सीतेति विक्रान्त स्संक्षेपेण न्यवेदयत्।
explanation: The valiant Hanuman worthy of worship having been honoured by both Jambavan and Angada was pleased. He responded briefly, saying 'Saw Sita'.

content: निषसाद च हस्तेन गृहीत्वा वालिनस्सुतम्।।5.57.36।।रमणीये वनोद्देशे महेन्द्रस्य गिरेस्तदा।
explanation: Then holding the hand of Vali's son he sat down at a beautiful location of the garden of mountain Mahendra.

content: हनुमानब्रवीद्धृष्टस्तदा तान्वानरर्षभान्।।5.57.37।।अशोकवनिकासंस्था दृष्टा सा जनकात्मजा।रक्षमाणा सुघोराभी राक्षसीभिरनिन्दिता।।5.57.38।।एकवेणीधरा बाला रामदर्शनलालसा।उपवासपरिश्रान्ता जटिला मलिना कृशा।।5.57.39।।
explanation: Hanuman felt happy and told Angada, the bull of vanaras, "I saw Sita in the groves of Ashoka guarded by dreadful ogres. She is blameless, eager to see Rama. She is wearing a single braid of hair. She is young and emaciated due to fasting. Her hair is matted and soiled".

content: ततो दृष्टेति वचनं महार्थममृतोपमम्।निशम्य मारुतेस्सर्वे मुदिता वानराभवन्।।5.57.40।।
explanation: Then hearing Hanuman's meaningful and nectarlike words all the vanaras rejoiced.

content: क्ष्वेलन्त्यन्ये नदन्त्यन्ये गर्जन्त्यन्ये महाबलाः।चक्रुः किलकिलामन्ये प्रतिगर्जन्ति चापरे।।5.57.41।।
explanation: Some powerful vanaras howled, some chattered, some roared and some screamed, going round and round and others echoed the sounds.

content: केचिदुच्छ्रितलाङ्गूलाः प्रहृष्टाः कपिकुञ्जराः।आयताञ्चितदीर्घाणि लाङ्गूलानि प्रविव्यधुः।।5.57.42।।
explanation: Some elephantlike vanaras who were excited and felt overjoyed lifted their long and beautiful tails and hit them on the ground.

content: अपरे च हनूमन्तं वानरा वारणोपमम्।आप्लुत्य गिरिशृङ्गेभ्यस्संस्पृशन्ति स्म हर्षिताः।।5.57.43।।
explanation: A few vanaras jumped down from the mountain top and hugged the elephantlike Hanuman.

content: उक्तवाक्यं हनूमन्तमङ्गदस्तमथाब्रवीत्।सर्वेषां हरिवीराणां मध्ये वचनमुत्तमम्।।5.57.44।।
explanation: And hearing Hanuman's sweetest words, Angada addressed the heroic vanaras

content: सत्त्वे वीर्ये न ते कश्चित्समो वानर विद्यते।यदवप्लुत्य विस्तीर्णं सागरं पुनरागतः।।5.57.45।।
explanation: "O vanara you have leaped such a wide ocean and have returned. In strength and valour. There is none equal to you.

content: अहो स्वामिनि ते भक्तिरहो वीर्यमहो धृतिः।दिष्ट्या दृष्टा त्वया देवी रामपत्नी यशस्विनी।।5.57.46।।दिष्ट्या त्यक्ष्यति काकुत्स्थ श्शोकं सीतावियोगजम्।
explanation: "O your devotion to the king, O your valour, fortitude  and courage is admirable. You could see Rama's wife, an illustrious lady. This is a matter of our good luck. Rama will (now) shed the sorrow due to separation from Sita.

content: ततोऽङ्गदं हनूमन्तं जाम्बवन्तं च वानराः।।5.57.47।।परिवार्य प्रमुदिता भेजिरे विपुलाश्शिलाः।
explanation: Then the vanaras went round all the three Angada, Hanuman and Jambavan. Out of joy they lay down on the huge rocks.

content: श्रोतुकामास्समुद्रस्य लङ्घनं वानरोत्तमाः।।5.57.48।।दर्शनं चापि लङ्कायास्सीताया रावणस्य च।तस्थुः प्राञ्जलयस्सर्वे हनुमद्वचनोन्मुखाः।।5.57.49।।
explanation: All the vanaras longing to listen to Hanuman about his crossing the ocean, seeing Lanka, Sita and Ravana kept looking at the face of Hanuman.

content: तस्थौ तत्राङ्गदः श्रीमान् वानरैर्बहुभिर्वृतः।उपास्यमानो विबुधैर्दिवि देवपतिर्यथा।।5.57.50।।
explanation: Surrounded by many great vanaras, Angada was shining like Indra, lord of the gods attended by the gods in heaven.

content: हनूमता कीर्तिमता यशस्विना तथाङ्गदेनाङ्गदबद्धबाहुना।मुदा तदाऽध्यासितमुन्नतं महन्महीधराग्रं ज्वलितं श्रियाभवत्।।5.57.51।।
explanation: The mountain peak graced by famous Hanuman and renowned Angada bedecked with armlets seated on top joyfully, appeared prosperous and splendid.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman narrates all the incidents starting from his departure for Lanka till his return.]ततस्तस्य गिरेः शृङ्गे महेन्द्रस्य महाबलाः।हनुमत्प्रमुखाः प्रीतिं हरयो जग्मुरुत्तमाम्।।5.58.1।।
explanation: Then the mighty Hanuman and other vanaras having assembled on the summit of mountain Mahendra and felt vey much happy.

content: तं ततः प्रीतिसंहृष्टः प्रीतिमन्तं महाकपिम्।जाम्बवान्कार्यवृत्तान्तमपृच्छदनिलात्मजम्।।5.58.2।।
explanation: Thereafter, very delighted Jambavan inquired Hanuman most affectionately of all that happened.

content: कथं दृष्टा त्वया देवी कथं वा तत्र वर्तते।तस्यां वा स कथंवृत्तः क्रूरकर्मा दशाननः।।5.58.3।।
explanation: "How did you find the godlike lady? How was she? How was the tenheaded one, cruel in action, behaving with her? You may narrate what she said.

content: तत्त्वतस्सर्वमेतन्नः प्रब्रूहि त्वं महाकपे।श्रुतार्थाश्चिन्तयिष्यामो भूयः कार्यविनिश्चयम्।।5.58.4।।
explanation: "O Hanuman, tell us in detail  the entire thing. On hearing it, we will think about the next course of action.

content: यश्चार्थस्तत्त्र वक्तव्यो गतैरस्माभिरात्मवान्।रक्षितव्यं च यत्तत्र तद्भवान्व्याकरोतु नः।।5.58.5।।
explanation: "You are wise and you should tell us in detail what is to be told and what has to be hidden when we report."

content: स नियुक्तस्ततस्तेन सम्प्रहृष्टतनूरुहः।प्रणम्य शिरसा देव्यै सीतायै प्रत्यभाषत।।5.58.6।।
explanation: Having been asked (by Jambavan and others) Hanuman with horripilations all over his body, bowed down and saluted in the direction of queen Sita and began:

content: प्रत्यक्षमेव भवतां महेन्द्राग्रात्खामाप्लुतः।उदधेर्दक्षिणं पारं काङ्क्षमाण स्समाहितः।।5.58.7।।
explanation: "I rose upwards leaping into the sky, intent on reaching the southern shore from the mountain Mahendra.It has been witnessed directly by all of you.

content: गच्छतश्च हि मे घोरं विघ्नरूपमिवाभवत्।काञ्चनं शिखरं दिव्यं पश्यामि सुमनोहरम्।।5.58.8।।
explanation: "Even as I was leaping I saw a terrific and wonderful golden peak which came as if to obstruct me on my path.

content: स्थितं पन्धानमावृत्य मेने विघ्नं च तं नगम्।उपसङ्गम्य तं दिव्यं काञ्चनं नगसत्तमम्।।5.58.9।।कृता मे मनसा बुद्धिर्भेत्तव्योऽयं मयेति च।
explanation: "The mountain stood on my way turning towards me in order to obstruct me. Then I resolved in my mind that this great, wonderful, golden mountain has to be smashed.

content: प्रहतं च मया तस्य लाङ्गूलेन महागिरेः।।5.58.10।।शिखरं सूर्यसङ्काशं व्यशीर्यत सहस्रधा।
explanation: "Hit by my tail the great mountain peak, which was radiating like the Sun was shattered into a thousand pieces.

content: व्यवसायं च तं बुद्ध्वा स होवाच महागिरिः।।5.58.11।पुत्त्रेति मधुरां वाणीं मनः प्रह्लादयन्निव।
explanation: "Perceiving that I am going to smash him he spoke to me in a sweet tone delighting my heart, addressing me like a son.

content: पितृव्यं चापि मां विद्धि सखायं मातरिश्वनः।।5.58.12।।मैनाकमिति विख्यातं निवसन्तं महोदधौ।
explanation: 'Know me to be a friend of windgod and so I am like your father's brother. I am dwelling in this great ocean and known as Mainaka.

content: पक्षवन्तः पुरा पुत्त्र बभूवुः पर्वतोत्तमाः।।5.58.13।।छन्दतः पृथिवीं चेरुर्बाधमानाः समन्ततः।
explanation: 'O son in the past, foremost of the mountains too had wings and they used to range  at will all over the earth tormenting all.

content: श्रुत्वा नगानां चरितं महेन्द्रः पाकशासनः।।5.58.14।।चिच्छेद भगवान् पक्षान्वज्रेणैषां सहस्रशः।
explanation: 'Mahendra, the killer of ogre Paka, heard the story (of the cruel deeds) of mountains and cut off their wings into a thousand pieces with his thunderbolt.

content: अहं तु मोक्षितस्तस्मात्तव पित्रा महात्मना।।5.58.15।।मारुतेन तदा वत्स प्रक्षिप्तोऽस्मि महार्णवे।
explanation: 'O son I was saved from Indra by your kind father Maruta who dropped me in this great  ocean.

content: रामस्य च मया साह्ये वर्तितव्यमरिन्दम।।5.58.16।।रामो धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठो महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः।
explanation: 'O subduer of enemiesI must make efforts to help Rama the foremost among the righteous, for I have received help (from your father) who is equal to Indra in valour'.

content: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य मैनाकस्य महात्मनः।।5.58.17।।कार्यमावेद्य तु गिरेरुद्यतं च मनो मम।तेन चाहमनुज्ञातो मैनाकेन महात्मना।।5.58.18।।
explanation: "When I heard Mainaka, I told him about my intention to go up. That great self Mainaka allowed me.

content: स चाप्यन्तर्हितः शैलो मानुषेण वपुष्मता।शरीरेण महाशैलः शैलेन च महोदधौ।।5.58.19।।
explanation: "Then the huge mountain in human form concealed as huge mountains remain hidden in the ocean.

content: उत्तमं जवमास्थाय शेषं पन्थानमास्थितः।ततोऽहं सुचिरं कालं वेगेनाभ्यागमं पथि।।5.58.20।।
explanation: "Then with great speed I proceeded on my path. It took a long time to cross the ocean.

content: ततः पश्याम्यहं देवीं सुरसां नागमातरम्।समुद्रमध्ये सा देवी वचनं मामभाषत।।5.58.21।।
explanation: "I saw Surasa, the mother of serpents in the midst of the ocean and she said:

content: मम भक्षः प्रदिष्टस्त्वममरैर्हरिसत्तम।अतस्त्वां भक्षयिष्यामि विहितस्त्वं चिरस्य मे।।5.58.22।।
explanation: 'O powerful monkey you are destined to be my food provided by the immortals. Therefore, I will eat you as I have I found you after a long time. (of unsatiated hunger).'

content: एवमुक्त स्सुरसया प्राञ्जलिः प्रणतः स्थितः।विवर्णवदनो भूत्वा वाक्यं चेदमुदीरयम्।।5.58.23।।
explanation: "When addressed thus by Surasa, I bowed low with joined palms, stood before her with my face turned pale, and said:

content: रामो दाशरथिः श्रीमान् प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम्।लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया च परन्तपः।।5.58.24।।
explanation: 'Dasaratha's son, the illustrious Rama, a scorcher of enemies, accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and wife Sita entered Dandaka forest.

content: तस्य सीता हृता भार्या रावणेन दुरात्मना।तस्या स्सङ्काशं दूतोऽहं गमिष्ये रामशासनात्।।5.58.25।।
explanation: 'His wife was abducted by the evilminded Ravana. By Rama's command I am going to meet her as messenger from Rama.'

content: कर्तुमर्हसि रामस्य साहाय्यं विषये सती।अथवा मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा रामं चाक्लिष्टकारिणम्।।5.58.26।।आगमिष्यामि ते वक्त्रं सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि ते।
explanation: "I told her that it is proper for her (living in the domain of Rama) to help his queen and wife. Or else, I promised after I disclose to Rama, Sita's whereabouts, I will come and enter her mouth.

content: एवमुक्ता मया सा तु सुरसा कामरूपिणी।5.58.27।।अब्रवीन्नातिवर्तेत कश्चिदेष वरो मम।
एवमुक्तस्सुरसया दशयोजनमायतः।।5.58.28।।ततोर्थगुणविस्तारो बभूवाहं क्षणेन तु।
explanation: "When Surasa said this I who was ten yojanas in height increased  by fifteen yojanas.

content: मत्प्रमाणानुरूपं च व्यादितं च मुखं तया।।5.58.29।।तद्दृष्ट्वा व्यादितं चास्यं ह्रस्वं ह्यकरवं वपुः।तस्मिन्मुहूर्ते च पुनर्बभूवाङ्गुष्ठमात्रकः।।5.58.30।।
explanation: "She too opened her mouth wide enough for my size. Seeing her distending her mouth, in a moment I became small equal to the size of thumb and came out.

content: अभिपत्याशु तद्वक्त्रं निर्गतोऽहं ततः क्षणात्।अब्रवीत्सुरसा देवी स्वेन रूपेण मां पुनः।।5.58.31।।
explanation: "Then Surasa assumed her natural form again in a moment and said this to me:

content: अर्थसिद्ध्यै हरिश्रेष्ठ गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम्।समानय च वैदेहीं राघवेण महात्मना।।5.58.32।।सुखी भव महाबाहो प्रीताऽस्मि तव वानर।
explanation: 'O noble vanara O foremost of the vanaras go and accomplish the task.Unite the great Rama with Vaidehi.O strongarmed vanara, be happy. I am pleased with you'.

content: ततोऽहं साधु साध्विति सर्वभूतैः प्रशंसितः।।5.58.33।।ततोऽन्तरिक्षं विपुलं प्लुतोऽहं गरुडो यथा।
explanation: "Then all creatures praised me saying 'well done well done'. Then I leaped into the vast sky like Garuda.

content: छाया मे निगृहीता च न च पश्यामि किंचन।।5.58.34।।सोऽहं विहतवेगस्तु दिशो दश विलोकयन्।न किञ्चित्तत्र पश्यामि येन मेऽपहृता गतिः।।5.58.35।।
explanation: "Then I was captured by a shadow of some one. I could not see and I reduced my speed and looked around in all the ten directions. I could not see the one who seized me.

content: ततो मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना किन्नाम गगने मम।ईदृशो विघ्न उत्पन्नो रूपं यत्र न दृश्यते।।5.58.36।।
अधोभागेन मे दृष्टि श्शोचता पातिता मया।ततोऽद्राक्षमहं भीमां राक्षसीं सलिलेशयाम्।।5.58.37।।
explanation: "Thinking so I looked down into the water and there I saw a terrific shedemon.

content: प्रहस्य च महानादमुक्तोऽहं भीमया तया।अवस्थितमसम्भ्रान्तमिदं वाक्यमशोभनम्।।5.58.38।।
explanation: "She was frightening and  laughed in loud voice without any hesitation. Steadfast she uttered these ominous words to me:

content: क्वासि गन्ता महाकाय क्षुधिताया ममेप्सितः।भक्षः प्रीणय मे देहं चिरमाहारवर्जितम्।।5.58.39।।
explanation: 'O huge monkey where are you going? I am hungry since long. I am going without food and must eat you. Make me satisfied'.

content: बाढमित्येव तां वाणीं प्रत्यगृह्णामहं ततः।अस्यप्रमाणादधिकं तस्याः कायमपूरयम्।।5.58.40।।
explanation: "I said 'well' and enlarged my body more than her mouth could hold.

content: तस्याश्चास्यं महद्भीमं वर्धते मम भक्षणे।न च मां साधु बुबुधे मम वा विकृतं कृतम्।।5.58.41।।
explanation: "She opened her huge mouth to eat me as she did not know that I had already assumed a huge ugly form on my own.

content: ततोऽहं विपुलं रूपं संक्षिप्य निमिषान्तरात्।तस्या हृदयमादाय प्रपतामि नभ:स्थलम्।।5.58.42।।
explanation: "In a moment I reduced from a huge form to a small one, entered her heart and sprang into the sky.

content: सा विसृष्टभुजा भीमा पपात लवणाम्भसि।मया पर्वतसङ्काशा निकृत्तहृदया सती।।5.58.43।।
explanation: "She who resembled a mountain fell into the ocean with her arms hanging down when I pulled out her heart.

content: शृणोमि खगतानां च सिद्धानां चारणैस्सह।राक्षसी सिंहिका भीमा क्षिप्रं हनुमता हता।।5.58.44।।
explanation: "I heard the charanas and siddhas residing in the sky talking to each other that the fierce ogres Simhika has been killed by Hanuman in a moment.

content: तां हत्वा पुनरेवाहं कृत्यमात्ययिकं स्मरन्।गत्वा चाह महध्वानं पश्यामि नगमण्डितम्।।5.58.45।।दक्षिणं तीरमुदधेर्लङ्का यत्र च सा पुरी।
explanation: "Having slained Simhika, I thought of the huge feat that I have done. I remembered the big mission before me and went to the southern shore of the ocean and saw Lanka full of trees.

content: अस्तं दिनकरे याते रक्षसां निलयं पुरम्।।5.58.46।।प्रविष्टोऽहमविज्ञातो रक्षोभिर्भीमविक्रमैः।
तत्र प्रविशतश्चापि कल्पान्तघनसन्निभा।।5.58.47।।अट्टहासं विमुञ्चन्ती नारी काप्युत्थिता पुरः।
जिघांसन्तीं ततस्तां तु ज्वलदग्निशिरोरुहाम्।।5.58.48।।सव्यमुष्टिप्रहारेण पराजित्य सुभैरवाम्।प्रदोषकाले प्रविशं भीतयाऽहं तयोदितः।।5.58.49।।
explanation: "Then the frightening form, with its hair burning like sacrificial fire, emerged to kill me. I defeated her hittting with my left fist and entered the city at sunset time.

content: अहं लङ्कापुरी वीर निर्जिता विक्रमेण ते।यस्मात्तस्माद्विजेतासि सर्वरक्षांस्यशेषतः।।5.58.50।।
explanation: 'O hero I am the presiding deity of Lanka whom you have won by your valour. Therefore you will win many demons she foretold.

content: तत्राहं सर्वरात्रं तु विचिन्वन् जनकात्मजाम्।रावणान्तःपुरगतो न चापश्यं सुमध्यमाम्।।5.58.51।।
explanation: "There when I went to the harem of Ravana and searched all night, I did not find the fairwaisted Janaka's daughter.

content: तत स्सीतामपश्यंस्तु रावणस्य निवेशने।शोकसागरमासाद्य न पारमुपलक्षये।।5.58.52।।
explanation: "Not able to find Sita at the residence of Ravana I was immersed in an ocean of endless sorrow and did not know what to do.

content: शोचता च मया दृष्टं प्राकारेण समावृतम्।काञ्चनेन विकृष्टेन गृहोपवनमुत्तमम्।।5.58.53।।
explanation: "While worrying like that I saw a long golden boundary wall surrounding a splendid home garden. (upabana)

content: स प्राकारमवप्लुत्य पश्यामि बहुपादपम्।अशोकवनिकामध्ये शिंशुपापादपो महान्।।5.58.54।।तमारुह्य च पश्यामि काञ्चनं कदलीवनम्।
explanation: "I crossed that boundary wall and saw many kinds of trees and in the midst of that Ashoka garden, a huge Simsupa tree. I ascended it and saw rows of banana plants.

content: अदूरे शिंशुपावृक्षात्पश्यामि वरवर्णिनीम्।।5.58.55।।श्यामां कमलपत्राक्षीमुपवासकृशाननाम्।तदेकवासस्संवीतां रजोध्वस्तशिरोरुहाम्।।5.58.56।।शोकसन्तापदीनाङ्गीं सीतां भर्तृहिते स्थिताम्।राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभिः क्रूराभिरभिसंवृताम्।।5.58.57।।मांसशोणितभक्षाभिर्व्याघ्रीभिर्हरिणीमिव।
explanation: "Not far from the Simsupa tree I saw beautiful Sita, of dark complexion, with eyes like lotus petals, whose face was emaciated due to fasting, wearing only a single sari (the same one since her abduction) her locks filled with dust, pathetic looking,  immersed in sorrow, meditating on her husband seated like a doe encircled by tigresses, surrounded by ugly and cruel shedemons fed on flesh and blood.

content: सा मया राक्षसीमध्ये तर्ज्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः।।5.58.58।।एकवेणीधरा दीना भर्तृचिन्तापरायणा।भूमिशय्या विवर्णाङ्गी पद्मिनीव हिमागमे।।5.58.59।।रावणाद्विनिवृत्तार्था मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया।कथञ्चिन्मृगशाबाक्षी तूर्णमासादिता मया।।5.58.60।।
तां दृष्ट्वा तादृशीं नारीं रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम्।तत्रैव शिंशुपावृक्षे पश्यन्नहमवस्थितः।।5.58.61।।
explanation: "I remained there looking on that renowned wife of Rama from the Simsupa tree.

content: ततो हलहलाशब्दं काञ्चीनूपुरमिश्रितम्।शृणोम्यधिकगम्भीरं रावणस्य निवेशने।।5.58.62।।
explanation: "Then I heard a deep sound mixed with jingling golden girdles and anklets coming from Ravana's residence.

content: ततोऽहं परमोद्विग्नः स्वं रूपं प्रत्यसंहरम्।अहं तु शिंशुपावृक्षे पक्षीव गहने स्थितः।।5.58.63।।
explanation: "I was scared and contracted my body size and stood on the Simsupa tree like a bird in the sky.

content: ततो रावणदाराश्च रावणश्च महाबलः।तं देशं समनुप्राप्ता यत्र सीताऽभवत् स्थिता।।5.58.64।।
explanation: "Then arrived the powerful Ravana with his consorts to that place where Sita was and stood there.

content: तं दृष्ट्वाथ वरारोहा सीता रक्षोगणेश्वरम्।सङ्कुच्योरूस्तनौ पीनौ बाहुभ्यां परिरभ्य च।।5.58.65।।
explanation: "On seeing Ravana, the king of demons, beautiful Sita, full of fear hid her face and plump breasts between her thighs.

content: वित्रस्तां परमोद्विग्नां वीक्षमाणां ततस्ततः।त्राणं किञ्चिदपश्यन्तीं वेपमानां तपस्विनीम्।।5.58.66।।तामुवाच दशग्रीवस्सीतां परमदुःखिताम्।अवाक्चिराः प्रपतितो बहुमन्यस्व मामिति।।5.58.67।।
explanation: "Sita was full of fear and worry, looked here and there without any protector to pacify. She was trembling in fear. To that Sita, the tenheaded Ravana bent his head down and said, 'trust me and respect me'.

content: यदि चेत्त्वं तु दर्पान्मां नाभिनन्दसि गर्विते।द्वौ मासावन्तरं सीते पास्यामि रुधिरं तव।।5.58.68।।
explanation: 'O Sita if in your pride, you do not respect me, I will see (drink) your blood in two months.

content: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।उवाच परमक्रुद्धा सीता वचनमुत्तमम्।।5.58.69।।
explanation: "Hearing the words of evilminded Ravana, Sita became very angry and spoke these approprate words:

content: राक्षसाधम रामस्य भार्याममिततेजसः।इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाथस्य स्नुषां दशरथस्य च।।5.58.70।।अवाच्यं वदतो जिह्वा कथं न पतिता तव।
explanation: 'O lowly demon I am the wife of valiant Rama and daughterinlaw of Dasaratha, the king of Ikshvaku race. How is it your tongue that spoke unspeakable words has not fallen down?

content: किञ्चिद्वीर्यं तवानार्य यो मां भर्तुरसन्निधौ।।5.58.71।।अपहृत्याऽऽगतः पाप ते नादृष्टो महात्मना।
explanation: 'O ignoble one when my husband was away, you came and abducted me unseen by the great Rama. You do not have even a little courage (to win me through a straight fight).

content: न त्वं रामस्य सदृशो दास्येऽप्यस्य न युज्यसे।।5.58.72।।यज्ञीय स्सत्यवादी च रणश्लाघी च राघवः।
explanation: 'You are not equal to Rama and not even fit to be his servant. He does yagnas and always abides in truth. He is valiant in war.

content: जानक्या परुषं वाक्यमेवमुक्तो दशाननः।।5.58.73।।जज्वाल सहसा कोपाच्चितास्थ इव पावकः।
explanation: "Thus addressed harshly by Janaki, the tenheaded Ravana blazed up in anger suddenly like the flame of the funeral pyre.

content: विवृत्य नयने क्रूरे मुष्टिमुद्यम्य दक्षिणम्।।5.58.74।।मैथिलीं हन्तुमारब्ध: स्त्रीभिर्हाहाकृतं तदा।
explanation: "Then the wicked Ravana raised his eyebrows and his right fist to strike at Sita and even the shedemon there raised their voice saying, ' alas, alas '

content: स्त्रीणां मध्यात्समुत्पत्य तस्य भार्या दुरात्मनः।।5.58.75।।वरा मन्दोदरी नाम तया स प्रतिषेधितः।
explanation: "Evilminded Ravana's wife Mandodari, a noble one among women came forward from the midst and prevented him.

content: उक्तश्च मधुरां वाणीं तया स मदनार्दितः।।5.58.76।।सीतया तव किं कार्यं महेन्द्रसमविक्रमः।
explanation: "She spoke sweetly to Ravana, who was tormented by the god of love saying, 'For what purpose do you desire Sita? You are equal to Mahendra in might'.

content: देवगन्धर्वकन्याभिर्यक्षकन्याभिरेव च।।5.58.77।।सार्धं प्रभो रमस्वेह सीतया किं करिष्यसि।
explanation: 'O lord you enjoy with the daughters of gods, gandharvas and even the young ladies of yakshas. Why do you need Sita?'

content: ततस्ताभिस्समेताभिर्नारीभिस्स महाबलः।।5.58.78।।प्रसाद्य सहसा नीतो भवनं स्वं निशाचरः।
explanation: "Then all the women got together and stopped the mighty nightranger, Ravana and quickly took him back to his mansion.

content: याते तस्मिन् दशग्रीवे राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः।।5.58.79।।सीतां निर्भर्त्सयामासुर्वाक्यैः क्रूरैस्सुदारुणैः।
तृणवद्भाषितं तासां गणयामास जानकी।।5.58.80।।गर्जितं च तदा तासां सीतां प्राप्य निरर्थकम्।
explanation: "Janaki did not care for their words of threat, as though they were a blade of grass and of no use to her.

content: वृथागर्जितनिश्चेष्टा राक्षस्यः पिशिताशनाः।।5.58.81।।रावणाय शशंसुस्ताः सीताध्यवसितं महत्।
explanation: "Since the threatenings of the shedemons were of no use the ogresses who live on flesh and blood reported to Ravana about great Sita's formidable determination.

content: ततस्तास्सहितास्सर्वा निहताशा निरुद्यमाः।।5.58.82।।परिक्षिप्य समन्तात्तां निद्रावशमुपागताः।
explanation: "Then all of them gave up hope of their efforts and scattered around her, succumbed to sleep.

content: तासु चैव प्रसुप्तासु सीता भर्तृहिते रता।।5.58.83।।विलप्य करुणं दीना प्रशुशोच सुदुःखिता।
तासां मध्यात्समुत्थाय त्रिजटा वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.58.84।।आत्मानं खादत क्षिप्रं न सीता विनशिष्यति।जनकस्यात्मजा साध्वी स्नुषा दशरथस्य च।।5.58.85।।
explanation: "From the midst of all of them got up Trijata, saying, 'You eat me if you like. Know that Janaka's daughter is a chaste woman and is the daughterinlaw of Dasaratha. She cannot be destroyed'.

content: स्वप्नो ह्यद्य मया दृष्टो दारुणो रोमहर्षणः।रक्षसां च विनाशाय भर्तुरस्या जयाय च।।5.58.86।।
explanation: 'Today I saw in my dream, a dreadful and horripilating scene of destruction of demons and even victory of Sita's husband.

content: अलमस्मात्परित्रातुं राघवाद्राक्षसीगणम्।अभियाचाम वैदेहीमेतद्धि मम रोचते।।5.58.87।।
explanation: 'To protect the demon clan from destruction by Rama, it is enough if we beg her (pardon). Indeed, I think that way.

content: यस्या ह्येवंविधस्स्वप्नो दुःखितायाः प्रदृश्यते।सा दुःखैर्विविधैर्मुक्ता सुखमाप्नोत्यनुत्तमम्।।5.58.88।।प्रणिपातप्रसन्ना हि मैथिली जनकात्मजा।
explanation: 'Whoever in a sorrowful state sees such kind of dream, would be not only relieved of all sorrows but will experience immense happiness. Janaka's daughter Sita will bless us with protection if we pray her.

content: ततस्सा ह्रीमती बाला भर्तुर्विजयहर्षिता।।5.58.89।।अवोचद्यदि तत्तथ्यं भवेयं शरणं हि वः।
explanation: 'On hearing the words (of Trijata) that 'Rama will succeed', young and bashful Sita felt happy and said that 'If it comes true I will protect thee'.

content: तां चाहं तादृशीं दृष्ट्वा सीताया दारुणां दशाम्।चिन्तयामास विक्रान्तो न च मे निर्वृतं मनः।।5.58.90।।
explanation: "Seeing Sita's deplorable state, her illluck and her dread, I began  to worry and had no peace of mind.

content: सम्भाषणार्थं च मया जानक्याश्चिन्तितो विधिः।।5.58.91।।इक्ष्वाकूणां हि वंशस्तु ततो मम पुरस्कृतः।
explanation: "I thought of a strategy to enter into conversation with Janaki that is to praise the Ikshvaku race.

content: श्रुत्वा तु गदितां वाचं राजर्षिगणपूजिताम्।।5.58.92।।प्रत्यभाषत मां देवी बाष्पैः पिहितलोचना।
explanation: "The divine lady heard my enumeration, sanctifying the royal seers. She replied me, with  her eyes blinded by tears:

content: कस्त्वं केन कथं चेह प्राप्तो वानरपुङ्गवः।।5.58.93।।का च रामेण ते प्रीतिस्तन्मे शंसितुमर्हसि।
explanation: "O foremost of vanaras who are you? Why and how have you come here? How did you make friendship with Rama? Tell me all that in detail.

content: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा ह्यहमप्यब्रुवं वचः।।5.58.94।।देवि रामस्य भर्तुस्ते सहायो भीमविक्रमः।सुग्रीवो नाम विक्रान्तो वानरेन्द्रो महाबलः।।5.58.95।।
explanation: "Hearing her I also said, 'O queen Sugriva, the warrior of fierce valour and king of monkeys developed friendship with your husband'.

content: तस्य मां विद्धि भृत्यं त्वं हनुमन्तमिहागतम्।भर्त्राहं प्रेषितस्तुभ्यं रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा।।5.58.96।।
explanation: 'I came here as a servant sent by your tireless husband to find you.

content: इदं च पुरुषव्याघ्रः श्रीमान् दाशरथिः स्वयम्।अङ्गुलीयमभिज्ञानमदात्तुभ्यं यशस्विनि।।5.58.97।।
explanation: 'O glorious lady the tiger among men, the illustrious son of Dasaratha himself sent this ring to you as a taken of identity.

content: तदिच्छामि त्वयाऽऽज्ञप्तं देवि किं करवाण्यहम्।रामलक्ष्मणयोः पार्श्वं नयामि त्वां किमुत्तरम्।।5.58.98।।
explanation: 'O venerable lady I seek your order. What should I do? Should I take you to  Rama and Lakshmana? What do you say?

content: एतच्छ्रुत्वा विदित्वा च सीता जनकनन्दिनी।आहरावणमुत्साद्य राघवो मां नयत्विति।।5.58.99।।
explanation: "Having heard all that (Hanuman said) Sita, the delight of Janaka thought over and said, 'Rama should kill Ravana and take me'.

content: प्रणम्य शिरसा देवीं महमार्यामनिन्दिताम्।राघवस्य मनोह्लादमभिज्ञानमयाचिषम्।।5.58.100।।
explanation: "Then bowing down I saluted the noble and blameless queen Sita to give a signet, which would be very pleasing to Rama.

content: अथ मामब्रवीत्सीता गृह्यतामयमुत्तमः।मणिर्येन महाबाहू रामस्त्वां बहुमन्यते।।5.58.101।।
explanation: "Sita then said to me, 'Take this best of gems and present it to the longarmed Rama as a token'.

content: इत्युक्त्वा तु वरारोहा मणिप्रवरमद्भुतम्।प्रायच्छत्परमोद्विग्ना वाचा मां सन्दिदेशह।।5.58.102।।
explanation: "Having said so, the noble lady delivered a wonderful jewel with supreme message to me in a sorrowful mood.

content: ततस्तस्यै प्रणम्याहं राजपुत्र्यै समाहितः।प्रदक्षिणं परिक्राममिहाभ्युद्गतमानसः।।5.58.103।।
explanation: "Reminded by her again (that Rama should turn up soon to take her), I offered reverential salutations by circumambulating her.

content: उक्तोऽहं पुनरेवेदं निश्चित्य मनसा तया।हनुमन्मम वृत्तान्तं वक्तुमर्हसि राघवे।।5.58.104।।
यथा श्रुत्वैव न चिरात्तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।सुग्रीवसहितौ वीरावुपेयातां तथा कुरु।।5.58.105।।
explanation: 'O heroic Hanuman narrate in such a way that by hearing you both Rama and Lakshmana will come here soon, accompanied by Sugriva.

content: यद्यन्यथा भवेदेतद्द्वौ मासौ जीवितं मम।न मां द्रक्ष्यति काकुत्स्थो म्रिये साहमनाथवत्।।5.58.106।।
explanation: 'Otherwise with none to protect me, I will live only  for two months.I will die like an orphan and he will not see me'.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा करुणं वाक्यं क्रोधो मामभ्यवर्तत।उत्तरं च मया दृष्टं कार्यशेषमनन्तरम्।।5.58.107।।
explanation: "When I heard her pathetic appeal, I was overtaken by anger. I perceived the task left over for me to do.

content: ततोऽवर्धत मे कायस्तदा पर्वतसन्निभः।युद्धकाङ्क्षी वनं तच्च विनाशयितुमारभे।।5.58.108।।
explanation: "Thereafter, I increased my body to the size of a mountain, intent on fighting and started destroying the pleasure garden.

content: तद्भग्नं वनषण्डं तु भ्रान्तत्रस्तमृगद्विजम्।प्रतिबुद्धा निरीक्षन्ते राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः।।5.58.109।।
explanation: "Those uglyfaced ogresses woke up and saw the devastated garden and terrified beasts and birds.

content: मां च दृष्ट्वा वने तस्मिन् समागम्य ततस्ततः।ता स्समभ्यागताः क्षिप्रं रावणायाचचक्षिरे।।5.58.110।।
राजस्वनमिदं दुर्गं तव भग्नं दुरात्मना।वानरेण ह्यविज्ञाय तव वीर्यं महाबल।।5.58.111।।
explanation: 'O powerful king an evilminded vanara has destroyed the inaccessible pleasure garden not knowing your valour.

content: दुर्बुद्धेस्तस्य राजेन्द्र तव विप्रियकारिणः।वधमाज्ञापय क्षिप्रं यथासौ विलयं व्रजेत्।।5.58.112।।
explanation: 'O king may orders be issued to kill this wickedminded vanara wandering aimlessly. He has done contrary to your interest.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रेण विसृष्टा भृशदुर्जयाः।राक्षसाः किङ्करा नाम रावणस्य मनोनुगाः।।5.58.113।।
explanation: "Ravana, lord of the demons having heard (the ogresses) sent invincible ogres called kinkaras who know his mind.

content: तेषामशीतिसाहस्रं शूलमुद्गरपाणिनाम्।मया तस्मिन्वनोद्देशे परिघेण निषूदितम्।।5.58.114।।
explanation: "I killed with an iron bar a battalion of eighty thousand demons who were guarding the garden with tridents and maces.

content: तेषां तु हतशेषा ये ते गत्वा लघुविक्रमाः।निहतं च महत्सैन्यं रावणायाचचक्षिरे।।5.58.115।।
explanation: "Those who were left behind, the less powerful ones went and reported to Ravana that the great army has been killed.

content: ततो मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना चैत्यप्रासादमाक्रमम्।तत्रस्थान्राक्षसान् हत्वा शतं स्तम्भेन वै पुनः।।5.58.116।।ललामभूतो लङ्कायास्स वै विध्वंसितो मया।
explanation: "Then a thought struck my mind. I took hold of a pillar of the tall, decorated mansion of Lanka and killed with it all the hundred demons stationed there.

content: ततः प्रहस्तस्य सुतं जम्बुमालिनमादिशत्।।5.58.117।।राक्षसैर्बहुभिस्सार्धं घोररूपैर्भयानकैः।
तं महाबलसम्पन्नं राक्षसं रणकोविदम्।।5.58.118।।परिघेणातिघोरेण सूदयामि सहानुगम्।
explanation: "With a dreadful iron bar I slayed Jambumali, who was endowed with mighty strength, and was an expert in war and other terrific ogres who accompanied him.

content: तच्छ्रुत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्तु मन्त्रिपुत्त्रान्महाबलान्।।5.58.119।।पदातिबलसम्पन्नान् प्रेषयामास रावणः।
explanation: "Ravana, the demon king sent his mighty army of strong footsoldiers, the sons of ministers.

content: परिघेणैव तान् सर्वान्नयामि यमसादनम्।।5.58.120।।मन्त्रिपुत्त्रान्हतान्च्छृत्वा समरेऽलघुविक्रमान्।पञ्च सेनाग्रगाच्छ्रूरान्प्रेषयामास रावणः।।5.58.121।।
explanation: "I sent all of them to the abode of Yama with just an iron bar. Having heard about the death of the less powerful ones, Ravana  sent five heroic army generals.

content: तानहं सहसैन्यान्वै सर्वानेवाभ्यसूदयम्।ततः पुनर्दशग्रीवः पुत्रमक्षं महाबलम्।।5.58.122।।बहुभी राक्षसैस्सार्धं प्रेषयामास रावणः।
explanation: "Since I killed all of them along with the army, the tenheaded Ravana sent out his mighty son Aksha together with many demons.

content: तं तु मन्दोदरीपुत्त्रं कुमारं रणपण्डितम्।।5.58.123।।सहसा खं समुत्क्रान्तं पादयोश्च गृहीतवान्।चर्मासिनं शतगुणं भ्रामयित्वा व्यपेषयम्।।5.58.124।।
explanation: "When Mandodari's son, an expert in war had risen up to the sky I caught his feet and whirled him round a hundred times and smashed him.

content: तमक्षमागतं भग्नं निशम्य स दशाननः।तत इन्द्रजितं नाम द्वितीयं रावणस्सुतम्।।5.58.125।।व्यादिदेश सुसंकृद्धो बलिनम् युद्धदुर्मदम्।
explanation: "When Aksha was done to death, the tenfaced Ravana was enraged and gave instruction to the second son, called Indrajit who was thirsting for war.

content: तच्चाप्यहं बलं सर्वं तं च राक्षसपुङ्गवम्।।5.58.126।।नष्टौजसं रणे कृत्वा परं हर्षमुपागमम्।
explanation: "When the army and even the Generals were done to death in combat I was very happy.

content: महतापि महाबाहुः प्रत्ययेन महाबलः।।5.58.127।।प्रेषितो रावणेनैव सह वीरैर्मदोत्कटैः।
explanation: "Thinking that Indrajit will surely kill me, the strongarmed mighty Ravana again sent intoxicated demon warriors.

content: सोऽविषह्यं हि मां बुद्ध्वा स्वं बलं चावमर्दितम्।।5.58.128।।ब्राह्मणास्त्रेण स तु मां प्राबध्नाच्छातिवेगितः।
explanation: "Realising that I cannot be slain and that his (Indrajit's) power is reduced, he released Brahma's weapon on me with high speed and captured me.

content: रज्जुभिश्चाभिबध्नन्ति ततो मां तत्र राक्षसाः।।5.58.129।।रावणस्य समीपं च गृहीत्वा मामुपानयन्।
explanation: "Then the demons bound me with ropes and brought me to Ravana.

content: दृष्ट्वा सम्भाषितश्चाहं रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.58.130।।पृष्टश्च लङ्कागमनं राक्षसानां च तं वधम्।
explanation: "The wickedminded Ravana, then enquired me why I came to Lanka and why I killed the demons.

content: तत्सर्वं च मया तत्र सीतार्थमिति जल्पितम्।।5.58.131।।अस्याहं दर्शनाकाङ्क्षी प्राप्तस्त्वद्भवनं विभो।मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रो वानरो हनुमानहम्।।5.58.132।।
explanation: 'I have done all this for the sake of Sita, O demon king I came to your mansion desiring to see Sita. I am the legitimate son of Windgod. My name is Hanuman.

content: रामदूतं च मां विद्धि सुग्रीवसचिवं कपिम्।सोऽहं दूत्येन रामस्य त्वत्सकाशमिहागतः।।5.58.133।।
explanation: 'I am a vanara, a messenger of Rama and minister of Sugriva.You may know that I have come here to convey the message of Rama to you.

content: सुग्रीवश्च महातेजास्सत्वां कुशलमब्रवीत्।धर्मार्थकामसहितं हितं पथ्यमुवाच च।।5.58.134।।
explanation: 'Highly powerful Sugriva enquires your welfare. He sends beneficial advice to you for your righteousness, pleasures and wellbeing.

content: वसतो ऋश्यमूके मे पर्वते विपुलद्रुमे।राघवो रणविक्रान्तो मित्त्रत्वं समुपागतः।।5.58.135।।
explanation: 'While I was dwelling at the woodedmountain in Rshyamuka, a treaty of friendship was made with Rama, who is skilled in war.

content: तेन मे कथितं राज्ञा भार्या मे रक्षसा हृता।तत्र साहाय्यमस्माकं कार्यं सर्वात्मना त्वया।।5.58.136।।
explanation: 'The king said, ' My wife was abducted by a demon. I request your help by all means to get her'.

content: मया च कथितं तस्मै वालिनश्च वधं प्रति।तत्र साहाय्यहेतोर्मे समयं कर्तुमर्हसि।।5.58.137।।
explanation: 'Sugriva told the story of Vali in turn and asked for his help and to make agreement to kill Vali.

content: वालिना हृतराज्येन सुग्रीवेण महाप्रभुः।चक्रेऽग्निसाक्षिकं सख्यं राघवस्सह लक्ष्मणः।।5.58.138।।
explanation: With fire as witness the great lord, Rama along with Lakshmana made friendship with Sugriva whose kingdom had been usurped.

content: तेन वालिनमुत्पाट्य शरेणैकेन संयुगे।वानराणां महाराजः कृतस्स प्लवतां प्रभुः।।5.58.139।।
explanation: 'In the combat Rama killed Vali with a single arrow and made Sugriva the king of vanaras.

content: तस्य साहाय्यमस्माभिः कार्यं सर्वात्मना त्विह।तेन प्रस्थापितस्तुभ्यं समीपमिह धर्मतः।।5.58.140।।
explanation: 'We too have to help him in this task. So a message is sent to you on righteous grounds.

content: क्षिप्रमानीयतां सीता दीयतां राघवाय च।यावन्न हरयो वीरा विधमन्ति बलं तव।।5.58.141।।
explanation: 'Before the heroic vanaras exterminate your entire army, return Sita at once to Rama.

content: वानराणां प्रभावो हि न केन विदितः पुरा।देवतानां सङ्काशं च ये गच्छन्ति निमन्त्रिताः।।5.58.142।।
explanation: 'Who knows not the power of Vanaras in the past? Even gods had sought their help.

content: इति वानरराजस्त्वामाहेत्यभिहितो मया।मामैक्षत ततः क्रुद्धश्चक्षुषा प्रदहन्निव।।5.58.143।।
explanation: 'This I was asked to tell you by the king of vanaras wishing your welfare'. 'Ravana then angrily looked at me as if to burn me.

content: तेन वध्योऽहमाज्ञप्तो रक्षसा रौद्रकर्मणा।मत्प्रभावमविज्ञाय रावणेन दुरात्मना।।5.58.144।।
explanation: "The evilminded demon, Ravana, who perpetrates dreadful acts ordered my slaughter, not knowing my power.

content: ततो विभीषणो नाम तस्य भ्राता महामतिः।तेन राक्षसराजोऽसौ याचितो मम कारणात्।।5.58.145।।
explanation: "Vibhisana, a very pious brother of the demon king, interceded on my behalf.

content: नैवं राक्षसशार्दूल त्यज्यतामेष निश्चयः।राजशास्त्रव्यपेतो हि मार्गः संसेव्यते त्वया।।5.58.146।।
explanation: "Vibhishana, a tiger among demons, asked Ravana to give up his decision as it was a forbidden course according to the science of royal polity.

content: दूतवध्या न दृष्टा हि राजशास्त्रेषु राक्षस।दूतेन वेदितव्यं च यथार्थं हितवादिना।।5.58.147।।
explanation: 'The royal code prohibits the murder of an emissary. A wellwishing emissary should convey the truth.

content: सुमहत्यपराधेऽपि दूतस्यातुलविक्रमः।विरूपकरणं दृष्टं न वधोऽस्तीति शास्त्रतः।।5.58.148।।
explanation: 'O Ravana of immeasurable courage even if the emissary has done any kind of harm he may be mutilated but not murdered. Nowhere do the sastras allow killing (of an ambassador).

content: विभीषणेनैवमुक्तो रावणस्सन्दिदेश तान्।राक्षसानेतदेवास्य लाङ्गूलं दह्यतामिति।।5.58.149।।
explanation: 'On hearing Vibhishana, Ravana instructed the demons to burn my tail.

content: ततस्तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा मम पुच्छं समन्ततः।वेष्टितं शणवल्कैश्च जीर्णैः कार्पासजैः पटैः।।5.58.150।।
explanation: "Having heard the king's words, all the demons collected and held my tail, wrapped it with saris of fibres and tattered rags of cotton.

content: राक्षसाः सिद्धसन्नाहास्ततस्ते चण्डविक्रमाः।तदाऽदह्यन्त मे पुच्छं निघ्नन्त: काष्ठमुष्टिभिः।।5.58.151।।बद्धस्य बहुभिः पाशैर्यन्त्रितस्य च राक्षसैः।
explanation: "Many ferociously courageous demons got ready. They bound me and hit me with firesticks and fists. They fastened my tail with ropes and set in on fire.

content: ततस्ते राक्षसाश्शूरा बद्धं मामग्निसंवृतम्।।5.58.152।।अघोषयन्राजमार्गे नगरद्वारमागताः।
explanation: "The brave demons took me round the city through the royal streets and announced loudly to let every one know that I am bound and that my tail has been set on fire.

content: ततोऽहं सुमहद्रूपं संक्षिप्य पुनरात्मनः।।5.58.153।।विमोचयित्वा तं बन्धं प्रकृतिस्थः स्थितः पुनः।आयसं परिघं गृह्य तानि रक्षांस्यसूदयम्।।5.58.154।।
explanation: "I reduced my form and rid of the bondage. Then again I assumed my original huge form and took up an iron bar lying near and killed all the demons (present).

content: ततस्तन्नगरद्वारं वेगेनाप्लुतवानहम्।पुच्छेन च प्रदीप्तेन तां पुरीं साट्टगोपुराम्।।5.58.155।।दहाम्यहमसंभ्रान्तो युगान्ताग्निरिव प्रजाः।
explanation: "Then I leaped to the entrance gate of the city without being perplexed. With my burning tail I set fire to the boundaries and towering mansions which looked like the world at the end of dissolution.

content: विनष्टा जानकी व्यक्तं न ह्यदग्धः प्रदृश्यते।।5.58.156।।लङ्कायां कश्चिदुद्धेशः सर्वा भस्मीकृता पुरी।
दहता च मया लङ्कां दग्धा सीता न संशयः।।5.58.157।।रामस्य हि महत्कार्यं मयेदं वितथीकृतम्।
