explanation: "Lanka has been burnt by me and Sita might have also been burnt. There is no doubt. The great purpose of Rama has been spoilt by me'.

content: इति शोकसमाविष्टश्चिन्तामहमुपागतः।।5.58.158।।अथाहं वाचमश्रौषं चारणानां शुभाक्षराम्।जानकी न च दग्धेति विस्मयोदन्तभाषिणाम्।।5.58.159।।
explanation: "Thus I was overtaken by sorrow and worry. Just then I heard the wonderful propitious utterances of charanas announcing that Sita was not burnt.

content: ततो मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना श्रुत्वा तामद्भुतां गिरम्।अदग्धा जानकीत्येवं निमित्तैश्चोपलक्षिता।।5.58.160।।
explanation: "It was amazing to hear the words of the charanas. On hearing that Jankai had not been burnt, I understood that it is on her account (that he is also not burnt  although his tail was ignited.)

content: दीप्यमाने तु लाङ्गूले न मां दहति पावकः।हृदयं च प्रहृष्टं मे वातास्सुरभिगन्धिनः।।5.58.161।।
explanation: "My tail was burning but I was not burnt by fire. There was joy in my heart. The wind carried sweet fragrance.

content: तैर्निमित्तैश्च दृष्टाथै: कारणैश्च महागुणैः।ऋषिवाक्यैश्च सिद्धार्थैरभवं हृष्टमानसः।।5.58.162।।
explanation: "For these two auspicious signs and the highly propitious words uttered by the sages I felt glad at heart.

content: पुनर्दृष्ट्वा च वैदेहीं विसृष्टश्च तया पुनः।ततः पर्वतमासाद्य तत्रारिष्टमहं पुनः।।5.58.163।।प्रतिप्लवनमारेभे युष्मद्धर्शनकांक्षया।
ततः पवनचन्द्रार्कसिद्धगन्धर्वसेवितम्।।5.58.164।।पन्थानमहमाक्रम्य भवतो दृष्टवानिह।
explanation: "Passing along the path of the Windgod, the Moon, the Sun, the siddhas and the gandharvas  I came to see you.

content: राघवस्य प्रभावेण भवतां चैव तेजसा।।5.58.165।।सुग्रीवस्य च कार्यार्थं मया सर्वमनुष्ठितम्।
explanation: "Everything was favourable to me by the power of Rama, by your goodwill and for the great purpose of Sugriva.

content: एतत्सर्वं मया तत्र यथावदुपपादितम्।।5.58.166।।अत्र यन्न कृतं शेषं तत्सर्वं क्रियतामिति।
explanation: "Let all that could not be done there and still remains to be done, be accomplished by you. I have presented the entire thing".इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman gives an account of the plight of Sita in Lanka -- incites the vanaras to be ready for the next course of action]  एतदाख्याय तत्सर्वं हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।भूयस्समुपचक्राम वचनं वक्तुमुत्तरम्।।5.59.1।।
explanation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod having narrated in detail all that had happened again started disclosing further details৷৷

content: सफलो राघवोद्योग स्सुग्रीवस्य च सम्भ्रमः।शीलमासाद्य सीताया मम च प्रवणं मनः।।5.59.2।।
explanation: "It is due to Rama's exertions, Sugriva's endeavour and Sita's conduct that I have been successful. My devotion to Sita has further deepened.

content:
तपसा निर्दहेल्लोकान्क्रुद्धो वा निर्दहेदपि।

सर्वधातिप्रवृद्धोऽसौ रावणो राक्षसाधिपः ॥ 5.59.3 ॥
explanation: "The demon king is rich in asceticism. He can burn the whole world with the power of his penance. In spite of Sita's anger he was not burnt(Hanuman gives the reason for Ravana's survival).

content: तस्य तां स्पृशतो गात्रं तपसा न विनाशितम्।न तदग्निशिखा कुर्यात्संस्पृष्टा पाणिना सती।।5.59.4।।जनकस्यात्मजा कुर्याद्यत्क्रोधकलुषीकृता।
explanation: "Sita can burn Ravana with the mere touch of her body but because of the power of his penance, he was not burnt even though he touched her hand. If enraged, Janaki can burn the whole world (by virtue of her chastity) in a way that even the flame of fire can not do. (But she desired that her husband should kill him.)

content: जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् सर्वाननुज्ञाप्य महाहरीन्।।5.59.5।।अस्मिन्नेवं गते कार्ये भवतां च निवेदिते।न्याय्यं स्म सह वैदेह्या द्रष्टुं तौ पार्थिवात्मजौ।।5.59.6।।
अहमेकोऽपि पर्याप्तस्सराक्षसगणां पुरीम्।तां लङ्कां तरसा हन्तुं रावणं च महाबलम्।।5.59.7।।
किं पुन स्सहितो वीरैर्बलवद्भिः कृतात्मभिः।कृतास्त्रै: प्लवगैश्शूरैर्भवद्भिविजयैषिभिः।।5.59.8।।
explanation: "When strong, wise and accomplished persons are there with me desiring victory  why speak again?

content: अहं तु रावणं युद्धे ससैन्यं सपुरस्सरम्।सहपुत्त्रं वधिष्यामि सहोदरयुतं युधि।।5.59.9।।
explanation: "I can also kill all the army,  his followers, sons and brothers of Ravana in war.

content: ब्राह्ममैन्द्रं च रौद्रं च वायव्यं वारणं तथा।यदि शक्रजितोऽस्त्राणि दुर्निरीक्षाणि संयुगे।।5.59.10।।तान्यहं वधिष्यामि हनिष्यामि च राक्षसान्।
explanation: "Even if the missiles used by Indrajit are Brahmastra, Indrastra, Rudrastra, Vayavastra, Varunastra which are difficult to see. I will destroy them in war and kill them.

content: भवतामभ्यनुज्ञातो विक्रमो मे रुणद्धि तम्।।5.59.11।।मयातुला विसृष्टा हि शैलवृष्टिर्निरन्तरा।देवानपि रणे हन्यात्किं पुनस्तान्निशाचरान्।।5.59.12।।
explanation: Now if I am permitted, I shall repulse them and destroy them with my valour. A  ceaseless shower of rocks sent forth by me in war is enough to destroy even gods what to say about the nightrangers?

content: सागरोऽप्यतियाद्वेलां मन्दरः प्रचलेदपि।न जाम्बवन्तं समरे कम्पयेदरिवाहिनी।।5.59.13।।
explanation: "The ocean may exceed its limits, the mountain Mandara may be shaken from its position but  no hostile army can move Jambavan in war.

content: सर्वराक्षससङ्घानां राक्षसा ये च पूर्वकाः।अलमेको विनाशाय वीरो वालिसुतः कपिः।।5.59.14।।
पनसस्योरुवेगेन नीलस्य च महात्मनः।मन्दरोऽप्यवशीर्येत किंपुनर्युधि राक्षसाः।।5.59.15।
explanation: "Even the mountain Mandara would be shattered by great Panasa or Nila by the speed of their thighs. What to say in a battle against ogres?

content: सदेवासुरयक्षेषु गन्धर्वोरगपक्षिषु।मैन्दस्य प्रतियोद्धारं शंसत द्विविदस्य वा।।5.59.16।।
explanation: "Who among gods, yakshas, gandharvas, nagas and birds can contend Mainda or Dvivida in battle?Tell me.

content: अश्विपुत्रौ महाभागावेतौ प्लवगसत्तमौ।एतयोः प्रतियोद्दारं न पश्यामि रणाजिरे।।5.59.17।।
explanation: "The (two) sons of Aswini are outstanding and foremost fighters and proud of waging war. Who can oppose them? I do not see any one.

content: पितामहवरोत्सेकात्परमं दर्पमास्थितौ।अमृतप्राशिनावेतौ सर्ववानरसत्तमौ।।5.59.18।।
explanation: "By virtue of the boons received from Brahma, they are very proud. They have also consumed nectar of immortality and are foremost among vanaras.

content: अश्विनोर्माननार्थं हि सर्वलोकपितामहः।सर्वावध्यत्वमतुलमनयोर्दत्तवान्पुरा।।5.59.19।।
explanation: "Earlier Brahma, the grandsire of all worlds has given the Aswini sons immeasurable invulnerability to honour them.

content: वरोत्सेकेन मत्तौ च प्रमथ्य महतीं चमूम्।सुराणाममृतं वीरौ पीतवन्तौ प्लवङ्गमौ।।5.59.20।।
explanation: "The heroic monkeys, proud of their boons became intoxicated it and slaughtered vast army and drank the nectar of immortality.

content: एतावेव हि सङ्कृद्धौ सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम्।लङ्कां नाशयितुं शक्तौ सर्वे तिष्ठन्तु वानराः।।5.59.21।।
explanation: "If these two become angry they have the power to destroy Lanka, the cavalry, chariots and also the elephants even if the vanaras stay away.

content: मयैव निहता लङ्का दग्धा भस्मीकृता पुनः।राजमार्गेषु सर्वत्र नाम विश्रावितं मया।।5.59.22।।
explanation: "I have burnt Lanka and have made my name popular even on the highways.

content: जयत्यतिबलो रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।राजा जयति सुग्रीवो राघवेणाभिपालितः।।5.59.23।।अहं कोसलराजस्य दासः पवनसम्भवः।हनुमानिति सर्वत्र नाम विश्रावितं मया।।5.59.24।।
explanation: "Mighty Rama and Lakshmana and King Sugriva protected by Rama are renowned for their valour. I am Hanuman, son of the Windgod, a servant of Rama. This I announced.

content: अशोकवनिकामध्ये रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।अध स्ताच्छिंशुपावृक्षे साध्वी करुणमास्थिता।।5.59.25।।राक्षसीभिः परिवृता शोकसंतापकर्शिता।मेघलेखापरिवृता चन्द्रलेखेव निष्प्रभा।।5.59.26।।।अचिन्तयन्ती वैदेही रावणं बलदर्पितम्।
explanation: "In the wicked, Ravana's Ashoka garden under the Simsupa tree the noble lady Sita surrounded by ogresses, is sitting, tormented by tears. Her brightness is like the Moon's, veiled by flakes of clouds. She does not care for Ravana's glory. She is brooding over Rama only.

content: पतिव्रता च सुश्रोणी अवष्टब्धा च जानकी।।5.59.27।।अनुरक्ता हि वैदेही रामं सर्वात्मना शुभा।अनन्यचित्ता रामे च पौलोमीव पुरन्दरे।।5.59.28।।
explanation: "Chaste Sita of beautiful hips, an auspicious lady though bound is wholly devoted to Rama alone like Sachi, the wife of Indra who was bound by Nahusha.

content: तदेकवासस्संवीता रजोध्वस्ता तथैव च।शोकसन्तापदीनाङ्गी सीता भर्तृहिते रता।।5.59.29।।
explanation: "Wearing the same single cloth which she had worn before, filled with dust, Sita remained sorrowful and piteous wishing her husband's welfare.

content: सा मया राक्षसीमध्ये तर्ज्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः।राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभिर्दृष्टा हि प्रमदावने।।5.59.30।।एकवेणीधरा दीना भर्तृचिन्तापरायणा।अधश्शय्या विवर्णाङ्गी पद्मिनीव हिमागमे।।5.59.31।।रावणाद्विनिवृत्तार्था मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया।
explanation: "I saw Sita often threatened by uglylooking ogresses. Wearing a single braid, she looked pathetic, thinking always about her husband, lying on the bare ground. She was like a lustreless lotus in winter. Spurning the advances by Ravana, she is rather determined to commit suicide.

content: कथञ्चिन्मृगशाबाक्षी विश्वासमुपपादिता।।5.59.32।।ततः संभाषिता चैव सर्वमर्थं च दर्शिता।रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च श्रुत्वा प्रीतिमुपागता।।5.59.33।।
explanation: "I created a little confidence in the fawneyed lady by pacifying her and explaining her with great difficulty the alliance of Rama and Sugriva on hearing which she became happy.

content:
नियतस्समुदाचारो भक्तिर्भर्तरि चोत्तमा।

यन्न हन्ति दशग्रीवं सा महात्मा कृतागसम्।।5.59.34।।
explanation: "Ravana is a great soul because, even though he has done harm to her, he is not killed. This is because Sita being a chaste woman of good conduct and deep devotion towards her husband (she refrained from killing Ravana as she wanted her husband to do that.)

content: निमित्तमात्रं रामस्तु वधे तस्य भविष्यति।सा प्रकृत्यैव तन्वङ्गी तद्वियोगाच्च कर्शिता।।5.59.35।।प्रतिपत्पाठशीलस्य विद्येव तनुमतां गता।
explanation: "To Rama, killing Ravana is easy (since Ravana's power of penance has already declined by his abduction of Sita). Separated from her husband she is naturally emaciated. She has become slender just like a student on the new Moon day (on the first day of study).

content: एवमास्ते महाभागा सीता शोकपरायणा।।5.59.36।।यदत्र प्रतिकर्तव्यं तत्सर्वमुपपाद्यताम्।
explanation: "Noble Sita is absorbed in grief. Let us do all that has to be done now."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Jambavan says it is advisable to follow Rama's instruction.]तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वालिसूनुरभाषत।अयुक्तं तु विना देवीं दृष्टवद्भिश्च वानराः।।5.60.1।।समीपं गन्तुमस्माभी राघवस्य महात्मनः।
explanation: After hearing Hanuman,  Vali's son said" O vanaras (Hanuman) having seen Sita it is not proper on our part to go without Sita to the great soul Rama.

content: दृष्टा देवी न चानीता इति तत्र निवेदनम्।।5.60.2।।अयुक्तमिव पश्यामि भवद्भिः ख्यातविक्रमैः।
explanation: "O vanaras, you are known for your valour. I think, to tell Rama that we have seen Sita but not brought her is not proper".

content: न हि नः प्लवने कश्चिन्नापि कश्चित्पराक्रमे।।5.60.3।।तुल्य स्सामरदैत्येषु लोकेषु हरिसत्तमाः।
explanation: "O noble vanaras Indeed either among gods or among demons there is none who can match the vanaras in leaping and exhibiting valour.

content: तेष्वेवं हतवीरेषु राक्षसेषु हनूमता।।5.60.4।।किमन्यदत्र कर्तव्यं गृहीत्वा याम जानकीम्।
explanation: "Hence, having killed the heroes among ogres what other task has Hanuman to do? Let us get Sita.

content: तमेवं कृतसङ्कल्पं जाम्बवान् हरिसत्तमः।।5.60.5।।उवाच परमप्रीतो वाक्यमर्थवदर्थवित्।
explanation: "Jambavan, the noble vanara, skilled in the execution of tasks thus commanded in a determined manner:

content: न तावदेषा मतिरक्षमा नो यथा भवान् पश्यति राजपुत्र।यथा तु रामस्य मतिर्निविष्टा तथा भवान् पश्यतु कार्यसिद्धिम्।।5.60.6।।
explanation: "O prince what you think is  acceptable to us also. Even though we are capable of achieving, knowing what is in Rama's mind, we should act only according to his command to accomplish the task.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramyana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Monkey leaders enter Madhuvan on the outskirts of Kishkinda and destroy it in their drunkenness.]ततो जाम्बवतो वाक्यमगृह्णन्त वनौकसः।अङ्गदप्रमुखा वीरा हनुमांश्च महाकपिः।।5.61.1।।
explanation: In the midst of all the leaders of the monkeys including Angada, Hanuman accepted Jambavan's advice.

content: प्रीतिमन्तस्ततः सर्वे वायुपुत्रपरस्पराः।महेन्द्राद्रिं परित्यज्य पुप्लुवुः प्लवगर्षभाः।।5.61.2।।मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशा मत्ता इव महागजाः।छादयन्त इवाकाशं महाकाया महाबलाः।।5.61.3।।सभाज्यमानं भूतैस्तमात्मवन्तं महाबलम्।हनूमन्तं महावेगं वहन्त इव दृष्टिभिः।।5.61.4।।राघवे चार्थनिर्ववृत्तिं कर्तुं च परमं यशः।समाधाय समृद्धार्थाः सर्वेसिद्धिभिरुन्नता।।5.61.5।।प्रियाख्यानोन्मुखाः सर्वे सर्वे युद्धाभिनन्दिनः।सर्वे रामप्रतीकारे निश्चितार्था मनस्स्विनः।।5.61.6।।
explanation: Thereafter led by Hanuman, all the vanaras left Mahendra mountain and marched very happily. The vanaras were strong and huge like elephants and resembled mountain Meru. Moreover when they leaped up they seemed to cover the sky (so it was difficult to tell their numbers). Since Hanuman had accomplished the task, the vanaras were praising his strength, his swiftness and courage. They were looking at Hanuman without blinking their eyes, and seemed as though they were carrying him by their eyes. They were determined in their minds to please Rama. Remaining in a state of offering themselves, some of them more accomplished than others, collected together eager to wage war and talking pleasantly among themselves having resolved to assist Rama.

content: प्लवमानाः खमाप्लुत्य ततस्ते काननौकसः।नन्दनोपमयासेदुर्वनं द्रुमलतायुतम्।।5.61.7।।
explanation: "The monkeys leaped into the sky and entered the garden that resembled the garden of Indra filled with trees and creepers.

content: यत्तन्मधुवनं नाम सुग्रीवस्याभिरक्षितम्।अधृष्यं सर्वभूतानां सर्वभूतमनोहरम्।।5.61.8।।
explanation: The Madhuvanam of Sugriva was wellprotected  and was difficult to access for the vanaras. It was enchating to all beings.

content: यद्रक्षति महावीर्य स्सदा दधिमुखः कपिः।मातुलः कपिमुख्यस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः।।5.61.9।।
explanation: Dadhimukha, the foremost of all monkeys, of great valour and the maternal uncle of Sugriva was the caretaker of  the garden.

content: ते तद्वनमुपागम्य बभूवुः परमोत्कटाः।वानरा वानरेन्द्रस्य मनः कान्ततमं महत्।।5.61.10।।
explanation: On reaching the vanara king's extensive, delightful garden all the vanaras highly rejoiced.

content: ततस्ते वानरा हृष्टा दृष्टवा मधुवनं महत्।कुमारमभ्ययाचन्त मधूनि मधुपिङ्गलाः।।5.61.11।।
explanation: The honeycoloured monkeys felt happy on seeing the Madhuvanam and sought Angada's permission to drink honey.

content: ततः कुमारस्तान् वृद्धान् जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् कपीन्।अनुमान्य ददौ तेषां विसर्गं मधुभिक्षणे।।5.61.12।।
explanation: Young Angada asked old Jambavan's permission for the vanaras to drink honey and Jambavan permitted them.

content: ततश्चानुमता स्सर्वे सम्प्रहृष्टा वनौकसः।मुदिताः प्रेरिताश्चापि प्रनृत्यन्तोऽभवंस्तदा।।5.61.13।।
explanation: Permitted thus to drink honey the forestdwelling monkeys were motivated. They rejoiced very happily and started dancing.

content: गायन्ति केचित्प्रणमन्ति केचिन्नृत्यन्ति केचित्प्रहसन्ति केचित्।पतन्ति केचिद्विचरन्ति केचित्ल्पवन्ति केचित्प्रलपन्ति केचित्।।5.61.14।।
explanation: Some sang, some prostrated on the ground, some danced, while some laughed, some jumped from the tree, some roamed about and some jumped up and down.

content: परस्परं केचिदुपाश्रयन्ते परस्परं केचिदुपाक्रमन्ते।परस्परं केचिदुपब्रुवन्ते परस्परं केचिदुपारमन्ते।।5.61.15।।
explanation: While some supported one another, some held each other, some exchanged secrets with one another, some entertained one another.

content: द्रुमाद्द्रुमं केचिदभिद्रवन्ते क्षितौ नगाग्रान्निपतन्ति केचित्।महीतलात्केचिदुदीर्णवेगा महाद्रुमाग्राण्यभिसम्पतन्ति।।5.61.16।।
explanation: While some ran from one tree to another, some jumped down from broken branches, and some swiftfooted ones fell down from the top of trees.

content: गायन्तमन्यः प्रहसन्नुपैति हसन्तमन्यः प्ररुदन्नुपैति।रुदन्तमन्यः प्रणुदन्नुपैति नुदन्तमन्यः प्रणदन्नुपैति।।5.61.17।।
explanation: While one was singing, others approached him laughing while some were laughing others fell on them laughing excessively. While some were roaring, others went pushing them down. While some were encouraged to do something others shouted at them.

content: समाकुलं तत्कपिसैन्यमासीन्मधुप्रसानोत्कटसत्त्वचेष्टम्।न चात्र कश्चिन्न बभूव मत्तो न चात्र कश्चिन्न बभूव तृप्तः।।5.61.18।।
explanation: The army of monkeys had lost control over their bodies due to drinking of honeywine. Not even one was quietly seated there. Not even one was not intoxicated. Not only that, none were satisfied.

content: ततो वनं तत्परिभक्ष्यमाणं द्रुमांश्च विध्वंसितपत्रपुष्पान्।समीक्ष्य कोपाद्धधिवक्रनामा निवारयामास कपिः कपींस्तान्।।5.61.19।।
explanation: Beholding the destruction wrought by the vanaras to the garden, trees, leaves and flowers, and having drunk all the honey, Dadhimukha angrily asked them to stop and get out.

content: स तैः प्रवृद्धैः परिभर्त्स्यमानो वनस्य गोप्ता हरिवीरवृद्धः।चकार भूयो मतिमुग्रतेजा वनस्य रक्षां प्रति वानरेभ्यः।।5.61.20।।
explanation: The elderly Dadhimukha who was the powerful protector of the garden reprimanded them and devised yet again a plan to protect it.

content: उवाच कांश्चित्परुषाणि धृष्टमसक्तमन्यांश्च तलैर्जघान।समेत्य कैश्चित्कलहं चकार तथैव साम्नोपजगाम कांश्चित्।।5.61.21।।
explanation: He spoke harshly to some, to others he asked not to talk, some he slapped on the hind part with the palm of his hand. To some he spoke pleasantly and with some he quarrelled. And to others he spoke in a conciliatory manner.

content: स तैर्मदात्संपरिवार्य वाक्यैर्भलाच्छ तेन प्रतिवार्यमाणैः।प्रधर्षितस्त्यक्तभयै स्समेत्य प्रकृष्यते चाप्यनवेक्ष्य दोषम्।।5.61.22।।
explanation: In their drunkenness they were using abusive language and with their strength they retaliated without fear. They invaded without considering their mistakes. They caught hold of Dadhimukha and pulled him.

content: नखैस्तुदन्तो दशनैर्दशन्त स्तलैश्च पादैश्च समापयन्तः।मदात्कपिं तं कपय स्समग्रा महावनं निर्विषयं च चक्रुः।।5.61.23।।
explanation: In their drunkenness some monkeys scratched Dadhimukha violently with their nails, some bit him with their teeth and others slapped and kicked him with their palms and legs.Getting together they looted the garden completely.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकषष्टितम स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Guards of Madhuvanam headed by Dadhimukha move to report to Sugriva.]तानुवाच हरिश्रेष्ठो हनुमान्वानरर्षभः।अव्यग्रमनसो यूयं मधु सेवत वानराः।।5.62.1।।अहमावारयिष्यामि युष्माकं परिपन्थिनः।
explanation: Hanuman, the foremost of the monkeys, bull among vanaras said, 'Enjoy the honey devoid of any fear. I shall prevent those who object to your action'.

content: श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं हरीणां प्रवरोऽङ्गदः।।5.62.2।।प्रत्युवाच प्रसन्नात्मा पिबन्तु हरयो मधु।
explanation: Pleased with Hanuman's words, the distinguished Angada permitted the monkeys to drink.

content: अवश्यं कृतकार्यस्य वाक्यं हनुमतो मया।।5.62.3।।अकार्यमपि कर्तव्यं किमङ्ग पुनरीदृशम्।
explanation: Even if Hanuman, the achiever, forbids me to do something, I will do it. And now when he has permitted you, why hesitate ?

content: अङ्गदस्य मुखाच्छ्रुत्वावचनं वानरर्षभाः।।5.62.4।।साधुसाध्विति संहृष्टा वानराः प्रत्यपूजयन्।
explanation: Having heard the words that came from Angada's mouth, the bulls among vanaras praised him for his generous approval.

content: पूजयित्वाङ्गदं सर्वे वानरा वानरर्षभम्।।5.62.5।।जग्मुर्मधुवनं यत्र नदीवेग इव द्रुमम्।
explanation: The vanaras praised Angada, the bull among vanaras and went to Madhuvanam swiftly like a fastflowing river going to uproot a tree.

content: ते प्रविष्टा मधुवनं पालानाक्रम्य वीर्यतः।।5.62.6।।अतिसर्गाच्च पटवो दृष्ट्वा श्रुत्वा च मैथिलीम्।पपुस्सर्वे मधु तदा रसवत्फलमाददुः।।5.62.7।।
explanation: Overjoyed at the news of Mythili, being seen, the vanaras entered Madhuvanam and attacked the guards violently, drank the honey and ate the tasty fruits.

content: उत्पत्य च ततस्सर्वे वनपालान् समागतान्।ताडयन्ति स्म शतश स्सक्तान्मधुवने तदा।।5.62.8।।
explanation: All the vanaras collected together, entered the Madhuvanam and attacked in many ways the guards protecting  the  garden.

content: मधूनि द्रोणमात्राणि बाहुभिः परिगृह्य ते।पिबन्ति सहिता स्सर्वे निघ्नन्ति स्म तथापरे।।5.62.9।।
explanation: All of them now gathered at one place and drank honey from large containers. Others were busy preventing the guards.

content: केचित्पीत्वा प्रविध्यन्ति मधूनि मधुपिङ्गलाः।मधूच्छिष्टेन केचिच्च जग्मुरन्योन्यमुत्कटाः।।5.62.10।।
explanation: The honeycoloured monkeys drank honey. Some threw large chunks of honey combs after drinking and some went about intoxicated.

content: अपरे वृक्षमूले तु शाखां गृह्य व्यवस्थिताः।अत्यर्थं च मदग्लानाः पर्णान्यास्तीर्य शेरते।।5.62.11।।
explanation: Some took branches of trees and rested at the root of trees. Some totally languid lay down spreading leaves due to drinking of sweet drinks.

content: उन्मत्तभूताः प्लवगा मधुमत्ताश्च हृष्टवत्।क्षिपन्ति च तथान्योन्यं स्खलन्ति च तथाऽपरे।।5.62.12।।
explanation: Intoxicated with drink, some behaved like mad people, some pushed others senselessly and some were unsteady and shaky.

content: केचित् क्ष्वेलां प्रकुर्वन्ति केचित् कूजन्ति हृष्टवत्।हरयोमधुना मत्ताः केचित्सुप्ता महीतले।।5.62.13।।
explanation: Some roared, some warbled happily, some felt drowsy, drinking honey and some dropped off to sleep on the ground.

content: कृत्वा केचिद्धसन्त्यन्ये केचित्कुर्वन्ति चेतरत्।कृत्वा केचिद्वदन्त्यन्ये केचिद्बुध्यन्ति चेतरत्।।5.62.14।।
explanation: Some made others laugh, some provoked others and some thought of doing something else having got over the intoxication.

content: येऽप्यत्र मधुपाला स्स्युः प्रेष्या दधिमुखस्य तु।तेऽपि तैर्वानरैर्भीमैः प्रतिषिद्धा दिशो गताः।।5.62.15।।
explanation: All the guards engaged in protecting the garden were driven away in all directions by the fierce vanaras.

content: जानुभिस्तु प्रकृष्टाश्च देवमार्गं प्रदर्शिताः।अब्रुवन् परमोद्विग्ना गत्वा दधिमुखं वचः।।5.62.16।।
explanation: Some were dragged on their knees and tossed up. Some monkeys exhibited their private parts, showing indecent behaviour. Dadhimukha, highly disturbed at this, said:

content: हनूमता दत्तवरैर्हतं मधुवनं बलात्।वयं च जानुभिः कृष्टा देवमार्गं च दर्शिताः।।5.62.17।।
explanation: Permitted by Hanuman (to enter Madhuvanam and drink), they dragged one another forcefully tossed up  on their knees showing their private parts.

content: ततो दधिमुख: क्रुद्धो वनपस्तत्र वानरः।हतं मधुवनं श्रुत्वा सान्त्वयामास तान् हरीन्।।5.62.18।।
explanation: Then Dadhimukha, the guardian of the garden became furious on the vanaras. Having heard from the guards that the garden was destroyed, he said soothing words to them.

content: इहागच्छत गच्छामो वानरान् बलदर्पितान्।बलेन वारयिष्यामो मधु भक्षयतो वयम्।।5.62.19।।
explanation: "Come, we will all go there to Madhuvanam and prevent forcibly the vanaras who have consumed honey proud of their power.

content: श्रुत्वा दधिमुखस्येदं वचनं वानरर्षभाः।पुनर्वीरा मधुवनं तेनैव सहसा ययुः।।5.62.20।।
explanation: "The heroes, bulls among vanaras, heard Dadhimukha and quickly entered Madhuvanam along with him.

content: मध्ये चैषां दधिमुखः प्रगृह्य तरसा तरुम्।समभ्यधावद्वेगेन ते च सर्वे प्लवङ्गमाः।।5.62.21।।
explanation: On the way, the energetic Dadhimukha took up a tree and ran to the leaping vanaras swiftly with guards following him.

content: ते शिलाः पादपांश्चापि पर्वतांश्चापि वानराः।गृहीत्वाऽऽभ्यगमन् क्रुद्धा यत्र ते कपिकुञ्जराः।।5.62.22।।
explanation: The furious vanara guards lifted rocks, trees and even mountains and went behind Dadhimukha the elephant among the vanaras.

content: ते स्वामिवचनं वीरा हृदयेष्ववसज्य तत्।त्वरया ह्यभ्यधावन्त सालतालशिलायुधाः।।5.62.23।।
explanation: The heroic vanaras held Sala and Tala trees and rushed at once keeping their leader's words in mind.

content: वृक्षस्थांश्च तलस्थांश्च वानरान् बलदर्पितान्।अभ्यक्रामंस्ततो वीराः पालास्तत्र सहस्रशः।।5.62.24।।
explanation: Then the heroic guards in their thousands fell on the vanaras proud of their power on and under the tala trees.

content: अथ दृष्ट्वा दधिमुखं क्रुद्धं वानरपुङ्गवाः।अभ्यधावन्त वेगेन हनुमत्प्रमुखास्तदा।।5.62.25।।
explanation: Having seen the fury of Dadhimukha, Hanuman the leader of the vanaras went to him swiftly.

content: तं सवृक्षं महाबाहुमापतन्तं महाबलम्।आर्यकं प्राहरत्तत्र बाहुभ्यां कुपितोऽङ्गदः।।5.62.26।।
explanation: Seeing the revered, powerful and strongarmed Dadhimukha rushing to him, the angry Angada caught him with both hands tightly.

content: मदान्धश्च न वेदैनमार्यकोऽयं ममेति सः।अथैनं निष्पिपेषाशु वेगवद्वसुधातले।।5.62.27।।
explanation: "Blinded by arrogance, the prince pushed him (Dadhimukha) on the floor forcibly,  forgetting that he was his revered granduncle.

content: स भग्नबाहूरुभुजो विह्वलश्शोणितोक्षितः।मुमोह सहसा वीरो मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः।।5.62.28।।
explanation: The heroic Dadhimukha, an elephant among monkeys, with his shoulders and arms broken, and body drenched in blood lost his consciousness instantly.

content: स समाश्वस्य सहसा सङ्कृद्धो राजमातुलः।वानरान्वारयामास दण्डेन मधुमोहितान्।।5.62.29।।
explanation: At once Dadhimukha, the maternal uncle of the king became conscious and chased with a stick the intoxicated vanaras.

content: स कथञ्चिद्विमुक्तस्स्तैर्वानरैर्वानरर्षभः।उवाचैकान्तमाश्रित्य भृत्यान् स्वान् समुपागतान्।।5.62.30।।
explanation: Escaping from the vanaras with great difficulty, Dadhimukha,  a bull among monkeys, repaired to a secluded place and said to his servants:

content: एते तिष्ठन्तु गच्छामो भर्ता नो यत्र वानरः।सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवः सह रामेण तिष्ठति।।5.62.31।।
explanation: "Let them stay here. Our broadnecked king Sugriva will be there with Rama. Let us go to him.

content: सर्वं चैवाङ्गदे दोषं श्रावयिष्यामि पार्थिवे।अमर्षी वचनं श्रुत्वा घातयिष्यति वानरान्।।5.62.32।।
इष्टं मधुवनं ह्येतत्पार्थिवस्य महात्मनः।पितृपैतामहं दिव्यं देवैरपि दुरासदम्।।5.62.33।।
explanation: 'Madhuvan has come down to us from our forefather's time. Dear to the king, its entry is prohibited even to the gods.

content: स वानरानिमान् सर्वान् मधुलुब्धान् गतायुषः।घातयिष्यति दण्डेन सुग्रीवस्ससुहृज्जनान्।।5.62.34।।
explanation: 'Sugriva will chase all the vanaras and their friends greedy for honey. They will be punished with a stick. They are doomed'.

content: वध्या ह्येते दुरात्मानो नृपाज्ञापरिभाविनः।अमर्षप्रभवो रोषस्सफलो नो भविष्यति।।5.62.35।।
explanation: 'Indeed those evilminded ones who have disobeyed the king's order deserve to be killed.That way our fury and forbearance will result in success'.

content: एवमुक्त्वा दधिमुखो वनपालान्महाबलः।जगाम सहसोत्पत्य वनपालैस्समन्वितः।।5.62.36।।
explanation: Powerful Dadhimukha having said that to the guardians of the garden rose up to the sky and went off with them.

content: निमेषान्तरमात्रेण स हि प्राप्तो वनालयः।सहस्रांशुसुतो धीमान् सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः।।5.62.37।।
explanation: In a moment, Dadhimukha reached the place where wise Sugriva, the son of Sungod was there

content: रामं च लक्ष्मणं चैव दृष्ट्वा सुग्रीवमेव च।समप्रतिष्ठां जगतीमाकाशान्निपपात ह।।5.62.38।।
explanation: Seeing Rama, Lakshmana and also Sugriva from the sky he landed on an even ground.

content: सन्निपत्य महावीर्यस्सर्वैस्तै: परिवारितः।हरिर्दधिमुखः पालैः पालानां परमेश्वरः।।5.62.39।।स दीनवदनो भूत्वा कृत्वा शिरसि चाञ्जलिम्।सुग्रीवस्य शुभौ मूर्ध्ना चरणौ पत्यपीडयत्।।5.62.40।।
explanation: Dadhimukha, a great hero and king of the guards protecting Madhuvanam surrounded by his servants, with a sad expression on his face offered painful obeisance with folded hands bowing down his forehead at the feet of Sugriva. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sugriva tells Dadhimukha not to worry about the destruction of Madhuvanam. He asked him to send Hanuman, Angada and others]ततो मूर्ध्ना निपतितं वानरं वानरर्षभः।दृष्ट्वैवोद्विग्नहृदयो वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह।।5.63.1।।
explanation: Feeling anxious on seeing Dadhimukha touching his feet with his forehead, Sugriva, the bull among vanaras said:

content: उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ कस्मात्त्वं पादयोः पतितो मम।अभयं ते भवेद्वीर सर्वमेवाभिधीयताम्।।5.63.2।।
explanation: "O heroic Dadhimukha, get up. Tell me why you have fallen at my feet. I give you protection from all.

content: स तु विश्वासितस्तेन सुग्रीवेण महात्मना।उत्थाय सुमहाप्राज्ञो वाक्यं दधिमुखोऽब्रवीत्।।5.63.3।।
explanation: When great Sugriva gave assurance to wise Dadhimukha, he got up and said:

content: नैवर्क्षरजसा राजन्न त्वया नापि वालिना।वनं निसृष्टपूर्वं हि भक्षितं तच्च वानरैः।।5.63.4।।
explanation: "O king in your time or even before, during the time of Vali, that (Madhuvanam) was forbidden for entry. Now it has been laid waste by the trespassing vanaras.

content: एभिः प्रधर्षिताश्चैव वानरा वनरक्षिभिः।मधून्यचिन्तयित्वेमान् भक्षयन्ति पिबन्ति च।।5.63.5।।
explanation: "Even though the garden guards forcibly tried to prevent them they did not care and have devoured all the honey.

content: शिष्टमत्रापविध्यन्ति भक्षयन्ति तथापरे।निवार्यमाणास्ते सर्वे भ्रुवो वै दर्शयन्ति हि।।5.63.6।।
explanation: "Some have thrown off the leftovers, when others were prevented from drinking off the honey, they raised their eyebrows (to show their grouch).

content: इमे हि संरब्धतरास्तथा तैस्सम्प्रधर्षिताः।वारयन्तो वनात्तस्मात्क्रुद्धैर्वानरपुङ्गवैः।।5.63.7।।
explanation: "When the guards asked the vanaras to leave the garden the enraged vanaras misbehaved with them.

content: ततस्तैर्बहुभिर्वीरैर्वानरैर्वानरर्षभ।संरक्तनयनैः क्रोधाद्धरयः प्रविचालिताः।।5.63.8।।
explanation: "O Sugriva the vanara guards were chased away by the many heroic monkeys, angry and redeyed.

content: पाणिभिर्निहताः केचित्केचिज्जानुभिराहताः।प्रकृष्टाश्च यथाकामं देवमार्गं च दर्शिताः।।5.63.9।।
explanation: "Some were struck with hands, some beaten on their knees and were dragged as they liked and showed up their private parts.

content: एवमेते हताश्शूरास्त्वयि तिष्ठति भर्तरि।कृत्स्नं मधुवनं चैव प्रकामं तैः प्रभक्ष्यते।।5.63.10।।
explanation: These heroes struck that way devoured the Madhuvanam on the earth at their will and devoured the honey even when you are there as king.

content: एवं विज्ञाप्यमानं तं सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम्।अपृच्छत्तं महाप्राज्ञो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा।।5.63.11।।
explanation: While Dadhimukha appealed thus to wise Sugriva, Lakshmana the killer of enemies happened to see them and enquired:

content: किमयं वानरो राजन् वनपः प्रत्युपस्थितः।कं चार्थमभिनिर्दिश्य दुःखितो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।5.63.12।।
explanation: "O king why has this protector of the garden come here? Why is he sad? What is he narrating, asked Lakshmana.

content: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना।लक्ष्मणं प्रत्युवाचेदं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः।।5.63.13।।
explanation: Great prince Lakshmana thus said, Sugriva the proficient speaker replied:

content: आर्य लक्ष्मण सम्प्राह वीरो दधिमुखः कपिः।अङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वीरैर्भक्षितं मधु वानरैः।।5.63.14।।विचित्य दक्षिणामाशामागतैर्हरिपुङ्गवैः।
explanation: 'O venerable Lakshmana Dadhimukha as complaining that the fruits and honey have been consumed by the vanara heroes, Angada and others who have come after their search for Sita in the southern direction.

content: नैषामकृत्यानामीदृशस्स्यादुपक्रमः।।5.63.15।।आगतैश्च प्रमथितं यथा मधुवनं हि तैः।धर्षितं च वनं कृत्स्नमुपयुक्तं च वानरैः।।5.63.16।।
explanation: "Those vanaras having entered Madhuvanam and broken the trees are quite right. Had they not accomplished their purpose they would not have indulged themselves that way.

content: वनं यदाऽभिपन्नास्ते साधितं कर्म वानरैः।दृष्टा देवी न सन्देहो न चान्येन हनूमता।।5.63.17।।
explanation: "If they have trespassed into the garden that way, they might have done their duty. No doubt, Hanuman alone among them might have seen Sita.

content: न ह्यन्यस्साधने हेतुः कर्मणोऽस्य हनूमतः।कार्यसिद्धिर्मतिश्चैव तस्मिन्वानरपुङ्गवे।।5.63.18।।व्यवसायश्च वीर्यं च श्रुतं चापि प्रतिष्ठितम्।
explanation: "Hanuman alone has the ability to do it, the reason being he has the capacity the wisdom, streneous effort, virility and enthusiasm to accomplish it. These attributes are wellestablished in him.

content: जाम्बवान्यत्र नेता स्यादङ्गदश्च महाबलः।।5.63.19।।हनुमांश्चाप्यधिष्ठाता न तस्य गतिरन्यथा।
explanation: Where Jambavan, Angada and Hanuman are leaders directing the task of the army it must have been accomplished.

content: अङ्गदप्रमुखैर्वीरैर्हतं मधुवनं किल।।5.63.20।।वारयन्तश्च सहितास्तदा जानुभिराहताः।
एतदर्थमयं प्राप्तो वक्तुं मधुरवागिह।।5.63.21।।नाम्ना दधिमुखो नाम हरिः प्रख्यातविक्रमः।
explanation: "Here is Dadhimukha, a vanara, known for his valour and sweet tongue. He came here this incident to tell.

content: दृष्टा सीता महाबाहो सौमित्रे पश्य तत्त्वतः।।5.63.22।।अभिगम्य तथा सर्वे पिबन्ति मधु वानराः।
explanation: "O strongarmed Saumitri the Vanaras must have seen Sita. Or else, they would not have arrived to drink honey.

content: न चाप्यदृष्ट्वा वैदेहीं विश्रुताः पुरुषर्षभ।।5.63.23।।वनं दत्तवरं दिव्यं धर्षयेयुर्वनौकसः।
explanation: "If the renowned vanaras had not seen Vaidehi, they would not have entered the wonderful garden granted as boon (by Brahma).

content: ततः प्रहृष्टो धर्मात्मा लक्ष्मणस्सह राघवः।।5.63.24।।श्रुत्वा कर्णसुखां वाणीं सुग्रीववदनाच्च्युताम्।प्राहृष्यत भृशं रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः।।5.63.25।।
explanation: "Then righteous Rama and Lakshmana rejoiced to hear the words of Sugriva, which were pleasing to the ears.

content: श्रुत्वा दधिमुखस्येदं सुग्रीवस्सम्प्रहृष्य च।वनपालं पुनर्वाक्यं सुग्रीवः प्रत्यभाषत।।5.63.26।।
explanation: Beautifulnecked Sugriva heard Dadhimukha, the protector of the garden, felt very glad and replied:

content: प्रीतोऽस्मि सोऽहं यद्भुक्तं वनं तैः कृतकर्मभिः।मर्षितं मर्षणीयं च चेष्टितं कृतकर्मणाम्।।5.63.27।।
explanation: "They went to the garden to drink only after having performed their duty. I am glad about it. Since they have accomplished the purpose, they are to be excused for their behaviour. I have pardoned them.

content: इच्छामि शीघ्रं हनुमत्प्रधानान् शाखामृगांस्तान् मृगराजदर्पान्।द्रष्टुं कृतार्थान् सह राघवाभ्यां श्रोतुं च सीताधिगमे प्रयत्नम्।।5.63.28।।
प्रीतिस्फीताक्षौ सम्प्रहृष्टौ कुमारौ दृष्ट्वा सिद्धार्थौ वानराणां च राजा।अङ्गैः संहृष्टैः कर्मसिद्धिं विदित्वा बाह्वोरासन्नां सोऽतिमात्रं ननन्द।।5.63.29।।
explanation: "Beholding young Rama and Lakshmana extremely delighted, their eyes filled with joy out of fulfilment of the purpose, Sugriva who was also highly delighted felt an auspicious thrill on his limbs and knew that good time had come.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman and Angada along with others approach Sugriva -- Hanuman tells Rama about the discovery of Sita.]सुग्रीवेणैवमुक्तस्तु हृष्टो दधिमुखः कपिः।राघवं लक्ष्मणं चैव सुग्रीवं चाभ्यवादयत्।।5.64.1।।
explanation: Pleased with Sugriva's command (to send forth Angada and Hanuman) Dadhimukha offered salutations to Sugriva, Rama  and Lakshmana.

content: स प्रणम्य च सुग्रीवं राघवौ च महाबलौ।वानरैः सहितः शूरैर्दिवमेवोत्पपात ह।।5.64.2।।
explanation: Dadhimukha offered his obeisance to Sugriva and the mighty Rama and Lakshmana  and rose up to the sky followed by the vanaras.

content: स यथैवाऽगतः पूर्वं तथैव त्वरितं गतः।निपत्य गगनाद्भूमौतद्वनं प्रविवेश ह।।5.64.3।।स प्रविष्टो मधुवनं ददर्श हरियूथपान्।विमदानुत्थितान्सर्वान् मेहमानान्मधूदकम्।।5.64.4।।
explanation: Descending into Madhuvanam, Dadhimukha saw all the monkey troops free from intoxication (of honeywine).

content: स तानुपागमद्वीरो बद्ध्वा करपुटाञ्जलिम्।उवाच वचनं श्लक्ष्णमिदं हृष्टवदङ्गदम्।।5.64.5।।
explanation: Heroic Dadhimukha went to Angada, holding his cupped palms reverentially and spoke these conciliatory words with joy:

content: सौम्य रोषो न कर्तव्यो यदेतत्परिवारितम्।अज्ञानाद्रक्षिभिः क्रोधाद्भवन्तः प्रतिषेधिताः।।5.64.6।।
explanation: "O handsome one, do not react harshly at these guards who have obstructed your companions out of ignorance and fury.

content: युवराजस्त्वमीशश्च वनस्यास्य महाबल।मौर्ख्यात्पूर्वं कृतो दोषस्तं भवान् क्षन्तुमर्हति।।5.64.7।।
explanation: "O mighty Angada you are heir apparent and also king. Out of foolishness I obstructed you. You ought to pardon me this mistake.

content: आख्यातं हि मया गत्वा पितृव्यस्य तवानघ।इहोपयातं सर्वेषामेतेषां वनचारिणाम्।।5.64.8।।
explanation: "O blameless prince I have already told your father's elder brother and all the forestdwellers about your arrival here.

content: स त्वदागमनं श्रुत्वा सहैभिर्हरियूथपैः।प्रहृष्टो न तु रुष्टोऽसौ वनं श्रुत्वा प्रधर्षितम्।।5.64.9।।
explanation: "He was not angry at your destruction of the garden. On the other hand, he was very glad to hear about your arrival.

content: प्रहृष्टो मां पितृव्यस्ते सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः।शीघ्रं प्रेषय सर्वांस्तानिति होवाच पार्थिवः।।5.64.10।।
explanation: "Your father's brother, Sugriva, the lord of vanaras felt very glad and indeed asked me to send you quickly."

content: श्रुत्वा दधिमुखस्येदं वचनं श्लक्ष्णमङ्गदः।अब्रवीत्तान् हरिश्रेष्ठो वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः।।5.64.11।।
explanation: At these good words from Dadhimukha, Angada, the monkey leader, an eloquent speaker said this:.

content: शङ्के श्रुतोऽयं वृत्तान्तो रामेण हरियूथपाः।तत्क्षमं नेह नः स्थातुं कृते कार्ये परन्तपाः।।5.64.12।।
explanation: "O scorcher of enemies I presume Rama has already heard the news of our arrival on accomplishment of the task. Hence it is not proper for us to tarry here.

content: पीत्वा मधु यथाकामं विश्रान्ता वनचारिणः।किं शेषं गमनं तत्र सुग्रीवो यत्र मे गुरुः।।5.64.13।।
explanation: "The vanaras of the forest have taken rest after drinking as much honey as they desired. What is left here to do? We have to go wherever Sugriva is."

content: सर्वे यथा मां वक्ष्यन्ति समेत्य हरियूथपाः।तथास्मि कर्ता कर्तव्ये भवद्भिः परवानहम्।।5.64.14।।
explanation: Angada said to the vanara troops assembled, "Tell me what we have to do. I shall act as you wish.

content: नाज्ञापयितुमीशोऽहं युवराजोऽस्मि यद्यपि।अयुक्तं कृतकर्माणो यूयं धर्षयितुं मया।।5.64.15।।
explanation: "Even though I am heir apparent, it is not proper for me to order you.You have accomplished the purpose and to command you is not befitting on my part."

content: ब्रुवतश्चाङ्गदस्यैवं श्रुत्वा वचनमव्ययम्।प्रहृष्टमनसो वाक्यमिदमूचुर्वनौकसः।।5.64.16।।
explanation: On hearing Angada's valuable words said in that way, the vanaras repled:

content: एवं वक्ष्यति को राजन् प्रभुस्सन्वानरर्षभ।ऐश्वर्यमदमत्तो हि सर्वोऽहमिति मन्यते।।5.64.17।।
explanation: "O king O bull among monkeys we think you are an exception to those to whom prosperity brings arrogance.

content: तव चेदं सुसदृशं वाक्यं नान्यस्य कस्यचित्।सन्नतिर्हि तवाख्याति भविष्यच्छुभयोग्यताम्।।5.64.18।।
explanation: "You alone could speak such words. Your humility speaks of your fitness for a  bright future.

content: सर्वे वयमपि प्राप्तास्तत्र गन्तुं कृतक्षणाः।स यत्र हरिवीराणां सुग्रीवः पतिरव्ययः।।5.64.19।।
त्वया ह्यनुक्तैर्हरिभिर्नैव शक्यं पदात्पदम्।क्वचिद्गन्तुं हरिश्रेष्ठ ब्रूमः सत्यमिदं तु ते।।5.64.20।।
explanation: "O Angada the best of vanaras without your command none will find it possible to put forward even a single step."

content: एवं तु वदतां तेषामङ्गदः प्रत्युवाच ह।बाढं गच्छाम इत्युक्त्वा खमुत्पेतुर्महाबलाः।।5.64.21।।
explanation: Thus addressed by all the vanaras, Angada said 'Well, let us go'. Then the powerful vanaras rose up the sky.

content: उत्पतन्तमनूत्पेतु स्सर्वे ते हरियूथपाः।कृत्वाकाशं निराकाशं यन्त्रोत्क्षिप्ता इवाचलाः।।5.64.22।।
explanation: All the vanara troops sprang up into the air as though there was no sky, like stones shattered by machines from the  mountains rise up.

content: तेऽम्बरं सहसोत्पत्य वेगवन्तः प्लवङ्गमाः।विनदन्तो महानादं घना वातेरिता यथा।।5.64.23।।
explanation: The swift monkeys roared aloud as though they went up the sky like thundering clouds driven by  the wind.

content: अङ्गदे ह्यननुप्राप्ते सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः।उवाच शोकोपहतं रामं कमललोचनम्।।5.64.24।।
explanation: Seeing the griefstricken, lotuseyed Rama, the lord of the vanaras Sugriva said this before the arrival of Angada:

content: समाश्वसिहि भद्रं ते दृष्टा देवी न संशयः।नागन्तुमिह शक्यं तैरतीते समये हि नः।।5.64.25।।
explanation: "Trust me, Rama. Be blessed. The vanaras have seen the divine lady. There is no doubt. It is not possible for them to come here after exceeding the time limit  (in their search for Sita).

content: न मत्सकाशमागच्छेत्कृत्ये हि विनिपातिते।युवराजो महाबाहुः प्लवतां प्रवरोऽङ्गदः।।5.64.26।।
explanation: "My heir apparent, the strongarmed Angada, and the best of the monkeys is endowed with virtues. He would not come near me if his mission had failed.

content: यद्यप्यकृतकृत्यानामीदृश स्स्यादुपक्रमः।भवेत्स दीनवदनो भ्रान्तविप्लुतमानसः।।5.64.27।।
explanation: "In case the vanaras have returned without accomplishing the task, Angada would have assumed a pathetic face, perplexed and unsteady in mind.

content: पितृपैतामहं चैतत्पूर्वकैरभिरक्षितम्।न मे मधुवनं हन्यादहृष्टः प्लवगेश्वरः।।5.64.28।।कौसल्यासुप्रजा राम समाश्वसिहि सुव्रत।
explanation: "If Angada, lord of the vanaras had not been happy, he would not have destroyed the Madhuvanam of my father's and my grandfather's time. O Rama, follower of righteous practices, Kausalya has an excellent son in you. Trust me.

content: दृष्टा देवी न सन्देहो न चान्येन हनूमता।।5.64.29।।न ह्यन्यः कर्मणो हेतुस्साधनेऽस्य हनूमतः।
explanation: "Hanuman is the one who has accomplished this task. Who else can? No doubt, he has seen Sita.

content: हनूमति हि सिद्धिश्च मतिश्च मतिसत्तमः।।5.64.30।।व्यवसायश्च वीर्यं च सूर्ये तेज इव ध्रुवम्।
explanation: "O Rama, the best among the wise just like the luminosity that abides in the Sun, capacity to succeed, energy, intelligence, even courage and steadfastness reside in Hanuman.

content: जाम्बवान्यत्र नेता स्यादङ्गदश्च बलेश्वरः।हनुमांश्चाप्यधिष्ठाता न तस्य गतिरन्यथा।।5.64.31।।
explanation: "Where Jambavan is the leader, Angada the commander of the army and Hanuman the guiding force, the end result will not be otherwise.

content: मा भूश्चिन्तासमायुक्तस्सम्प्रत्यमितविक्रमः।।5.64.32।।ततः किलकिलाशब्दं शुश्रावासन्नमम्बरे।हनुमत्कर्मदृप्तानां नार्धतां काननौकसाम्।।5.64.33।।किष्किन्धामुपयातानां सिद्धिं कथयतामिव।
explanation: "You are extremely valiant and it is unbecoming of you to be anxious at this time Rama. Just then chatterings of the monkeys were heard from the sky as they roared in pride talking of Hanuman's achievement. Having successfully completed the errand, they have arrived at Kishkinda.

content: ततश्श्रुत्वा निनादं तं कपीनां कपिसत्तमः।।5.64.34।।आयताञ्चितलाङ्गूलस्सोऽभवद्धृष्टमानसः।
explanation: The great Sugriva heard the roar of the monkeys and was extremely happy. He kept raising and shaking his long tail in joy.

content: आजग्मुस्तेऽपि हरयो रामदर्शनकांक्षिणः।।5.64.35।।अङ्गदं पुरतः कृत्वा हनूमन्तं च वानरम्।
explanation: The joyful monkeys with Angada and Hanuman leading them descended with eagerness to have a close look at Rama.

content: तेऽङ्गदप्रमुखा वीराः प्रहृष्ठाश्च मुदान्विताः।।5.64.36।।निपेतुर्हरिराजस्य समीपे राघवस्य च।
explanation: Angada the chief along with the heroic monkeys very joyfully and exuberantly descended close to Sugriva, the king of monkeys and Rama.

content: हनुमांश्च महाबाहुः प्रणम्य शिरसा ततः।।5.64.37।।नियतामक्षतां देवीं राघवाय न्यवेदयत्।
explanation: Then the strongarmed Hanuman with his head bowed down offered salutations and reported, 'Divine lady Sita with her constant devotion to Sri Rama is sound in body'.

content: दृष्टा देवीति हनुमद्वदनादमृतोपमम्।।5.64.38।।आकर्ण्य वचनं रामो हर्षमाप सलक्ष्मणः।
explanation: On hearing the nectarlike words from Hanuman that Sita was found, Rama and Lakshmana were delighted.

content: निश्चितार्थं ततस्तस्मिन् सुग्रीवं पवनात्मजे।।5.64.39।।लक्ष्मणः प्रीतिमान् प्रीतं बहुमानादवैक्षत।
explanation: Sugriva and Lakshmana glanced at Hanuman respectfully with affection thinking surely Hanuman alone has succeeded.

content: प्रीत्या च रममाणोऽथ राघवः परवीरहा।।5.64.40।।बहुमानेन महता हनुमन्तमवैक्षत।
explanation: Rama, the slayer of heroic enemies was extremely delighted and glanced at Hanuman with unbounded affection.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकावे सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुःषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman apprises Sri Rama of Sita's presence under the Simsupa tree surrounded by demonesses and presents the Chudamani to Rama in the presence of Sugriva.]ततः प्रस्रवणं शैलं ते गत्वा चित्रकाननम्।प्रणम्य शिरसा रामं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम्।।5.65.1।।युवराजं पुरस्कृत्य सुग्रीवमभिवाद्य च।प्रवृत्तिमथ सीतायाः प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमुः।।5.65.2।।
explanation: Thereafter the vanaras arrived at the Prasrvana mount, with wonderful forests and bowed down to Sri Rama and mighty Lakshaman and Sugriva placing their leader, heir apparent in front. Then they began telling the story of Sita and her state.

content: रावणान्तः पुरे रोधं राक्षसीभिश्च तर्जनम्।रामे समनुरागं च यश्चायं समयः कृतः।।5.65.3।।एतदाख्यान्ति ते सर्वे हरयो रामसन्निधौ।
explanation: The monkeys in Rama's presence narrated all about Sita's detention in Ravana's Ashoka garden, the ogresses threatening her and the time limit fixed by Ravana (for her survival).

content: वैदेहीमक्षतां श्रुत्वा रामस्तूत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.65.4।।क्व सीता वर्तते देवी कथं च मयि वर्तते।एतन्मे सर्वमाख्यात वैदेहीं प्रति वानराः।।5.65.5।।
explanation: Hearing of Sita alive and not harmed, Rama asked the vanaras, 'How is Sita? How is she disposed to me? Tell me everything'.

content: रामस्य गदितं श्रुत्वा हरयो रामसन्निधौ।चोदयन्ति हनूमन्तं सीतावृत्तान्तकोविदम्।।5.65.6।।
explanation: On hearing the words from Rama, the vanaras requested Hanuman who was aware of  Sita's position to tell Rama all about her.

content: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तेषां हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः।प्रणम्य शिरसा देव्यै सीतायै तां दिशं प्रति।।5.65.7।।उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञस्सीताया दर्शनं यथा।
explanation: The son of the Wind god, Hanuman who was wise in speech heard the words of Rama, offered salutations to Sita in the direction in which she was located and narrated the story about her discovery.

content: समुद्रं लङ्घयित्वाहं शतयोजनमायतम्।।5.65.8।।अगच्छं जानकीं सीतां मार्गमाणो दिदृक्षया।
explanation: "Having crossed the sea consisting of a hundred yojanas in quest of Vaidehi, I found her.

content: तत्र लङ्केति नगरी रावणस्य दुरात्मनः।।5.65.9।।दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य तीरे वसति दक्षिणे।
explanation: "On the southern shore of the ocean is situated the city of Lanka , ruled by the evilminded Ravana.

content: तत्र दृष्टा मया सीता रावणान्तः पुरे सती।।5.65.10।।सन्न्यस्य त्वयि जीवन्ती रामा राम मनोरथम्।
explanation: "There in the inner palace of Ravana, I saw your lovely wife Sita, with all her hopes pinned on you, giving up all other desires.

content: दृष्टा मे राक्षसीमध्ये तर्ज्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः।।5.65.11।।राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभी रक्षिता प्रमदावने।
explanation: "I found her in the beautiful garden guarded by hideous ogresses threatening her again and again৷৷

content: दुःख मासाद्यते देवी तथाऽदुःखोचिता सती।।5.65.12।।रावणान्तः पुरे रुद्धा राक्षसीभि स्सुरक्षिता।एकवेणीधरा दीना त्वयि चिन्तापरायणा।।5.65.13।।अधःशय्या विवर्णाङ्गी पद्मिनीव हिमागमे।रावणाद्विनिवृत्तार्था मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया।।5.65.14।।देवी कथञ्चित्काकुत्स्थ त्वन्मना मार्गिता मया।
explanation: "Sita, who did not deserve and yet was full of grief was detained by Ravana in his inner palace, guarded by ogresses. She had single braid (a sign of desolation), was pathetic,  and totally absorbed in your thought. She was lying on bare ground with her limbs turned pale, like lotus in winter. She was averse to Ravana and was determined to commit suicide. She has only Rama in her mind. Somehow I found her.

content: इक्ष्वाकुवंशविख्यातिं शनैः कीर्तयतानघ।।5.65.15।।सा मया नरशार्दूल विश्वासमुपपादिता।
explanation: "O sinless one O tiger among men To inspire confidence in her I praised the glory of your Ikshvaku dynasty.

content: तत स्सम्भाषिता देवी सर्वमर्थं च दर्शिता।।5.65.16।।रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च श्रुत्वा प्रीतिमुपागता।नियत स्समुदाचारो भक्तिश्चास्यास्तथा त्वयि।।5.65.17।।
explanation: "When the divine lady talked to me, I presented all the facts about the alliance of Rama and Sugriva. On hearing me, virtuous Sita, whose devotion is fixed on you became delighted.

content: एवं मया महाभागा दृष्टा जनकनन्दिनी।उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता त्वद्भक्त्या पुरुषर्षभ।।5.65.18।।
explanation: "O bull among men I saw Janaki,the delight of Janaka, a formidable lady filled with devotion to you and richly endowed with austerity.

content: अभिज्ञानं च मे दत्तं यथा वृत्तं तवान्तिके।चित्रकूटे महाप्राज्ञ वायसं प्रति राघव।।5.65.19।।
explanation: "O wise one, with your ring given her, she told me an anecdote of a crow that took place at Chitrakuta.

content: विज्ञाप्यश्च नरव्याघ्रो रामो वायुसुत त्वया।अखिलेनेह यद्धृष्टमिति मामाह जानकी।।5.65.20।।
explanation: (She said)'O son of the Windgod you should let Rama, the tiger among men know all that you have seen here.

content: अयं चास्मै प्रदातव्यो यत्नात्सुपरिरक्षितः।ब्रुवता वचनान्येवं सुग्रीवस्योपशृण्वतः।।5.65.21।।
explanation: 'Within hearing of Sugriva, tell him about your efforts. Present this(signet) to Rama carefully preserved by me.

content: एष चूडामणिश्श्रीमान् मया सुपरिरक्षितः।मनश्शिलायास्तिलको गण्डपार्श्वे निवेशितः।।5.65.22।।त्वया प्रणष्ठे तिलके तं किल स्मर्तुमर्हसि।
explanation: 'This auspicious (jewel) Chudamani has been preserved by me very carefully. Remind him of the decorative red mark he painted with a stone pigment on my forehead, indeed, it is proper to remind him of this.

content: एष निर्यातितश्श्रीमान्मया ते वारि सम्भवः।एतं दृष्ट्वा प्रहृष्यामि व्यसने त्वामिवानघ।।5.65.23।।
explanation: 'O sinless one tell Rama that this auspicious Chudamani born in the ocean is sent to him and I was gazing at it as if it was him (Rama) and feeling happy.

content: जीवितं धारयिष्यामि मासं दशरथात्मज।।5.65.24।।ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न जीवेयं रक्षसां वशमागता।
explanation: 'O Son of Dasaratha I will hold on to life for a month. Captured by the demons, I will not live for more than a month'.

content: इति मामब्रवीत्सीता कृशाङ्गी धर्मचारिणी।।5.65.25।।रावणान्तः पुरे रुद्धा मृगीवोत्फुल्ललोचना।
explanation: "With her limbs emaciated through austerities detained in Ravana's inner palace, eyes wide open in fear, Sita said this to me:

content: एतदेव मयाख्यातं सर्वं राघव यद्यथा।।5.65.26।।सर्वथा सागरजले संतारः प्रविधीयताम्।
explanation: "O Rama I have spoken everything that has happened. We have to pay attention to the means of crossing the ocean."

content: तौ जाताश्वासौ राजपुत्रौ विदित्वा तच्चाभिज्ञानं राघवाय प्रदाय।देव्या चाख्यातं सर्वमेवानुपूर्व्याद्वाचा सम्पूर्णं वायुपुत्त्र श्शशंस।।5.65.27।।
explanation: Coming to know that the two princes were sighing in relief, Hanuman presented the token of identification given by Sita to Rama, after having communicated in full the messsage of Sita in an orderly manner.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Sri Rama wails piteously after seeing the token chudamani.]एवमुक्तो हनुमता रामो दशरथात्मज:।तं मणिं हृदये कृत्वा प्ररुरोद सलक्ष्मणः।।5.66.1।।
explanation: Thus addressed by Hanuman, Rama held the token (Chudamani) against his bosom and wept with Lakshmana.

content: तं तु दृष्ट्वा मणिश्रेष्ठं राघव श्शोककर्शितः।नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत्।।5.66.2।।
explanation: Seeing the precious jewel, Rama's eyes were filled with tears. Overwhelmed with grief, he spoke to Sugriva.

content: यथैव धेनु स्स्रवति स्नेहाद्वत्सस्य वत्सला।तथा ममापि हृदयं मणिरत्नस्य दर्शनात्।।5.66.3।।
explanation: "Just as a cow fond of its calf begins to distil milk from its teats at the sight of the calf, so does my heart melt at the sight of this excellent jewel.

content:
मणिरत्नमिदं दत्तं वैदेह्याश्श्वशुरेण मे।

वधूकाले यथाबद्धमधिकं मूर्ध्नि शोभते।।5.66.4।।
explanation: "At the time of marriage, this jewel was presented by my father-in-law. Vaidehi wore it on her forehead and it looked charming.

content: अयं हि जलसम्भूतो मणिस्सज्जनपूजितः।यज्ञे परमतुष्टेन दत्तश्शक्रेण धीमता।।5.66.5।।
explanation: "This was found in water and was bestowed by Indra out of great joy on Janaka who had performed a grand sacrificial ceremony. So it was worshipped by elders of the family.

content: इमं दृष्ट्वा मणिश्रेष्ठं यथा तातस्य दर्शनम्।अद्यास्म्यवगतस्सौम्य वैदेहस्य तथा विभोः।।5.66.6।।
explanation: "O noble Sugriva now when I see this excellent jewel, I get direct sight of my father and king of Videha (in the same way as I obtained the sight of Sita).

content: अयं हि शोभते तस्याः प्रियाया मूर्ध्नि मे मणिः।अस्याद्य दर्शने नाहं प्राप्तां तामिव चिन्तये।।5.66.7।।
explanation: "This jewel was shining on the head of my beloved. Now its mere look makes me feel that I am seeing her.

content: किमाह सीता वैदेही ब्रूहि सौम्य पुनः पुनः।पिपासुमिव तोयेन सिञ्चन्ती वाक्यवारिणा।।5.66.8।।
explanation: "O handsome Hanuman Sita is like water for a thirsty person. Tell me again and again what Sita said to you. Sprinkle on me (lifegiving) water of her words in the form of message.

content: इतस्तु किं दुःखतरं यदिमं वारिसम्भवम्।मणिं पश्यामि सौमित्रे वैदेहीमागतां विना।।5.66.9।।
explanation: "O Saumitri I see this jewel born (formed) under water but not her. What can be more sorrowful to me?

content:
चिरं जीवति वैदेही यदि मासं धरिष्यति।

क्षणं सौम्य न जीवेयं विना तामसितेक्षणाम्।।5.66.10।।
explanation: (Addressing Hanuman again) "O dear, if she can live for a month it is living for long. I would not live for a moment without the black-eyed Vaidehi.

content: नय मामपि तं देशं यत्र दृष्टा मम प्रिया।न तिष्ठेयं क्षणमपि प्रवृत्तिमुपलभ्य च।।5.66.11।।
explanation: "Take me to the place you saw my beloved. Knowing where she is I cannot stay here even for a moment.

content: कथं सा मम सुश्रोणी भीरुभीरु स्सती सदा।भयावहानां घोराणां मध्ये तिष्ठति रक्षसाम्।।5.66.12।।
explanation: "She is always very timid. How can my fairhipped beloved remain in the midst of dreadful and fearsome demons?

content: शारद स्तिमिरोन्मुक्तो नूनं चन्द्रं इवांबुधैः।आवृतं वदनं तस्या न विराजति राक्षसैः।।5.66.13।।
explanation: "Her face resembling the autumnal Moon bereft of its stain, though covered with rainclouds does not shine so bright.

content: किमाह सीता हनुमंस्तत्त्वतः कथयाद्य मे।एतेन खलु जीविष्ये भेषजेनातुरो यथा।।5.66.14।।
explanation: "O Hanuman Tell me now truly what has been told by her. I am eager to know. Indeed, it will keep me alive just as medicne does. (I shall survive on the strength of her message)

content: मधुरा मधुरालापा किमाह मम भामिनी।मद्विहीना वरारोहा हनुमन् कथयस्व मे।।5.66.15।।
explanation: That lovely Sita who speaks sweetly, that fairhipped beautiful one who has been separated from me, my beloved, what did she say? Please narrate.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman once again narrates to Rama, Sita's condition.]एवमुक्तस्तु हनुमान् राघवेण महात्मना।सीताया भाषितं सर्वं न्यवेदयत राघवे।।5.67.1।।
explanation: Thus asked by Sri Rama, Hanuman repeated everything spoken by Sita to Rama.

content: इदमुक्तवती देवी जानकी पुरुषर्षभ।पूर्व वृत्तमभिज्ञानं चित्रकूटे यथातथम्।।5.67.2।।
explanation: "O bull among men queen Janaki related to me as a token of identification an incident  that had taken place at Chitrakuta in the past.

content: सुखसुप्ता त्वया सार्धं जानकी पूर्वमुत्थिता।वायस स्सहसोत्पत्य विददार स्तनान्तरे।।5.67.3।।
explanation: "When she was lying on your lap happily she awoke early and a crow came swiftly and scratched on her breast.

content: पर्यायेण च सुप्तस्त्वं देव्यङ्के भरताग्रज।पुनश्च किल पक्षी स देव्या जनयति व्यथाम्।।5.67.4।।
explanation: "O Bharata's brother, when Sita awoke from sleep you slept on her lap. The same crow again hurt her.

content:
पुनः पुनरुपागम्य विददार भृशं किल।

ततस्त्वं बोधितस्तस्याश्शोणितेन समुक्षितः।।5.67.5।।
explanation: Again and again the crow came to her and scratched her. She woke you up as you were getting wet with blood shed from her body.

content: वायसेन च तेनैव सततं बाध्यमानया।बोधितः किल देव्या त्वं सुखसुप्तः परन्तप।।5.67.6।।
explanation: "O scorcher of enemies pained by the crow hurting her repeatedly, while you were sleeping happily, she woke you up and informed you about it.

content: तां तु दृष्ट्वा महाबाहो दारितां च स्तनान्तरे।आशीविष इव क्रुद्धो निश्वसन्नभ्यभाषथाः।।5.67.7।।
explanation: "Seeing the blood flowing from her breasts you became furious like a hissing serpent and said:

content: नखाग्रैः केन ते भीरु दारितं तु स्तनान्तरम्।कः क्रीडति सरोषेण पञ्चवक्त्रेण भोगिना।।5.67.8।।
explanation: "You are of timid nature. Who has scratched your breasts with the tip of the nail? Who is sporting with an enraged fivehooded serpent"?

content: निरीक्षमाणस्सहसा वायसं समवैक्षथाः।नखै स्सरुधिरैस्तीक्ष्णैस्तामेवाभिमुखं स्थितम्।।5.67.9।।
explanation: 'Seeing all over, at once I glanced at the crow that stood in front of her with sharp bloodstained nails'.

content: सुतः किल स शक्रस्य वायसः पततां वरः।धरान्तरचरश्शीघ्रं पवनस्य गतौ समः।।5.67.10।।
explanation: 'That crow, the foremost of the birds was the son of Indra moving about all over the earth swiftly. His speed matched the Windgod's.

content: ततस्तस्मिन्महाबाहो कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः।वायसे त्वं कृथाः क्रूरां मतिं मतिमतां वर।।5.67.11।।
explanation: 'O longarmed, wise and revered Rama, then in anguish you took a cruel decision'.

content: स दर्भं संस्तराद्गृह्य ब्रह्मास्त्रेण ह्ययोजयः।स दीप्त इव कालाग्निर्जज्वालाभिमुखः खगम्।।5.67.12।।
explanation: 'You took out a blade of grass from your mat and chanted the mantra to invoke the weapon of Brahma (Brahmastra) and hurled it on the crow. It blazed like the fire of the doom's day.

content: क्षिप्तवांस्त्वं प्रदीप्तं हि दर्भं तं वायसं प्रति।ततस्तु वायसं दीप्तस्स दर्भोऽनुजगाम ह।।5.67.13।।
explanation: 'You hurled the blazing blade of grass on to the crow. That burning blade of grass chased the crow.

content: स पित्रा च परित्यक्तस्सुरैश्च समहर्षिभिः।त्रीन् लोकान् सम्परिक्रम्य त्रातारं नाधिगच्छति।।5.67.14।।
explanation: 'He was abandoned by his father, even by great sages and gods. Then he went round the three worlds but could not find a saviour.

content: पुनरेवागतस्त्रस्तस्त्वत्सकाशमरिंदम।स तं निपतितं भूमौ शरण्यश्शरणागतम्।।5.67.15।।वधार्हमपि काकुत्स्थ कृपया पर्यपालयः।
explanation: 'O destroyer of enemies the crow came back again to you trembling seeking protection from you and fell on the ground. Even though it deserved to be slayed, you saved him out of compassion.

content: मोघमस्त्रं न शक्यं तु कर्तुमित्येव राघव।।5.67.16।।भवांस्तस्याक्षि काकस्य हिनस्ति स्म स दक्षिणम्।
explanation: 'O Rama since a divine weapon cannot be withdrawn, it did strike his right eye'.

content: राम त्वां स नमस्कृत्य राज्ञे दशरथाय च।।5.67.17।।विसृष्टस्तु तदा काक प्रतिपेदे स्वमालयम्।
explanation: 'Thereafter that crow left without killing offered salutations to you and king Dasaratha and returned to his abode.

content: एवमस्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठस्सत्त्ववान् शीलवानपि।।5.67.18।।किमर्थमस्त्रं रक्षस्सु न योजयति राघवः।
explanation: 'You are efficient, foremost among wielders of weapons, truthful and powerful. Why are you not directing weapons against the demons?

content: न नागा नापि गन्धर्वा नासुरा न मरुद्गणाः।।5.67.19।।न च सर्वे रणे शक्ता रामं प्रतिसमासितुम्।
explanation: 'It is not possible for nagas, gandharvas, even asuras or Marutas to confront Rama in war.

content: तस्य वीर्यवतः कश्चिद्यद्यस्ति मयि सम्भ्रमः।।5.67.20।।क्षिप्रं सुनिशितैर्बाणैर्हन्यतां युधि रावणः।
explanation: 'If you have any anxiety about me, you will certainly slay Ravana in the battle immediately with your sharp arrows'.

content: भ्रातुरादेशमाज्ञाय लक्ष्मणो वा परन्तपः।।5.67.21।।स किमर्थं नरवरो न मां रक्षति राघवः।
explanation: 'For what reason is the the scorcher of enemies, Lakshmana, the best of men also does not protect me at the behest of Rama, his brother?

content: शक्तौ तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ वाय्वग्निसमतेजसौ ।।5.67.22।।सुराणामपि दुर्धर्षौ किमर्थं मामुपेक्षतः।
explanation: 'Why are the two tigers among men whose power is like that of wind and fire and who are unassailable even to suras are neglecting me?

content: ममैव दुष्कृतं किञ्चिन्महदस्ति न संशयः।।5.67.23।।समर्थौ सहितौ यन्मां नावेक्षेते परन्तपौ।
explanation: 'Have I done any great sin because of which even though both the scorchers of enemies are capable, they are not doing so?'

content: वैदेह्या वचनं श्रुत्वा करुणं साश्रु भाषितम्।पुनरप्यहमार्यां तामिदं वचनमब्रुवम्।।5.67.24।।
explanation: "On hearing Vaidehi's piteous words, I once again said this to the noble lady:

content: त्वच्छोकविमुखो रामो देवि सत्येन ते शपे।।5.67.25।।रामे दुःखाभिभूते तु लक्ष्मणः परितप्यते।
explanation: 'O divine lady I swear to you on my truthfulness, that out of grief for you Rama is not interested in anything else and Lakshmana is deeply afflicted because Rama is overhelmed with grief.

content: कथञ्चिद्भवती दृष्टा न कालः परिशोचितुम्।।5.67.26।।अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते दुःखानामन्तं द्रक्ष्यसि भामिनि।
explanation: 'O lovely lady somehow I could discover you. This is not the moment for lamentation.Your grief will end.

content: तावुभौ नरशार्दूलौ राजपुत्रावनिन्दितौ।।5.67.27।।त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहौ लङ्कां भस्मीकरिष्यतः।
explanation: 'The two princes, tigers among men are blameles. They are anxious to see you. They will reduce this Lanka into ashes.

content: हत्वा च समरे रौद्रं रावणं सह बान्धवम्।।5.67.28।।राघवस्त्वां वरारोहे स्वां पुरीं नयते ध्रुवम्।
explanation: 'O fairhipped lady Rama will slay fearsome Ravana and all his relatives and take you to his city. It is certain.

content: यत्तु रामो विजानीयादभिज्ञानमनिन्दिते।।5.67.29।।प्रीतिसञ्जननं तस्य प्रदातुं त्वमिहार्हसि।
explanation: 'O blameless lady you should give me that which he would be glad to recognise as a token.'

content: साभिवीक्ष्य दिशस्सर्वा वेण्युद्ग्रथितमुत्तमम्।।5.67.30।।मुक्त्वा वस्त्राद्ददौ मह्यं मणिमेतं महाबल।
explanation: "O mighty Rama, she glanced at all directions and untied the end of her garment  in which she had this best jewel worn on her hair preserved and gave it to me.

content: प्रतिगृह्य मणिं दिव्यं तव हेतो रघूद्वह।।5.67.31।।शिरसा तां प्रणम्यार्यामहमागमने त्वरे।
explanation: "O foremost among the Raghus I took that wonderful gem for your sake from the noble lady and offered her salutations, bowing my head, and returned quickly৷৷

content: गमने च कृतोत्साहमवेक्ष्य वरवर्णिनी।।5.67.32।।विवर्धमानं च हि मामुवाच जनकात्मजा।
explanation: "Seeing me eager to depart and growing in size, the loving daughter of Janaka said.

content: अश्रुपूर्णमुखी दीना बाष्पसन्दिग्धभाषिणी।।5.67.33।।ममोत्पतनसम्भ्रान्ता शोकवेगसमाहता।
explanation: "She was dejected. Her face was filled with tears. Despondent at my departure, she shed tears profusely and said:

content: हनुमन् सिंहसंकाशावुभौ तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।5.67.34।।सुग्रीवञ्च सहामात्यं सर्वान् ब्रूया ह्यनामयम्।
explanation: 'Hanuman tell both Rama and Lakshman who are like two lions, Sugriva and his ministers about my welfare.

content: यथा च स महाबाहुर्मां तारयति राघवः।अस्माद्धुःखाम्बुसंरोधात्त्वं समाधातुमर्हसि।।5.67.35।।
explanation: 'You may go and tell mighty Rama to make arrangements to relieve me from this ocean of sorrow.

content: इमं च तीव्रं मम शोकवेगं रक्षोभिरेभिः परिभर्त्सनं च।ब्रूयास्तु रामस्य गतस्समीपम् शिवश्च तेऽध्वास्तु हरिप्रवीर।।5.67.36।।
explanation: 'O foremost among the heroic monkeys approaching Rama, you should tell him the intensity of my sorrow and the threatening of the shedemons. Let your journey be speedy and auspicious.'

content: एतत्तवार्या नृपराजसिंह सीता वचः प्राह विषादपूर्वम्।एतच्च बुद्ध्वा गदितं मया त्वं श्रद्धत्स्व सीतां कुशलां समग्राम्।।5.67.37।।
explanation: "O lion among kings noble Sita has spoken these words in grief: 'Make him know all this and tell him that Sita is faithful and safe in all respects.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

content: [Hanuman describes to Rama the manner in which he warded off Sita's doubts regarding monkeys' crossing the ocean and rescuing her.]अथाहमुत्तरं देव्या पुनरुक्त स्ससम्भ्रमम्।             तव स्नेहान्नरव्याघ्र सौहार्दादनुमान्य वै।।5.68.1।।
explanation: "O tiger among men In view of her regards for me and and her love for you she was confident and once again addressed me:

content: एवं बहुविधं वाच्यो रामो दाशरथिस्त्वया।यथा मामाप्नुयाच्छीघ्रं हत्वा रावणमाहवे।।5.68.2।।
explanation: 'You may appeal to Rama, the son of Dasaratha in many ways, that he should come quickly and slay Ravana in the battle and get me back.

content: यदि वा मन्यसे वीर वसैकाहमरिन्दम।कस्मिंश्चित्संवृते देशे विक्रान्तश्श्वो गमिष्यसि।।5.68.3।।
explanation: 'O crusher of enemies O brave Hanuman I wish you rest for a while in a secluded place around here and leave tomorrow .

content: मम चाप्यल्पभाग्यायास्सान्निध्यात्तव वीर्यवन्।अस्य शोकविपाकस्य मुहूर्तं स्याद्विमोक्षणम्।।5.68.4।।
explanation: 'O valiant (Hanuman) by your presence here, the less fortunate me, will be relieved of sorrow for a while.

content: गते हि त्वयि विक्रान्ते पुनरागमनाय वै।प्राणानामपि सन्देहो मम स्यान्नात्र संशयः।।5.68.5।।
explanation: 'O courageous tiger among monkeys when you depart (abruptly) I doubt if I would be alive by your return.

content:
तवादर्शनजश्शोको भूयो मां परितापयेत्।

दुःखाद्दुःखपराभूतां दुर्गतां दुःखभागिनीम्।।5.68.6।।
explanation: I am an unfortunate one, afflicted by sorrow and tormented (by demons). If I am not able to see you I will be lamenting in grief.

content: अयं च वीर सन्देहस्तिष्ठतीव ममाग्रतः।सुमहांस्त्वत्सहायेषु हर्यृक्षेषु हरीश्वर।।5.68.7।।
explanation: 'O brave vanaras I have great doubts about your assistants the vanaras and bears, crossing the ocean.

content: कथं नु खलु दुष्पारं तरिष्यन्ति महोदधिम्।तानि हर्यृक्षसैन्यानि तौ वा नरवरात्मजौ।।5.68.8।।
explanation: 'How will the vanaras and bears cross this great, impassable ocean? How will the princes Rama and Lakshmna be able to cross it?

content: त्रयाणामेव भूतानां सागरस्यास्य लङ्घने।शक्तिस्स्याद्वैनतेयस्य तव वा मारुतस्य वा।।5.68.9।।
explanation: 'Only three among all beings, Garuda, the Windgod and you have the capacity to cross the ocean.

content: तदस्मिन् कार्यनिर्योगे वीरैवं दुरतिक्रमे।किं पश्यसि समाधानं ब्रूहि कार्यविदां वरः।।5.68.10।।
explanation: 'O heroic Hanuman you know how to succeed. But I wish to know what expedient you have to accomplish which is difficult by all means. O foremost vanara, please tell me .

content: काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने।पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते बलोदयः।।5.68.11।।
explanation: 'O Slayer of enemy heroes you have the ability to accomplsh this task singlehanded. By succeeding in accomplishing the objective you will become renowned (and not Rama).

content: बलै स्समग्रैर्यदि मां हत्वा रावणमाहवे।विजयी स्वां पुरीं रामो नयेत्तत्स्याद्यशस्करम्।।5.68.12।।
explanation: 'When Rama slays Ravana and his entire army and takes me to his city after becoming victorious it will add glory to him.

content: यथाऽहं तस्य वीरस्य वनादुपधिना हृता।रक्षसा तद्भयादेव तथा नार्हति राघवः।।5.68.13।।
explanation: 'Tell valiant Rama not to take me back the way Ravana, the demon abducted me out of fear. Which is not right.

content: बलैस्तु सङ्कुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः।मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थस्तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत्।।5.68.14।।
explanation: 'If Rama, the slayer of the enemy army, could fill Lanka with his arrows and take me that will be a good sight for him to see.

content: तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः।भवेदाहवशूरस्य तथा त्वमुपपादय।।5.68.15।।
explanation: 'You may make arrangement in such a way that the exalted hero Rama exhibits his might according to his stature'.

content: तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम्।निशम्याहं तत श्शेषं वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रुवम्।।5.68.16।।
explanation: "Hearing the meaningful, courteous and reasonable words of Sita, I replied :

content: देवि हर्यृक्षसैन्यानामीश्वरः प्लवतां वरः।सुग्रीवस्सत्त्वसम्पन्नस्तवार्थे कृतनिश्चयः।।5.68.17।।
explanation: 'O queen The lord of the army of bears and vanaras who is the foremost among the monkeys is endowed with enough strength and has resolved to rescue you.

content: तस्य विक्रमसम्पन्नास्सत्त्ववन्तो महाबलाः।मन स्सङ्कल्पसम्पाता निदेशे हरयः स्थिताः।।5.68.18।।
explanation: 'Mighty, powerful and tough monkeys who have the speed of thought are under the command of Sugriva.

content:
येषां नोपरि नाधस्तान्न तिर्यक्सज्जते गतिः।

न च कर्मसु सीदन्ति महत्स्वमिततेजसः।।5.68.19।।
explanation: 'All of them can go upward in the sky, downward into the underworld or obliquely in any direction without obstruction. They are brilliant enough to do any great task without any difficulty.

content: असकृत्तैर्महाभागैर्वानरैर्बलदर्पितैः।प्रदक्षिणीकृता भूमिर्वायुमार्गानुसारिभिः।।5.68.20।।
explanation: 'O great lady the mighty vanaras of extraordinary strength can fly with the wind and have  even circumambulated the earth.

content: मद्विशिष्टाश्च तुल्याश्च सन्ति तत्र वनौकसः।मत्तः प्रत्यवरः कश्चिन्नास्ति सुग्रीवसन्निधौ।।5.68.21।।
explanation: 'There are monkeys who are more powerful than me or equal to me. None are less strong than me or Sugriva.

content: अहं तावदिह प्राप्तः किं पुनस्ते महाबलाः।न हि प्रकृष्टाः प्रेत्यन्ते प्रेष्यन्ते हीतरे जनाः।।5.68.22।।
explanation: 'When I could come here, what to speak of the mightier monkeys?, People do not send the superior ones on errand, but send only the juniors.

content: तदलं परितापेन देवि मन्युर्व्यपैतु ते।एकोत्पातेन ते लङ्कामेष्यन्ति हरियूथपाः।।5.68.23।।
explanation: 'O noble lady give up your lamentation. Enough of sorrowing. The vanara army will fly and reach this place at one leap and fill it.

content: मम पृष्ठगतौ तौ च चन्द्रसूर्याविवोदितौ।त्वत्सकाशं महाभागे नृसिंहावागमिष्यतः।।5.68.24।।
explanation: 'O noble lady the lions among men, Rama and Lakshmana who resemble Sun and Moon will ascend on my back and reach here.

content: अरिघ्नं सिंहसङ्काशं क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम्।लक्ष्मणं च धनुष्पाणिं लङ्काद्वारमुपस्थितम्।।5.68.25।।
explanation: 'You will see the lionlike Rama, a slayer of enemies and Lakshmana wielding bow in hand standing at the entrance of Lanka very soon.

content: नखदंष्ट्रायुधान् वीरान् सिंहशार्दूलविक्रमान्।वानरान्वारणोन्द्राभान् क्षिप्रं द्रक्षसि सङ्गतान्।।5.68.26।।शैलाम्बुदनिकाशानां लङ्कामलयसानुषु।नर्दतां कपिमुख्यानामचिराच्छ्रोष्यसि स्वनम्।।5.68.27।।
explanation: 'You will hear before long the shouts of generals of the vanaras who resemble rainclouds on the mountain roaring like lions from the Malaya mountain of Lanka.

content: निवृत्तवनवासं च त्वया सार्धमरिन्दमम्।अभिषिक्तमयोध्यायां क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम्।।5.68.28।।
explanation: 'You will soon see Rama, the slayer of enemies crowned as king of Ayodhya with you, having duly completed the term of  exile in the forest'.

content:
ततो मया वाग्भिरदीनभाषिणा शिवाभिरिष्टाभिरभिप्रसादिता।

जगाम शान्तिं मम मैथिलात्मजा तवापि शोकेन तदाभिपीडिता।।5.68.29।।
explanation:
Sita though afflicted heard from me that you were also in excessive grief on account of separation from her and from my soothing, auspicious and welcome words, she derived comfort and remained quiet.
इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।
Thus ends the sixtyeighth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
